Reviews.Title: “Business Trip by Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Vickie N
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and enjoyable stay during a conference. Bed and the room was spacious and comfortable. Loved the balcony, although have to be careful of the what the feathered creatures leave behind :-) My room faced Seaworld with great views. Was within walking distance to Seaworld as well as public transportation. Loved the restaurants - great food! Service was excellent. I would though, like to suggest a different rate structure or plan for wireless services. 14.95/24 hrs I thought was excessive when I only needed it for a few hours each night (I was gone during the day) and the signal was weak at times losing connection. Otherwise, loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KYgreen
Reviews.Content: Attended recent conference at this hotel. Very friendly staff. Really liked the layout of the large atrium lobby. Several areas for email or reading and never felt like someone was close by - very open and comfortable. May have been lucky but very little noise from adjoining rooms. Very comfortable room and bath. Nice pool and convenient Starbucks off lobby. Parking maybe a little pricey but in-and-out convenience with room keys. Great location on and off expressways - only minutes from every eating establishment you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BV36
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very professional and friendly. Hotel was spotless. Upon check-in you receive a welcome glass of champagne, or if you do not drink you are offered a glass of juice. Our room was large and the beds were comfortable. Lots of pillows. The only thing that was missing was a hair dryer. A hotel of this quality and no hair dryer was disappointing. Every staff member made a effort to smile and acknowledge us in some manner during our stay. The breakfast was delicious. The breakfast buffet was $20. per person. However when the bill was presented we were only charged $31. total for 2 people. The server said we did not eat that much. We do not eat large breakfast's but we did eat plenty. All the meals were pricey but not out of line with other hotels of this quality. There are no restaurants within walking distance so unless you drive or take a taxi, the hotel is the only resource for meals. The burgers in the little hut by the pool are excellent, and it is a fun place just to hangout. If you are going to Sea World which is across the street, there are many choices of places to have a meal. Sea World is across the street but a great distance to walk to get to the main gate. The meals in there are just as pricey. The hotel offers a shuttle to all the theme parks. The shuttle runs on a schedule. There is a complimentary bus that goes to Busch Gardens but you must board it at Double Tree Hotel which is located behind the hotel but not close enough to walk. The hotel offered us a ride to the Double Tree but getting back to our hotel cost us $10.00 which is what Double Tree charged us plus tip. Overall a great experience and we would return to this hotel if we are in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Near Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: jdchua521
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention in Orlando, and got Hotel Renaissance at a good price from Expedia. Out side it is the regular Renaissance Hotel, but this hotel is big and renovated in the inside. Its room was big and the beds are comfortable. BNath room is also big. Your welcome drinks were champagne. The hotel has a Starbuck and sports bar for meals. Its staff can guide you to the best theme park at a reasonable price. You can buy hop on hop off bus for very cheap price to go on its route up to the two outlet mall. You can also buy convention pass to all theme parks by showing your convention id. Going to the Universal Studio and Sea World include regular pick up shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ben E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had always wanted to stay at this hotel. As pass holders for Sea World, we would see the hotel from the parking lot and mention that one day we would be there. We used Priceline and got a great deal. Our room, was standard King room, and was a very nice size; and we had a great view of the pool and courtyard. When we checked in, we were given a glass of champagne, which was perfect as my wife and I were there for our anniversary. The staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. Due to an allergy, we needed the room to be feather free. I had told them in advance, but I think they gave us a different room then they had planned. I called the front desk and within 10 minutes, someone was there to change out the pillows. My wife and I went then went out to dinner, and when we got back, the staff had taken out the down comforter and replaced that with a non feather one as well. The price for parking was a little steep, but we were told of the parking fee ahead of time; but the hotel is literally across the parking lot for Sea World, so it is in walking distance, and they don't want people parking there, trying to avoid paying to park at Sea World. There was a small issue regarding inappropriate (or lack of) attire from a guest that we observed in the hot tub, I informed security and they took care of it right away. I can't rate the food as we didn't eat at the hotel. The property itself is beautiful, and they have daily activities for kids, to give the adults a break. The pool is one of the largest I have seen at a hotel, and there are two hot tubs. This truly was a great experience, as the concierge was helpful in suggesting some local places to eat...I hope to one day return for another weekend stay. From a meeting planner's observation, this would also be a very nice hotel if you are looking to have an event at a location in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Plain on the outside, great on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: dtothesecondpow
Reviews.Content: Wonderful from start (complimentary sweet champagne at check-in) to finish (Starbucks inside the building). We ask for a room high up and near the pool and were accommodated with 9073. King bed as well as couch and chair big room double sinks in the bath, loved the fridge Special perk -there is a small elevator near that end of the building that takes you to the exit closest to the pool. The service and staff were superior. Each member personable and competent. When we had trouble with our umbrella there was someone there within a minute or so to help. We were going to have to leave the pool because my husband needed electric (laptop was dying) a staff came and found an outlet two seats from where we were! I spilled my aloha screwdriver down my dress and my server gave me a new one,drink that is. Can't say enough about the pool either. Music playing, but not too loud, great bar food, humus was esp. good as well as the sauce that goes with the homemade potato chips. Extra towels everywhere and still usually a chair between you and your neighbor. Two ginormous hot tubs as well as a water playland and ping pong and foosball right outside the pool gate. It could have been a pool at a resort in the Caribbean. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Loved the omelet station as well as a juicer! I had never seen a juicer before on a buffet. Carrot, pineapple, strawberry was very good. There are two things to note-the self park is $16 a night! What are we in downtown Manhattan? Also, housekeeping was stingy with shampoo and conditioner. We would def. stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue, no disappointments!”
Reviews.Author: funlonghorn
Reviews.Content: I was only there one night for a quick speech at a convention, but the hotel met all the needs. It is a lovely place, and the common areas are quite nice. I had a positive experience with the staff - I had left my cell phone on a table in the lobby, and one of the staff turned it in to lost and found - many, many thanks! Food was good and the bar staff friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rate +”
Reviews.Author: jwstanley2004
Reviews.Content: On the negative side - even if you get a good room rate. don't forget to add in the $14.95 for wireless internet in your room (come on its wireless unsecured - this should be free!!) and $16.00 to self park your car! Also not enough choices in the restaurant menus! On the positive side - I was greated with a glass of champaign. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The pool area was excellent and the staff at the poolside eatery attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Champagne”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We really though it was such a nice welcoming amenity to present me and my hubby each a glass of bubbly champagne. It sort of set the tone for our stay, put us in a good frame of mind. Made us feel that they went out of their way to welcome us. Good vibrations. Fortunately our rate included self-parking. There are a lot of different rates, some even include admission to Sea World, and some include breakfast. Ours only included the self-parking, which we were grateful for. Would prefer the ones that include breakfast, although they cost more. So when you are booking, review all the different rate plans, and pick the one that works for you.

Reviews.Title: “My magical experiences”
Reviews.Author: McUtahScott
Reviews.Content: This has been an amazing experience. The staff has always been friendly and very helpful. The pool area is wonderful. The food has been delicious. The location is perfect for the convention center and Sea World & Discovery Cove. The rooms and public spaces are very clean and nicely maintained. The grounds and pools are amazing and beautiful. The details of the candle lit walkways and fire pits in the outdoor lvining rooms and the game areas inside and outside are great ways to relax and unwind. The spa is very nice with a great staff and amazing services. There were many "magical moments" for me and my family at this hotel. I would recommend it and stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience at a Marriott chain!”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews however this was the best experience that I had at a Marriott chain. I am Gold member through Marriott & have stayed at many chains. The most notable was the customer service. I had booked my hotel using my United air miles. All was good and had the confirmation # from both the 3rd party company booking the reservation and then got my reservation/confirmation through Marriott. Upon arrival/check-in, they could not find my reservation. After some research, they found out that the 3rd party company cancelled my reservation. I never got an email and they claim they don't have history of it. We know the 3rd party company dropped the ball because I had the Marriott confirmation #. Anyhow, during this process the employees at the front desk were very friendly, always keeping me confident, and happy. One employee, I believe her name was Fernada, eventually was the one to get me checked in. There was a computer glitch that she had to follow up later to fix and she did. There was also a discount that she allowed me to use even though you can use it booking online. She went out of the way to make sure I got a room and didn't have to worry about anything so I can enjoy my vacation with my family. They even offered by champagne a couple times during the process :). The reason we chose that place because it was right next to SeaWorld. We just walked over to the park. The inside is beautiful and spacious and alot to do. Surprisingly the price is very cheap for being such a vacation spot. Again, the best experience at a Marriott chain, best customer service, great rates! Awesome! Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay but bed bugs were found:(”
Reviews.Author: Ejpjap
Reviews.Content: My brother and I were staying at this hotel for a convention. The first night he woke up with bites all over gis arms and face. He looked online and found it I be similar to bed bugs. He told the front desk and thy claimed I have ecolab check the room. They did indeed find bedbugs. He was switched rooms and they steam cleaned his clothes. Would not stay again because of this:(

Reviews.Title: “Florida Resident Package was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: husni76
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of being Florida Residents and purchased a package that included all you can eat dining at Sea World, two passes to Sea World and two nights at the Renaissance across from Sea World. Renaissance is an amazing property, I'm going to begin with the cons as they are so few. 1. $16.00 for self parking is ridiculous no matter how you justify it. 2. No free wi-fi in the rooms. Now that we have those out of the way let's get to the awesomeness that is the Renaissance Orlando Resort. First of all walking into the lobby you feel like you're inside of a massive city, there's a Starbucks, two restaurants and a bar & grill. We have a toddler boy and he absolutely enjoyed the Water Park that is at the property and free for the children that are guests there. Your children will love this water park. There is a slide and the pool is only 12 inches deep at its deepest level. There's another part of the water park that's separated but right across the floor there and it's got two larger slides. You can spend all day watching the children play while getting sun. The pools are beautiful and big and the pool bar is right along the main pool. All the employees greeted us with smiles and always asked if we needed help. We simply enjoyed are stay and will be going back to the Renaissance as often as we possibly can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience during my stay here. My only complaint was the smell and taste of the water which seemed to be all over Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 7 years. It isn't too far from the airport, it's a great location for Sea World. There are a couple of restaurants to choose from and the option of a Starbucks coffee shop, lots of other restaurants a short drive away. The large pool area is very well maintained and now has a large separate pool and recreation area for children. The rooms are large and have very comfortable king size beds. Recommend the full buffet breakfast, one of the best we've had in a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boris”
Reviews.Author: Plovdiv
Reviews.Content: Very nice overall, walking distance to Seaworld, Aquatica and Discovery Cove, an a good free shuttle to Universal (a couple of time a day only, however). 16 dollars per day for parking and no free Wi-Fi either. Plus the irritating US habit of never knowing what anything really costs as tax slapped on each price. Bill had an unexplained restaurant spent on it, which was removed by reception staff at check out (without explaining how it got there). Came home to find another unrecognised charge on my credit card, contesting it with credit card company now - so, check your bills carefully!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, large hotel but not to my taste”
Reviews.Author: Barbados_addict
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel for a work event. I have to say immediately that I'm not a fan of large hotels (750 rooms) such as this and wouldn't choose to stay at one on a trip I'm paying for. With that said, the hotel interior is very good and spacious, but I found my room to be very basic. It was large for a standard hotel room, but very basic. As other reviewers have said, the bed is very comfortable and is the best thing in the room. My favourite part of the hotel is the outside area around the pool and gardens. This is lovely and had a great pool side bar. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Seaworld or if you enjoy large hotels with all their facilities. If you prefer smaller hotels with more personal service, then I'd try and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: Pineview3
Reviews.Content: As seasoned travelers my husband and I both agree the staff at the Renaissance were the friendliest we ever encountered. From housekeeping to security to front desk staff everyone looked directly at us, smiled and asked how we were doing. It was refreshing to see customer service in action, at every level. The rooms were quite large and well appointed. The fireplace pits were lovely at night, surrounded by large comfortable furniture. Great place to unwind after a long day. The grounds/pool area very inviting – however I must agree with other reviewers that the ‘chair saving’ issue was out of control. Towels appeared on chairs beginning at 7am – yet no one actually sat in the chair until 11am or later. We also overheard a number of unpleasant exchanges between guests regarding chairs. Plenty of natural shade plus umbrellas – huge pool and Kids Zone fabulous for younger folks. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I will never forget my stay there it was worth every dollar and a must go back”
Reviews.Author: barbie035
Reviews.Content: I dont know where to start it was so beautiful so relaxing the beds where super comfortable I had not slept the way I Sept on my nights there for years I felt in heaven I woke up without pain well rested I mean it was a miracle not even at home I feel like that and I have great beds I saved money on gas because i was at walking distances from Seaworld and aquatica and only 10 mins from universal there whirlpools my son and i every night when we came from the parks we would go to there whirlpools the service is great the only thing is that its pricey and you pay for parking but other then that I loved it I must go back hopefully for next spring break I give these hotel a 10 I loved all the decor I wished I had more time to explore more of it but when you visit the parks your just tired and hungry and since its pricey I can't say ill be there soon but next spring yes i recommend these hotel to all my fellow travelers but make sure to set a day to explore it because its worth it

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnjanieN
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you're traveling with children. We loved almost everything about this hotel and were bummed when we had to leave (aftern 7 nights) to complete our vacation at the Rosen Shingle Creek. Check in was a breeze, but we weren't offered the champagne/juice others were being given. I think it was only for Marriott Platinum members, but it was not nice that we saw others receiving it and were not offered any. Room was great: we were given a huge king with an equally huge balcony. Bathroom was standard but did have double sinks (time saver when my daughter and I need to brush at the same time). Why are hotel sinks so incredibly high? I had to tiptoe and we had to get a stool for my daughter to reach it. With so many kids staying here, each room should have one. Housekeeping was fine. We tipped every day, but didn't feel that it enhanced the service. Pool and kid's waterpark: AWESOME and the best part of the hotel experience. We spent days lounging by the pool just hanging out. Food: Starbucks on site was fantastic. I did get attitude a couple of times though. Mostly I was just glad that it was there and I could have my machiatto every day, twice a day as I'm used to. Good for snacks too, and the most reasonable food in the hotel. Tradewinds food was ok. Crab cake app was very good, but skip the spinach/artichoke dip. Yuck. This hotel had a kids menu where everything (burger, grilled cheese, chicken fingers, etc) was $6. That was a great bargain! We did the breakfast buffet one day and did not feel it was anywhere near worth the $40 we spent (one adult, one child). There is a Denny's literally up the road that is a much better deal for breakfast. Pool food was fine, not too terribly overpriced. Kids menu available there too and that helped bring down the price a lot. We usually spent $35-40 for a drink, a salad and kids meal at the pool. Not cheap, but if no kids menu, bills would be 50-60% higher. Don't get the "drink special of the day" drinks they have by the pool. They're priced HIGHER than the drinks on the regular menu and you only know this after you've gotten the bill. Pool special drinks are usually half price or 2 for 1 at most hotels. The computers in the business center are super slow and you will spend a fortune if you try to get anything done on them. I had to cut my losses one day and drive to the nearby (about 2 miles) UPS store to use the computers there. Half hour is $5. At the hotel, half hour would cost you $12 and you would need at least double the amount of time because of the slowness. Hotel is beautiful and has a very sleek vibe. There is a sushi bar in the lobby, but we didn't try it. Self parking is a breeze as the lot is very close to the hotel and there are several entrances. Self was $16 plus tax and valet $21 plus tax. Pretty much all the large hotels charge the same parking fees, so there's no getting around that. The Renaissance saves you money on parking at Seaworld though as it is literally across the street. Ticket prices for Seaworld are cheaper online than at the hotel. If you have to pay to use the computer, forget it and get tickets at the concierge desk. Nearby restaurants we tried were: Red Lobster - prob a little better than what you'd expect Thai Thani - ok, not great thai food Ming Court - nice venue, maybe getting a bit worn, but food not very good. shrimp was not cleaned, but they did take it off our bill Ciao Italia (near Delmonico's on I-drive) - excellent and the best food we had during the entire 11 days. try the superb lobster ravioli.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ddt1979
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean, modern and enjoyable. The customer service was just the best. I look forward to visiting again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 8 nights during Spring Break period. When we arrived at check-in we were greeted by John at the front desk. He was very nice and accomodating. He poured champagne for me and sparkling cider for my 5 year old daughter. He recognized my husband was a platinum rewards member and I inquired to whether we could get a suite. To my delight, a suite was avaialble later that day which we didn't mind waiting for. We were on the 10th floor in a beautiful king room corner suite and it made our 8 nights there very memorable (thanks John). Bear in mind, while writing this review, I'm aware that suites have been uprgraded with newer face lift while some of the standard rooms are still in the process of being renovated from what I hear. But, if you have a suite - you should be in good shape. (very nice decor and colors and we had a great view!) The pool was fantastic - but will say, food service at pool hit or miss! I didn't worry about it too much as most of the time I was enjoying the beautiful pool and new waterpark area with my family. The first day we had lunch at Tradewinds. We had a nice waiter, but didn't get the right dressing with my salad and it didn't have croutons on it as mentioned on the menu - the food was fair. At the end of our meal though, the waiter gave our daughter a really cute shamu stuffed animal and a coloring book - so made up for the salad error. We did go back for dinner one night and had a pretty good dinner - and Easter brunch was great! They had omelets made to order, kids pancake station, and tons of fresh fruit on the bar. This was the highlight of the food for this restaurant. Scale of 1-10 for tradwinds 7-8, but overall fine. easter brunch a 9! The maid service was hit or miss! One day, we came back to our room and the maid had made our room so nice, even organizing all of my daughters stuffed animals on the bed - it was super cute - I even took a photo - for the most part maid service was fine - but there were times in which we noticed mirrors not being properly cleaned or full towels not always restocked. Again, some nights exceptional, some just fine. We loved our suite and the large refrigerator it had - good for morning snacks, water, and other beverages. We also had turn down service and chocolates - but noticed it was not on all of the nights just a few - did enjoy the nights in which they came in with those chocolates though! The bellman at the hotel were very nice and accomodating. Also, another very nice touch was we were not sure if our regerator was working, so put in a service request. The maintenance person left a note with a chocolate saying hoped everything was working properly - thought this was Excellent for customer service. Also, the hotel organized a really nice Easter Egg hunt for the kids. Only problem big kids got the eggs too quickly - maybe next year -organize by age group - just a suggestion? There weren't enough eggs for eveyone to find. Other idea is to communicate to kids - no more then 3 eggs per kid so enough to go around. But, it was a lovely event and nice for the hotel to do - at the end they found a box of additional eggs to give to the kids who didn't find them - so that was good. It is disappointing to have to pay to park but knew that anyways when booking - no biggie. Keep in mind - you can walk to Seaworld - so you don't have to pay for parking there if you plan to go there at least one day. Plus, the resort gave us free quick queue for SeaWorld - that well made up for the parking costs. _ get them from concierge day before or early morning before they run out. This would have costs $19.99 each if you bought at the door - and we got for free. This allowed us to bypass people in line. For the one ride, Journey to Atlantis there was a 60 minute wait, but in the quick queue line - no wait at all - we enjoyed riding it with my daughter four times in a row and never had to wait. All and all we had a great experience at the hotel! Everyone was very friendly at the front desk area and accomodating. It also helped that we got lucky to score a great room that led to a memorable and relaxing family vacation. Give it a 9 on scale of 1-10. If food at tradewinds better and pool bar service better - would have been a 10. But, already recommending this hotels to others especially if they are going to seaworld. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jac2580
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel as part of a work related conference. The lobby is beautiful and very inviting. the place just says "Relax and stay a while" Our room was spacious and clean. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge gave us excellent suggestions for "after conference evening entertainment. The location (right across the street from Seaworld) allowed for easy access to the park in addition to the hotel grounds offering lots of vistas, pools and conversation spots. The gym was well supplied and allowed for nearly any workout you wanted. The restaurant had a huge breakfast buffet each morning, with lots of food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for a average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianadavid
Reviews.Content: I wish I was told about the 16 dollar per day parking along with the 15 dollar per day Internet. Very disappointing to pay these additional fees that are free in most hotels. The rooms were surface clean. Meaning the closer you look around the more dirt or rust you find. To me the beds weren't comfortable. It felt warn out. Lastly it would be great if they used a mat in the tubs because it was too slippery

Reviews.Title: “Tiger's Baseball”
Reviews.Author: janetgetty
Reviews.Content: We were staying up Island at Amelia so decided to drive down to attend a spring training ball game with the Detroit Tigers. We only stayed the one night but we were very impressed. Upon arriving about 3 p.m. (our game got rained out 5th inning) the front desk staff asked us politely to wait in the GIGANTIC lobby-thinking my twin grandsons (3yrs) would love to run in this place:)...she returned to say our room was still a few minutes away from being ready would we like a flute of champagne or sparkling apple cider!! Room was great we are silver status Mariott members so we got a room facing with large picture window of the grounds and pool below. (It really pays to join hotel or car rental orgs-it has a few perks and it is all for free). Large King size bed and pull out couch and chair. Huge counter in bathroom double sinks etc. Other rooms look out into the giant courtyard that are filled with couches and 'east indian' designed sitting areas with cushions and hanging curtains as well as huge TV's everywhere with images of sealife swimming around. In the bathroom you get a small squizzable shamu whale sitting on the tub so I quickly phoned down to the front desk to ask for another for my grandsons and was immediately given another! Had a bit of a problem with the TV so someone came promptly to fix as while he was in the room attending to the TV the front desk called twice to make sure he came and the work was done!!! BRAVO. Suggest some cabinets added to huge bathroom counter underneath to store items especially if you were staying longer. Didn't find coffe machine until we were leaving as it was stored in closet-please place on your lovely coffee table it will fit nicely and people will see it for sure. Food court area in the lobby (didn't try restaurant) had great food and service. Gift shops are super great esp for kids with a candy store inside. Full size Starbucks on main floor as well, spa and lovely grounds and pool area with kids waterpark on site. Trolley bus runs by hotel, SeaWorld across the street, and Aquatica 2 walking blocks away. Great location we will be back. Book early online for great rates. paid $119

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Renaissance and it was as nice as I expected it to be. The entry and lobby are beautifully decorated. The room was clean and comfortable. We headed to the pool and the kids played until the sun moved away and it got too chilly. The best thing was the Quick Que passes we got from the resort. No waiting in lines at Sea World. Not only is it right across the street (walking distance) but the Quick Que made the whole thing worthwhile. Be sure to get your passes the night before, they go fast. The cons for me were: The price of the restaurants inside the resort. $71 for buffet breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children. (buy the Sea World meal plan instead and eat all day for one price) Paying to park, $16 per day. Ouch! And loud hallways and thin walls. Hard to sleep with all the action. But if you have been at the park, you'll be too tired to care. Sea World is the most amazing place and you can't get any closer to it than this. Spent the morning at the pool before we checked out. It was very nice and super relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: Ning70
Reviews.Content: Pool area reminds me of a tropical region. Staff, room, and overall atmosphere was very nice. The children loved the children's pool area which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Pool but lots of additional charges”
Reviews.Author: allie-gator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and had booked through priceline and got the hotel for $70 a night. I was worried about what room they would put us in, but as soon as I stepped into our room all my doubts vanished. Here are the pros, cons and mehs; Pros GREAT location – walk to Seaworld steps from an itrolley stop. GREAT Seaworld benefits – loved the quick queue passes. Fantastic pool and waterslide area for the kids and pool is open until midnight which is very nice! Friendly Staff. Starbucks on site is convenient. Welcome drink and water in the lobby. Clean rooms. Cons Tradewinds restaurant is way overpriced for the food it serves. Dinner food was okay, but bill was $70 for one adult and two kids (with only one alcoholic beverage). Breakfast was $15 for 2 eggs, bacon, homefries and toast – that is insane so of course we did not eat there for breakfast. A child’s pop at the pool is $3 – for a fountain drink. Wayyyy over priced! $16 a night for parking seems a little steep (glad I got the hotel cheaper) $10 a night for access to internet is just crazy. Even the best western gives it to you for free. Mehs The uniforms on the front desk staff are awful to the point of embarrassing for them – they do not even fit them! The rooms and bathroom could use a little facelift. They do not have any brochures anywhere, you have to ask at the front desk for them. They were serving someone else so I had to wait a little over 5 minutes just for a brochure. All in all a good 4 star hotel. I would stay there again just because of the pool. Next time I would bring kids drinks into the pool area (although no coolers allowed).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Leyla C
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I planned a quick trip to Seaworld for a Spring Break vacation. I ordered tickets through Seaworld online and got a package deal with the tickets and room together, which was surprisingly affordable given the prices of Seaworld tickets. I was very pleased when we arrived two and a half hours early and were able to check in right away. Upon arrival, I was given a complimentary glass of champagne and my daughter was given a glass of sparkling cider. The valet parking was definitely a plus (especially after walking around Seaworld, it was nice to have the car brought to us). The inside courtyard was beautiful and everything was very clean--from the front entrance to the pool area to the elevators to the rooms. The complimentary quick queue tickets were great! No waiting in line for us when we wanted to ride something at the park! The shuttle service to and from the park isn't necessary since the hotel is just across the parking lot from the entrance to the park and only takes a few minutes to get back and forth. The restaurants in the hotel were quite pricey so we didn't eat there but we wanted to "explore" the area in Orlando to see what else was there to eat so that wasn't a big deal. We'll definitely stay here again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but oddly quite family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: natebanta
Reviews.Content: The atrium is giant and a beautiful welcome to a very nice hotel. Service is friendly. Wonderfully manicured gardens surround the pool area. The pool is large and surrounded by plush seating and some special seats for multiple people to lounge together. There is also a small water feature area for kids that includes a couple medium sized water slides and splash area. We didn't spend much time there because the water was shockingly cold. The rooms were nicely decorated as part of the whole hotel's muted sea life theme to go with their connection to sea world. The little shamu bath toy was a nice touch for our youngest kiddo. Overall, this hotel is quite beautiful, but very expensive for food, drinks, parking, and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, right across the street from Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: HardCoreMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was impressive from the moment we entered the hotel. We stayed here for a business/pleasure trip. We were served champagne right at the check-in counter, the entrance and ground floor level is impressive! I love the decor, open airy feel, the pool was awesome and provided towel service. Our room was fabulous...comfortable beds, temperature control that was in working order, the place was immaculate. The concierge service was very helpful in directing me to the best transportation to get where I wanted to go. They had shuttle service to the convention center for the business trade show we were attending. They do not have free breakfast, but you can eat at the hotel. I did not eat breakfast there, so I cannot speak about the food, but did buy coffee every morning at the Starbucks right in the lobby of the hotel. Seaworld is right across the street from the hotel. I had a car, so I drove a few miles away for dinner. They do charge $15 to self-park on the premises, and I did not get free wi-fi, unless I went down to the lobby, so there are added costs to staying here. I found this inconvenient. They had a computer set up in the lobby for guests to print off their flight boarding passes, which was very convenient. Overall, I would stay here again. I appreciated the great service, beautiful spaces and most of all, comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms close to Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: roseee311
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here in April and had a pleasant experience. We got checked in easily and our room was ready early. We missed the free shuttle to Sea World, but made the walk across the parking lot to sea world with our 2 and 4 year old with no problem. Spent the day at Sea World and then went to the pool for a swim. Great pool but the kids pool was really cold so we stayed in the big pool. The only thing I didn't love was the restaurant selection. We were told TradeWinds was the most kid friendly, but the restaurant was too expensive for us. I won't pay $15 for a hamburger. The good news was that we drove to a smokehouse nearby an had a great meal at a fraction of the price. We would stay here again if going to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurboLax7
Reviews.Content: This is a family favorite. We have stayed here multiple times over the past 10 years. Always perfect

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous pool / water slides for kids and adults!”
Reviews.Author: Suzane M
Reviews.Content: 1,000% happy with this property! we stayed for 2 days and enjoyed the pool and waterpark with slides to the max.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: TheMrsTMF
Reviews.Content: The appearance was very nice. We didn't use many of the amenities, but it had a very attractive property. The staff was friendly and helpful. We even received a free glass of champagne (its was the cheap kind but still tasty lol) after we checked in. Our room was spacious and the bed was comfy. However....our A/C blew out semi warm air, so the room temp was a constant 75...which for my husband who likes it cold, was not good. That was my only complaint....oh and that housekeeping just walked in the room while we were sleeping although we had our sign on the door. They apologized so it was no big deal. We do plan to visit again, but next time will bring the kids. The resort water park looks like something they would enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, very enjoyable and family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Ron H
Reviews.Content: A dream come true for my wife, a killer whale fanatic since childhood. SeaWorld is our 2nd home and my wife has always wanted to stay here as it's just across the parking lot. Front desk staff were all courteous, professional and happily attended special requests. The chilled glass of bubbly was a welcome surprise (pun intended) on this hot afternoon! Our room was clean, comfortable with a balcony overlooking SeaWorld. Perfect. The bed? Mmmmmm...almost missed breakfast. The breakfast buffet at Tradewinds in the atrium was fantastic! Clean, fresh, well stocked (almost too many choices, if there is such a thing) and all kitchen and service personnel were on their "A Game." A great way to start our day. Kids and parents will love the many different pools. Separate areas for toddlers, older kids and adults. And two water slides! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful! The staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the pool, hot tubs, and childrens water park area. The rooms were ok but the view of the hotel and the pool area really made up for that. The hotel provides fast passes for SeaWorld which was very nice and the kids loved that! Another tip - if you purchase SeaWorld tickets online you get a 2nd day visit for free! As long as you use the 2nd day within 7 days of your first visit. Overall an excellent stay and a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: kes1639
Reviews.Content: MAJDF18148 wrote a very comprehensive review of the hotel. One error I saw was that there is not a separate "adult pool". There is a kiddies pool with slide, but children are allowed in the main pool and along the deck. Caution -- the deck gets very slippery when wet especially if you are wearing flip-flops. A few things to add. We made the reservation last minute due to a bad experience at our hotel in Lakeland and decided to check out of there a day early and be closer to the airport for our departure. Yes this hotel is a major conference facility (three ballrooms) but the only time we saw attendees were at the pool after 5:00 in the bar. Never felt they were in the way. Since I am a Marriott Elite member we were given complimentary champagne upon arrival. Our room was nice with a "view of SeaWorld" (which was really of Seaworld's parking lot). I was a bit peeved that we had to pay $16 for self-park (the same price as valet). You would think the parking would be a lot cheaper than that. There is a bus that stops (called the I-stop red and green line) right outside of the hotel and runs along International Blvd to all of the major restaurants and shopping. We laid out at the pool and the Bartender was very friendly. Drinks were a bit pricey ($9 for a frozen margarita) but probably because we are at a resort. The Bartender recommended the hotel restaurant for dinner. We went to Tradewinds and had excellent service and one of the best meals of our whole Florida trip! The hostess almost sat us next to a large family group of 15 with several squirmy children (we had seen them at the pool) but she quickly moved us to a quieter corner when we protested. The extra towels I had ordered through marriott. com were not in the room when we checked in but they quickly arrived with a phone call to housekeeping. My husband liked the gym except that a thicker floor mat was needed to do push-ups. The hotel accomodated our request for a noon checkout rather than a 11:00 a.m. checkout. While the room did have refrigerator it was very noisy and you could hear the compressor running from inside of the cabinet. And the bathtub shower head was a bit short for my 5"11" husband. All of these negative comments are nit picky -- we really did have a great time and we were very happy that we had changed our reservation and were only 10 miles from the airport. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Clean, Bright and Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: majdf18148
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 15th march for a week as our base for the Orlando phase of our two week holiday to Florida. Location: Situated on Sea Harbor Drive, one block off International Drive, the hub of access to most things going on in Orlando. 5 minutes walk from SeaWorld; directly opposite. The Hotel: 7oo (ish) rooms is built in a hollow square format on 10 floors with a huge glass roof forming an atrium over the interior. The hotel is bright, clean and welcoming. Rooms: These are large, well appointed and well furnished, choice of two Queen beds or a super king, large well appointed bathroom et al. Excellent rooms with good facilities incl safe, refrigerator etc. Eating and Drinking: There is a sushi bar and restaurant, not tested. A US type sports bar and restaurant at which we ate twice. First experience was good. Second experience was very poor, due to a conference in the hotel (these are on an everyday basis almost). The place was obviously under pressure, our food took an hour to arrive, was cold and poorly presented. The waiter was embarrassed and replaced the food but we were still charged the full amount. There is also a restaurant called HBs. We ate breakfast here twice. Full buffet breakfast hot and continental choice costs $21 plus tax, continental only $16 plus tax. We tried both. The continental is better value with a good array of fruit, breads, pastries et al plus unlimited coffee and OJ. Service was excellent both times.There is a Starbucks inside the hotel which is very good for a quick snack and excellent coffee. Facilities: The hotel has an adult pool and an excellent children's pool with mini flumes. Whilst we were there the pool area was heavily used by conference guests, many of whom were dressed and lying on the pool beds between meetings we presumed. Car parking is good and plentiful and situated close to the hotel. The concierge service is outstanding, extremely knowledgeable and courteous staff who are very helpful in arranging park tickets, quick queue entrance to rides at al. They even produced us an email map for the 2nd part of our holiday south to Naples.We never tried the spa.There are ice machine stations on all floors. The hotel runs a free courtesy bus to SeaWorld (not really needed) and to Universal Studios. The Staff: As previously intimated the staff at this hotel are unfailingly polite, friendly, helpful and welcoming.We felt we were valued as guests and we loved the way all staff went out of their way to ensure we had all we needed. Minus Points: Not much to gripe about really, the maid service in the rooms was a bit hit and miss at times and the presence of large contingents of conference guests could deter some people but the hotel is there to make money. Overall Experience: Very positive, we would return and we would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting excellent service in a welcoming very clean environment, ideally located for access to most of what is going on on Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelsABunch
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you are going to the Sea World or staying in Orlando in general. The rooms are big, the furniture is modern, the restaurant food is good and the service in general is impeccable. The breakfast is good but expensive and not really worth $21 although they let you mix your own fruit juice. The pool is definitely a resort style and better than any regular hotel pool. The kids pool has water park style slides. I would recommend for people on business (rooms are very spacious and elegant) and recommend to families with kids (the Pool). I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Going to SeaWorld?”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to spend a couple of days at Seaworld, this is the best location. You can walk to the main entrance in less than ten minutes. The hotel has a ten story atrium, and a very open feeling. The pool area is now very large, and very child friendly. The pool area has a large childrens water park like area, with slides etc. our two grandchidren ages one and three both enjoyed this area. The staff was very helpful, and friendly. We booked three rooms, two were connecting and this worked very well for our family. The rooms are large, they have a small fridge,and a coffee maker. The only negatives, $ 16 a day to park, and the lack of real resturants, the food was ok, not up to what you would expect at this type of hotel. There are a number (many) of resturants about a ten minute drive up International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next to seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: bluekarma
Reviews.Content: I really love to stay at this hotel when we go to Seaworld.You can't get any closer.Very easy to walk to. It is right across the street.They have really updated this hotel since the last time we stayed here.Much more modern and I really loved the little seating areas all over the hotel.They now have a waterslides and a great pool area for kids..There are a few different resturants but be prepared to pay.We ate in the sports bar in the lobby and had the breakfast buffet one morning.Everything we had was great. Parking is 16.00 a night. Everything at the hotel was a little high but the staff was very friendly and you are so close to the park, They also have a starbucks but it closed very early! We had a inside balcony room. We loved it.But they also have rooms with views of seaworld.We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: momdad5kids
Reviews.Content: my husband, myself and our 5 children (age 3 to 12) stayed at Renaissance the first week of march. we have nothing bad to say about this place. everything was perfect. the staff was excellent and well attentioned. the atrium in the lobby is quite unique and very nice. we really enjoyed their pools and jacuzzi. the grounds were always very clean. our room was always nicely done. we had room service every morning and their breakfast was always delicious. the hotel is literally across the street from sea world. and close to everything else. a pharmacy 1 min away, Disney parks 15 min away,etc. great place. you go and do not worry.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with modern services and solid service.”
Reviews.Author: Soki816
Reviews.Content: Great hotel from top to bottom. Clean, modern, good service and good sized rooms. The only negative is a $15 Internet charge per device. I'd recommend this to all types of travelers.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Had A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alyson N
Reviews.Content: We went to SeaWorld for "SeaWorlds Christmas Celeration" We stayed here, and it was so convenient just to walk over to the park instead of paying the 14 dollars for parking at SeaWorld. The place was clean. We had a room with a double bed, then we put an air mattress that we brought. It fit and we still had more room to walk. The rooms were bigger then most hotels which was nice for the 5 of us. Not free to park but we didn't mind. The pool is really big, and their was life size checkers, and Chess that was a lot of fun to play with. We love starbucks so that was a plus too. Overall we had a nice stay, and recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Edward K
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the years with the family and it is always nice. It is the best location when it comes to getting to all the attractions. Any great theme park is never more than 20 minutes in any direction. Would always stay here. The pool area for kids is a great addition. The inside is peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here any chance we get”
Reviews.Author: Shoogi123
Reviews.Content: We live two hours away so we come stay here all the time... The rooms have been renovated, they are bright, fresh, airy, clean & comfortable. We stay here every chance we get. Great value and across the street from Sea World and close to other area attractions & restaurants. The hotel is very nice...The pool is big and the kids zone is awesome for the little ones not to mention the customer service is excellent. We have probably stayed here over 20 times and will continue to return any chance we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: travelerjrm
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay. Excellent fitness center, comfotable large rooms. Pool area great and not tocrowded. Reasonable dinner buft with tasty salmon and nice greens. Breakfast buffet pricey but nice omelette station. JM

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blmarlow
Reviews.Content: Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel is beautiful! Beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: sunsetsinparadise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during spring break with 3 teenage boys who enjoyed the fitness area and pool late in the evening after we returned from Universal. It was great for them to be able to have fun later in the evening instead of staring at a TV. I enjoyed the spa and the firepit in the evening-very relaxing. The $16.00 parking was disappointing but it was nice to see a security guard watching over the lot when we came in late in the evening-you can't put a price on feeling safe. We did ask for a cot because the boys did not want to share a bed and it was $20.00 extra per night which I felt was excessive as we have had cots at other hotels without a charge. We found an open bottle of Evian when we arrived to the room which was over $3.00 per bottle so we took it to the fronk desk and was not charged for it. We bring our own water and drinks when traveling with teenagers. We found the room to be very comfortable and large with French doors opening onto a balcony overlooking the lobby area. We booked on Priceline and got a great rate for this hotel. We would recommend to others and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “one word .....FAB”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie M
Reviews.Content: i stayed at thsi hotel in sept 2010 and omg i was oooooooooooooo happy , before traverlibg i emailed teh hotel telling them i was comin from england on my honeymoon and would love a room with a view of sea world. on arrival we were offered some bubbly we were then shown to our room swith our bags to follow. The room was huge i cannot complain about anythink apart from teh bottled water in your room was ova priced. And yes i got my wish a view of sea world on the biggest balcony iv eva seen. The staff were all friendly and helpfull we had a problem with our safe one day an they fixed it straight away even though it was our fault and gave us free vochours for coffee :) the hotel is in walking distance to sea world and aqauicia which is great or the eye ride is right outside :) we went to discovery cove one day and i asked how i got a taxi an i was told no need they took us ova there an brought us back again now that service ova all FAB

Reviews.Title: “National Meeting”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: I am 5 ft 6 in tall. I was in a feather room which I requested - thank you for providing this. However, when I got a shower, I had to duck down to get under the shower head in the bathroom. This made it very difficult to enjoy my experience there in the hotel. In addition, the base of the bathtub had some rust spots on it. This is not very appealing. The water served at the group lunches/dinner tables had the taste of sulfur and left an after taste. The hotel uses a water softener and the local people must be used to that taste in their water. Housekeeping did a good job cleaning the room. Service was great. Conditions of the hotel bathroom was run down and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: The only reason I feel compelled to give a 4 star vs a 5 star is for the "Thinner walls". We stayed two nights. After the first night our obnoxious neighbors (I'm being pretty generous by using that term) became so loud that after much to-do with security and such I asked for a new room. The hotel staff tried very much to accomodate us and switched us right away. They granted us a new room and sent staff to help me move (my husband and older child were at Seaworld and I was stuck there with a 2 year old... who TRIED to take a nap but couldn't because of neighbors). So, my only complaint is that the walls are a bit thin with rooms that have connecting doors. I think I would have still had an issue with those folks even if the walls had of been thicker, but I noticed other sounds "normal" coming from other neighbors (we requested a room away from elevators), etc. They have champagne/ sparkling cider there for you upon arrival- nice touch, especially if you have just left Seaworld and are parched! Upon check-in, the bell hop got a 2nd toy Shamu whale because he saw I had 2 small children and there was only one in the room... very thoughtful. The pools were a bit cool, but it is March! I would have thought the heated one could have been a bit warmer, but we still enjoyed it. Staff was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as a smaller accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Earnest A
Reviews.Content: I didnt know we were being charged 16 dollars a day for parking there and then I didnt know we would be charged for using their internet....bottles of water in the room that says $3.50. WOW....this placed appeared elogant but at the same time cheap greedy like. Loved everything except the unknown additional charges that I wish I knew about ahead of time so I couldve booked somewhere else. I rally had a better stay at the fairfield in on the other side of Sea World. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louis O
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at the hotel. The staff was very friendly. Our kids had a great time at the pool area; can't beat having water slides at the pool. Also the bar at the pool area was nice with flat screen televisions. My two compliants were the cost of parking at $16 (seems a little steep) and the fact that no microwave existed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: bsrflariley
Reviews.Content: I just read some of the negative reviews and I certainly did not experience anything that was below excellent during my stay. Concierge was extremely helpful, beautiful cooler of water with orange slices in the lobby, affordable breakfast and kids eat free with paying adult. Opted out of the free champagne, but was offered that upon check in. Also, another surprise for us was that they gave our family wristbands to wear at Sea World that gave us a pass to the front of any line. Room was very large and bed was fabulous and comfortable. Nice size bathroom that was polished and clean. Not many towels, but we had plenty only ten minutes after a phone call. The pool area and kids water section is one of the best I have seen in not just Orlando but all of Florida and it is open late, so it was great after a long hot day at the parks. Will definitely be returning to this hotel! Also, the day we left, the valet gave us bottled water for our trip home. Not a detail was missed in the service from check in to check out! If you're a Florida teacher make sure you ask for their teacher discount. You need to show your teaching certificate at check in.

Reviews.Title: “No microwaves....really?”
Reviews.Author: Cameron L
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Can you believe not one microwave in the ENTIRE place? Not one. Only other thing EVERYTHING is overpriced....everything (food, water, drinks). I mean, DISNEY overpriced! Stay here if you are doing Aquatica and Seaworld. Don't stay here if you are doing disney.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute worst hotel stay of my life - don't go even if it is free!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 19mrpb58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty but a bit shabby around the edges. Champagne appears to impress some reviewers but I look deeper. Nice touch, but the service is ABYSMAL. I was there for a conference. Two packages were sent and signed for by the hotel 2 days before my arrival. Both lost - got one on Tues. and one Thurs. night. Hotel messed up a key card ad buy. Did not distro to guests. Very nonchalant - told me "if they want them they can come get them". (Refunded but opprtunity lost). Billed me with another person's Marriott reward number -4 trips to front desk to resolve.Gave me points that I doubt I will ever see. Pool bar did not have ingredients for basic drinks. Food service awful. Staff acts like they are asleep and doing you a favor. No GM or Asst. Gm available to speak with me re concerns. Front desk mgr told me "this is Orlando - it is slow here."

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rae2691
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few nights. My only complaint is all the children, but hey, didn't expect any differently. It is Orlando! KC at the concierge desk was by far the best hotel employee I've ever encountered. Such a sweetheart! Our room was huge and we loved walking across the street to visit Seaworld. Pool area is really nice too and was never crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Cathy A
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Renaissance, and we were impressed in most respects. The lobby area is classy - with the marine theme, a nice gift shop, well-appointed bar area, Starbucks & business center - and makes a good first impression. Also, the valet and reception staff greeted us by name and demonstrated excellent customer service in every way. The complimentary glass of champagne was a nice touch. The room was very large & clean, and the Aveda bathroom products were appreciated. The pool and water play areas for the kids were a big part of our enjoyment, and although we were there for 2 days primarily for a visit to Disney, my daughter asked to spend the whole first day in the pool area. It was relaxing & enjoyable. I have three suggestions that would make it an experience that is more consistent with this quality category. 1: The service in the pool area could be better. Having experienced similar setups at other hotels, I found that although poolside refreshment service was offered, it was inferior to that of other similar hotels. It was somewhat challenging to flag someone down & get a menu, and the follow-up once it was delivered was almost non-existent. Also, we initially set up in the children's water play area, and no service was offered there. It could be that we started there before they started providing poolside service (I read somewhere later that that service starts at 11 a.m.), or maybe they don't send servers to that area at all, I don't know. Either way, parents in that area need that service most of all! Those in the main pool area without kids typically have the freedom to get up & order at the poolside cafe, whereas parents watching children in the kids area would have to drag their kids away from their play, requiring quite a bit of effort in some cases, to get some food at the cafe. In any case, poolside service should start before 11 in my opinion. They post rules that say you may not bring your own drinks/coolers/snacks into the pool area - that opens early in the morning - and then they don't make drinks & snacks accessible? Not good. 2. The beds were very comfortable, but the bedding did not fit the beds, and the sheets were thin & not very high quality. The fitted/bottom sheets did not fit over the bottoms of the mattresses, which gave it a cheap appearance and also meant they did not stay in place very well, especially on the kids' bed. I would have expected better in this price category. 3. Have a lazy river. It would be the perfect finishing touch to what is otherwise an very nice pool area. There are a number of hotels in the area that are similar enough that would have an edge because they have the lazy river. None of the above areas for improvement would keep me from going back, although I might gravitate toward the lazy river at the Hilton on International or the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure & Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: bannertraveler
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Seaworld was a very nice hotel and in an excellent location, directly across from Seaworld. The staff was very accomodating, rooms were very clean, etc. The only thing was that one person at the concierge desk gave us directions to the east coast avoiding the toll roads and interstate. It took us 2 hours through evening traffic to get there. On the way back we took the interstate and toll road and made the trip in one hour fifteen minutes. This person also scheduled our Seaworld Luau on a day that it was not open. These were really just trivial things were easily remedied. Over all 4 night stay was great. One last thing....I must mention the pool area. It is awesome and so picturesque!

Reviews.Title: “Papa & Nan Fox's Family 2012 Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: SHANE48991
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:30 am and was treated really well when we arrrived. The hotel was breathtaking. Our room was very clean and nice. They also gave us Aveda lotion and soaps in our bathroom . On Saturday morning we ate at the breakfast buffet and it was very very good! Having a Starbucks in the property topped it all off! The bell men was very professional and helpful getting us on our way to Disney! Loved it will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it was just wonderful!! There are two hot tubs and a very nice pool that we REALLY enjoyed! We stayed on the 10th floor and had a huge balcony with fantastic views! It is not brand new but kept up very well. Staff was friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: JillDenise123
Reviews.Content: We just left after a 3 night stay at this property. Everything was absolutely perfect. Everyone was soooo helpful and kind. We came back the second night to see that the maid had not only cleaned our room, she laid out our toothbrushes and lined up all 10 pairs of shoes we had thrown in a corner. Just wow. Kids pool area is awesome. Can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHILIP W
Reviews.Content: just checked out Sunday March 4th, had a interior atrium balcony. This was a nice hotel that was perfect for a sea world bound trip. easy access to Sea World. no the hotel is not brand new but is keep up very well. We had a screaming kid next door and the parents did not seem to mind, not the hotels fault. we travel 2/3 weekends a month.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: hydster007
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times for both Sea World & Disney trips. The hotel is very nice. Rooms are nice & spacious. Lobby & atrium are very nice. All hotel staff is friendly & helpful. The Aqua Zone is fun for the kids. Staff @ the Aqua Zone is AWESOME- extremely friendly & helpful with my special needs son. Tradewinds has good food and the kids eat free package make it a good value. Although the resort charges for parking, it is only a short walk from the lobby & pool areas. Location is great- directly across from Sea World & easy commute to Disney. Nice hotel & good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: karrmanng
Reviews.Content: The staff is helpful and courteous, but the rooms are somewhat run down, my room phone did not work, the A/C in the room did not work, and while the front desk was very compassionate the maintenance crew was completely inept at making any repairs. I would not stay here again if other options were available.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: nosrac933
Reviews.Content: The appearance of the hotel is amazing! Upon checking in the staff was standing waiting for the guests arrival and ready to help! The check in process was very quick and efficient! Once we were checked in we went to our room which was spotless and very cozy for our entire stay! The cleaning staff did a terrific job! We scoped out the entire hotel and have no complaints! The pool area was beautiful with outdoor fire pits to relax by! The pool itself was huge and had 2 big hot tubs as well! The only complaint was the waterpark shutdown at 5:30 everynight we were there and we never got to use it because we were at all the attractions! The location to everything was great! I would recommend this place to everyone! Very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JanetC62
Reviews.Content: Right from the time we arrived to our departure it felt like every staff person knew us

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned Business Traveler I was shocked when I checked into this Hotel. If your purpose for being in Orlando is SeaWorld, then you're in the right spot. If you like 1980's Decor, a poor selection of Restaurant Options, and an abundance of whining, wet, kids with bickering Parents, then you're in the right place. Otherwise, keep on looking....

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: We got this on Priceline so i was dubious if we where going to be placed in a broom cupboard somewhere in it :) But i have to stay this hotel was FANTASTIC! Fast checkin - asked if we would like some champagne or apple cider when we checked in. Super friendly check in staff - i wish i could remember the guys name who checked us in as he was brilliant. Beautiful atrium, truely stunning - excellent pool area with great loungers and hot tubs, excellent gym. The room was immaculate and with a Seaworld View. Its not a hotel i would have picked myself but im so glad priceline found us it.... i would definitly go back. It was been by far the best hotel of our stay. Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: Ebony G
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one night stay at the Renaissance Orlando. Check in only took five minutes and we were given a glass of champagne. The staff in the lobby were super friendly and when you walk into the atrium of the hotel it is really pretty. We had a room on the 8th floor, and even though the hotel was full because it was All Star weekend in Orlando, the hotel felt cozy and comfortable. The beds were very great and it was really cool to have a balcony that over looked the atrium. No complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, with incredible conference facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy G
Reviews.Content: The renaissance is the Marriott flagship, so you know you're getting not notch. They are centrally located next to seaworld, with incredible ameneities, and a world class conference center. If you are looking to host a large audience and need a centralized venue, the renaissance is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzychicken
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Renaissance Resort at Seaworld was a great hotel. We stayed here for our anniversary for a few days. The location can't be beat for going to Seaworld. You just cross the street and you're there. Check in was a breeze. Free glass of champagne upon arrival. We booked a package through Seaworld and requested a room with an outside balcony. Just be aware - there is a $30.00 charge per night for a balcony and we are Marriott rewards members. Also, just know that parking is $16.00 a day. We had a room on the 8th floor overlooking Seaworld. The room was huge with a king bed and seperate sitting area with a couch, coffee table and desk. The bathroom was large with 2 sinks. Amenities include coffee maker, coffee (not the best), refrigerator, safe and iron. Wi-fi was $14.95 a day. Our balcony was so huge, 20 people could have fit out there. Sunrise and Sunset were awesome to look at. Other than Seaworld, there is not a lot to do within walking distance. Check with the concierge to check out menus for various area restaurants. They also have coupons for some of them, but you have to ask. There is a trolley that stops in front of the hotel. A one way ride is $1.25 (exact change required) and will take you to a number of places. We went to Point Orlando, just 8 stops from the hotel. Just remember, the trolley rides end at 10:30 p.m. The hotel offers 1 day passes for $4.00. The only downside for us was the pillows. They were way too soft for our liking. Even with 2 pillows doubled up, it was tough getting a good nights sleep. The Starbucks in the lobby was a plus and the pool area is great. Try the hot tub! We'll definitely be back for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: R0bot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2012 and overall had a nice experience but some drawbacks as well. Here's the good and bad: The good: You can't beat this location if you're visiting Sea World. It's the closest hotel by far and we made the easy walk there even though the hotel offers bus transportation right to the front gate. Nice touch to have the hotel offer champagne and sparkling cider at checkin. It was so nice to just walk back to the hotel after our SW visit; other hotels are available fairly nearby but a much longer walk especially when traveling with a six year old. Renaissance Sea World is a comfortable, modern hotel with impressive architecture. It's like a gigantic box facing Sea World with the walls of the box consisting of rooms, the floor of the box is the lobby, restaurants, and ballrooms; and the rest of the box is open air with large lattice structures holding up a huge skylight. The hotel staff was very friendly throughout our visit. Our room was spacious and the bathroom had luxurious marble tile floors and very large double sink countertops. The outdoor pool is massive, the hot tub large and refreshing, and the kids water park is one of the best I've seen anywhere. Our daughter wants to go back to this hotel for this feature alone, as she spent a good two hours there. The bad: We booked this hotel based on our status as Sea World annual passholders attending the 'Bands Brew and BBQ' event at SW. We selected the Renaissance knowing it was a premium priced hotel with advertised benefits and a great location. The hotel's website advertises that for the BBBQ event, annual passholders are entitled to a special room rate (which we received), a free breakfast for kids, and free self parking. There are also other amenities available to SW annual passholders year-long that we didn't know about at booking, including free 'Quick Que' passes. At checkin, we got the special event passholder rate per our reservation, but were told the free self parking was for Sea World - meaning if we drove across the street to the Sea World parking lot we could park free, which we could do as annual passholders anyway, but when we drove back to the hotel for the night we would still have to pay the hotel's self parking rate of $17/night. We never heard anything about the advertised free kids breakfast or other available Sea World passholder benefits like Quick Que. In our room, which was on the top floor near the elevator, there was a consistent clack-clack-clack noise that I assume was related to the operation of the nearby elevator. It was noticeable as soon as we checked in, and while not ridiculously loud and probably not avoidable, it was an unwelcome disruption especially as we were trying to sleep. Our room had some nice features but others that need upgrading for a premium hotel - flatscreens are small, room has double vs. queen beds, and there is evident wear and tear. The verdict: This is a very nice hotel that has an unbeatable location if you are going to Sea World. It's a premium priced hotel and has great amenities, but make sure you understand (and get) all the things you should be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: This Marriott-owned resort was awesome- from the rooms, to dining experience, and customer service. I stayed five nights for a conference in mid-February and found the food and its presentation was very good, given the number of person being served. The pool area was just beautiful and included two large hot tubs. The grounds were kept impeccably clean. The inside/atrium area of the hotel was one of the most striking I've seen and the aquatic theme nicely done. Lounge areas were numerous and comfortable. Internet was free in this open area, but did not reach the outside pool. Employees were very helpful, cheerful, and courteous. Recommend as somewhere to stay on business travel or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Orlando”
Reviews.Author: gillyutd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010 for our honeymoon in Orlando. We could not fault the hotel it was very clean and tidy and the pool area was great. (for the little time we spent here) We found it an excellent base, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Our choice each time we visit..”
Reviews.Author: BellaPhia
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, and each time we visit the Orlando area, we choose to stay here. You ask for anything more for the price. The rooms are spacious, the food options are great (and the on site Starbucks is a bonus), the pools is wonderful (but get a spot early), and the kids water park is fun for both parents and kids. Anyone who complains about this hotel, in my opinion, must be the type of person that must find something to complain about all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Mtraveler84
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Renaissance Orlando Resort at Sea World. The property is not new, but does not feel dated. The rooms are very large with comfortable beds and extra room to relax. The breakfast buffet served daily is really great. It includes fresh fruit, pastries, a smoothie bar, as well as made to order eggs, omelets, pancakes and waffles. The pool area is beautiful. There are two pool areas, one peaceful and the other lots of fun for younger children. The kids even enjoyed their ping pong table. The Starbucks downstairs was a nice treat and the atrium lobby is very pretty. The one draw back was the limited self-laundry facilities. There is only one washer and one dryer for the entire property! And it is a huge hotel. The location can't be beat for a trip to Sea World, which is directly across the street, but we found it to be very convenient for all of the Disney parks as well. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with their roomy suites for families”
Reviews.Author: TripMel
Reviews.Content: We live locally and stay here on occassion as a treat for the kids after a long day at sea world. We have stayed at this exact property numerous times over the past 3 years, and after staying last night, I was still very satisfied, especially with the newly redecorated suite we stayed in. Will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Well Trained Staff, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: sfischburg
Reviews.Content: I use over 100 different hotels per year and must say that I have rarely experienced such well trained, caring, sincere, helpful staff. Arrival was interesting as there was a chorus of front office staff offering champagne on silver serving trays. While I didn't accept the alcohol it was a nice touch. I was attending a convention and the hotel is set up well for a self contained convention of up to 700 people (guess). The location was good for a convention as there is no where to go without a taxi, but from a tourist perspective you have to drive to I-Drive. I was checked into a room with 2 queen beds. The room was ok, however it was not clean. There were bodily fluids staining the bed ruffle which really turned me off. Mattress was old - not comfortable. There was a party in the room next door and I felt as if they were in my room. The power outlet on the desk on the lamp didn't work. There was no power by the bed. On the positive side, the shower head was a rain shower-head and the water was softened. First time I have experienced that. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venue for a Great Conference!”
Reviews.Author: Perry H
Reviews.Content: The Service and the Attendants covering our rooms and meals were OUTSTANDING!!! Friendly, personable, and all round great experience. Thanks AGAIN! Perry

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family and convention fun”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavenFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from the moment I drove up and a smiling young man helped me with my luggage and car. Best of all there was no outrageous charge for valet parking and one guy took my luggage out of the car and up to the room so there was no need to tip a zillion people.
