Room was gorgeous, like a mini-suite with couch and chair and desk + bed. Quiet but convenient. Great comfy bed and spotless bathroom with marble vanity and tile. No problem getting an accessible room and a lovely fruit basket was waiting for me when I checked in. Yes, I paid for it but it was very reasonable and the fruit was delicious. Fridge in the room was convenient and the ballroom convention spaces were convenient and very nice. I would definitely stay at this hotel again- nicest hotel I have stayed at in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights 2/3-2/7. Upon arrival we were greeted and treated in a friendly manner. The room we had was just the right size-Executive Suite. There is a Starbucks on location that was very handy and we did visit the on site restaurant for breakfast 1 morning as well. The hotel is not far from other eating establishments and shopping so we liked the location. Overall, good hotel- no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Discover the difference! Business or fun, this Resort has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Jon E
Reviews.Content: You know a hotel understands hospitality when you arrive and the first thing that happens is that you are greeted with a genuine smile and your choice of sparkling cider or champagne! Something so simple really set the tone for my stay. The front desk was more than helpful during my stay and always had an answer for my questions. The rooms are enormous, spotless, and comfy. I recommend having lunch at the poolside bar, Palms. There is the perfect mix of sun and shade out there to meet everyones needs. Although I do not have kids the "R" Aqua Zone looked like a hoot, if I was 20 years younger I would have spent all day out there. Inside the must visit place to eat is Mist. The Sushi is fantastic and the staff is friendly and attentive. The beakfast restaurant is called Tradewinds and they have a really good buffet. On my last morning I tried the Corned Beef Hash and was sad I did not order it prior... The Chef knows his stuff. I spoiled myself on Sunday morning and got a massage at the Spa. Diana (?) gave me a Hadachi massage which is done entirely with her feet. IT WAS AMAZING! The Spa has everything you need and the shower I took afterword was the icing on the cake. SIX shower heads! That is all fine and dandy, but the part that made the difference for me was the staff. This is the first hotel I have ever stayed at that when I called down to valet for my car it was waiting in the drive when I walked out. Not once, but every single time. They would even put a cold bottle water in there once in a while! Each time they offered assistance with directions or suggestions in the local area. When I returned from my outings they recognized me by name. Allistar in the Boardwalk Sports Bar was also awesome. The hotel is literally walking distance to Seaworld, and only one exit from Downtown Disney and not far from Universal either. I was in Orlando without being overwhelmed with Disney. I love this place and will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: April B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. The rooms are big, the pools are amazing, and the service is the best EVER! We walked right across the parking lot to Sea World and were even permitted to keep our car parked at the hotel. This was the best hotel experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Parking and Internet NOT included”
Reviews.Author: Prreader
Reviews.Content: We pricelined this hotel for a reasonable amount, but the extra $16+1.04 tax per day sure messed up our budget. Internet in the rooms was $15/night, but it was free in the lobby area. This hotel is enormous. The pool and hot tubs were great. They had free ping pong and a game room. The fitness center is well equipped and quite large. It has multiple treadmills, elipticals, bikes, free weights, and machines. It even has a mirrored aerobics room with balance balls and yoga mats. The lobby was huge and well appointed. Our room looked out onto the Sea World lot. It was fun watching it fill each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Eileen C
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific time. The staff was extremely attentive and were available for every need. Definitely will return with my family for a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance - terribly disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Fyn_Dup
Reviews.Content: After a week's stay at the Palms in Miami we drove up to Orlando for a few days at the amusement parks. We really weren't expecting too much as far as hotels go, but we thought that with the Renaissance we were sure to get a standard level of comfort and service. Firstly, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who has a problem with heights. The atrium with the hotel rooms on all four sides gives the impression of being in a high ceilinged industrial warehouse. The massive space gives the hotel a deserted look. The ambience is cold and there's a mish mash of of interior decoration that does nothing to help that. Cool, strangely shaped rattan lounge sofas are strategically positioned in the atrium but ruined by a terrible blue/green/orange carpet that the hotel should have done away with in the 90s. Other beach/lounge chairs give the whole thing a confused look. The sushi bar is modern but we gave it a skip because the fish didn't look fresh that evening. The best place for a drink and a bite to eat would be the hotel's sports bar, which is warm and inviting. The pool area is beautiful and it's a real shame that the rest of the hotel does not have the same standard. We found our room - which had two queen beds - disappointing. Although spacious, the room is furnished poorly. - The fridge droned so loudly, we had to unplug it from the socket. - There was no minibar. - The coffee/tea machine was stored in the closet and from the calcified look it had and the dust it had gathered, it obviously hadn't been cleaned for some time. - The hair dryer was likewise full of white dust/mould and a long strand of someone's dead hair was still on it (and I have the pictures to prove it). Also, the length of the cord meant you had to stand right by the bathroom door when using the hair dryer otherwise you would pull it out of the socket. - There was a wet, used face flannel hanging on the back of the shower head. - The chair by the office table was dusty and hadn't been cleaned either. - Wi-Fi in the room cost $14.95 for the first 24 hours and self parking now costs $16. - I believe someone already mentioned the Fedex Business Center. For a hotel of Renaissance's stature I would expect a decent internet connection if my credit card is being charged by the minute to use your business center computers. I felt frustrated and embarrassed for the hotel. - I must say, the thing that we found most unacceptable was the behaviour of some of the front desk staff. It's highly uprofessional behaviour to gossip about your guests (regardless of what they look like, where they're from, who they're with or any other factor) particularly when they are in full view of you and can see you doing it! The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that there was a highly competent, polite staffer (Australian/ Canadian?) working at the sports bar who made at least that bit of our stay enjoyable and the ladies who worked at the inhouse Starbucks were a pleasure too. Overall, for $320 dollars a night I would expect a little more from a Renaissance hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jan 31, 2011 Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ichabod66604
Reviews.Content: My spouse was a presenter at a seminar at the hotel. We received a huge corner room and a complimentary fruit and cheese tray. The staff was very attentive to the seminar needs. The hotel was lovely with a huge open atrium and free wi-fi in spots of the lobby. Parking was $15/day. We were right across from the Sea World entrance. There was only one hotel restaraunt available at lunch, but it was fine. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The tub and shower were one unit, and the tub a little slippery. We had a safe and frig, and the usual amenities in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: IslandAdventure4
Reviews.Content: We really loved the Renaissance It is both beautiful inside and out. We have a 5 year old son, and a 3 year old daughter. we checked in about 9:30pm on a Friday and stayed til Sunday. The pictures do not do it justice. The lobby is amazing. very big and tall, had a great feel to it. the staff was very pleasant. we went up to our room and got settled. (we had a view of Sea World) rooms were very spacious, we had 2 queen beds, with a little sitting area with 2 chairs end table and foot rests, there was also a desk and chair, (which was great for charging phones, cameras, laptop etc.) bathroom was spacious. only issue was counter was very high kids had to use desk chair to brush teeth. (no biggie) we then went down to the sports bar in the lobby and got a bit to eat. food was ok, (but is was 10pm at night. next morning we had a quickie breakfast Starbucks (coffee, Danish) we got our Sea World passes from concierge, which came with fast passes (can only be used on big rides) and we walked across the street to Sea World, about a 5 min. walk. they do provide a shuttle if you would like. after a day at the park we ate at the other restaurant in the lobby, I think is was trade winds?? it was a very quiet relaxing dinner, food was very good. after dinner we took a stroll outside to check things out. very pretty we actual sat on couches around a fire pit while the kids ran around. Next morning we had breakfast at Trade winds, breakfast buffet was more economic, was very good, made yummy omelets to order. After breakfast we checked out and put our luggage in their secured room and went to the water park and pool area outback. both were awesome. water park is geared towards littler kids but still fun. pool area was really relaxing, there is a huge pool bar, with a full menu. (burger baskets looked yummy) I could have spent a few more days just relaxing at the pool. we left about 2 pm, concierge had us loaded up luggage and all within 5 minuets for Disney World and off we went.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but right in the thick of it”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Mandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks beginning of Jan 2012. Really funny experience walking to Sea World!! it really is that close. If booking as a package (we went with Virgin) the advertised $16 per day hotel car parking parking is waved. All aspects of the hotel were very clean, well maintained and coupled with the normal fantastic USA service and genuine want to help you out. Attraction tickets sold at a generous discount. The most important thing that impressed me was the total lack of in your face attitude that sometimes the Americans can be guilty of. All of the staff, whatever their role, were fantastically friendly, helpful and there at an instant to help you out, but no pushiness. Really good this aspect. I don't think you could get better if you add up the location, so easy to find from Orlando airport, just out of the way, but seconds from Interantional Drive & 192 and minutes from Disney. If your visit is a first to Orlando and you are worried/daunted especially with children about the prospect of staying safe, quality and ease of finding your way around, put this hotel at the top of your list for consideration, it really is that good, well located for a visit to the Mouse and all the other theme parks. It is also only minutes away from the main roads that take you north/south or east/west. Steve & Mandy Williams

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay P
Reviews.Content: Excellent conference hotel, with great networking locations and atmosphere. Staff are very nice and helpful. Daniel the bartender is great! Rooms are spacious, comfortable and well-appointed. Tradewinds restaurant has very good food, lunch is reasonably priced. Breakfast not as economically priced however... Easy to find, close to Disney, Universal, and of course Sea World. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott does a great job here!”
Reviews.Author: cmpqse
Reviews.Content: Great for families with a really fun pool. Rooms very clean and a service staff that goes all out for the guest. I was very impressed and would return. I would have to say this was a maybe some of the best Marriott Staff I have ever seen

Reviews.Title: “A great conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: packingandunpacking
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance SeaWorld for four nights this month, while attending a conference. It is a very comfortable hotel for a conference as every part of the hotel is just a short walk. It was a pleasure to be in a warm climate for a few days, and the many outdoor seating areas, both inside the pool enclosure and just outside the ballroom were close enough for a quick dose of sunshine between sessions. The area feels quite safe for going for a walk around the block. I only had one lunch in the Tradewinds Restaurant. Service was excellent and the food was very good. Hotel catering did serve us a couple of group buffet lunches, several receptions and breaks and the quality was consistently good. An added bonus is the ease of using public buses, as both the I-Link (for shopping along International Drive, with Premier Outlets both north and south) and the Lynx city buses (for a 30 minute ride to the Florida Mall) have stops at the back of the hotel on Westwood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: JogNy
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed with my recent stay, for a conference. First of all, when I reserved online, I specifically requested and was confirmed for a single king-size bed, but when I arrived, I was told that all of those rooms were taken and I was given two queen beds. The hotel is big, and the rooms are laid out in a rectangle around a large interior courtyard. There are only two elevator banks, in the middle on opposite sides of the large sides of the rectangle, so it's almost always going to be a long walk to your room. There are outside rooms, which have a view of little more than the Sea World parking lot, and inside rooms, whose glass doors open out onto the interior courtyard. But they are also visible from the hallways that surround the courtyard, so you must keep your drapes drawn or people will see in. This is really bad when you wake up, because you can't get any light in the room until you're dressed. (Rooms are dark, with low-wattage light bulbs.) After several days, the effect was claustrophobic, never seeing the outside world until we went outside the hotel. The courtyard has what looks like a huge fish tank, but it's just apparently a model. There are no fish, nor even water. There are several large TV screens showing video of fish. There are a couple of bars, but they are overpriced, the bar where where we drank was not well-stocked and the bartender made weak drinks poorly. The outdoor swimming pool has a bar, but it was even less well-stocked, and the bartender had never even heard of drinks or brands we were asking for. Plus it closed at 6 p.m. Also, the bathrooms are big, with double sinks, but there is no shaving/makeup mirror. The wide countertops are a bit away from the mirrors, so if you are nearsighted, it's hard to see while you're shaving or applying makeup. Not a dealbreaker, but worth noting. Cable TV pixilated or blacked out regularly. There is a FedEx business center, but it closes at 5 p.m. and is closed on weekends, when our business conference was scheduled, so you can't, for instance, ship heavy business materials back home. The hotel wasn't totally terrible - the staff was helpful and nice, and the restaurant was decent. We got a special room rate for the conference, but the posted rate in the room was $459. Are they kidding? For this? Taxes, fees, parking and internet will add to the bill. Some of these things sound like needless quibbles, but the small things add up to make the difference between a nice stay and a mediocre one.

Reviews.Title: “4+ star property, however age is showing”
Reviews.Author: WalterBTV
Reviews.Content: Nice property, huge rooms and clean. Only issue is that property is dated with old fixtures and furniture. Would stay at newer property if had a choice, however was happy with the quality level of this hotel. Got a great rate via an online bidding site. PS- Food was good at the sports bar, except the hamburger/cheeseburger - no taste at all. Order the lobster quesadillas- awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort hotel for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: nhpod
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a business conference. The hotel property is spacious and elegant. The lobby is similar to Embassy Suites, but much more dramatic. Lots of waterfalls, ponds, and itimate seating areas. The staff is very friendly and accomodating and check-in is fast. I was surprised that there was a charge for parking ( $16/day) as this is more a suburban and not a big city hotel ( think NYC or Boston) with a premium on parking. If you drive your options are limited as there is no street parking. So factor in this cost when staying here. The pool area was superb. Two large hot tubs. Lots of seating possibilities including a large day-bed type of affair which invites napping. The woman in charge of the pool area was very helpful. Food at the pool restaurant also very good. Two criticisms: 1) Avoid a room at the back of the hotel near the large AC units. They cycle on and off all night and for light sleepers they can be troublesome. It was to me 2) I am not sure why the toilets have push-buttons rather than flush mechanisms. They do not work well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: SproutTrout
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in the hotel in January on route to a cruise. The lobby staff, activities desk, and Hertz rental desk were all friendly and professional. The room was large and clean. We got a room with a generous balcony and a pull out couch, which made me wish we had the kids along. There is a beautiful pool area, with many unique seating options and two hot tubs. There's also a special kid's waterpark. Trahsportation to Universal Studios and Sea World is free, but be sure to check in the night before with the activities desk to get your shuttle ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a week in January 2012”
Reviews.Author: DaveandTrina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Orlando at SeaWorld as a result of a business event. My wife traveled with me. Overall we liked the hotel. Our room had a very large balcony, which we enjoyed. The Sushi Bar was good but had a limited selection on the menu. The hotel is well maintained but will need some updating in the next couple of years. We did have a problem with our in room safe, but the staff was very helpful in fixing it. The only thing that bothered me about our stay was that their internet access was very slow. To the point of almost being unusable. Which was a problem for me traveling on business and owning a software company. Otherwise, I would definitely consider staying there again when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Kathrin80
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business conference. I had a room facing inside the hotel. The roomsize was pleasant, but: the bathtub was so old, it had scratches and stones inside iand you wonder if one should were slippers. the door to the small balkony would not close proper, so you hear the noice when they arrange breakfast downstairs or people celebrate in the evenings. so you might want to get a room facing the outside, but then you can't open the windows. the conference facilities were ok, but they are unable to prepare proper breakfast or a dinner for large groups. there were ofteh stains on the chairs.... is it so hard to clean them? reception and staff was always nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for SeaWorld visit”
Reviews.Author: wilhelm7
Reviews.Content: Just got back and it is the best location if you want to walk to SeaWorld. It is directly across the street. The hotel also offers great perks because of its affiliation with SeaWorld. If you are going to the parks, make sure you talk to the Concierge. He let me know about a buy 1 day get one day free pass which was great because we arrived at noon, only giving us 6 hrs at the park. The free extra day added was a huge bonus. And their tickets were cheaper than at the gate. And no line to deal with either. The rooms are spacious enough and as some have posted, they are looking a bit outdated relative to other Marriot properties. Parking is $17 a day fyi. You can't beat the SeaWorld convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baileyjenny
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Clean and modern with much to do; you really don't need to leave the hotel for anything with the restaurant, bars, starbucks, etc. all inside. Sea World is literally across the street. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired - the hotel not me!”
Reviews.Author: seabird20
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for a business conference. Apart from the woman who checked me in, the hotel staff were delightful. The lobby is stunning. The food choices are awful - well breakfast was barely OK, but the rest of the food not so much. The room was comfortable enough - pretty much as expected. They had my preferences locked and loaded, so it was good. Aveda bath products - very nice. The conference facilities worked well. The bar was OK - a bit limited on the beers. The sushi rice was dreadful. The sushi products were fine - lots of weird rolls, but a few (very limited) choices of fish. 4 in total, I think. The really bad stuff was coming from the kitchen. From surly egg cooks at breakfast to woefully undercooked potatoes on every occasion. Cooking hashed browns isn't hard. When they are brown they are done. When they are white they aren't

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel if you are going to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Mechelle F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful courtyard style lobby! Clean, spacious rooms. Courteous staff. Our family stays often. Many Sea World perks for guests of this hotel. We can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age...”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingProf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Nice friendly welcome with champagne for the adults and juice for the kids was a nice touch. Rooms are a bit dated - don't like the fact that the door to the room does not automatically close as one now expects - found my door ajar a couple of times as a result. The doors also do not securely close - there's about 1 cm of play that allows it to rattle, even though the door is closed and locked. Beautiful atrium and a nice pool complements the stay. Great location if you're heading to Sea World; otherwise, there's a trolley stop right out front that will take you to the happening places along International Drive. Maid service was spotty - while the room was cleaned and the bed was made, I would always be shorted on one of the toiletries. Overall, a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cazza30 Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy although we didn't receive the champagne we saw others receiving on their arrival. The hotel was beautifully decorated with a giant Christmas tree and huge gingerbread house. We were initially disappointed to walk in the room and see we didn't have a balcony that overlooked the giant atrium just a giant window that overlooked a car park, however the room was huge and beautiful and we were so busy for the week we were in Orlando that it wasn't an issue at all. All the staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful and my husband loved having a starbucks on site although the opening hours could have been longer. We had no problem self parking each day, valet parking is available if you want it. The pool area is amazing and my 12 year old loved the splash zone, parents of younger children would love this area as there is plenty of room to relax, toilets nearby and a large shaded area. it takes less than 10 minutes to walk from the foyer to the entrance at Seaworld and you get fast passes for the rides- speak to the hotel concierge Orry who was lovely and remembered all our names when we spoke to him a day or 2 later. We have stayed in Orlando Villas, in Kissimee and at a moderate Disney hotel a few times but this is our new favourite Orlando hotel and we can't wait to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: luv2getaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance to end our trip in Orlando and loved it! The front desk staff was fantastic and the room was very clean and large. The only downside is the cost of the parking. It would be nice if this was included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Gamecock bowl game”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic. Everything you coul want was provided. Enjoyed the Starbucks located in the motel. Good appetizers at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes a difference - Top notch resort”
Reviews.Author: annelisle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our college football team on a trip to the Capital One Bowl for a week. When you are gone for an entire week, sometimes the hotel lifestyle can wear you out. This was more like being in a home with a plethora of entertainment right outside the door. We had several instances that we needed interaction with staff and found them to be friendly and quick to respond. The television reception in our suite was bad. The tech team was there within 5 minutes of our call. He made several attempts to correct it inside the building but found it necessary to go outside and work with the dish. He gave us a free movie in the other room for the inconvenience which made my sick daughter very happy. This gesture was something so simple but greatly appreciated. Our housekeeper worked quickly around us when we found ourselves in our room for the day with a sick child. She was sweet and changed out all of the linens in both rooms after we informed her of the illness. We didn't ask her to... she did it of her own accord. We had connecting rooms - a king room (very roomy with an awesome balcony overlooking the pool and firepits) and a king suite (beautifully appointed in peacock colors with wonderful furnishings including a sectional with pull-out). Our room was right next one of the elevators which we never heard. (I will add that this elevator closed at 9pm each night which may have helped the noise potential) This is a true resort with several places to eat, a couple of lounge areas, a full-service spa on the second floor and amazing grounds topped off with one of the best pool areas I have seen. There is a top notch water park for kids in the pool area. I have never seen one of this size at a resort outside of the Caribbean. The pool area is full of hammocks, beach beds and clam shell chairs. Awesome poolside bar! Finally... the location. It can't be beat! This resort is directly across the street from Sea World. We walked to and from the park. The on ramp to I-4 is the equivalent of 2 blocks away. Downtown Disney is the next exit. If you go the other way, Universal Studios is the next exit. Great outlet shopping located about a mile and a half away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlestonfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel for the Citrus Bowl (1/2/12). The hotel was packed as it was the Team Hotel for the University of South Carolina. I called that morning to check on the price and it was fairly high but they offered us a $100 resort gift certificate that we could use for meals, etc. So I booked the room because with the $100 discount it was a very good rate. When I checked in the front desk confirmed the $100 discount offer and told me to charge the meals to the room and get the credit or that I could just get $100 off of my room rate. We ate in the Boardwalk restaurant in the hotel and it was a good experience as you could see all of the folks after the game including many of the players and coaches. The meal itself was pretty good. The room was nice and we had a balcony overlooking the atrium. We got our bill the next morning and it did not include the $100 discount. I called the front desk and asked about the credit and was told the $100 credit was only good for a 3 night stay! The front desk clerk would not clear up the mistake and I had to speak to her supervisor. I had to hold for 5 minutes and finally they agreed to give the credit to us. On check out I called to speak to valet to get my car brought around and the front desk said valet does not have an extension and that I would have to come downstairs to ask for my car. So I did and then during the wait had a latte in Starbucks. All in all a good time and if you ever attend the Citrus Bowl as a fan of the SEC, this is the team hotel. Staying at the team hotel is the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: melon m
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located next to seaworld park and offers great breakfast in the room price .The pools are great for kids and it has a nice atrium.Shame about 16usd parking fee per day and outrageous internet charges at fedex office downstairs-(40 cents per minute)

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: Luis G
Reviews.Content: this hotel was excellent in every way.. i would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Igknighter
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here during the Capital Bowl New Year's weekend. Our team stayed here and we wanted to be near all the planned activities. We enjoyed our stay so much. We found it peaceful and quiet and it was packed with guest. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The lobby is beautiful. We had a room with a balcony looking over the lobby and we enjoyed being able to open the French style doors and "people" watch! The night before the game a group of small children started an impromptu touch football game in at one end of the lobby. They had great time a bothered no one! We used the self park, which worked out for us since our university had activities for us to attend each day. We ate at BB King's restaurant last night located at Pointe Orlando. We heard a blues band Shau Rounds, who we thought was amazing! I would like to return to this hotel and bring my grandkids they would love the pool. It was 83 degrees on Jan. 1st. Now if my team wins today this will be a very special memory for us!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay while visiting Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: masseytravels
Reviews.Content: This trip was a surprise trip by husband for Christmas. We checked in smoothly without any problems. They stay was the same. We did not have to talk to the front desk for anything the entire stay.. That's when a vacation really stands out!! We were pitched a return timeshare stay, but they were not annoying about it. The pool area was great.. Get there early for a chair with sun ..as the palm trees block some sun. The fire pits at night was a cool added touch after a swim before bed. I would stay again.. No doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Schupps
Reviews.Content: We booked the Renaissance for the Thanksgiving break based on overall reviews in the last few months and its close proximity to SeaWorld Orlando. The hotel is literally only a few minutes walk over the road from the massive SeaWorld car park. Our room was spotless--from the glossy tiled bathroom floor to the often overlooked areas behind the TV and on the floor of the built-in robe. The reception staff were always very helpful with any enquiries. It was good value for money especially with the daily buffet breakfast included with our booking. Most of our time was spent at SeaWorld so on our last evening, we walked around the complex and tried their swimming and spa pools. There was a children's water play ground but it was closed by the time our family arrived in the early evening. For older children there was also a small games room on the ground floor. We sampled the hotel bar's sushi combination platter for dinner on our last evening--the sushi was so tender and delicious that we ordered a second platter. The service was courteous, friendly and prompt and aside from a delay with our dessert (it was taken to the wrong hotel bar area), almost seamless. One of the reception staff recommended taking a trolley bus to either the northern or southern premium shopping outlets in town and were happy to store our luggage on the last morning until we had returned from our trip. We would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Terri D
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! The location right across from Sea World makes it easy to visit the park all day. I have stayed twice for New Year's Eve because of this, no more fighting traffic after the fireworks. I've always received great service from the front desk to room service to housekeeping. Also, room service was well priced, when compared to eating at the parks all day. Have the breakfast buffet, worth the price for made to order omlettes and pancakes with chocolate chips, blueberries and even gummy bears.

Reviews.Title: “Last but not least...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg on our Christmas vacation, which took us from Tampa (home) to Savannah to St. Augustine and then to Orlando for the ICE exhibit at the Gaylord Palms. The hotel was incredibly busy, but we were able to check into our room with ease. The king room was very large and comfortable. With the breakfast buffet (normally $21 per person) for two daily, the cost was only $109 a night for Marriot Rewards members. Even with a hotel full of families, our room was incredibly quiet. A nice end to a very nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel evere stayed”
Reviews.Author: Mariusz N
Reviews.Content: Booked two double bed rooms a month in advance, arrived lateat 10 pm, waited 15 min at front desk and were told there is only one room on reservation (paid already for two) after 30 min at front desk they found two rooms but the servive person wasn't polite. in the morning the guests of other room got bite mark on legs and arms. We told that at the front dest but they told that its not possible. Also the rooms were dusty. I would not recomend the hotel to anybody else. will never go there again. And $16 for parking? Give me a breat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Raymond H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days and everything was wonderful. Waiters, waitresses, bar staff, valets and front desk were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No way 5 stars!!! Dusty hotel with dusty service!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahtilden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in December. We had stayed at Hard Rock Hotel for 7 nights then 7 nights in a Ana y Jose in Tulum Mexico (both excellent) and had 1 night before returning to UK. Our daughter wanted to go to Seaworld (Discovery Cove) & so we booked this 5 star thru Virgin Holidays which states it is an excellent base for seaworld. Despite the booking being made a week in advance the hotel had no record of us. After some checking the room was found. It was 830pm. We were given a card saying we had 10 % off at the sushi restaurant. We went to the restaurant at 830 and it was closed! Eventually after speaking to 4 people we were told it had closed as they had only made $50 that night! We were offered an extra 10% off at the bar and had to have a bar snack of deep fried chicken wings or some such - not exactly 5* sushi! The room was a shock! An ugly view of something industrial looking & a loud annoying air-conditioning unit. The room was so dusty I started sneezing! I tried to phone to get it cleaned or to change but the phone didn't work. I then asked a man at one of the desks for an ATM he shrugged & said he was new & didn't know. I asked another person for details of Discovery Cove (part of Seaworld) & was told she didn't know as the hotel had nothing tO do with them. We got up early and left and although no-one had told us we knew we were entitled to fast passes for seaworld so got some. We didn't try out anything else so maybe other things in the hotel are OK. I won't be trying it out again. It was cheaper than the Club Level at Hard Rock but both are 5 star but I think they are like different planets! The Renaissance was a complete let down! Totally at odds with the rest of our Florida experience. There did not appear any link with Seaworld (apart from queue jump tickets) and it was soulless and very dusty!

Reviews.Title: “Sea World Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty cool hotel. It's probably not the nicest or the newest but it has a lot going for it. We really enjoyed the pool scene. Huge pool with lots to do. Live entertainment near the bar and awesome tennis courts made for a lot of fun. We were there for Sea World across the street but wish we could have spent more time at the hotel. Rooms were great with comfortable beds and linens and room was very clean. Inside of hotel has beautiful atrium area with lots to do. We were there on a Saturday night and maybe not every night has a lot happening but the night we were there was a lot of action and a lot of fun. This hotel is well maintained and the best location for trips to Sea World. We were very happy with our stay and I hope you will be to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but the room was just okay”
Reviews.Author: Disneyprofmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights solely for the purpose of visiting Sea World and Aquatica. That worked out great. We walked to Sea World and walked back late at night, feeling perfectly safe the whole time. We also walked to Aquatica and took an easy trolley ride ($1.25) back to the hotel. The hotel is also simply beautiful and the staff was very nice. That being said, we did have problems with our room. Bedding was not provided for the pull-out sofa. When we attempted to call the front desk, the phone did not work so we had to go downstairs. The door never really shut properly. We didn't get enough towels on our second night (which was a real problem when the toilet backed up just as we were preparing to leave). Our view was also terrible. We were on a Sea World package and I'm not sure if that made a difference. We did alert the staff to the problems with the room and the issues that could be rectified were rectified. Would we come back? Probably. My feeling is that the room was an aberration. It looked like it might have been out of service for awhile and maybe that explains the issues we had.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BasingstokeTiggy
Reviews.Content: spent 2 weeks at this hotel and our room was overlooking seaworld wow,great place to stay and the staff at the hotel were amazing,i would deffinatley go back to this hotel if i decided to go back.I.ride rigfht outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Up grade to fire works view, NO Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Henrique R
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, so the lobby view is better and cheaper than Sea World view...

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: volksaudinut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights for a business meeting that was being held at the property. Hotel lobby is quite grand and beautiful - the aquatic theme used throughout is great. Front desk staff offered me a glass of champagne and worked with me to find a nice room as I am Marriott Platinum. I was offered a "Parlor Suite," which I was told was newly renovated. The one caveat with this room is that it is equipped with a Murphy Bed (the kind that can "tuck away" into a wall), so it's not your typical Marriott/Renaissance signature feather-topped bed. Not too bad, though, as the room was HUGE (at least 600 sq ft), and was equipped with a dining room table for 6, a large sectional couch, double vanity in the bathroom, and brand-new, very contemporary furnishings and decor. The large flat-screen TV was nice, too. I enjoyed the Aveda toiletries and the room was relatively quiet, except for when the neighboring room's kids decided to run up and down the halls every morning around 7 am. I enjoyed the lobby bar, but didn't frequent the hotel's two restaurants as I felt they were very overpriced. The fitness room was PHENOMENAL and one of the best I've ever experienced - tons of machines, free weights, kettle bells, yoga mats, exercise balls, bosu balls, and more. New-in-bag headphones also provided for workouts. The pool and grounds of this hotel are immaculate and I enjoyed some pool side lounging. I wish it had been warm enough to swim in the pool as it looked very nice. Parking was easy, although it cost $16/day. Access to area shopping and restaurants is easy via rental car or a tram (ask at the front desk). Note to Marriott Gold and Platinum members: as this is a Renaissance Resort property, there is neither a Concierge Lounge nor is there a daily breakfast buffet voucher. Therefore, they give you a 500-point bonus instead (this is on top of whatever Welcome Amenity you select if you are a Platinum member).

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa V
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days at this Hotel and couldn't have been happier! We had 4 adults (one over 70 with a motorized cart), a 3 year-old and 2 teenage girls. This property was fantastic....the food and service at all of the restaurants was wonderful. The Pool was beautiful and the Aqua Zone pool play area for the 3 year old was perfect! We all loved the open lobby and the full Starbucks. Every time we called down for bath towels (we needed a lot of them) they brought them up within minutes of the phone call. This does NOT happen everywhere....It is certainly not a high high end hotel, but for $100 per night, the service, quality of food, location and property was well well well worth it. The room was also very large with a huge bathroom and 2 sinks. We will definitly stay here again!! Very SATISFIED!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: princessangel
Reviews.Content: I live very close to Orlando and frequent many Orlando hotels. I got a rate of 90.00 a night and booked the hotel. I had stayed at Renaissance Orlando Resort at SeaWorld one time before and remembered how beautiful it was, but could not remember why I had not gone back in many years. At checkin there was a very nice man to check us in. Seeing that the hotel was empty I thought I would ask for an upgrade, he said he could upgrade for 40.00 more and I told him I was looking for free and said no thanks. We had a complimentay glass of Champagne which was a treat! The room was nice and it made my day to see the little whale sitting on the tub!! We were hungry and wanted to experience the hotel ambiance so we were going to eat in the Tradewinds restaurant. We went to be seated and the man at the front said they were closing and we were told to go to the Boardwalk. We went to the Boardwalk and we ordered chicken wings to share with our drinks. There wasn't much of a choice on the menu so we thought we would eat outside the hotel later. The chicken wings were undercooked and we had to send them back. The drinks were way over priced at 12.00 for a Rum Runner & 9.00 for a Mai tai. I think the alcohol was a little skimpy because I had 2 Rum Runners and did not taste the alcohol. The Rum Runners were good otherwise. The wings were taken off our bill but we ended up paying a bill of 47.93. There are so many good restaurants outside the hotel whuch would have been a better choice. Starbucks for breakfast the next morning was a real treat! I did not like the idea of paying 16.00 to self park. I do not understand parking fees at hotels!! I enjoyed the beautiful hotel atrium with beautiful Christmas trees and lights. The hotel seemed to be empty for this time of the year. Although the hotel is beautiful I do not think I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kimmy04
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. Everyone that we came in contact with was just sweet and very helpfull! We were celebrating our daughters 7th bitrthday while at the ROSW. They sent her 2 very yummy cupcakes with happy birthday written in chocolate! She was so excited!!! You could not ask for a better hotel if you are going to SeaWorld. We loved the Quick Que to the front of the line and the easy access to the park! Just grab a Starbucks (yes they have a Starbucks in the lobby) and walk a short 5 min walk to the front gate! This was one of our most relaxing and enjoyable vacations we have ever had! We have stayed at the ROSW twice and we will continue to stay here because of the outstanding customer service, beauty, comfort and the location! Love the ROSW!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Florida Resident Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Deena H
Reviews.Content: We are Sea World pass holders, so frequent the Orlando area frequently. This hotel never disappointments me. From special requests emailed prior to arrival to friendly faces at the front desk, I am never disappointed. The perk of free quick que at Sea World is awesome. Just used it this weekend and it turned the 1 hour long wait for rides to a walk right on to the ride! Had the breakfast buffett for the first time because we always would just eat at the park - what a mistake we had been making. Made to order, fresh food - not your tipical buffett! Thank you Renaissance for another great weekend - you never disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Seaworld Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance @ Seaworld is our family's go to weekend getaway. A glass of champagne at during a quick check in and off to our corner king suite where there was a wine, cheese & fruit platter waiting for us along with a beautiful view of Seaworld. (The Seaworld view can not be beat IMO, not only a wonderful fireworks display at night, but a sunrise to match.) The corner suite has additional square footage and a fold out bed from the couch to accommodate small families; ask for an upgrade when you check in - it's well worth the $. Tradewinds has a very good breakfast buffet, of course I have seen larger buffets elsewhere, but the buffet here seems perfect for our family as we like everything on the menu and never have any challenges finding enough to eat. We especially like the juicing bar, omelet and waffle stations. At night we also eat at Tradewinds as we love the pork chops. Room service is very prompt and hot food is hot and cold food is cold, as it should be. I can not say enough about the staff at The Ren Seaworld, my 4 year old twins know them by name and love them all. They will try their best to accommodate any request, just ask. My husband and I have traveled a lot and the staff at The Renaissance continues to impress us each time we visit. Personal attention and customer service is their priority; time after time they prove that to us and continue to blow us away with their attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JUDY S
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would go back there in a heartbeat. It's beautiful, the staff was great, the room was huge and clean. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend escape location.”
Reviews.Author: 2Italylovers
Reviews.Content: We booked a King room and had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff are extremely helpful and very, very friendly from the champaign at check-in to check-out. We had breakfast included with our rate and it was very fresh, great variety, and again, the staff here were wonderful. Location is great for visiting the area around Sea World and I-Drive. Would definitely recommend it. Only thing negative is the carpet in our room needs replaced but it was very clean, just worn in spots. Our parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a deal”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne L
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $80/night on Priceline and it was a great deal! The rooms were huge, great bathroom, beautiful lobby, short I-Trolly ride to Pointe Orlando, gorgeous pool, overall, it was a great hotel at a great price. Service was good, everybody gets a complimentary glass of champagne upon arrival. Hotel is a little dated and room decor could use some updating, but the bathroom was surprisingly modern. Mini fridge in room is very convenient, and the fact that the pools are open till 12am is excellent -- nothing better than relaxing in the hot tub after a lonnnggg day of walking. There aren't any restaurants within a 5 min walking distance from the hotel, but if you have a car, there are many to choose from a short drive away. Parking is a little pricey at $16/night. Probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless the main focus of my trip is Seaworld, but if you don't mind a bit of driving to various theme parks, its a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brojoe73
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at this hotel for a week. The rooms were huge! The lobby and dining areas were great and the meals we did have there were very good. This hotel had plenty to do for kids, without the circus like atmosphere of a Disney hotel. My negatives were $16/ day parking fees, room decor not as nice as other Renaissance hotels, and there was no club lounge for elite members of Marriott. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Work trip finds nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: ZMyers
Reviews.Content: Great find for a work trip...And I am sure that the location "in season" is great. But I am not sure why it is a Renaissance. It seems a few steps below the others I have stayed at before. Rooms were huge...just a bit outdated. Tons of rooms. Good atmosphere. I would stay here again for work...maybe with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of nowhere - bad food”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and was very frustrated. This is a beautiful hotel but it has horrible dining options. I was forced to pay exhorbitant prices for bad food that was WAY below temperature. There is nothing within walking distance - it took me almost half an hour to walk around the block just to find that there was nothing around. If you aren't in Orlando for a trip to any of their many overpriced attractions, this is a terrible place to stay. It was like being held hostage in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: owlelvis
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two weeks and thought it was a brilliant hotel. rooms were very clean and comfortable,pool and jacuzzi good. plenty of help if needed from all the front desks,found all the staff to be friendly and pleasant. will definately go again

Reviews.Title: “Sea World + service = satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: pleasnttrvls
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my son's special 10th bday trip to Sea World. We have been lucky enough to visit MANY high-end resort hotels, and the management here must be well aware of the stiff competition. Dramatic giant Christmas trees in lobby and easy self-parking was a good start...Every staff member was courteous and professional and arriving at 10:30 p.m. after a full day of work and school could have been a recipe for a bad experience. But as promised by Lanita our upgraded room was a huge room (corner suite with hip decor) and checkin was already completed -- the requested rollaway bed with all linens, and a lovely bday welcome amenity with a bag chockful of Sea World souvenirs delighted my sons. Hungry and tired we ordered room service -- the menu indicated the food would be delivered in thirty minutes -- make that 15 minutes (!) piping hot and Marriott yummy -- pizza with Brie and wild mushrooms and a Reuben. Next surprise -- fireworks outside our window! The next day we enjoyed the breakfast buffet (we always have enjoyed the Marriott waffles, etc.) and leisurely walked to Sea World after our friendly waitress offered us to-go coffee cups to sip from. No pressure making it to the shows with our hotel right across the parking lot. That evening -- Mist the hotel bar -- delicious and unusual cocktail options reasonably priced at $10.00, given the very stylish vibe -- plus hamachi sushi, artistically carved chess board, and kid's menu options. I had the "Dark and Stormy" -- ginger beer with Black Seal Rum -- spicy -- and no guilt, since there was no driving. One regret -- our stay was too short to check out their beautiful pool -- nit picking points -- shower stream could have been stronger, but nice firm mattresses made up for it, no honor bar, but did have refrigerator All in all a very positive experience, solid value -- (and a bargain, given our AAA discounted rate).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boundlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold Marriott member and this was a great hotel. The interior is done really nice and they have a full service Starbucks in the lobby which is great. If I had to choose some downfall the mattresses could be updated they are a little hard to sleep on. No other complaints we would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: GER_REG
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located within close proximity to many restuarants and directly across the street from Sea World. The rooms were clean, the staff was pleasant and responsive. These were all a plus, but what we did not expect was to pay $16/day to SELF par and $15/day to use the internet (if you feel like sitting in the lobbby, you can access the WiFi for free). Our first day we ordered room service - breakfast for two (Pancakes , bacon and orange juice & a spinach omlet, sausage, and water.). The meal was a bit pricey and cost about $60, but the food was decent. Overall our stay was comfortable, but due to the add-on parking and internet fees, we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Wow in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations for this hotel, which I have passed many times over many years. I was candidly blown away by my stay. The lobby is very, very large. I was offered a glass of champagne on check-in. The staff was very friendly. The room I had was huge with a wraparound couch and dining table. It had the largest flat screen I have seen in a hotel. It had ingesting lamps. The bathroom was average, but nice enough. The bed was comfortable. You can hear some noise from within the hotel, but if you keep your fan on, it drowns it out. The lobby contains multiple restaurants and a nice bar. The sports bar was comfortable and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lastipe
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel! It seems to be mainly a conference hotel, but from the excellent check in service to the turn down service, everything was great here. We went to Orlando for a concert, and came in late at night. We felt safe every night, walking from the parking lot. We had a balcony room, which was fun, but it overlooked the parking lot, so the views aren't exactly what this location boasts. The rooms were redone, so they are gorgeous! The hotel looks brand new from the inside, and I loved the water that was available, it had either lemons, cucumbers, or pineapples in it. Delicious! This hotel is not near too many things but Sea World, but it is within walking distance of Sea World. You are literally across the parking lot from it. They offer a shuttle, but if you can walk, that is not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: godivaleeflorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and I am just putting in my review now because I enjoyed my stay. I used Priceline and only paid 70 bucks per night. I even had the room with the balcony that looks towards the atrium. I stayed two nights and ordered in and the service was great from the staff. The pools were awesome. They had two jacuzzis, a small aquatica version for the kids, and a larger pool for everyone. They had a restaurant/bar outside and nice/cozy cabanas too. At night, they played CARS out on the green lawn and my kids enjoyed it. Just bring a blanket to lie on. The inside atrium is gorgeous and all of the decor and furniture was so lovely. You do have to pay for parking however, but can come and leave as you want by using your hotel room card. Walking distance to Sea Word/Aquatica, but I'd rather drive...

Reviews.Title: “It's very beautiful, but very disappointed about the parking fees.”
Reviews.Author: jocro22
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is beautiful, good price, and walking distance from SeaWorld. However, if you just wanted to go out to dinner, go to universal stuidos, or ANYWHERE, you had to pay the parking fee EVERYTIME you go through the gate. We ended up having around $100 just in a parking fees. I think if you are spending that much on a hotel, you shouldn't have to pay to park there! Ridiculous. Also, the staff was very snoody and had an attidude. Our room wasn't even ready upon check-in time. So, we had to wait around an hour or two AFTER the hotel check-in time until our room was ready. I did get engaged in this hotel, so that's the only reason I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for visit to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: K C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2010 and October 2011. Both times booked on priceline and got good rates. Easy walk across the parking lot to Seaworld, making an afternoon nap possible. Lobby can get a bit loud for light sleepers but no problem for us. Avoid the lady selling Mariott vacations plans just outside the elevator in the lobby if you can. Parking is somewhat steep but expected. Would have loved free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: rnev8437
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here in November, 2011. Overall, a very nice hotel with a huge atrium area and lobby. My family and I found the hotel comfortable, with excellent service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room service menu was somewhat limited and some of the selections perhaps a little overpriced, but in line with other hotels. I guess I just don't like paying $5 for a glass of orange juice, but I've seen this at other hotels too. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Why are people soooo picky?”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Liles
Reviews.Content: I have read so much blah, blah, blah about this hotel here on Trip advisor, that I was really scared to even stay. I have read about smelly water, bad service, bad internet, the hours at Starbucks. GIVE ME A BREAK! ...the hours at Starbucks?! What's next? The tweed count of the sheets? The decibel level of the elevator music? Geez! I am back now from a 2 night stay with my wife and 3 year old son (11/4 – 11/6) and to be honest, this place is stellar. From start to finish, superb. Pros: Starbucks on site. Gigantic Heated pool. The mini water park area for kids. Jacuzzi Hot tubs. Very Nice Fitness Center (24hrs) Outdoor fire pits. Cons: None really. Not a 5 star hotel, but a 5 star experience. Self parking was beside the building, not a mile away like at other hotels. The hotel has an atrium setup, which is aesthetically pleasing and the constant bubbling water fall area is relaxing and inviting. The Wi-Fi worked in our room without charge. A call to the front desk for extra towels took 3 minutes from housekeeping, then a follow-up call from the front desk – Nice touch. I am really sad to see certain reviewers spending so much energy complaining about such trivial things. I on the other hand had a very good time, and most of all, my wife and son want to go back. This is the sign of a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not environmentally friendly enough”
Reviews.Author: b0Duk3
Reviews.Content: +1 = nice oceanic ambiance +1 = clean +1 = friendly staff -1 = poor and expensive dining options - 1 = very little nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Mia M
Reviews.Content: We are Disney nuts but decided on a weekender to do Sea World. BOY we were amazed and love this resort. The lobby and atrium are great. When you check in you get champagne or cider (the kids LOVED drinking out of champagne glasses). We changed to a room with a balcony overlooking the atrium. The elevators kind of scared my daughter but we were on the 9th floor. The pool is amazing! We met several families there that had driven from Tampa and other close towns because of the pool. You literally walk out the front door, cross the 4 lane street and boom you are in Sea World's parking lot! That was a welcome close to the park when traffic was backed up!! My only complaint is the price of the food! Unbelievebly expensive! We didn't eat a morsal from there, we went to the many fast food place near there. International Blvd is extremely close and it's easy to navigate. Plus if you stay here you get the front of the line pass for FREE! Great deal on the room and that's an added bonus! I am a travel consultant at www.mackeymousetravel.blogspot.com and will be encouraging my clients stay here! Perfect Perfect weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect second visit”
Reviews.Author: TheBatties
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at the Renaissance in October 2009 (see our review here: http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g34515-d85438-r57000499-Renaissance_Orlando_Resort_at_SeaWorld-Orlando_Florida.html) and as you can see, we enjoyed it tremendously. So naturally, while arranging our next Orlando holiday, we booked to come here again. This time we had brought my brother, my nephew (16yo) and my sister-in-law; it was their very first time to Florida so we were keen to show them our favourite haunts. Well, the Renaissance did not disappoint - it was just as fantastic as our previous stay. Needing three rooms, plus the use of a wheelchair, plus disabled facilities and plus lots of other extra requests, we must have been quite a difficult family group to accommodate. However, the hotel came up trumps and all of our requests and extras were provided, and provided with charm and friendliness. We ate at the Tradewinds a three times during our stay and always found it a good experience and the food delicious. As for the buffet breakfasts, well they were two years ago, and still are, absolutely terrific. Seeing my nephew discover the pancakes with all the toppings was incredible! Lunch at Palms was also excellent. Oh, and Mike was still there. It was great to see him and chat with him again. We all had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Renaissance - we enjoyed the ambience, the friendliness, the casual easyness of the place. Should anyone ask us, we would certainly recommend they stay at the Renaissance at SeaWorld. Thank you! We'll definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location , close to the Convention Center, International Drive, and the parks. The service at the hotel is wonderful, and the ammenities great. The hotel is very clean. The lobby is huge, the pool exveptional.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, just check your bill for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTechie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a trip to Sea World. This is a very nicely decorated, clean hotel. What you would expect from any Marriott in this category. The only problem we had was when I looked at the details of my invoice that was slid under my door, there were 2 charges for $3.00 each for water bottles that we did not drink. These are two bottles of Evian that are placed in the rooms for convienience I guess. I am not sure if they just charge everybody for them or the maid keeps track of who drinks them but we didn't and we were charged. I called the front desk to inform them that we didn't drink the water and to please remove the charges. The person I spoke to said they would remove them. When I got to the front desk to pay the bill, the charges were still on the bill and had to ask to have them removed again. The woman I spoke to asked me if I drank the water in a snooty tone. I asked her if she wanted to to go up to our room with us and check. She then removed the charges. I thought that this was a little rediculous, especially for a Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: MurphOC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting at the convention center which was about 1-2 miles away. There is no longer a lounge for Marriott members. The room itself seemed a bit dated. Never tried any of the food at the restaurants. The gym was pretty good for those that want a workout. As far as convenience goes, you are directly across the street from SeaWorld if that is where you want to go. However, I really saw NO restaurants anywhere within walking distance outside of the hotel. Convention center is a $8-10 cab ride away. All in all, a very average hotel. No frills, but clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazz4qb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel often. We just came back from Orlando visiting Disneyworld and Seaworld. This was our 6th trip to Disneyworld over the last fifteen years. We have stayed at many properties in the area. We were traveling with an 8 year old and found this hotel to be just wonderful. It is so convenient to Seaworld, you just need to walk across the street. They offered QuickQueue passes which takes you to the front of line at Seaworld for all the rides. It is a short ride to the Disneyworld park. The hotel has a wonderful pool and play area for children with slides and children pool. The staff was outstanding and could not do enough to make your stay pleasant. The resturant had a breakfast buffet, which made it convenient in the morning and was reasonable priced, food and service was very good. I would stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay for a SeaWorld visit”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacationFl
Reviews.Content: We had a blast. Valet parking is free for hybrid owners and they offer complimentary SeaWorld QuickQueue passes for guests. Our kids made great use of the passes and bypassed 40 minute long line waits to get right to the front of the queue. The pool area is gorgeous and the pool is heated - very nice for the colder days in winter. The room was large and well cared for - really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little Issues Spoil a Great Property”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for five nights. Overall, we were satisfied by the hotel. However, we were expecting more for our money, but this Renaissance didn't live up to those expectations. The Good The hotel is well maintained and is in a great location; right across the street from Sea World and only a 10-15 minute stroll down to Aquatica. It is right at the end of the International Drive strip with all the necessary places to eat, drink and shop for kitschy souvenirs. The property has a fantastic pool with a large, separate mini water park for kids. There is a Starbucks on site along with a sushi bar, full restaurant and a bar and grill-type eatery. We didn't try the sushi bar, but the other two eateries and the Starbucks were top-notch. The room was spacious and clean and looked well maintained. The beds were comfy and the room had the usual amenities (TV, desk, etc). The bathroom was also quite roomy with two sinks and full size tub. And even though we were just down from the elevator, the noise from them didn't filter into our room. Noise from adjoining rooms was non-existent. The staff were friendly and very helpful when we needed answers about the hotel and local areas. The maids were excellent and kept our room spotless. They even took the time to arrange our daughters stuff animals in fun scenes when they made the beds. The Bad The hotel has a huge convention business due to the many "ballrooms" on site. In our five days there, one conference ended, one ran its course and another was just starting. The first one had an older, professional crowd and blended into the rest of the guests. The second one, however, was made up of college-age young adults who were quite noisy late into the evenings. The hotel staff didn't make any effort to keep them quiet either. For some reason, the water in the hotel stank. Not just smelled funny. It smelled bad. Sort of like a burnt asphalt smell. We didn't particularly like bathing in it, but it didn't leave any residual smell. The rooms are set-up for wifi and ethernet internet access...for $14.95 per day. I still have a hard time understanding why hotels that charge this much for a room insist on charging for internet access when even the cheapest independent flea-bags in town have free internet. The hotel does offer free wifi in the lobby, but this was so slow and prone to drop-outs that it was totally unusable. And speaking of extra costs, the $16 per day for on-site parking is a bit ridiculous. I understand the need to keep people from using it as an alternate Sea World lot or to sneak into the excellent pool, but charging your own guests just smacks of outright greed. The only alternative is valet parking at $21 per day. Choosing this option just gets you the service to the door. The cars are still parked out in the elements like all the others. One last nit to pick. The Starbucks closes at 7pm but the gift shop closes at 11pm. This seems backwards. Bottom Line This is a great hotel in a great location let down by some questionable operating practices and stinky water. Although we were satisfied with our stay, the next time we are in the Orlando area we will not be staying at this Renaissance. There are just too many little issues to make it worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay borderline 4star”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong it is a nice hotel, but I would say borderline 4 star. The hotel is huge and cavernous. Massive atrium in the center. Rooms were clean but just a little tired. TV did not work but was repaired quickly. Internet was spotty in the room but front desk gave me a credit. Staff was friendly and efficient. I did get an excellent deal on PL. They do charge extra for parking and internet. Seems like a great location. Seaworld is in between Disney and Universal. Location was quiet. I gave it a three based on it's standing among other 4 star hotels in the area. Organic coffee and tea in the room was nice. Better than Starbucks which is in the lobby. Safe travels

Reviews.Title: “Terrible conference experience”
Reviews.Author: ailed89
Reviews.Content: Bad service at reception, terrible food and NO wi-fi in rooms; oh and the wi-fi in the lobby was practically non existant. I truly expected more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Casual conference traveller says yes!”
Reviews.Author: ChaniCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with the intention to attend about half of my conference and visit local attractions with the remainder of my time. It worked admirably for this circumstance. Location: A $45 cab ride from airport. About a half hour walk, partly along dirt tracks, from the West Building (the furthest point) at OCCC. Across the parking lot from Seaworld. Check-in: Had a room ready at 1:30 for me, expedia rep on site to purchase attraction tickets and answer questions. Very knowledgable and had access to discount codes associated with each conference. Rooms: HUGE! Clean, updated, Aveda amenities Food: starbucks on site opens at 6:30. Tradewinds had full buffet, but also extensive continental breakfast. Didn't eat lunch or dinner there. Transportation: very convenient public transit. Either the i-drive trolley ($1.25) or #8 lynx bus (2.00) will take you up international drive to the conference centre (stop in front of the Peabody hotel for the West building) and further north to restaurants and nightclubs. I never had to wait more than 5 minutes night or day for a bus. Universal Studios is closest to the G4 i-drive stop, although I cabbed as it threatened rain that day. Pool: large pool and surrounding grounds were stunning!!! More like Mayan Riviera than Orlando. Great loungers, lots of towels, great service from bar and outdoor giftshop. Extensive kids water play zone was in a slightly separate area so the main pool stayed quiet- who needs Aquatica tickets?! Spa: had a good massage, environs relaxing but not luxurious Price: Bid low on Priceline, I got a huge deal. Conclusion: convenient for the casual conference goer, great place to relax by the pool, priced right. If you're hitting the conference all day every day you'll want the Peabody or Rosen center which are the closest (although bring your comfy shoes, everything's a hike!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HeidisHappyHols
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2005 but only just joined Trip Advisor Hotel - cant fault it. The staff were excellent and it was so clean and the rooms were lovely, although our view overlooked the car park to the left to the right you could make out all the Disney parks! Cant comment on travel as we had a car and made our own way to all the parks however by car if you are hiring then its in a perfect location, slighlty out of the way that you dont feel over run by other tourists but it was so peaceful. Food at the pool side bar was lovely every time although kept forgetting chips were crisps! Highly rated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no service”
Reviews.Author: HuatulcoBound
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Some face out onto pool or street, others are interior rooms that face into an open lobby. Sounds strange but it's quite nice. following is a random selection of thoughts about this hotel. Room service was fantastic - good food and the staff were lovely. In-room amenities were lacking. The free coffee was just that - no cream or sugar, so you can only use it if you drink your coffee black. The room itself was nice and clean and comfy, but the bathroom was a bit worn. The finish was worn off the bathtub so that it was bare in several places and had a big dip in the middle where water would pool. They charge $14 for internet hookup in the room but they don't bother to tell you that it's free in the lobby, and all you have to do is open your balcony door to access the free wireless. Quite a money grab and i'm sure everyone who discovers this after they've paid for in-room internet instantly becomes disgruntled. The capper for me was that my room was not serviced, even though i was out of it all day (from about noon) and the do not disturb sign was NOT in place (i double checked this when i found my room still unserviced at night when i returned). When i reported this to the front desk the next morning upon checkout, the staff said i must have left the DND sign on the door. In fact, I did not, as I've mentioned.She then apologized but didn't offer any sort of recompense, which was surprising. I thought perhaps I'd get a call or something in the mail (as she said she would report it), but nothing. I'm not overly picky and I'm not a complainer. I was extremely polite at the desk. But come on...you pay hundreds of dollars for a hotel room so that you don't have to make your bed or wash your own towels -- that's the point of room service -- and then they don't do it, and they don't seem to feel it's a big deal. Overall, the hotel itself is quite nice and the staff are warm and pleasant, but I'm extremely disappointed in the way my lack of room service was handled. I shouldn't have to ask for a remedy - they should have offered it. I hate to think how they would react to a more serious issue (although as hotel stays go, not getting your room cleaned is pretty high on the Crappy Service List).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet getaway from commotion”
Reviews.Author: davidmfiske
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at a conference that was at another hotel. Not knowing anyone allowed me to relax at this place. The parking is okay, though not worth the extra cost with so many unused spaces. The lobby is a GREAT place to relax. There are water fountains, scores of seating areas to unwind or relax while doing paperwork, and lots of different food or drink venues nearby. The best part is the free internet access. I wish such hotels would get away from the $4 bottled water, in-room internet access charges, and the silly charges for coffee or soda that look like a ripoff. It's a joke when you get nothing free, like the more budget chains do. It is well kept and the clientele are surprisingly upscale given its proximity to Sea World. It did not seem like many tourists were there for that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, conference food excellent... mattress, awful!”
Reviews.Author: wrensaver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in October. I requested a room on the Sea World side and they were able to accomodate my request. Valet and bell service was excellent. The Valet guys were really great. The lobby is spectacular, although the many tv's showing film of fish is a little weird, there's no LIVE fish. Looks like the area above the main bar used to be a real aquarium; just a little odd considering the proximity to Sea World, but I digress. The food served by their staff throughout our conference was excellent, probably the very best conference food I've had. If you're considering this location for an event, the food is REALLY REALLY GOOD! The room was very nice and looked updated; there is even a notice about the "room stylist" (huh?) that did the room. I had a king room with a couch; there was plenty of room for my laptop on the desk, plug-ins were plentiful. Now the bad part. The mattress was HORRIBLE. It was only about 8" thick and the sheets didn't even go to the bottom of the mattress. It sagged and offered *zero* support. My back hurt every morning. I checked with my colleagues and they all said the same thing, so I know it wasn't just my room. One other thing that bugged me, I had a balcony room but the balcony was shared by the room next door- with a huge potted plant between the space but no actual barrier. If someone in the next room had wanted to look in my sliding doors they could have climbed right over that pot. So I liked the view and the fact I could go outside; the potted plant standing between me an a potential wacko, not so much. I would not stay here again, simply for the mattresses. I could not imagine a family of four returning from a day at the parks and having to sleep on them and get any sort of restful sleep. If they update those, it's a fab place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little faded for the money”
Reviews.Author: normalguyToronto
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad hotel and probably the safest place to be in a hurricane (it's a giant concrete bunker), but it's in need of a freshening-up. There's really no such thing as a conveniently-located hotel in Orlando (in my opinion) - everyplace is a fairly lengthy drive. Allow 30 minutes to/from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and well located”
Reviews.Author: POSitiveBrett
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference at the Renaissance and was quite impressed with te overall experience, from the open and inviting layout, to the quality of the rooms and food served at the restaurants and bars. Also, the event I attended was very well staffed and catered by the facility.
