Also, the closeness of Seaworld and other attractions made it great for those with families to extend their stay for a little R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in walking distance to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: realityaddict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed overnight with our 4 year old son. We recieved complementary glasses of champagne upon check in. The king room was a nice size, with a small living area with a couch, chair and coffee table. The bed was comfy and the room super quiet. It rained the two days we were there (without lighting of thunder) so the kids pool section/waterslide were closed but we did enjoy the oversized pool and hot tub (there are two large ones). The property is all well manicured and modern. We walked to Sea World from our hotel and it took about 5 minutes max...but they also offer a shuttle if you'd rather ride. My son loved the small arcade they had there as well. Great hotel for families. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Oh and I got a great rate with free parking through Marriott rewards...worth it to join.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 11 Day Holiday”
Reviews.Author: taratupps2
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening of 26 Sept 2011 to a warm welcome. Unfortunately we did not get the champagne on arrival, but after flight delays from the UK we were happy to head to bed as soon as possible! We were surprised at the size of the room and found the beds very comfortable. We spent the first day around the pool, which has plenty of sunbeds/cabanas and the pool was superb, be aware the jacuzzi's are extremely warm and you may not want to get out! We did eat in Tradewinds for breakfast on the Sunday and thoroughly enjoyed the buffet we also ate in the Sportsbar on three occaisions, again the food was excellent as were the waiters who were very attentive and friendly. The on-site Starbucks was a major plus for us as we are not great breakfast eaters and we do like our coffee. Overall this is a excellent hotel and found everyone very friendly and helpful, the Renaissance is by far the best hotel we have stayed in on I-Drive. Being next to Seaworld and close to Aquatica and Discovery Cove is just another bonus, as is the free wi-fi in the lobby area. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: scottishgibo
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the renaissance 12th sept 2011 for 2 weeks, prior to arriving i called the hotel and mentioned it was our honeymoon and asked if we could have a high floor room with balchony overlooking seaworld, we were given room 9109 which is on the 9th floor and has the big balchony overlooking seaworld so was perfect, we were brought up a bottle of wine with a congratulations card signed by the front desk staff which was a nice touch, ALL of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful including the dudes at the front door who gave great advise on places to eat and shopping etc, the hotel was very nice, the gym was spot on and the pool was excellant although we were at the parks most days so didnt use it to much, it was 35 degrees most days and only rained the last three days but not until 6pm so couldnt complain, the food in the hotel was good although a bit of a rip off if you ask me but we ate out most nights, there was several pizza delivery leaflets put under our room door and we used these a couple of times i would 100% stay here again when we come back to orlando and the location is perfect for getting to the parks, jump on the i ride trolley to all the shops and restraunts and the hotel does tranport to universal, we came with virgin so we got free taxis to disney, all in all a cracking hotel and great honeymoon, def one to remember,

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, First Class service”
Reviews.Author: CTT31
Reviews.Content: Booked through Opodo and paid a very good price for a 16 night holiday flight & hotel for 3 people for £2000. Arrived the 30 Sep to a champagne reception. The hotel is massive but not to busy. The lobby is beautiful and kept to a very high standard. The rooms were clean, comfortable and big. The service you receive here is outstanding the staff are polite, friendly and can not do enough for you. The pool area is superb, my 4 year old son loved the mini water park which was never overcrowded. The hotel is situated opp. Seaworld and has free shuttle buses to sea world, aquatica and Universal parks but not the disney parks. We did not hire a car and to be honest it wasn't needed we explored international drive on the I ride trolley which was cheap and easy to use. Had several meals in the hotel restaurants which were very tasty and service was great. My boyfriend used the hotel gym everyday which had up to date equipment and i had a massage at the spa which i highly recommend after a long day at the theme parks! This was our first time to Orlando and overall the best holiday ever we will defiantly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: carbon4life
Reviews.Content: Overall, very nice, but all Renaissance hotels are nice. Rooms. Upgraded by front desk clerk because of my Marriott Rewards to a huge suite. It was bigger than a lot of peoples homes. No joke. It was absolutely beautiful. We also had a large 2 queen room for my teenage boys. Restaraunt. We ate at the sports bar. It was good, not great. I liked the food. The 4 teenage boys with me were not enjoying their fancy foods much. The portions were modest, but the price was not. Not a bad place by any means, but would have liked more traditional sports bar food options. Pool. Very nice. Especially for little kids. The adult pool is gigantic. Overall the pool is very relaxing. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Comfortable, Clean, Delicious!!!”
Reviews.Author: joseudy
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the guy that compared this hotel with the Peabody is a little bit out of boundaries. I have stayed on both and the Renaissance is way superior to the other one. Nevertheless, this space is to write about the Renaissance and that's what I'm gonna do. The hotel is magnificent, the employees treat you like Queen Elizabeth, champagne when you arrive, check-in is fantastic, quick. The hotel lobby is humongous with several restaurants, a full Starbucks, spectacular pool and spacious. The breakfast buffet is out of this world, with fruits, made to order pancakes, waffles and omelettes, all kind of pastries, muffins, porridge, breads, cereals, bacon and much much more. Plus, they support local grocers and they even have a juice extractor for you to make your own juices! Absolutely fantastic! The rooms: clean, comfortable and BIG!! They even put a small Shamu Toy on the tub for you to play, LOL. The bed pretty comfortable, spectacular view to Sea World, TV, safe and Refrigerator to keep things cold. Overall, 5 Stars to Renaissance and Fernanda from Argentina, excellent first class Customer Service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: mleTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference onsite. Room was clean and comfortable. Bar was very busy with great service. Room service was delicious. Great restaurant selection nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: earsropen
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful! This is a good place to take the entire family for all to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Okish”
Reviews.Author: the_pina-coladas
Reviews.Content: Booked through virgin, reps do not come to this hotel! Mainly a convention centre hotel some of the staff are excellent in particular rey and one of his colleagues on the navigation desk were fantastic the other girl there was rude and unhelpful and got stroppy, when we asked to see the manager she was abrupt and didn't even bother to introduce herself. This hotel would get a much better review if they could sort out just a few things, stop with the hard sell time shares who will call you at 2130 + learn from your most polite staff, if we spend alot of money we don't expect you to be rude to us, and most importantly sort out your transport to universal this was our main reason for visiting I had tickets that allowed for early park entry but transport leaves at 0950 and returns at 1840 absolutely useless On a pluss note the rooms are nice and hotel is clean, shame there is no free wifi in the rooms and the restaurants are expensive, we ate mostly at the village inn on I-drive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for family”
Reviews.Author: Murielle P
Reviews.Content: What a great place ! Been there twice now with our daughters. First time, they were 3 and 5 y-old. And we went again around Christmas and they were 5 and 7. They LOVED it, especially the balcony with a view on the lobby. Best hotel as well to go to Sea World. You just cross the road and you are there in 5min! We liked the fact the room are big, so lots of space. The restaurants are great. Nice pool too. Only negative - service can be average!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Samsrobin
Reviews.Content: I joined my husband as he attended a conference here. What a delightful surprise!!! Our room was spacious and super comfortable! CLEAN rooms, bathrooms, hallways, everything! Big TV, fridge, 2, yes 2 easy chairs with an ottoman, a desk with chair, a fridge and a safe. Double sink in larger bath area. Loved, loved, loved the little balcony out of the french doors into the atrium! Super friendly staff, always speaking and smiling. HUGE pool with a wonderful separated play water area for small children. Pool area has comfy chairs, cabanas, great landscaping, & beach towels and a restaurant. Outside couch area near firepits for comfy evenings. Hallways were quiet and was even quiet with the french doors to room wide open to atrium!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 5 nights !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ajith N
Reviews.Content: Great for family with kids. Close to most attractions . Great service. Fantsatic staff ..good onsite entrtainment & food............what more do you want ? Our experience was just close to perfect.....having said that I feel the rooms can get some new paint / makeup....Parking & Internet do cost extra :(

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, only raves from me”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan333
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hotel Orlando was the best hotel in the city. The rooms are large and well appointed. Staff are incredible. Always smile and good mornings. I was sad to leave and return home. BTW, the breakfast buffet is great. Lots of great items including a make your own fresh veggie juice machine. I did not mind paying for parking or the internet. I don't know why others claim it is "nickel and diming" guests. It is normal in most hotels I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “fab location full stop..”
Reviews.Author: gibsonsmum
Reviews.Content: Having been up and down INTERNATIONAL Drive on the I-Ride we were very grateful at the excellent choice of hotel we had made. The location couldn't have been better, just a short walk to Seaworld, were we could catch the free ride to Discovery cove. (Although there used to be a free bus from the hotel to Discovery cove, but that has now stopped)..The pool was lovely and there was a kddies pool away from the adult pool.. a good bar at the pool side, and some good places to eat within the hotel itself.. The I-ride bus stop was just outside and $4 got you an all day ticket.. The staff were all great and very helpfull and I loved the toy SHAMU whale on the side of the bath.. lovely touch..

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, and a pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wrightbythesand
Reviews.Content: If SeaWorld is your destination, this is the place to stay. The hotel is located literally right across the street from the entrance to SeaWorld, a five minute walk. This hotel offers early access to SeaWorld like Disney Magic Hours (only available certain days so be sure to check with the Navigator or Concierge to obtain the schedule.) This hotel also offers free "Quick Queue" passes to guests (limited number available, first come first serve). Now for the down side....during off season, only one hotel restaurant is open at a time so on site dining options are very limited. While they advertise free transportation to several local parks and Universal City Walk, the shuttle times are very limited which means you may have to take taxis. The room was clean and well appointed. The pool was really nice and they have a great water play area for the younger set. The staff was certainly helpful enough. If the prime purpose of my next trip was to visit Sea World and the parks in that area, I would definitely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, lots to do for families”
Reviews.Author: dadofgirliegirls
Reviews.Content: The good: - nice, open lobby - walking distance to Sea World - front of line privileges at any Sear World park - activities galore for families - water park Not so good: - a bit pricey compared to other options in Orlando - food choices are not so good - nickle and dime you for parking, internet, etc. Overall this is a very nice hotel. We stayed here for 3 days in July while doing Discovery Cove, Aquatica, and Sea World. Shuttles to each of these places is nice, especially for those parks that require you to pay for parking. The water park was very nice for my 6 and 9 year old. They had movie night with smores and popcorn on the lawn - also very nice. We probably did 10% of all the activities they had planned for families. All in all, a very nice place. The pros far outweigh the cons and I would definately consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Just average.”
Reviews.Author: CM90
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a recent visit to SeaWorld. The hotel is the closest one to SeaWorld, and is EXTREMELY convenient. BUT, this hotel is not your typical renaissance. There is nothing luxurious about this hotel. The rooms are spacious, but the beds are uncomfortable and a bit lumpy. The lobby is extremely nice and breakfast is amazing. My recommendation though would be to stay at the Crowne Plaza, their beds are MUCH more comfortable. Or if you want a luxurious hotel, stay at the Peabody Orlando. The Peabody is extremely nice. But back to the Renaissance...it's just not up to par with it's other hotels. I won't be staying here again. The staff are extremely nice & professional though.

Reviews.Title: “Food and beverage services can be improved”
Reviews.Author: JaneNevis80
Reviews.Content: We went to the Renaissance Hotel for a long weekend.. Ideal location for our plans to visit SeaWorld and Universal. The room was superb, vast and the bed comfortable. Housekeeping was first class. Where things fall down is in the food and beverage department. On our first night we dined at the Tradewinds restaurant in the lobby. We had to wait for a table despite the fact I could see at least 10 empty tables within. The reception staff at this restaurant are not efficient.and spend more time trying to figure out the seats on their computer system We were called forward but they were not quite ready for us, so we waited. There was an overwhelming smell of fishy oil. This tells me that the kitchen staff do not clean their oil filters often enough, When the food came it was okay but Patrick's calamari was overcooked and was too salty. I had a soup which was fine. The next morning when we wen tthere for breakfast we had to wait for nearly 15 mins. Again tables free inside and 5 staff running about the reception like headless chickens. Why are they sooooo disorganised ? Patrick went to the buffet and 15 minutes later he still wasn't back. Where was he? Out catching the eggs from the chickens ? The trays for scrambled or fried eggs were empty. When he asked a staff member she went to the kitchen and at last appeared with eggs. This is REALLY poor foodservice management. They do not have busboys/ table clearers and the wait staff are expected to do this. the restaurant MUST hire some busboys to keep things flowing. The next day was worse. We came for breakfast and had to stand for THIRTY-FiVE minutes waiting for a table. I gave up and went across to Starbucks. Patrick hung on. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels and never have ail had to wait 35mins for breakfast. This is supposedly a 4 star hotel. The F&B department needs a new manager and at least 3 busboys. Just a minor point, at the entrance to the Tradewinds restaurant there are faux plastic rocks, they look cheap and nasty, sort of thing you might see at a Macdonalds. They should replace this with plants, these nasty plastic 'rock's are not appropriate here. The lobby area is vast and the kids loved running around the space while their parents stood in line. So all in all, the F&B department needs a serious shake up. The SPA in the hotel is excellent. I had massage by a Chinese lady call Miranda. I recommend her to anyone. Okay bit of a long review, but I hope someone in the hotel passes my comments on the Food and Beverage department. Jane Ebbitt.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia34
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from Sea World, so this hotel can get busy and hectic. But this time of year the hotel was practically deserved. It was easy and quick to get in and out. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Has it's own mini-water park. As a business traveler, I was disappointed that the "business center" was a FedEx office where you had to pay to use the computer and to print documents.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: UWFTransplant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a recent business trip. Our room was clean and well-appointed. It does not have free Wi-Fi except in the lobby where it does have numerous quiet sitting places. We did have one problem of broken phones ( the message light continually blinked after being cleared), but eventually was fixed prior to our departure. The hotel has a nice exercise room with good equipment. The restaurant was so-so for the price. Nothing special. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We received extra towels and toiletries when requested. Check-out was easy. The quiet we had enjoyed the entire trip was disrrupted the last night we were there. A family with small children checked in next to our room. Their children refused to go to bed and cried for hours! The next morning, the children cried and screamed when trying to get ready to go out. I would suggest the hotel consider having a "family area" designated to put the noisier guests together. I know this is done in many hotels. Same quality of rooms, etc....just separated from other guests who enjoy some quiet time and sleep! This was our 6th stay here! Nice place to stay when not disturbed by other guests!

Reviews.Title: “Water galore = Happy Grandson !!”
Reviews.Author: FeliciaG_11
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels in Orlando (& I have researched plenty), I found the reviews for this hotel and decided this is where we would take our grandson (9yrs.old) for his final summer fling over Labor Day weekend. Living in Florida we have visited Orlando many times and stayed in many hotels. We had a great experience for our first time staying here. Excellent location between the Disney Parks, Hotels (check them out for cheap fun), of course Seaworld, Publix & Outlet malls a few miles down the less traveled stretch of Int'l drive. We requested a King room with pull out for the grandson. Bed was comfortable. Room on 3rd floor away from elevators was very quite even though the hotel was busy. Forgot to request sheets for pullout at check-in, however, after calling housekeeping at 9PM, they delivered within ten minutes. The WATERPARK was fabulous for the kids. We were'nt planning on Seaworld or Aquatica so this was the ticket for us. Grandson spent hours sliding and using the uncrowded large pool. Since we were there early we checked in and had hours of fun before dinner. The next day we checked out at eleven and stored luggage, had lunch around the pool, played in the water more then changed clothes for the trip home. We did not use the Starbucks (I bring my own coffeepot) and the line was very long for morning coffee. Also, we picked up fruit, muffins, o.j., milk, and small cereals at the Publix down the street, stored in the provided room refrigerator for breakfast so we had no wait on a Sunday morning and a great breakfast in our room, therefore, I did not see how busy the restaurant downstairs was, but I imagine it was very busy. Also, they had sceduled childrens activities around the beautiful grassy area away from the pool and waterpark, and a Toy Story movie on a big screen in the evening while relaxing in nicely padded lounge chairs. Couldn't ask for a more relaxing, inexpensive weekend. Only complaint was traffic trying to get to Downtown Disney to see activities and fireworks Sat. evening, however, this was a holiday weekend and we've been able to do this before when not a special weekend. All in all, totally satisfied with hotel and services.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Full-Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MythosRestaurant
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel during my last two business trips to Orlando. The hotel is a full-service facility equipped with restaurant, bar, Starbucks, gift shop, and conference center. It's ideal for families with kids who want to visit Sea World, which is located within walking distance (directly across the road). However, you will need to drive to the other parks and/or dining establishments outside the hotel. I particularly appreciated the champagne welcome that was offered at check-in. I don't know if that is standard or was offered to me because I am a member of the Marriott rewards program. The onsite gym is larger and much better equipped than I had anticipated. The rooms are large, modern, and well-appointed. Service at all of the onsite facilities is friendly and courteous. The room rates are reasonable relative to the caliber of the facility. The only downside is that there is a substantial fee for parking ($15) and Internet service ($15), both of which would be free at a limited service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: beachdude654
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect. When entering the lobby you will say to your self, "Is this what I paid for! Its just more than I expected". Those were my words but yours will be different if you stay. The hotel has a huge atrium. Really cool with plants and fish. We got the seaworld package that include tickets and some extras. We had two connecting rooms. The rooms were very large! HUGE! For the price, this hotel is just worth it. The breakfast at Tradewinds was great. A very large buffet. There is internet in the atrium for free. The best part is, its just steps away from the entrance of Sea World. I highly recommend staying here. You will not be disappointed. Get a high level room for the best views.

Reviews.Title: “Meticulous housekeeping, perfect for going to Discovery Cove, Seaworld and Aquatica! Third time here wil definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: sunsea99
Reviews.Content: Although the front desk made quite a few errors ie; room safe wouldn't open and they gave security wrong room, he also didn't know we couldn't open safe ... he'd been told we were "locked out" although we called from "inside" our room. He was "totally professional" rectified the problem with the safe and gave us two complimentary coupons to Starbucks for coffee for the inconvenience. In addition, we had booked originally for two nights went back in and got argued night so we had two room reservations (through priceline) Explained this over the phone PRIOR to our arrival... told no problem" would make a note of it.. repeated this exercise at the front desk UPON ARRIVAL were told we'll make a note of it... yup... checked us out on second day.. had to call again from the room and she made the final change. Very professional and apologetic. All in all a great stay... pool is rather small for a resort but we were staying to go to Discovery Cove ( 5 minutes away) so we didn't really use their pool. The food is rather expensive at the hotel and just ok. We'd suggest you go to Delmonico's (5 minutes away) reasonable prices and DELICIOUS . Order the Delmonico steak and split it ...1 and 1/2 LB for $19.99! In closing, the Renaissance is exceptionally clean ,well maintained and professional staff. At $100.00 (through priceline) and 15.00 parking it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dedmad
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel...Pro's and con's - its right across the street from Sea World and they offer a quick queue pass if you ask before they run out and early admission to Sea World on Saturday and Tuesday. Try to get a room deal that includes parking or you'll have to pay for it. The food tastes great but is quite pricey and you don't get a whole lot of it. If you want a good breakfast, I would go out. The buffet is not worth $20 unless you can eat that much eggs and pancakes. The rooms are very large but really need more draw space if you are staying for a week or more. There's only three small ones and for a family of four, you better hang most stuff up in the closet. Stay a way from a room near the elevators. They are quiet until you attempt to sleep at night. Although there a few cons here, the pros definitely out way them. Very clean and employees are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Always Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AQHAKC
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year for a state conference. The room price is reasonable for the quality of the hotel. The rooms are spotless the service is beyond excellent. This is every time I go there consistently.The food is a little pricey at the Boardwalk but the Tradewinds has plenty of reasonably priced ($15-$20) lunch items. Generally the food is very good but this trip I had blackened shrimp on my salad that was so over-spiced I couldn't eat it. That was the only negative I have ever had there in four years. OH! and the pool area is amazing and they have a Starbucks in the lobby. I'm a happy camper at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pparrella
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very friendly. Kids had enuf to do to keep them busy when the afternoon rains came. (wii game, chess sets, arcade, free ping pong and foosball. Nice new mini waterpark geared mostly for smaller kids, but our 9 year olds loved the bigger slide. Great pool area filled with beautiful landscaping and cushioned lounges. Good food though very pricey. (loved the organic Chix sandwich at the sportsbar) Would love if they added more food area choices. We did quite a business at Starbucks for breakfast and lunch. Only had one issue. The room was not cold enuf for us. Had engineering up there, but it still was warm to us. Everything else was FAB!!!! OH......and it is across the street from SEAWORLD. Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent renaissance”
Reviews.Author: ChuckAhern
Reviews.Content: For you Marriott elites, they offer champagne upon arrival, which was nice and not very common anymore. Was upgraded to a suite that was nice, new, and clean. The SeaWorld theme was well pulled off without looking tacky. Bed was comfortable, liked the furniture. The downside for me was they didn't have free breakfast for platinums, and although they seem to have a few bars and lounges, they never seemed to be open.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In A Sea of Orlando Hotels”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGutdoc
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time searching for hotels for a brief stay in Orlando prior to heading for a cruise at Port Canaveral. We were looking for a kids friendly place with lots of amenities and convinient for amenities. It was not far from the airport, right off the highway. Our stay met all expectations. The staff was very accomodating. Arrived on an early flight and gave us early check in at noon. The lobby area and all common spaces were very clean. A front desk clerk gave my 8 and 10 year olds an activity book to keep them entertained while waiting in the lobby for a few minutes before lunch. The newly opened pool area was better than most moderate resorts I have been at with a couple of waterslides, a beautiful main pool with plenty of shade and lounges available. Poolside bar available though we didn't get anything there. Rooms were clean and relatively spacious. Location of the hotel on International Blvd. very convinient for restaurants and shopping. It is located directly across the street from seaworld. Only a few minor disappointments. 1) As others have mentioned there is a self parking fee daily,not part of most room packages. 2) We booked a room for 5. I was told on the phone there was no charge for a rollaway bed, but upon check in the clerk advised me there is a fee. Since I was given misinformation, she readily removed the charge for the bed, without me asking. 3) Restaurant in the hotel a bit pricey,($10-15 lunch entrees, we didn't choose to eat there). THis was one of the best hotel experiences I have had, and a summer special ran us less than $100 for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: brijulkat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so much better than we expected. The room was roomy, the bathroom beyond clean. The atrium in the middle of the hotel was beautiful, with a restaurant, a bar, another bar that you could also order food, starbucks, arcade for the kids, etc .... it exceeded my expectations. I would definately stay here time and time again, I would recommend to book a room with breakfast included it is well worth it and cheaper than paying at the restaurant. Per every adult a child eats free. This is a hotel to go if you have no children, if you have teens, or small children. It is great for any age. The pool, the water park, everything was great. I am so glad I trusted the reviews I read in trip advisor!!! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel but some of the magic had faded”
Reviews.Author: boostravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in total and went back this year because its just somewhere I love to stay however i have to say some of my favorite things from previous visits have gone , just little things but I guess its the little touches that stand out. Firstly the candles in reception, now I know it sounds petty but there were always the most beautifull scented candles glowing in the reception area of an evening previously and it just gave the area a lovely and special feel...but not this year they were gone. They always turned down the sheets and left a little seaworld choccie on your pillow before but not anymore and the poolside snackbar was very much lacking in anything worth ordering, they used to do fab chicken tenders and fries but they had gone from the menu and not replaced with anything remotely similar. The starbucks is great but more expensive than a usual starbucks, infact the States used to be a reasonably priced place to eat but i found it very expensive this time round, I know the exchange rate is noweher near as good as previous years but the prices seemed generally higher. Now I know this sounds all very negitive but my comments are based more around the fantastic experience I have previously had and the changes I have noticed this time round, all in all I can say this is still an excellent hotel in a fantastic location and If you have never been before its doubtful you would be dissapointed. Fab location Friendly staff clean and comfortable rooms Can walk to seaworld from hotel Sportsbar very good and has nice food I am sure its not the last time I will be staying at this hotel but will maybe give it a break for a few years

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Matty17r
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel just across the street from Seaworld. We were offered sparkling wine on arrival. We had a pool view room which was very spacious. We got this hotel for an excellent rate on Priceline of 70 dollars a night plus tax. My only gripe would have to be the 15 dollars a day parking charge which added 135 dollars onto the cost of our 9 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average for business, better for families”
Reviews.Author: mankerholz
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at the Renaissance, but it was nothing memorable. The location is great for people that are wanting to spend time at Sea World, but the on-site restaurants are very pricey and not worth the premium prices. I stayed here for a conference at the resort and moved to another hotel, the Ritz Carlton Grande Lake, after finding a deal that made a couple of nights there cheaper than the rate I received at the Renaissance. I was very underwhelmed with this resort and would choose to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - All around!!”
Reviews.Author: MEDENS
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here 1 night before heading to Cape Canaveral to go on a cruise. We will definitely be back again - this hotel was well worth the $ and had lots to offer for all types of travelers. The rooms were clean and spacious, the staff friendly, and the location in proximity to Sea World, Aquatica, Discovery Cove, and lots of eating choices couldn't be beat. There is also a brand new water park for kids at the hotel, along w. a beautiful pool and pool bar. Basically, for the price, why stay anywhere else when visitng Sea World or any other nearby attractions. Also, at check-in, we were told to visit the Expedia concierge to get our "fast pass" for Sea World. That alone was worth $60 total and it was completely free here. It saved us time waiting in line for the popular rides in the heat at Sea World. We'll be back to this Renaissance for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had know about it before I blew a grand”
Reviews.Author: sina b
Reviews.Content: was looking for a 4 star hotel to stay at for 1 evening before our flight, at less than 100 a night, thought we weren't going to find it, but stumbled upon a great deal at the Renaissance. From the complimentary glass of champagne to the spacious room, great pool and lobby, this was perfect and I wish I had known about it before spending a week on Disney property. The only negative is the parking fee of 15.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - Surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CitizenoftheAir
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 2 rooms. As soon as we approached the front desk...ahhh we felt at home, welcomed. The hotel rep wanted to know the purpose of our trip, how many guests (adults and children) and number of beds needed. Little did we know that she was gathering information to accommodate us and offer us a grand suite instead of 2 individual rooms. This suite was fully furnished with a glass dining room, kitchenette, very nice furniture and decor, beds and extra beds in both rooms. The suite was facing Sea World and were able to enjoy the show and lights from the balcony without paying an entry fee to the park. For us, it was unheard of a hotel that went out the way to anticipate our needs with such sensitivity and throughout our stay, they knew our names and greeted us every time we came back from the outside. This hotel does not force you, not even by insinuation to eat at their restaurants. Of course, you get a map of the property and they point you to them! However, you are free to order food to be brought to the hotel such as great Italian food from a nearby restaurant (ordered online). The lobby and common area ambiance is soothing, colors are relaxing and employees make the difference!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Caressia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far more than I expected! Everything was done in excellence! The rooms were extremely clean and well taken care of. The customer service was great, always anticipating your needs. I travel as a profession (Airline Industry) and I must say this is one of the best hotels yet, since I've seen my share of them. The only thing I didn't like about this location was the distance from the airport to the hotel. They do not have a shuttle service, so you much secure shuttle or take a taxi which will cost about $30-40 a trip. Other than that, everything was excellent! Will definitely be returning! They also have a kiddy pool area, with slides and things for smaller children. Definitely something to do for ALL ages!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Trip to Seaworld or Not”
Reviews.Author: enjayflyer
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance at Seaworld is perfect for those who are visiting Seaworld and want a nice pool, great kid planned activities, a waterpark area and decent food – all in one location. You don’t even need a rental car and you don't need to go to Seaworld, just an overall nice property. The rooms are fine. They are large but not decorated as nicely as you would think for a Renaissance. There is tons of seating in the lobby and the Starbucks is a plus. What I didn’t appreciate is the constant badgering of visiting other properties (time share-esque) to get free tickets and other semi-enticing benefits, oh and no internet in the rooms. I don't understand why hotels do not include this in the rate. We enjoyed our time at the pool and at the bar - which is what we planned to do anyway... One major observation: The water/ice had a funny taste of which I also experienced at Seaworld. Seaworld is across the street as mentioned and expensive. The rides are very far apart from each other and after you’ve seen a few of the animal shows, you’re done. Two (2) days is all you need. I would come back to the Renaissance primarily because of the location and the kid’s activities. Gives parents a time to relax, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: NothingButBS
Reviews.Content: Again, I show them my Marriott's Reward Program card and AGAIN they give me a ROOF view with the AC Units, which the sound is unbearable. The constant whirring of the units all day and all night. ROOF VIEW...REALLY...AGAIN. What is it with Marriott and the roof views. I got it again and again I wanted to move and again the customer service would not do it. If you stay here, get the rooms behind the front desk, not the ones in front of them...ROOF VIEW and they WILL NOT CHANGE YOUR ROOM regardless of whatever program you are a part of. NO THANK YOU. I will go to a Hilton or Hyatt where they DO CARE about their customers. And by 5pm, my room was not refreshed...5pm? REALLY? Whatever!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for our busy family holiday”
Reviews.Author: KittyWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a wonderful hotel. We all found the rooms very clean and comfortable. Normally I struggle to sleep well on holiday but the beds at Renaissance were perfect. During our stay we visited the Tradewinds restaurant for breakfast a couple of times, children get a free breakfast if booked through Virgin. The choice of food was great and certainly set us up for busy days at the many parks. We also ate at the Sports bar a couple of nights. They could do with a little more choice on the menu, however, what they served was always good quality. We all enjoyed relaxing by the pool during our stay. There are plenty of beds, with tables and umbrellas. My 10 year old daughter loved the pool and aqua zone and I could relax because I knew she was safe. The pool bar serves a good selection of light bites and drinks. There are two water fountains available at either end of the bar which come in useful during the hot weather! The staff in the hotel were all very pleasant and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. We'd certainly consider staying at Renaissance again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed this hotel/resort to the fullest... AWESOME STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dianaoor
Reviews.Content: Although there was a delay of 45 mins. for my room to be cleaned and ready at check-in, they complimented us with FREE parking for our entire stay and were very regretful of the delay. The entire staff was very helpful and friendly ( from the Front desk agents, to the Expedia agents, to the staff on the floor and poolside). My stay was great and the grounds were beautiful. This will be my place to return to when I'm vacationing in Orlando. A few tips I have to offer: - When you pay for the internet keep in mind that you it's $14.95 for 24 hour access only. -The drinks at the Palms (Poolside bar are not too pricey and my pina colada was pretty tasty) - Tradewinds restaurant can be a bit pricey if traveling with kids under 12. I believe one child is free per paying adult -- don't mark my words but this is what I overheard. The pancakes are awesome ! -Definitely try and rent a car; there's so much to explore in the area. - Sea World is within short distance; Disney theme parks are about 20 mins away. Enjoy your stay... I will be back :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Seaworld, but??????”
Reviews.Author: jakki c
Reviews.Content: My Partner and myself went to Orlando in November 2010. We chose to stay at the Renaissance because of the reputation it had. Check in was not easy and there was alot of hanging around. The receptionist was pleasant enough. We was not shown to the room, just given the room key. The room was clean and tidy and we had a great view of Seaworld. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was clean. There was a coffee machine, iron and ironing board in the wardrobe. The bathroom was basic, and the shower was okay. Clean towels daily. Very quiet in the room and there was not many children. Downstairs, you had a Starbucks, gift shop and a ticket office for excursions and sport bar and restaurant. Aswell as an information desk, there is a very helpful man working there that will help you with any queries that you have (sorry, I cannot remember his name). We had breakfast at the hotel twice, I would suggest to take the bus to International Drive (very easy to do) and eat at one of the many resturants there. The buses are directly outside the hotel and you can purchase the bus tickets from the hotel's ticket office. The bus takes you to International Drive and the shopping malls and there is a bus that will take you to Walt Disney World. When we were checking out of the hotel, they tried to charge us for parking. We did not have a car to park. The stay at this hotel was okay. But, we were expecting alot more.........

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for a visit to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Parenttravel46
Reviews.Content: I had not been to this Renaissance resort in many years. I was happy to see all the improvements that were made such as the new lobby and the new water zone. While the water zone could not compete with Aquatica, it was a great break from the parks. The area was well supervised, clean and comfortable. I liked the cushions on the chaise lounges and the ease of obtaining towels. The water zone was in a separate area from the pool which I thought was nice so that the pool area was a bit more quiet. The hotel itself was very nice. The food was good at Tradewinds Restaurant. The breakfast buffet was great. The hotel room was very large and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also very large and included a nice size tub/shower and two sinks. The wood furniture was a bit tired looking. This was one of the larger hotel rooms I have been in which was not a suite. The hotel room was also very quiet. I was a bit concerned based on the size of this hotel, but it was quiet as could be. The hotel is across the street from Sea World. It took us about 5 minutes to walk to the front gate. For a stay at Sea World, this hotel cannot be beat. There were shuttles to Sea World, but the times were not the most convenient and they needed to load and unload in the bus shuttle area. Honestly, it was faster to walk to and from the hotel that to wait for the shuttles. Also, the bus shuttle area was not exactly that close to the front entrance of Sea World. We stayed at Sea World until it closed and there was so much traffic getting out of the parking lot that I was happy to just walk across the street as opposed to sitting in the traffic on the shuttle trying to exit the parking lot. The only complaint I had about the hotel was the fact that people put menus under our door from local pizzerias. Be aware, we have been warned that these are scams to get your credit card information. I was disappointed that the hotel was unable to stop solicitors (whether real or not) from roaming around the hotel. We came in contact with one person delivering these menus and did not know about this scam until after the fact. Luckily, we had no intention of ordering any pizza. However, when I advised the hotel management of same, they advised security and said they do their best to try and keep these people out of their hotel. They were very attentive to the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!! but.........................”
Reviews.Author: annonted
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong the hotel was very nice clean big but the beds where hard & there is a $15.00 parking fee which I dont remember reading on the web site I just dont think i should have 2 pay 2 park @ a hotel I paied to sleep in. But rite next door 2 Sea World & they have a great water park for kids. oh yeah their internet is not free!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic all round holiday”
Reviews.Author: harpsy68
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week family holiday in florida and stayed at the Renaissance Orlando and found the hotel to be excellant in all ways. We holidayed with another family and between us we had two 15 year olds with us and a 4 year old and found the hotel good for both ages.The new waterpark delighted our four year old. We did theDisney parks which are excelllent but tiring and we found coming back to the hotel was heaven>The beds are so comfortable ( normally like getting home to my own bed not on this holiday), they have Aveda products in the room which are restocked everyday. the hotel restaurants we found good but didn't use often as we were out and about most of the time. The staff are friendly and helpful.The local pizza restaraunt called Flippers was top class and found the pizzas really tasty there. So we could suit everybody at the theme parks we got a fast passes for the rides which is free and just gives you a time to go back and get on quicker. We visited Discovery Cove which i would defintly do again. i do not go on rides as i am a bit chicken but the rest of the party voted the Harry Potter ride in universal Island of Adventure the best ride ever. All in all the holiday was really enjoyable and we would definatley go to the Renaissance Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mikem28
Reviews.Content: A well run good quality hotel with excellent facilities. We stayed in a standard room which was large , well furnished and maintained to a high standard daily. The bar food was excellent and the restaurant was very good. Drinks were reasonable for a hotel of this standard and cheaper than the equivalent in the UK. The in house Starbucks was a cheap option for breakfast. All the staff we talked to were helpful and smiling from the concierge to the chambermaids. The swimming pool and new water attraction were immaculately maintained and it was always possible to get a sunbed and shade. Ample parking (free for Virgin guests) made for easy use of our hire car and the location gave easy access to all the major routes and attractions.Even the presence of large conferences did not affect our enjoyment as the hotel simply ensured enhanced staffing to cope. Overall a very good hotel, offering excellent facilities and services.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place”
Reviews.Author: Sean O
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Rooms were very nice. People were friendly. Ideal to get to most of the theme parks. Reception went above and beyond their duties to ensure that our visit was satisfactory and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Quiet and classy”
Reviews.Author: kittyc117
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms are spacious and stylish. The lobby is open air and very current. Loved having the Starbucks right there. The pool is so pretty and serene, not to mention huge. There was no shortage of chairs. Plus the little water park was excelllent for kids of all ages. Our four year old stayed on the kiddy side and our nine year olds loved the bigger kid side with two water slides. It was a great, quiet hotel and the price was unbeatable. You can walk directly across the street to SeaWorld. Ask for a high floor facing SeaWorld to view their fabulous, nightly fireworks. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissionViejomom
Reviews.Content: We came for a family member's wedding and had a wonderful stay! Every employee in this hotel was just wonderful and the room was comfortable and clean. The pool was great and we also loved the breakfast buffet. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of Seaworld and there was a Shamu character in the hotel's Tradewinds restaurant which amused the breakfast crowd (both kids and kids-at-heart). If I were to say anything negative about the hotel it would be the quality of the food at the wedding reception.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: peanutpuppy
Reviews.Content: This resort exceeded our expectations and that is so rare lately!! The check-in was seamless and they offered champagne and cider upon arrival. Self park was CLOSE to the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean, Aveda products were a perk. The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced for the kids ($9.00). The pool was clean and the pool cushions were like new, plenty of clean, fresh smelling towels, too! There were organized games at the pool for the kids and s'mores and a movie on the lawn in the evening. We traveled with our kids ages 8 and 10 and they had a blast. I was impressed because these days it seems even the hotels we once enjoyed are slipping and are disappointing- this hotel had it all and we can't wait to go back when in Orlando again. (Only negative was the service for lunch at the pool the first day, service was SLOW although the waitress had no other tables. We sat down with four adults and four kids who were all hot and thirsty (and hungry) and the waitress took our order and then waited 20 minutes to bring our drinks and food at the same time... (no drinks or even water first even tho we saw them ready and sitting on the bar?!) She had an indifferent attitude toward serving our table.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, especially with kids!”
Reviews.Author: slmasonhhi
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at the Renaissance Orlando Sea World, me and my two four-year-old girls and my friends, a couple with their five-year-old boy. The hotel was wonderful! The rooms were very large and felt spacious, the kids were happy just playing in the room. The glass elevators, aquarium videos everywhere and oversized furniture kept them entertained in the lobby, and they enjoyed the game room as well as the foosball and ping-pong tables outside. The pool was very big and had a big shallow end with wide steps where they could play, but the best thing, by far, was the water park, with three water slides, fountains, sprayers, water guns, etc. that they loved! We spent hours of our vacation there. I had been worried that we were going to have to go to a "real" water park when they saw their slides from the road, but they were perfectly content with this one. They also had kids eat free nights, and scavenger hunts and movies on the lawn for kids. My only complaint is that the hotel didn't advertise those activites well enough ahead of time. We always seemed to find them already in progress. We hadn't planned on going to Sea World, but we almost changed our minds because of the hotels convenient location, right across the street, and the shuttle and discounts they provided. We spent our time at Disney and while this hotel wasn't as convenient as being on Disney property, it did not feel too far at all. I do plan to go back for a visit to Sea World, and I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, services and location!”
Reviews.Author: LuvToGetAway22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have stayed at this hotel for the past 2 years in July for a dance convention. They do a wonderful job of providing afforadable meal selections for the convention, special lines of food during lunch, dinner and late evening competitions. They just added a small waterpark and also have a beautiful pool and pool bar/restaurant set-up. Starbucks in the hotel that you can charge to your room, too! Check-in and check-out was super easy. The staff was always very accomodating. Rooms are nice. Location is right across the street from SeaWorld, too! They do a fantastic job of handling all of these moms and dancers for the Tremaine National Dance Competition/Convention! Highly recommend for any convention! They do have a spa, too, but I never utilized it.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: aprilvillegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very, very nice. Location was perfect. We walked across the stree to SeaWorld and the front desk gave us free Quick Pass to the front of every line 2 days in a row. Staff is very friendly and the rooms are in perfect condition. I would highly recommend staying here and plan to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Kids and Adults”
Reviews.Author: Jotedney
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for a long weekend with my five year old. I can't say enough good things. If you are visiting Sea World, it is right across the street. They have shuttles, but it is an easy walk. After a day at a crazy, crowded park, walking into the hotel is an "ahhhh" momemnt. They have managed to make it peaceful, very kid friendly, and yet also sort of hip with a chic cockatil/sushi bar right in the middle. Cocktails a plenty while the kids run around. The pool is great (could always get a chair and towels a plenty without having to sign your life away), the waterslides are even better. The breakfast was amazing -- not only the food, but the fact that no matter what time we went -- on a summer weekend no less -- there was never a line. And on the weekends they have a kid pancake station -- their height and can have sprinkles, gummy bears etc. Plus, Shamu shows up at breakfast on Saturdays! Staff was overall great. I would surely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twinsdad24
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week and the hotel was very impressive. Excellent pool and they even have a nice sprinkler park for the kids! The rooms were very spacious and clean. The bathroom was a good size as well with double sinks. Hotel food is okay, not great but as good if not better than most. Breakfast buffet is definitely the best deal of the day. To summarize, this was a great hotel that offered great activities for kids (s'mores movie night, etc..) in a pretty centralized location. Only drawback was that transportation to universal and Disney can get expensive if you're not renting or using a car.

Reviews.Title: “Leave the Family at Home”
Reviews.Author: HotelJumpers
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a convention at this hotel, so rather than leave my family home I took them with me. Big Mistake. There was not really a lot for our two teens to do on property. They have a really nice mini 'water theme park' for the smaller guest but nothing else really for older children. Wifi caused a lot confusion. When we called ahead, and at checked in, we were told it was free with the room. On the second day, after the Xbox and several lap tops were hooked up we were told it was $15 per device, per day ... of course I flipped out and they comp'd the cost for that first day. There is free WiFi in the lobby but when your room is on the 8th floor that can be a real hassle. I did end up getting the Wifi two additional days for the teens to play Xbox, because there really wasn't anything else for them to do. There are no vending machine of any kind, so snacks are $4-$5 a pop at the gift shop or restaurant. The food at the restaurants were way over priced and small portioned. So if you are traveling with teenagers be ready for a large food bill during your stay. There was also confusion about parking. At check in we were told it was free and then we were told it was $6 per day. The staff could not get their stories straight as far as fees were concern... My biggest concern was when TWO staff members told me there were no stair cases at the hotel (there was a long line for the elevator so we wanted to hike it instead). I gently reminded these staff member that fire laws require exit stairs... These are the people that we are expected to rely on for information in an emergency? Seriously? You think the building has no stairs? I cannot recommend this place because there are way too many and much better hotels in Orlando to stay at...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, room was fine.”
Reviews.Author: mammalux
Reviews.Content: Room is nice. Very clean. Staff was pleasant. Am here on a business conference. Pool and Jacuzzi are nice. Not sure what other travels are talking about. There is an entire water park just for kids. Can't wait to bring the family back here and being literally across the street from SeaWorld is great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jessicasolomon
Reviews.Content: The bathroom floor had dried up stains. Room service was very slow to bring extra towels when needed. The staff was unpleasant when approached about the dirty room. There were many business conferences at the hotel not at all a family oriented place.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel, breakfasts fantastic”
Reviews.Author: foursomefamily
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel. Our rooms faced the atrium and were too noisy to sleep. We moved to rooms facing the pool and slept well from then on. Breakfasts are fantastic, plenty of choice. We had interconnecting rooms which were large and clean. We benefited from the quick passes to Seaworld which made a great difference, walked straight onto rides (even on 4th July). Staff are helpful and attentive. So glad we chose this hotel - would definitely return. The position of this hotel is fantastic for Seaworld and Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dsimpson0530
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel July 2nd thru July 7th. We had a great time. Good location in regards to seaworld and disney world. The hotel itself was very clean and the service was excellent. Convenient Starbucks in the lobby. Overall this was a great hotel The only complaint that I have was that they nickel and dime you for everything. 15 dollars a day to park, when you order room service the charge you a service fee and a "tip" fee on your bill. I thought service fee was a tip fee. Also they charge you for Internet in the hotel room but it is free in the lobby which doesn't make sense to me. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!! We Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: sabrinasmom1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from 7/9-7/12. We went for my sons birthday and to got to Sea World and Aquatica. From the start the staff was excellent. My husband and I received champagne upon checking in. Our room was spacious and clean. I loved that the bathroom had two sinks. Our room was an atrium view which was great. We received front of the line passes for Sea World from the expedia desk. The sushi restaurant was awesome. Best sushi I have ever eaten. We ate their for dinner two nights in a row. We ate the the Tradewinds 3 days in row for lunch. Our waiter Ray was awesome and knew our kids by name. We were able to walk to both Sea World and Aquatica. There was a shuttle, but we opted to walk. I notified the concierge that it was my sons birthday and they sent up a little gift bag for him. He is 7 so he was very excited. The pool area was awesome. Our kids loved the new water park area. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great staff and very customer focussed”
Reviews.Author: RAS1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks, the hotel is large and has good facilities and a nice pool area, which has been extended since we left. Our main plus point was how friendly and helpful the staff were, we travelled with 3 kids including a young baby and the servers and other staff showed genuine interest and did their best to make things go well. We had the odd glitch e.g. on orders in the restaurant - nothing serious it was like the wrong wine was served. But any time there was a problem the team were really good at fixing the problem and adjusting the bill to compensate. Our package included a kids eat free at breakfast option which meant that we had buffet breakfast every day; but for this it could have got a bit pricey and we would have eaten breakfast out. Dinners were probably a bit more than if we had eaten out but not that much more and the food was good; menu was slightly limited but was fine. We also had inclusive parking which helped as otherwise its $15/20 per day (self/valet park). The location was good - directly opposite seaworld and close to all the main attractions. Overall we really liked the hotel and would definitely return hopefully before long!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for traveling to Seaworld and family friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kim34432
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Renaissance at 10pm on Friday night for the 4th of July weekend and were greeted by Valerie, who was very sweet and imformative in regards to our stay. We requested a view and did she deliver, we had a beautiful view of the amazing pool/water park area and also a peek at Seaworld! This was our first time at this location and our first time for our children to visit Seaworld, so it was a great surprise to arrive in our room and find in the bathroom Shamu squirters for the kids to play with in the bath or pool! It is the small touches that make a stay memorable. There were also daily activities at the facility for children (we were not able to utilize these, but next time we hopefully will be able to). All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to any family wanting a memorable stay at a classy and friendly facility! The only two negatives are the parking, $15/day plus tax and we ended up in the back of the hotel one night and free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the check in hype”
Reviews.Author: rmbt58
Reviews.Content: I am an "elite member" of the Marriot frequent guest program. When checking in the man said "since you are an elite member we upgraded your room to a balcony." I asked for a high floor room with a view away from the elevator. I got third floor, three doors from elevator with a view over the roof and looking into a building.It was the back side of the hotel. Yes the balcony was small, one chair and very narrow, but with no view, why bother. I felt I was misled. The housekeeping staff was excellant, friendly and very efficient. The rest of the staff were helpful and friendly. I felt the front desk was very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnn1641
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids - 10 & 7. They have been on cruises and stayed in lots of hotels and state this to be their favorite. From an adult aspect I have to agree. From the second we arrived I felt like a VIP. The pool area is fantastic for kids as well as adults and the kids play area is separate enough that I would come without my kids and know I wouldn't be bothered. Food is good and for a hotel across from Seaworld not ridiculously overpriced. Best thing was the perk of free quick que access to seaworld putting you at the front of the lines because you are staying across the street. Trust me this means no waiting on the hot sun to get on rides. This hotel is beautifully decorated and run to perfection without being stuffy. We felt totally at home with our kids but still happy with he grown up amenities. Spa, bars hot tub. Even the valet's go out of their way for you, when they saw us walking up the path from Seaworld one

Reviews.Title: “Are you serious???”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelA1234
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel looks nice. However, I got to my room and: 1) saw a stain on my rug 2) paint was chipping off the ceiling 3) mirror on the sliding closet door was cracked 4) my bath towel had two HUGE holes. I told the front desk about the towel and cracked mirror and the clerk told me, "I will let house keeping know; I'm pretty sure they accidentally missed it."

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyAnn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel June 17-21. I arrived at the hotel at 10am and my room wasn't ready, which I expected. I decided to leave my bags and check out Seaworld. I stopped at the Expedia desk and picked up comp quick passes. (You have to go to the customer service desk in Seaworld to get the acutal band, you can't just show the paper to ride attendants).We just missed a shuttle and decided to walk across the parking lot and it was a quick 5 min walk. Within an hour I got a call from the hotel stating my room was ready :-) The pool area was nice, the new mini- water park opened the next day and it was a great, especially for little kids. My meal at Tradewinds was delious. The rest of the food was blah to me. The pool grill had a very limited menu, though my daughter loved their cheeseburgers. The sports bar food was nasty and it was a really long wait. Breakfast buffet was a little pricey, but you can get fresh made pancakes and omelettes made to order. Over all the staff was very nice and accomodating. I would definately stay here again if I was going back to Discovery Cove and Seaworld. Better food would have gotten this stay 5 stars. With three resturants on site and nothing good to eat is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome New Water Park / Friendly and Clean! Well worth the price!!”
Reviews.Author: bwalsh19
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding experience we had this weekend. We were lucky enough to be at this hotel the day the new water park opened! The Food was the best I have ever had in a hotel! All of the staff were very friendly and made us feel at home. They were over the top in providing my family and I with a wonderful experience! Bravo!! Also the new suite renovation was really worth the extra upgrade fee. (hint, as the desk when checking about an upgrade into one of their fabulous suites...) Try the Sushi Bar - Tamaki was a true sushi pro! As good as some of the best places in California. The Baordwalk was also great for watching the game and grabbing a burger. Tradewinds has a kick _ _ _ buffet for breakfast and some of the best Cod and Short Ribs I have tasted. The housekeeping staff was friendly and they have very CLEAN ROOMS as well! The Desk staff was friendly and the bellman were super... Also, a very nice SPA with a great massage and steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Far below expectations - avoid it if you can!”
Reviews.Author: RaffaeleB
Reviews.Content: Put together a well know hotel chain and the average quality of the 4 or 5 stars hotel in US and your expectations will be right at the top. Well that was my case and the disappointment was even more. The hotel furniture it is not only stuck in the 80s but for the status it is it seems it is from the 80s for real! Same for the bathroom furniture (with plastic cortines in the bath :/) and not exactly the standard of cleanliness you would expect. 220$ for all this and not breakfast included. Do we want to talk about the swimming pool? better I stop here. You have so many options (My colleagues stayed at the Peabody - much central, excellent hotel and cheaper!) at Orlando that staying here feels like a waist.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you're visiting Seaworld -- the perks rule!”
Reviews.Author: mespy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel so my family and I could visit Seaworld. We booked here for the Marriott points, without knowing about the perks you get for Seaworld. First, the location couldn't have been better -- it's directly across the street from the entrance. The hotel did have a shuttle to the entrance, but we didn't bother -- it's only a five minute walk to the entrance. Upon checking in, the front desk had us check with the concierge to get our quick passes. We checked with them and we got: (1) Early admission to the park -- an hour before anyone else, (2) Unlimited quick passes (fast passes) to all the crowded ride, (3) A early morning tour of the part (we opted out of this one). The perks were huge. We road Altantis, Kracken, and Manta a couple of time before anyone arrived at the park. Even after people arrived, we had exhibits to ourselves. The best part was leaving SeaWorld at lunchtime, walking across the street, getting out of the heat, and eating lunch at a reasonably-price restaurant in the hotel. After a quick dip in the pools, we went back to the SeaWorld. We were able to use the quick passes to buypass 30 minutes waits in the lines. The rest of the hotels was great -- great rooms and great service. I definitely recommend this hotel if you're visiting SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: DFWvol
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the pleasure of staying at the hotel for a long weekend to visit Disney World. Upon check in we were upgraded to an interior balcony room on the eighth floor. We did not want to leav ! The hotel is conviently located about a block away from Intersate 4 thus making Disney World and Orlando Premium Outlets easily accesible. Sea World is also literally across the street. This is a true luxury hotel and the staff are very accomidating and extrememly professional. The complementary champagne at check in is also a nice touch. We got a great rate via Pricline for 75.00. However, keep in mind that this is a higher end hotel so expect to pay for parking. We will definetly stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Would Have Been Nice - If they weren't doing construction :-(”
Reviews.Author: WeirdNJ
Reviews.Content: I went to Orlando in May for Business. I had multiple hotels I could have chosen to stay at, but always try to stay at a Marriott, because of their friendliness and service. I had a reservation, but was put into a room right next to another room that was under construction. Because I was travelling on Business, I was not using the pool or in the room much, but would have been extremely disappointed if I was on vacation. The one day that my meeting started later, and I would have been able to sleep in, I was awoken at 8:00am by banging on the wall next door. The sheetrock dust literally came through the underneath the door adjoining to the next room. Because of the construction, I couldn't take a conference call from my room and had to call the front desk to arrange for an internet connection and a quiet room to make my phone call from. While the hotel staff was very accomadating, they should not have sold a room right next to a room that was under construction. The construction went on all day starting at 8am. It was very disappointing for a Marriott, therefore I'm only giving three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Here for a conference; come back for Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here in June. The hotel was beautiful. It had a huge, multi-story lobby with restaurants, bars, etc. It also had free wireless. The staff was very friendly and helpful. More than once, I was pausing to figure out my bearings and it seemed like I was asked if I needed help by staff nearly every time. My third floor room looked brand new. They were working on two other rooms on my floor, so I assume they mine was recently renovated. Despite being above the outdoor pool, I rarely heard any noise from outside my room. They didn't note any recycling options in the room, such as setting the message on the bed or hanging up sheets (but offered the latter anyway.) They did have thin recycling barrels spread throughout the main floor, so I was able to drop off my paper and plastics. The business office was run by Fed Ex and I was able print out stuff there from a USB and that was helpful. Even when the desk was closed, guests could access the computers and printers with a key card. I didn't use the Concierge service, but they looked ready to help guests with all the fun stuff nearby. The hotel is set back a bit from the road, so I imagine it wouldn't be easy to simply walk about, but I must admit I stayed in the hotel for the entire conference. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, but totally decent.”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrav-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days for a conference hosted at the hotel recently. The conference food, set up, and service all seemed to be great. Every staff member I encountered was at the very least polite, and most were really friendly. The hotel itself is absolutely huge, which isn't really my cup of tea, but some of the things that make huge hotels inconvenient (long waits for the elevator, lines, crowded areas) were not a problem. The outdoor pool area is really nice, though it was absolutely choked with people after about 6pm (when everyone returned from the parks). My room was spacious, with a mini fridge. The only negative (and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) was that there where issues with cleanliness details - crumbs in corners, nail clippings under the desk (gross!), and a desk chair in serious need of a vacuum at the back of the seat and on the pedestal. A colleague had similar issues in his room. This is also a nickle & dime hotel - $15 for parking and $15 for Internet. Still, nice place and if you get a great rate, I would recommend it. As long as they vacuum better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dozzymoocow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks from 16th may 2011. The hotel is fantastic with great service. The rooms are large and all areas were very clean. This hotel would be fantastic for people visiting sea world, discovery cove and aquatia as they are all within walking distance. Also there is a bus stop right outside the hotel for the I ride to go to international drive and the number 50 bus to down town Disney. The free shuttle to parks is not regular thoughout the day so it probably be advisable to plan other modes of transport to universal, wet and wild and Disney. The shuttle to busch gardens goes from sea world, so again you can walk this in 5 mins. The only down side to this hotel is that the food is pricey and there are no food out let's close by. The nearest is a 20 min walk and they are not the best. However, it is only a short ride on the I Reilly to international drive where there is lots of choice on things to do and for food. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms and lobby since the last time I was there.”
Reviews.Author: pammer22
Reviews.Content: 2n stay here. 2 queen beds ..comfortable. The lobby has been redone. They are adding a new pool section to the facility. They have updated the rooms and lobby since the last time we were here. Staff was nice on the phone and in person. Priceline name your own price...70.00 Can not beat that. I do hate that they do charge 15. for self park and extra for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of all the additional surcharges”
Reviews.Author: starcox88
Reviews.Content: When reserving the Renaissance at Sea World, I was very excited! Generally speaking you can never go wrong with staying with this particular hotel chain. However, I have to admit I was very disappointed from many various aspects of this hotel. I am a certified road warrior business traveler and have stayed at more hotels than my own home. Seriously! I booked this hotel through Priceline and stated I wished to stay at a 4 star hotel in this area. 99% of the time I agree with the rating they give the hotels. However, they missed the star rating mark on this hotel. I would give this hotel a 3 star rating. This may not seem like a big difference, but believe when I tell you that one star even ½ a star makes a difference. My emotions really want to give this hotel a 2 ½ star rating. Let me explain why… 1. The hotel looks very old and shows its age. They made a meager attempt to make it something. However, that something…. is just plain odd. It looks appears they are having money problems and are trying their best to keep the hotel afloat. 2. Crazy additional expenses such as $15 per day for self parking, $14.95 per day internet (Most 4 star offer this complementary) Breakfast buffet was $20 plus taxes and gratuity = $26.00 for eggs and bacon etc. Evening snack personal size pizza was $18. No extra gratuity added. Business center charges .55 per minute for dial up speeds. .59 per printed page. Over $26 in less than 11 minutes. 3. Imagine the worst bed you have ever slept in and you will have a good idea of what to expect. The king beds only have standard pillows. No king pillows. That really isn’t that bad but the bed is horrible. 4. The staff does seem to offer the basic customer service that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. That is about wraps it up. If you are planning on visiting Sea World you will love the location. Otherwise, for other travelers I would not recommend this hotel, especially business travelers. So there you have it.

Reviews.Title: “Right by sea world”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: Nice place if you are going to sea world. Rooms could use updating, but are acceptable. Ate at Tradewinds and was satisfied, but not excited

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY MARVELOUS”
Reviews.Author: Kimmie57
Reviews.Content: First time stay at the Renaissance, which was chosen after several weeks of reading reviews and research. The hotel is one of the most beautiful and well kept that I have ever stayed in. The pictures on the website is exactly what you see upon arrival. No hidden fees. Room service as great and prompt. Staff friendly and helpful with suggestions. Only negative, is that there are no restaurants within walking distance and bottled water in the room cost $3 each.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Madigan5
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a five day conference. The hotel is just okay. I stay mostly at Marriott brand hotels and I wasn't as impressed with this Renaissance. Most of the service was fine, except the restaurant. Everyone had awful service and the food was not only limited in choice, but not very good. This is a large hotel and my suggestion would be to have another restaurant other then Tradewinds and a Starbucks. The pool area was very nice. I would also suggest that they update the lobby a bit. It was clean. The internet and wireless access was terrible. Everyone had problems getting connected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sports bar and service”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneFamilyFour
Reviews.Content: We love Orlando and we loved this hotel. Right on the doorstep of Searworld and Aquatica, perfect. The service was great and we loved the casual atmosphere of the sports bar where our two girls were very welcome. We like to try somewhere different every time we visit Orlando but I would have no issue coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Travelwidkids
