Reviews.Content: Arrived middle of the week with early check in that the Front desk facilitated and took care of us very well till then. It is within walking distance to Sea world with a beautiful well maintained hotel and rooms. They gave us free Quick passes for sea world through their enterprise desk which were very helpful toavoid the long queques at all the major rides. Free champagne in the evenings. Cons paid parking. $15 dollars a day for self and 20$ for unlimited valet. Valet was great because we used our car a lot and they were quick and courteous. Trade winds restaurant in the hotel was expensive and slow during peak breakfast times.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: JaneC83
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with this hotel - our visit was great from beginning to end. The amazing friendly service and special touches make this hotel, in my opinion for value and location, the absolute best hotel for visiting Sea World and Universal - Rooms are large, clean with extremely comfortable luxurious bedding. Food in restaurants are great. - I was even given a recipe when I remarked how good the dip was! My kids loved this hotel, asked to go back again just to stay and enjoy the hotel - the addition of a pool slide in the summer will be amazing. We were here on Easter and the hotel had a Easter Bunny and Easter egg hunt which made it all the more personal. Highly recommend this hotel - Florida residents get special deals and do not get stuck in the worst rooms like other hotels do . Do yourself a favor and stay here . 2 thumbs up all round.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Champagne!”
Reviews.Author: Dejais
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline for an unbelievable price! I was greeted at the reservation desk with champagne (nice touch!) and given our room immediately. We had spent the day shopiing in Orlando so the room was heaven sent. Our room was huge and had a balcony overlooking the interior of the hotel which was charming. The coffee and tea in the room was excellent quality. Aveda products in the bathroom which made my night. Beds were very comfortable. And we were right next to the I-4 ramp and Sea World. We would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluenosegirl06
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with our 3 year old son. Our first impression was positive as we were checked in by a friendly and helpful employee named Valerie. Our room had a balcony with a great view of Sea World and we enjoyed the beautiful pool area in the evenings after our park excursions. We ordered room service one evening and the service/food was great. Overall, very impressed with the staff at this hotel as they make every effort to assist guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: tonyandalison
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good sized room but could have done with a little more storage as with two adults & two children (10 & 8) it was a bit tight. Very claen room with a great fresh coffee maker provided. Fantastic location just off of idrive so you are away from the hustle but is just a couple of minutes away. Just a short drive to I4 as well. As this is a Sea World partner and if you have Sea World tickets you can get 'FREE' quick queue for the rides as many times as you want. But get them early as there are limited numbers. (We did both Karken & Manta 9 times in a day!) The hotel has a great buffet breakfast and our package meant our children ate free, which was good value, otherwise it would be expensive. The evening dinner was good value for the kids. The hotel is huge and whilst we were there there were several large business meetings but this did not impact on our stay. My kids loved coming back to the hotel with a 30 foot bag of crisps outside Great pool and it is currently being extended to include slides. Check you package as if it does not include free transfers, Kids eat free & free parking it could be expensive. A couple of downsides; most rooms overlook the huge foyerand I found it noisy at times when trying to sleep, but not all the time. If you want 100% peace get a room that does not overlook the foyer. Check your bill as I had 3 items that were not mine. But there was no quibble when questioned.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: wvbuckeye
Reviews.Content: The facility is very nice, but the staff make it special. Check in was very quick and Valerie was friendly. They were offering a glass of champagne free at check in. That was a nice welcome! The rooms were large and quiet. The restaurant was very nice (although a tad pricey) and our waiter, Oscar, was outstanding for both dinner and breakfast. If you are visiting discovery cove or SeaWorld, you can't beat the location. Internet and parking were extra, but wireless internet is available in the lobby for free. The pool is huge. They were building a water play area while we were there - looked fun. Looked like a beautiful place for a convention. We booked on line through the Marriott site and had a good deal with our AAA card.

Reviews.Title: “Great+ Overall”
Reviews.Author: a2trip
Reviews.Content: Hotel is across from SeaWorld. Also, very close/very easy access to I-4 for Disney. LOBBY is very KIDS and adult friendly, very pleasant and relaxing. Yes, rooms don't have free internet (thanks, GOD!!!) but lobby does... We stayed for 3 days, 1 day we spent relaxing at pool (it was great, best jacuzzi - very powerful), next day (wish weather was better) had to spend inside - lobby provided plenty of space/comfort/entertainment for kids and us. Lobby also has Starbucks and Concierge/Travel/Entertainment Office next to it. Only con - $15/day parking fee but at least it has in/out rights with hotel card...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pool and lobby with more renovations on the way.”
Reviews.Author: alisonchilla
Reviews.Content: The pool area here is fantastic. Lots of seating in and out of the sun, plus a poolside grill and bar. They are building another pool/waterplay area that will end up making this area amazing, I think. Right now there are kids in the pool, but there is still plenty of space for the adults. With the additional play area, I think they will end up with a separate area for families. The lobby area is very pretty -- set up like a courtyard area with lots of natural light and a GIANT screen TV in a centrally located "open-air" bar. The exercise room here is good with plenty of machines and more equipment than I've seen at other hotels. The food is decent. It isn't the best I've ever had, but I didn't have a bad meal here either. Service in Tradewinds is fast, elsewhere it is a little slow... My room and bathroom were big. Nice flat screen TV. Comfy beds. I'd definitely come back here, especially if I wanted to spend time at Sea World -- it is within easy walking distance. It was fine getting to the convention center on the provided shuttles as well. Nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family and fun!”
Reviews.Author: bnj1999
Reviews.Content: Loved the inner atrium atmosphere and friendly staff. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest experience!”
Reviews.Author: happy34141
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and were very impressed by EVERYTHING! While my husband was checking in, the kids and I (ages 12, 10, & 8) checked out the lobby. WOW!!!!! The lobby was HUGE and oh so "sheek". The waterfall, the underwater scene on the t.v's at one of the bars, the couches & pillows, the tables above one of the other restaurants, the balconies overlooking the courtyard, etc. We were very impressed! There was also a tiny game room, foosball table, & pingpong table for the kids. Pool was great and firepit at night was very calming. Our room was huge and very clean. Bathroom was very spacious and clean too. Staff was great! Elevators were so quick each time. Beds were extremely comfortable. The floors were extremely quiet too. At other hotels you hear doors slamming and people walking, but not here. Would DEFINETLY stay here again and/or recomment this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Close to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: funhole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 2010 Thanksgiving Holiday week. It's your typical new Florida hotel with a huge courtyard in the middle and the rooms surround it. Some of the rooms have balconies that overlook the courtyard. The courtyard has some restaurants and huge areas for conventions, etc. We stayed on the 9th floor, front of the hotel, overlooking Sea World. We picked this hotel due to its proximity to Sea World. While you can walk right across the street to Sea World, we had to drive to Discovery Cove and Aquatica where we spent most of our time. Unfortunately, this hotel is not near Disney and there is no shuttle from the hotel. It's about 20 minutes to Downtown Disney from this location. When you first drive up, it's somewhat confusing. The self parking lot has a gate and you can't get in without a key. There are daily charges to park there also. So, you're forced to valet park in front which also costs money. When we walked in, you are greeted immediately and helped. The front desk was awesome and made check-in a breeze. Since we were Marriott Rewards members, we were offered a package of free valet parking, internet and breakfast for a slight additional charge. This was great while we were there, but turned into a checkout nightmare when we were charged for these services instead of being credited. Technically, we weren't supposed to get this package (we were a day early) so there was some disagreement on the charges. Eventually, they credited everything. But if we didn't have this package, there would have been alot of extra charges at check out which totally inflates the actual cost to stay here. The hotel itself is either new or newly renovated. Everything is clean and trendy. The rooms are your typical Mariott: roomy, big beds with lots of pillows, a nice flat screen TV and a desk area to do work or work on your laptop. The Internet is not free in the rooms. When we were there is was $15 a day. Not sure why Fairfield Inns offer free internet access but these upscale Mariotts do not. In the public areas, there is some free Wi-Fi, but it's quite slow. The rooms are excellent. They are clean and updated including the bathroom, all renovate. We didn't hear any noise from guests next to us or above us. The sleep experience was excellent especially when you're walking around all day at the Parks and you're tired. The pool out back is really nice. Alot of seating, a pool bar, towels, etc. There are outdoor fireplaces in use at night. It's a big hotel with alot of space. You can see that they must have conventions and/or business meetings. When we were there, it didn't feel packed with people especially during the day when everyone is out at the Parks. In the Courtyard, there are several restaurants/bars, a Starbucks and a gift store. We ate at the TradeWinds breakfast buffet which was pretty good each day. The service was excellent and the food selection adequate. We ate there because it was part of the package but it is somewhat expensive for breakfast if we had to outright pay for it. But, you could definitely eat a big breakfast here instead of the Parks and save time. We also ate at the Boardwalk Bar the first night because of a late check in. It's your typical sports bar/pub food. The food was fine and has alot of TVs. Overall, this is a really nice, clean updated hotel and a perfect location if your vacation includes Sea World. It was kid friendly and perfect for families. It's very quiet for a good night sleep. The downsides are that it's not close to Disney and no shuttle, there seems to be quite a few additional incidental charges and the Florida taxes that are tacked on every day, you have to pay for parking and the Internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is VERY BIG”
Reviews.Author: IL-Snowbirds
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Sea World you can't beat the location. They have a shuttle but we just walked across the street to enter the park. The beds are VERY comfortable and I slept like a baby! Maybe it was because we stayed at a budget Disney resort and were on a cruise prior to going here, but everything was SO BIG: the room, the beds, the bathroom, the huge center court, the pool and two jacuzzis. I'm probably too energy conscience, but I kept thinking about the cost to cool all of the space in Orlando! The pool by the way is gorgeous. Unfortunately there were a lot of kids that kept splashing in the jacuzzis so it was hard to be romantic with kids diving and jumping in next to you late in the evening. The pool was not heated so I guess the kids were too cold to swim there - still, why were little kids at a pool this late at night? One other comment: There is no free shuttle to/from the airport which I thought was odd for such a gorgeous resort. I had to make my own arangements and pay extra for them.

Reviews.Title: “There are nicer cleaner hotels with alot more amenities for the money”
Reviews.Author: rockingtp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. I was very dissappointed in the front desk staff, they were not a friendly bunch of people. The rooms are very dated. The beds are dilapitated and are in need of replacing. The water smells like sulphur and makes taking a shower unpleasant. The Breakfast buffet is $21 a person and no egg is worth that much especially when there are so many higher quality eating establishments within walking distance. Also they charge $15 for wireless service and $15 dollars for parking, who in this day and age still chrge for wireless and feel like they are doing you a favor. The resort is not downtown so why would they charge for parking? There are 2 Hilton properties adjacent to this one for a better rate and free wireless and parking. I will definitely stay at one of them on my next visit.The high points are the pool and fitness center. They are building a water park and a lot of the parking lot has been blocked.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for Group Seminars with a Wonderful Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: mcolsonvsaok
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance for a work-related seminar. The quality of the service, including the seminar areas and related refreshments and dining was excellent. I was able to take advantage of the Lotus Spa on two separate occasions – Ana Maria was wonderful! The fitness center was well equipped, including complimentary bottled water and ear phones for the cardio machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences and travel too”
Reviews.Author: bmarie114
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference and had a wonderful expereince. I have a gluten food allergy and the staff was above and beyond to assist me. Hotel is large with rooms that have views of the outdoors and views of the indoor common area. I would have preferred a view of the outdoors, but it was not horrible. The pool area was great and so was the staff. I really enjoyed being greeted at check in with champagne! Location was right at Seaworld, but seemed to be a bit of a travel to ther places.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Agoraphobics!”
Reviews.Author: BoeingBoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just completed a week at this hotel as a base for touring the Orlando area. Simply Excellent is the only description available. Everything about the hotel is top of the range, with faultless and friendly service from EVERY member of staff we spoke to. However with glass fronted lifts and a central atrium big enough to house three Jumbo's this is not a place for those with a fear of wide open spaces. My wife coped well but it was the only thing that one needs to be aware of regarding the design of this hotel. The only other thing to recommend is not to eat here unless someone else is paying the bill. The sports bar is more expensive than the main restaurant for the same items and in both you need a sub prime mortgage just to eat a burger! Otherwise this is an excellent hotel with probably one of the best service levels in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: Kclynnd
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby, rooms, and landscaping; that said, I wouldn't stay here again. Free champagne on check-in. The smell of the orchids in entry was amazing. However the $15 self parking, $20+tax+tip valet ridiculous. Good location next to SeaWorld, however no shuttle to Disney, which charges $14/day for parking. No free internet either. Add up all the fees and you're better off paying more for a room with Disney Transport provided.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: helenesq
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about the hotels I stay in. This exceeded my expectations. Perfect location for Seaworld/Aquatica & Discovery Cove. Walk to SeaWorld & offered free valet to Discovery Cove. Taxis were always outside as is trolley for International Drive. Starbucks in lobby. We ate at the poolside cafe & Boardwalk restaurant- great food but extremely limited menu - would've liked to have seen more choices. Rooms were very, very clean & spacious, comfortable beds, clean linens and really nice bathroom with marble top & double sinks. Pool area was spectacular and grounds were immaculate & well maintained. Only complaint was pool temp a bit on the cold side & hottub temp waaaay too hot. Also, would like to see more snack choices by pool area. There is a CVS within walking distance. If you plan a trip to Seaworld/Aquatica & DC, this is THE place to stay. I would not stay here for convenience to Disney. Front desk staff is very helpful. Free champagne at checkin was a nice welcome. A bit offput by a bill at the end of my stay for parking when I did not even have a car with me, but was promptly removed. You really do not need a car to stay here if flying in because of all the convenient transportation options right outside the hotel. Also, I was worried that this hotel might be overrun by screaming kids b/c of convenience to SeaWorld but that was not the case at all. There are many business travelers staying here as it is very close to the Convention Center. Smoke free & pet free is a big plus in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but they charge for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: tawanda18
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place, fairly upscale. The staff is well trained, professional and helpful. The hotel is extremely clean, very safe. It is right across the street from Sea World, you can walk there. The design of the whole hotel is lovely, very beautiful with attention to the details. However, I missed the great beds that I usually find in the Marriott hotels. These are rather hard. And don't stay on the top floor near the elevators, you can hear them going all the time- which wouldn't quite as annoying if this hotel were'nt over $225 a night! Plus they charge: $15 a day for internet, no free breakfast, $3 for bottled water (the water in Orlando is awful tasting-) and another $15 a day to self park your car. The food here is also quite pricey- tho it is very good. All in all, I'd rather stay in one of Marriott's Fairfield Inns. Same great service, better beds, free breakfast, and costs one third as much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: The only downside to this hotel was the $15 daily parking fee. But with M.R. Gold status, we were given a great room, and one adult breakfast is free (could be upgraded to the full buffet for $5), as were breakfasts for our two young kids. So we bought one adult breakfast for $15 and had a great meal for four. There is an adult pool and a kids pool, well-heated, plus a playground. They are creating a new waterpark to open soon. Lobby is gorgeous. On Saturday night, the main restaurant was a bit overwhelmed for some reason, we just missed the rush, but we heard others who arrrived later complain by the pool the next day. Location across from Sea World can't be beat if you are going there. Rare for a fancy hotel, there's a guest laundry; it would be nice if they had more than one washer and dryer. Even though our room overlooked Sea World and a parking lot, there was no noise=good windows! There are a lot of great hotels in the Orlando area. Stay at this one if you can get a good price, esp. if you are a M.R. Gold member and get free internet, room upgrade, and breakfast, for under $150.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a great rate through the Marriott price guarantee program for about $115 a night, so at that price, worth every penny! The lobby is fantastic. The mini-river, the sports bar, tradewinds, all wonderful! The rooms are a bit out of date compared to other Renaissance Hotels I have stayed at, but still a great room. Bathrooms were nice EXCEPT for the showers. The shower heads seem to be extremely low. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Also, the wait staff in the Tradewinds Restaurant were excellent as well! Parking is interesting. Daily parking rates in their self parking lot or valet parking is available. The trick is though if you are coming into town and renting a car, try and get a hybrid. All parking fees, self park or valet, are waived. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Smashed my high demands”
Reviews.Author: Paddington-bears-pal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days booked through a virgin holidays. Had a lovely welcoming greeting at reception. Room was very clean and the bed was cosy. Great location for Sea world and Aquatica. Also if you drive and book through virgin the car park charge is waivered. Less than 10 mins drive for both premium outlet malls. Great swimming pool. Overall very pleased.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Delhielhi, National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: subramanyan_nv
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel room under the group booking scheme to attend the symposium of the Society of Actuaries which was held there. In one word the stay was very pleasant. I have stayed at many hotels over the years in various countries but this place was indeed a feast to the eyes with its luxurious interiors and friendly staff. I’m sure we will still fondly remember the vacation we had there. Being bang opposite the Sea World resort meant that it was very well connected and passing time was never a problem. The friendly service made the stay worthwhile and easy. The only grouse I can think of is the lack of a decent vegetarian spread, even by continental standards. Inclusion of the same would make this place stand out as the best in the city. Thanks for making the stay pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “An OK choice for business travelers but plan on dining elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sss45
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from a limited available convention block. Overall it's pretty decent but not operating yet at the same level as Rosen Center or other hotels more suited to business travelers. Clearly aimed at SeaWorld tourists and families. Still, not bad if you don't mind cabbing elsewhere for dining and activities. Positives: Upgraded room was available as requested for early checkin. Friendly checkin process. One of the largest vanities I've seen in a hotel room of late and nice size shower (took a while for really hot water to come on). Starbucks onsite. Aveda toiletries. Plenty of good quality towels. Comfortable beds and bedding. Negatives: Restaurant menu and quality is sub-par and pricey. No other options within close walking distance. Paid $20 for a very mediocre breakfast buffet aimed at families e.g. Froot Loop dispensers and cheap danish for the kiddies. Huge size carrot and celery sticks looked like fodder for Sasquatch. Atmosphere was dreary - wooden tables with haphazard table settings. For $199/night would have expected something a bit more upscale. From that point forward, made a point to go elsewhere. Also just one bar of soap in the room - can you spare it? Onsite taxi pickup appears to have some sort of arrangement with hotel with inconsistent pricing to the same destination depending on who was assigned by the valet. We heard this from several drivers along the way. Still, I'd recommend this hotel as an option to mid and lower end chains if the preferred convention hotels aren't available, because you can dine elsewhere, it's not that far from the OCCC, and everything else is pretty acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - staff cool tooo”
Reviews.Author: JayneHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazing, great location for Sea World, plentey of Taxis for other parks or other destinations(due to the great concierge team) And the I-Trolly stops right outside. Reception staff where out-standing. As were the bar staff. In fact the whole hotel was Amazing. As i was celebrating my 40th birthday, the hotel staff was very abliging, my girls absolutely loved the hotel and, can't wait to return. We would like to thank, Frances, for a lovely welcoming to the hotel, Ray on the consiarge desk, Britt, Michal, Shimera for being a great credit to the bar/ waitress team they sure know the right way to tend a bar!!!! The pool was pretty good too- some where nice to chill after long days in the parks or the lovely shopping malls!!! - had such a great time there were a few business functions going on - but this did not interfer with us on a wonderful leisure holiday!! would most definatley recommend this great hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGeocat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $100 per night. We stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise out of Port Canaveral, FL. When we booked I really wanted to be closer to Walt Disney World but thought this would be OK to as we were not going to Sea World. As we pulled up the hotel is very nicely lanscaped with beautiful grounds. The valet area that you pull into is very grand with huge curtains hanging down to the ground. As you enter the hotel you see large TV's showing all kinds of underwater fish. Just Beautiful! We checked in with no problems and were given a room on the 8th floor. As we entered the room I could not believe how huge it was! Nice room with 2 beds, nice bathroom with Aveda products and a flat screen TV. Very nice and clean. We went back down to get something to eat. We ate at the bar area and the appitizers were very good. We also ate at Tradewinds and thought that was really good too. The French Onion Soup was delish! There is a Starbucks in the hotel that was good too. Nice gift shop with good selection of clothes and gifts. The hotel is a convention hotel and they had a realtors convention going on during the days we were there. It's a different feeling than being at a Disney hotel but for the price it was really nice. The pool area and grounds are gorgeous. Really nice landscaping, nice fountains, a nice outdoor area with gas fire, gazebo, 2 hot tubs, tennis courts, kids area and baby pool. Nice bar area too. It was cold when we were there but we did go in the hot tub. The first night I forgot to take the do not distubrb sign off the door as we left the hotel so our room was not made up when we came back to the hotel. I called down to the front desk to ask for some toletries and within 5 minutes someone was at our room with more Aveda Products. Very good service. We took a cab from hotel to Animal Kingdom and it was around $25 for 4 people. No problems there. From Downtown Disney took a cab and it was $12 for 4. Again no big deal. Overall we didn't mind having a car. You would have to walk for different restaurants but we just ate at the hotel. Very happy here at the Renaissance. I thought this hotel was very nice and would stay here again for the price. If I had to pay the listing price I would probably stay on Disney but it just depends on what you want to do while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Large Open Hotel, Outside Feel Inside, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel located across the parking lot from sea world. Not many restaurants within walking distance but a great location to have a convention. Food at bar was good, and the breakfast buffet was great, most items made to order. Room was clean turn down service nightly. Room had updated T.V. and was large, sofa and chair along with work station. Outside they have fire pit was nice to sit around at night and enjoy. Clean pool area and staff always walking around making sure its clean at all time. Very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “My perfect holiday hotel.........time and time again”
Reviews.Author: boostravel
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband have stayed here many times over the past few years and as soon as the time comes to look at where we want to go on holiday the Renaissance is always first on our list, cant wait to get back this year. I wanted to let people know about the location because parking at the hotels and parks is expensive so we never bother to have a car... you really dont need it here, the hotel offers free transport to all Disney locations, the trolley bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you all the way up I-Drive and seaworld is across the road... you can even get free transport from here to Bush Gardens. On the odd occassion you need a taxi its still works out cheaper than having a car ... just thought this might be useful info for those considering not taking the car option...we have never had a problem with it. The Hotel is perfect in every way, great staff, pool, rooms, food i just cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service”
Reviews.Author: robwvu
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! The staff was one of the best, especially given the rate. Location was perfect - across the street from the Sea World parking lot. As you can read from the other reviews, they do charge $15 per day for parking, but you won't need to pay for Sea World parking while staying. We did not get the suite, the standard room was slightly larger than you would expect. Not a lot of frills in the room. They did have flat screen TV's, coffee makers, hair dryers, fridge, safe, etc. There was also a Starbucks on site. The food was good, but a little pricey. There was an additional fee for Wi-Fi. The fitness center was great. The hot tub was large. Everything was exceptionally clean. I would highly recommend the Renaissance if you are going to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler00
Reviews.Content: The staff is super friendly - from valet, front desk, servers in the restaurant to housekeeping. We felt at home. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the Holidays and the open atrium was inviting and contemporary in feel. The food was good and more than plentiful. Beds were very comfortable - one of the best night sleeps I have had away from home.

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 teens) stayed at the Sea World Marriott Renaissance Orlando over Thanksgiving weekend. I'm not sure why, but they were having a special for $74/night (AAA) we got a double-queen room with a balcony overlooking the atrium area. It was just super!!!! The room was spacious - especially since we usually stay at the Disney value resorts where things are so small and cramped. The room had a lot of space and the bathroom was enormous, with two sinks. The balcony was small but we moved our chairs out there and it was a wonderful view. We listened to the waterfall all night (if you leave your door ajar). Hotel grounds, lobby, atrium area and hallways and rooms are very clean. No issues with our housekeeping service. Even the elevators were fast. I had no complaints about this place at all except ..... they charge $15/day for self parking. I don't like that. Why don't they just shove it into the room rate so we don't know about it. I can see why Disney charges you to park - they have people manning the parking lots all day and trams are running. The Renaissance has a self-serve ticket machine and nobody around. Some people have mentioned their parking was free but I don't know how. I'm a Marriott member and it still wasn't free. Anyway, this is a fab resort with a great location for Sea World. Disney hotels are better location for Disney parks but then again they are so small and cramped. I highly recommend this place. And yes, you can actually walk right across the street and over to Sea World. The pool was very nice, even though we were too busy to swim. We didn't use any of the restaurants, spa or fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentCD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Orlando for 2 nights and it's location to Sea World and Disney World was wonderful. It is right across the street from Sea World and a very short drive away from Disney World. The hotel itself was a 5 + star hotel, the rooms are very spacious (far more spacious than many other 5 star hotels I have stayed in), modern and the double sinks in the bathroom were a heaven sent! The room also had a lovely balcony which you can see Sea World from. The facilities and amenities were fantastic as well, the lobby is beautiful and there is a great waterfall/water fountain in the centre of the lobby. The restaurants were great, there is a Starbucks, a full service restaurant for breakfast lunch and dinner (beautiful breakfast buffet!) a modern sushi bar and a modern bar and grill. The pool area was relaxing and very large and there is a great fire pit that you can relax around and have a drink. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travelers; families, couples and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: basvince
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel during our roundtrip through florida. We started and ended in this wonderfull hotel. First the friendly staff who were always very helpfull. Welcome with champagne is always nice! Also the roomrequests were no problem at all. The second time we even had a better room with balcony! All the rooms are very spacious and clean. Excellent beds with nice fluffy pillows. clean and spacious bathroom. The rest of the property is very nice. Nice swimming pool with 2 good size hot tubs. Very good cocktail bar. Also location was very good. Just across seaworld and downtown disney and international drive was a 10 min drive. I ride trolley stop in front of the door of the hotel. Defenitely a recomendation worth!

Reviews.Title: “Big, business oriented and dated with fab pool... A little basic for a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Greenie_Christina
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay after a conference for a few days here, and decided to switch hotels. While my stay was pleasant and I had nothing to complain about, I felt the hotel was over-rated and really geared to the business traveler. Check in was speedy and efficient- I was even offered a glass of champagne while I checked in. This is a large hotel, and rooms can feel remote from the elevators. I felt bad for those who overlooked the interior/lobby vs seeing the lovely pool or at least the out of doors. The room furnishings are pleasant, sheets/beds comfy and staff accommodating. Well appointed bathrooms with Aveda toiletries a plus. Very pleasant. The lobby is odd and poorly used; some parts are jammed with restaurant activity, some parts have random umbrella-shaped lamps and no seating. Bizarre. One accesses the pools from the main lobby level, which I'm not a fan of... is awkward to run into fellow conference attendees soaking wet in a suit and cover up! Spa has pretty high prices, but seems pretty well appointed- not a full blown destination-style spa, though. Decided to pass on my usual stop for a spa treat. Overall a fine business hotel experience, but not a "luxury" experience for vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest hotels i've been to”
Reviews.Author: T0pman
Reviews.Content: Me and my family checked in on the 16th oct 2010. 4 Adults, 1 teenager and 1 toddler. First impressions was WOW and so much facilities to use. The hotel was clean, rooms were big a service with a smile. The only downer was the conferences. These went on for the whole 2 weeks and the hotel got really busy. Starbucks is a real bonus as well : )

Reviews.Title: “Bad sushi!!”
Reviews.Author: Johngravely
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a business conference (CRMUG) and ate sushi at the bar in the lobby/atrium. I spent the whole next day in my room with food poisoning. You would hope a hotel like this would not let their sushi get too old but I can tell you they definitely did. Very uncool.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but watch out for upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy0505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for a business trip of mine. It is a good hotel, but watch out for any "upgrades". When we checked in we were offered an upgrade to a room with a "pool view". What a rip off. We literally had to smoosh the side of our face on the window to see the "pool view" and it was a real pain to try and get the room changed after that. Other than the false upgrade, it has a great work out room, a wonderful pool and the valet guys were awesome. Our meetings were well taken care of too. They checked on us frequently, made sure the room temp was comfortable, the food was really good and they were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant but the extras are VERY pricey. Just sleep there!”
Reviews.Author: erniesands
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beaten for Seaworld. Literally just 5 mins walk across the car park. Hotel is massive, with a really stylish internal courtyard design, indoor waterfall, glass elevators, the works. Ask for a room with an indoor balacony unless you are a sun worshipper. The food in the restaurant was excellent and so was the service. Prices here are not too bad. However, avoid room service. We paid $67 plus tip for a basic breakfast for two. It was a bit cold, not cooked brilliantly and was just down right expensive. Other than that, the best you will get at Seaworld. The car park is a rip-off as well at $15.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah3000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. South of I-Drive, on two i-trolley stops and with a public transport connection for Magic Kingdom. You can definitely stay here without a car if you just want to do the parks. $17 for 2 weeks continuous i-trolley trips and $4 rtn for Magic Kingdom. Seaworld, Aquatica and Discovery Cove all walkable. Local CVS store, walkable. Hotel restaurant OK, but I think overpriced for what you get. Much easier to take a quick 5 minute trolley trip to one of the chains - McDs, Dennys, i-hop, Red Lobster. Or further north on I-Drive for every other kind of food. i-trolley also takes you to both of the main Outlet Malls. Check out the i-trolley map online to get your bearings. Rooms large, well maintained and clean. Pool fab, pool bar, towels and lots of sun loungers. No nightlife here and the i-trolleys stop at 10.30 so you would have to get a cab back from elsewhere but if you've been on your feet all day walking around with your Mickey ears on this won't be a problem! If this is your first stay in Orlando (and you are intending to do the parks) I would probably recommend one of the Disney hotels, just because their internal public transport is fantastic, but this is a great base if you've done all that before and you only want to do a couple of days at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool, great fun”
Reviews.Author: diane31957
Reviews.Content: Spent five days here. It was easy being right across the street from Sea World. We could just walk across the parking lot. Found fast food restaurants down the street by Aquatica for less expensive opions for the kids. Rooms were clean. Beds comfortable. The pool was enjoyable with activities for the kids on the weekends. It was also nice having a outside place by the pool to eat and drink and still watch the kids swim. Plan on visiting in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Orlando at Seaworld - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: atslk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a conference. Everything about the hotel was great. Accomodations were very nice, the location is literally walking distance from Seaworld, the staff was very accomodating and the food was great. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Older 4 Star Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SaintAugTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Good: The pool is beautiful with free cabanas The atrium is beautiful Free Parking Good location near I-Drive and I-4 Superior Front Desk Staff Ping Pong and Foosball by the pool The Bad: The hotel is older and the rooms are starting to show it. Popcorn ceilings etc... The Beds are not on par with other 4star hotels in the area. Poolside drink service is sporadic at best. Overall we liked the hotel but we only paid around $70 a night on a popular bid based website. I would have been very disappointed if we had paid the normal retail rate.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel but can't walk to shops or restaurants”
Reviews.Author: flomale
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here three nights and enjoyed the spacious room with two sinks, fridge, safe, cleanliness, and comfy bed. Breakfast buffet expensive at $20 for hot and $15 for cold. Cannot walk to shops or restaurants but local trolly for $1.25 or .25 cents for seniors is very convenient being just outside the hotel. There is a beautiful pool but we had no time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to SeaWorld, standard but nice conference-type hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricY_68
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando specifically to go to SeaWorld, and the best thing about this hotel was the proximity to SeaWorld. You can walk across the street and parking lot, and in 5 minutes (10 minutes with the slower young 'uns) be at the front entrance. Saves you the daily parking fee (but beware, as with many hotels here, there is a daily parking fee, we splurged the $18/day for valet). The pool was very nice, eating by the pool was convenient and quite good. The Hilton down the road has a better pool area for kids (big water slide and lazy river), but this was fine for straight-up swimming/splashing. Staff were very friendly. SeaWorld didn't have fireworks during the off season, but if you go during the summer try to ask for a higher floor room facing SeaWorld so you can watch from there.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: glynandsiobhan
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - the service is amazing ,you never have to wait for someone to help you , staff are always very friendly and go out of their way to assist. The valet drove us over to Discovery Cove and picked us up at the end of the day. We are experienced travelers and this is one of the best - although a large hotel it has a very 'boutique feel' and service

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodickson
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 2-week holiday at the Renaissance with my partner, and I have to say, it's quite possibly the best hotel I've ever stayed at (and I've stayed at some amazing hotels) and I feel so privileged to have stayed here for 2 weeks. First-off, the location - just perfect. We couldn't have asked for a better located hotel. Just off the I-4 and 528, it's really easy to get to from airports/disney/universal, as well as being just off I-Drive. If you want to be on I-Drive, it's maybe not ideal, and it's certainly best for those with a car, but if you're happy to drive the 5 minutes to Pointe Orlando for dinner, it's brilliant, away from the hustle of I-Drive. In addition, it's easy walking distance to SeaWorld, and the concierge are happy to drive you to Aquatica and SeaWorld for free (in a Cadillac Escalade too, which feels very classy!). Second, the quality of the rooms - we were in a King Room, and it was HUGE! The room was beautiful, the bed huge, with a desk, sofa and armchair, big HD flat-screen, walk-in wardrobe, fridge, safe. We had a pool view, sunset view and no balcony, which we didn't mind at all. In fact, as we had a Yellowjacket nest right outside our window we were glad, although we loved watching our little wasps working away each morning! Third, the hotel in general - the pool was beautiful, with cosy cabanas, 2 hot tubs, and a pool bar. We enjoyed evening swims, so we could've done with the pool being a couple of degrees warmer, but we loved the funoodles and snorkels that were available. The atrium area is just breathtaking. We spent a bit of time in the Boardwalk bar - the food there is brilliant, as are the cocktails. Try the Renaissance Sunrise and the Rum Runner! Reception staff were very happy to help with any queries we had, and gave us directions leaflets, restaurant recommendations and change for the arcade, among other things! We got a glass of champagne at reception, and when I was given a false charge at the end of the trip, the staff was more than happy to take the charge off, with no quibbles. When I enquired about a coach booking I'd made to Busch Gardens, and the time we had to be at the bus stop, the staff went above and beyond the call of duty, calling to make sure we were booked in. The fitness centre is also brilliant, and I enjoyed spending a couple of quiet mornings there. We went to Tradewinds one morning for breakfast, and the buffet was fantastic; I was very impressed by the quality and number of items on offer. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the price - $20 for breakfast is just too steep. Parking is free, which is great, as is WiFi in the lobby - don't get internet in your room, go downstairs! In addition, the shop is great, and has everything we needed during our time there. The laundry facilities were also top-notch, and it's brilliant having clean clothes halfway through your holiday. My only complaint about the Renaissance was the lack of an appropriately-priced breakfast or WiFi - at what is quite an expensive hotel, I believe such facilities should be increased. In addition, I didn't appreciate what was quite a pushy timeshare salesperson who had a desk in the atrium - while I appreciate that Marriott has a timeshare club and they need to promote that, I found the salesperson unnecessarily pushy, to the point that we avoided using the door near the salesperson's desk for the majority of our holiday. To conclude, the Renaissance is an absolutely fantastic hotel, and if you're looking for a really special holiday in Orlando, I would recommend this hotel over any other.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, great location, best hotel in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Deni48
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. The surroundings inside were fantastic with giant fish tanks etc and rooms all built around the central area. Here is a summary of my thoughts on the hotel: 1. Great location for Sea World (you can walk over from the hotel) and you can also catch a free shuttle bus from Sea World to Aquatica. 2. A lot of conferences were going on in the hotel but this wasn’t a problem at all 3. There was a fridge in the room 4. Free parking onsite 5. There were PCs set up in hotel for checking in online with Virgin 6. The room was clean and a nice size 7. The swimming pool was good and never too busy 8. There are rooms facing inside the hotel and those facing outside. We had a room facing outside and noise wasn’t a problem so if I went back I would request a room facing the outside again. 10. Staff were really friendly and helpful This was a higher class of hotel than those I saw on International Drive. If you don't need to walk out straight onto International Drive then I would definitely go with this hotel! Best place we ate at was Flippers Pizzeria. The staff and pizzas were fantastic. There are 2 Flippers near to Sea World, a really small one which is more of a take out place and a nice restaurant one where it is better if you are eating out. I also recommend Discovery Cove. It is really expensive but it was the best day of the whole holiday and a once in a lifetime experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service and they had a gym!”
Reviews.Author: Alison H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at this hotel (Monday 30th August - through to Monday 13th September 2010). Service was excellent, lovely marble features everywhere and our room had its own personal balcony looking out at the back of the hotel and from which you could see the pool. I think we were really luck to have this room and if you are going to stop you may want to try and specifically request this type of room - we had lots of sun in the later afternoon and evening and I could just bask in it! Please note that lots of the rooms have balconies but they look into the inside of the hotel so please be specific. The bathroom had his and her basins, complementary soaps and shower products, great big lcd tv, a sofa, few easy chairs, tables, fridge, coffee maker and room safe for which there was no additional charge. The pool outside was bliss with plenty of sun loungers and two jacuzzis. We only went in the jacuzzi on our last day and it was really hot - perhaps too hot for some - I had to work my way into it. Gym was fantastic and I took full use of this - personal tv screens on most of the equipment and so much better than the gym at home that I currently use. Benefit of staying here was that you could walk to both Seaworld - really just opposite the hotel and round the corner to Aquatica - about a 7 minute walk, thus saving on having to pay between $12 - $15 dollars for the priviledge of parking your car there. Also parking at the hotel for residents was free. Downside for me (as I was not the one that was driving) was there you are not really within walking distance of any shops or restaurants - we usually stop somewhere on international drive so I am more used to just going out of the hotel and going to a restaurant or the shops and you cannot do that there. There is an i-trolley stop just outside the hotel and we did use this once but they don't run late and getting back to the hotel from Universal Studios was a horrendous $25 - the taxi that we had was driven by someone with no skills whatsoever, who drove like a madman and it was a sheer relief to just get back to our accommodation in one piece (although feeling quite sick). The staff were wonderful - very helpful and a late checkout for us was not a problem for them and my partner said he would definately like to go there again. I would also definately return but would make sure that I am listed to drive as well next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: rtpac
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night at the Renaissance for an "in-town" getaway to celebrate our daughter's sixth birthday. It was fantastic! We pulled up and were immediately greeted and offered bag assistance and parking. Walking into the lobby is like walking into a complete oasis. It is open, peaceful and has many small, quiet spaces to sit and relax. There is a waterfall in the lobby - very relaxing. We had a standard king room up on the 8th floor. It was HUGE. One of the largest hotel rooms that I've stayed in. High ceilings, large pullout couch, seating area, desk, etc. More than enough room for all of us to spread out. We had dinner in the Tradewinds restaurant. The food was fantastic and top notch service. The seating area extends into the relaxing lobby which made it even better as the atmosphere in the evening there is even more relaxing. We also spent some time out at the pool. This area was probably the most amazing and unexpected. There are landscaped garden areas, many small seating areas, one with fire pit. There are huge checker and chess games (the chess pieces were as big as my child!) and ping pong and foosball games on the lanai. The main pool is huge and clean. There is also a children's pool, 2 hot tubs and a playground. All are surrounded by lush landscaping, comfy, cushioned lougers and some cabana-like seating that I'd never seen before. You really feel like you are at a much higher-end resort. We didn't use the pool bar, but it appeared very convenient and also in a beautiful setting. We walked over to SeaWorld twice during our stay and both times were given cold water as we departed and more cold water as we returned. The bellman would actually come walking toward us with the water as we would be coming in across the parking lot. He anticipated our needs - a major gold star in my book. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I actually thought I walked into the wrong hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jazzsmin
Reviews.Content: On my drive down to south florida from Tally I made an impulse stop in Orlando to go to Disney World. I booked online quickly at the Renaissance and paid $97 with tax. I got a discount for being a florida resident. I checked in at 1am after a full day at the park, needless to say I was exhausted. My mom and I really thought we had walked into the wrong hotel because it was BEAUTIFUL and I thought no way for $97 a night. Well it was my hotel, and when I checked in to my room I expected something small, boy was I wrong, huge double beds room with the most beautiful bathroom. I was so happy. Everything was very clean and so inviting, after a day at the park it was god sent. I wasn't going to leave a review but I figured I should because they deserve it. I had the buffet breakfast downstairs, $45 with tip for 2 and it was worth every penny... it was the best I have had in a long time. It was delicious and just an amazing way to start your morning. I highlly recommend this hotel its A+ all the way. Parking is $15 a day, but mine was waived because I am a marriott member. And finally the pool is very very nice. They even have a small arcade for the kids. I loved it here so much that I think this will be my hotel when I visit orlando for good. I will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bengalpink
Reviews.Content: I loved it, lots of things to do, the childrens pool is great and the park keeps the kids busy, I wouldn't eat in the restaurant inside the hotel, but wouldn't mark it down for it as you can nip along the road and there are loads of restaurants.the rooms were clean and the whole hotel was relaxing, the breakfasts were gorgeous but expensive compared to the cheap buffets on I drive. I can't wait to go again! also the staff were great, very pleasant and were great with my twin 4 year old girls. And a bonus is you can walk into sea world..just across the road! Recommended to everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Third year in a row that we have had a great holiday thanks to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PAND1961
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we stayed at this hotel because it is perfect for the parks and is always very welcoming. I cannot fault the hotel or the staff or the facilities. Hopefully we will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience- pool is great!”
Reviews.Author: Katf4
Reviews.Content: We were looking to spend a weekend at the pool with (adult) family and found a great rate at this hotel. We weren't going to theme parks or shopping, but it would be a good location for that as it's located on Sea World property near the other attractions/shopping. The hotel is very nice inside- recently redone with lots of couches, a full-size starbucks, and several restaurants. The pool is great- very large with a nice restaurant area and poolside waiters/waitresses and two hot tubs. The pool had free funoodles and several free cabana/loungers which was a nice touch. The staff periodically handed out free watermelon which was also a nice touch. There were games with prizes like Starbucks cards on Saturday (for kids and adults). We ordered fries and chips and salsa for about $15 total and we were impressed with the large amount of good food for the money. The staff was overall very nice and accomodating. We had breakfast at restaurant (tradewinds?) and it was very good. They gave us free smoothies-another nice touch! We really liked our waiter. The room was spacious, updated and very comfortable- Aveda products in the bathroom. I don't usually write hotel reviews, but we were really impressed with this hotel especially for the price. We really had a nice weekend getaway. One small negative- the parking was a little expensive, though was free/validated if you ate at one of the restaurants or the pool. There were also a lot of children at the hotel- not a negative for us, but might bother some.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT WE EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: BUNNYRANCH
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked two nights for my birthday, upon arrival the girl at the front desk was very arrogant, spoiling his mood for the rest of the night. After we settled in, we visited the jacuzzi that was suppose to be hot but it was barely warm. Disappointed we went back to the room, the bed was very comfortable but we sweated all night because the air conditioner did not get cold. Would rather stay at the Hilton .l.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: shaytread
Reviews.Content: We checked into this resort on a Tuesday and has the most relaxing time. The staff was friendly and helpful with everything we requested. When you check in they give you a "passport" for their restaurants and shops. When you present your passport that particular restaurant or shop stamps it and gives you a free gift. At the sushi restaurant, they gave us 2 beautiful pieces of sashmi and at the sports bar, they gave us 2 signature shots. The room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. We hope to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great property but not so good service”
Reviews.Author: Buzzman88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice property at the heart of Sea World Orlando. If you plan to visit Sea World Orlando, naturally this is one of the nicer places to stay at. We stayed there at around July 4 but came out unimpressed. The property is huge, parking is painless, the swimming pool is a bit crowded, but nice, and the lobby is nicely decorated/built. However, the service, for a hotel with this class, is sub par. The front desk was polite, but cold, no smile whatsoever from both of the people who worked there that day. The hotel "navigator" (concierge) was exactly the same, polite, but cold. Coming back to the hotel after Sea World did its big fireworks display can be VERY tricky. Traffic was a mess and they closed one of the street near the property, so I had to drive around it. My big gripe was the "lost and found" department, which I think should be called "lost and lost". When we were there, we left $200 worth of electronics (mostly video games for kids) at the room. On the next day, once we realized what happened, we immediately called the hotel and was transferred to the lost and found department. On the first call, we only got a voicemail asking to leave a message with a phone number to call, and we did. We never got a call. So one day we called again, and was transferred again to a voicemail, and we did leave another mesage, but again, no call back. The third time, we asked to talk to a real person, so front desk finally did transfer me to a real person. Unfortunately, the person said nothing was ever found in the room we stayed in, so we were very disappointed. I expected a bit more (in terms of service) from a hotel with this class, but they came short. There are many hotels in Orlando, and I certainly cannot recommend this hotel to most people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: JZ1984
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this beautiful hotel for our honeymoon. We stayed on the 9th floor and had a huge balcony. The bed was massive but really comfortable and surprised that people thought the bed was hard, what planet are they on? Nice bathroom twin sinks and a shower and bath. The staff are really friendly and helpful too, especially rey, who works in the concierge part. The breakfast was about $20 pp and yeah it might be a bit expensive, but this is a 4 star hotel and it is totally worth it, lots of choice and keep refilling your juice and coffee. This hotel can be suitable for anybody, it isnt just for conferences or just for families, it can do both there was a few conferences at the hotel, but it did not bother me one little bit. If you're a perfectionist and critise about everything this hotel isnt for you, but if you're laid back like me, it's definately you and it was the best holiday i've had and not because it was my honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisey”
Reviews.Author: yoyomur
Reviews.Content: very nice impressive hotel but noisey even the slightest sound echos around the hotel loads of conferances with people drinking into the early hours these people wernt being noisey but there voices just echoed around the hotel then the birds in the cage in the reception start at 4 am transfer service is brill food not great nice views over seaworld but just 2 noisey for me

Reviews.Title: “Strongly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: julie11096
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks at this massive hotel. I read the reviews about conferences taking part and there were many during our stay even dinner dances and I must say you never heard a thing unless you were nosy! Yes there were extra people going about but the size of the hotel did not make it busy, it had a lovely calmness with piped music throughout. The rooms are huge, cleaned daily with toiletries replenished daily too(soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion). You also have a coffee perculator with coffee, sugar and milk supplied daily as well as a safe and fridge. Breakfast buffet $20 quite pricey but Starbucks great. Restaurant , Sushi Bar and Pool Bar all serve lovely food. You DO NOT need a car if staying here. I-Ride directly outside hotel as is the Lynx Bus Stop. You get Lynx no 50 and it takes you directly to Downtown Disney then Disney Transportation centre for $2 and the same no 50 back both at punctual 30 minute apart and runs until after midnight. Go to golynx website for bus timetable. You can buy a weekly pass for both at hotel. The free transportation from hotel has set times you have to pick and if you want to change your homecoming time you have to phone 2 hours before (nuisance in middle of Disney)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sshuttle
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a new lobby which is beautiful. It is directly across from Sea World and is within easy walking distance. You must have a rental car if you are planning on visiting Disney and Universal from this hotel. It is an easy drive to both areas, however, not easy enough for coming back and forth during the afternoon for a break. Our room was spacious, especially the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was very good, but expensive. The pool was very nice and the grounds beautiful but no slide. There was ping pong tables, tennis, fooze ball, and a small arcade. The staff was very friendly, however, make sure you know your package if you book one. They had a great one which included champagne at check in, 12 and under eat free with adult, free movie, free parking, etc. I had to remind her about my champagne and then they charged me for the movie so I had to stop by the front desk and have it fixed. No problem, just be aware. If your goal is Sea World and you don't plan on going back and forth to Disney during the day, this is a great choice, otherwise stay on Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: gypsili
Reviews.Content: What a great place this is! I have to say the staff was by far one of the friendliest we've experienced. The hotel is clean, trendy, the food is good, the pool is big, the grounds are beautiful....and it's directly across from Sea World. The trolley stops right out front, which is very convenient to get to I4 stops. The front desk and logistics staff desk personnel are so nice and helpful! The room we stayed in had 2 double beds and was enormous. Plenty of space. The lobby also has a nice gift shop and a Starbucks if you wanted something to grab and go. We were able to get from the hotel to anywhere we wanted to go in a matter of minutes, yet we were off the main drag. Quiet and relaxing. I didn't make it to the fitness center or the spa, but both seemed top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: kylers1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two weeks holiday. The location is excellent, directly opposite Seaworld and round the corner from Aquatica. If you have a car it is central to everywhere. The hotel is well kept and very clean, as are the rooms. The downside when we stayed was the arrival of hundreds of dancers for some stupid competition who took over the pool area so we went to Aquatica every day until they left the hotel, but beware as staff told us that they come at this time every year! Another negative thing is that the walls in the rooms are paper thin so if you get a noisy person/family next to you like we did, it gets irritating after a while. Overall we had an enjoyable time but as with most hotels it is expensive, so eat and drink out if you can or get your beer from Walmart as there is a fridge in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay during Fourth of July Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ATLGirl25
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for business but this trip was for leisure. We went to Orlando to celebrate my husband's birthday and they treated us so nicely. We stayed at this hotel during the Fourth of July Holiday and I have to say , I really like this hotel!!! First, Due to an early flight we arrived around 12 noon. Our Room was ready so we were able to check in early. Second, I told them that we were celebrating a birthday and they sent a nice package with champange and fruit basket. Third, This hotel is walking distance from SeaWorld so you dont have all the hassle with parking and fees. Cant beat that. Also, they have a nice pool area, table tennis, bars, and plenty of areas to lounge and relax. What more could ask for? The rates are usually pretty good too! The only cons I could write are as follows: (1) The Marriott International Vacation Club tried to sell us one of those time share thingys (2) The AC did not get a cold as we would of liked. We didnt bother to complain because we were gone most of the time (3) The parking fee is $15 which does suck. 4) Save your money on the spa. It's a bit overpriced and I have been way better. Overall, I still like this hotel and I would definitely stay there again. It wasnt too crowed, nice pool, bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly a hidden gem for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mccafamily
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Sea World has a great location for just about all of the theme parks in the Orlando area. It has the largest standard rooms in Florida. While the place does have some age on it, overall it is well-kept and up to date. The pool area is not exquisite, but it is nice, and great for kids. We've never experienced a crowd at this hotel either, and it easily handles groups without them overrunning the place. With the indoor waterfalls, fish scenery, etc., our daughter thinks this place is so cool. The only fault I could find is the beds are rather hard. The pricing for parking ($15), Internet ($14), and room service is irritating...the place would be a real value without that. Sorry, I just don't see how it costs the hotel $15/day for my car to occupy an 8ft x 12ft slab of asphalt. But oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Alicialee45
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful! We arrived much earlier than anticipated and our room was not ready, but they let us check all our information at the front desk and gave us an exact time that we could come pick up our keys. They offered us a complimentary glass of champagne after that and told us we could enjoy the pool while we wait for our room. We did not eat at either of the hotel restaurants, but we did order a drink out by the pool and at their sushi bar. Our waitress at the sushi bar was very rude and never came back to ask us if we wanted another drink and the prices were outrageous!!! If you stay here, make sure you ask the concierge for specials around the area. They were very helpful and gave us some coupons to use for dinner and such. The pool was very crowded with children during the day, but one night when we came back from Universal Studios, we went to relax by the pool and we were the ONLY ones there. It was nice. The biggest complaint I have is that you have to pay for parking, and when we came back from Universal one of the nights, we could not find a parking spot! We complained to the front desk and they said that the only thing they could do for us is valet parking, and told us we would have to pay extra. One suggestion would be if you stay at this hotel, request a room with a balcony facing sea world. The view of the fireworks is absolutely amazing at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: juiletoscarHampshire
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from this lovely hotel. We had a queen twin room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool. Room was huge with nice size tele and fridge. The beds were so comfy and just what is needed after long days at the parks. It was really hot whilst we were there so the air con was great. This is a big confrenece hotel but made the pool nice and quite during the day which was fantastic for us. We had a package deal with virgin so transport to parks was free, just had to book with the concierge two hours before you needed to go. Also hotel has the trolley and lynx bus stop right outside which is great for getting up i-drive or to downtown disney.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel when visiting Sea World/Aquatica”
Reviews.Author: fishheadflorida
Reviews.Content: Checked in Sat pm and immediately WALKED to Sea World. Saved the parking fee and enjoyed the 10 minute walk with the teenagers. Sea World was packed and HOT! Purchased the one day Sea World, one day Aquatica pass. Aquatica on Sunday was more fun than Sea World. Aquatica filled up in the afternoon, then the fun dwindle down. Go early to the parks. The meals and the drinks at the parks were the least fun. Long lines, slow service, and crowded space. Local knowledge will help. We have been many times to Sea World, but had forgotten how crowded summer, peak season is. Renaissance was not crowded. Big pool, spa, nice tennis courts, played basketball with my teenager at 9 pm with the Sea World fireworks going off. Good service and food at the pool. Starbucks in the lobby was breakfast. Used our Marriot points for our two rooms. 10 or 20 years ago the 10th floor was a conciere floor. They chopped it. It was great. $15 self parking fee was new, and was the only bummer at the hotel. Took the teenagers to UCF for there campus visit on Monday. UCF or FSU?

Reviews.Title: “wow- excellent hotel over the road from sea world”
Reviews.Author: Cakes78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in may and it was brilliant as it was just over the road from Sea world meaning i could be at the gates in 10 mins also handy for getting the buses to Busch Gardens and Aquatica. The rooms where great with 2 king sizes beds plus a sitting down area. In the bathroom there was 2 sinks and a big shower. I asked for a view of sea world and its great to see it at night with all the lights on it. The pool area was big and with plenty of sun chairs plus free towels. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great workout facility, good food, clean, recycles but...”
Reviews.Author: jseitz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean which is always a plus for me. The staff were friendly everywhere I went- giving a pleasent smile and greeting. The workout facility is the best one I have seen at a hotel! As a person whom works out I was happy to have a safe and clean environment with a variety of working machines and free weights. Plus clean headphones were available for free to use on the machines-excellent. Free apples- a nice touch. The hotel is promoted as green. I found a couple of black recycle bins but I had to ask a member of the staff what I could put inside. Typically blue is the color associated with recycling. There was no signage, even in the rom, that the hotel recycles. I often saw recyclable items put into the trash can by hotel guests. I was at the hotel for business. I hope the recyclable items left in the meeting rooms were recycled. In the bathroom was a sign that to keep your towels hang them up and if you want new ones place on the floor. I hung my towels but when I came back to the room they were both folded and arranged with the other towels. I purposefully moved the towels I wasn't going to use out of the way. I wonder if they gave me new towels anyway. It seems a shame to have to wash all the towels when I only used two. I do understand hygeine and clean items for the next person. The room itself was beautiful but chilly. It took a while for me to get the room a comfortable temperature. I had to turn the air condtioner and fan off. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. I agree with others that the $15 parking fee for a staying guest is high. There were at least two other organizations having events at the same time but the hotel parking lots had plenty of room. I suppose taxes plays a role in the high fee but ontop of everything else one has to pay for includng food it is costly. All the food I ate during the conference I was at was delicious as was the meal I had at thier onsite restaurant Tradewinds. I stayed for an event this week for two nights and three days. Overall I was pleased. Jenny Seitz Alachua County

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel with a Mediocre Spa”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: We checked in in for the couples spa package that included $25 dinner credit, breakfast, and couples massage. The bill came and breakfast and dinner were not credited, once I pointed this out it was corrected. The spa services were good for the massage and facial but stay away from waxing and mani/pedi services, they were substandard and very expensive. I have to wait for my eyebrows to grow out and get them reshapped very bad waxing job. The grouper in the restarant was very good as well as the breakfast buffet, lots of choices on the buffet. Do not pay for the upgrade for the Seaworld fireworks you get one free if it is available when you check in just ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN ORLANDO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suziminahan
Reviews.Content: Ok so I travel a lot, as I am in field sales, ad I have stayed in just about every brand, in various cities from coast, to coast. This hotel is owned by Marriott, and Marriott, should be proud to call it a mariott, I have stayed in the Gaylord Palms, Orlando, The Mariott, World, Center, the Mariott, Downtown Disney, the majority of the Disney Hotels and the Hilton, across the street from this Hotel, and this is by far the best one in Orlando. Also I recently came back from the JW Marriott in Buckhead Atlanta an if you have never been there, it is very ritzy and honeslty I thought this was a much better experience. The food, and amenities were excellent, and well priced. Also we took my little girl for her birth day, and the staff truly went out of their way to treat her special! Truly the extra mile, also in relation to the Sea world park, it is across the parking lot, and as long it is not gonna rain it is less then a 5 minute walk to the front gate! Excellent, stay, room, pricing, staff, cannot say enough good, felt so good about it, I actually called the hotel management to let them know I had recently stayed in Buckhead, Atlanta, and this was a better experience! Loved it, Stay there you won't regret it! From Oscar at the front desk, the bartenders at Mist, the waiter at the sports bar restaurant down stairs, to the waitress in the Tradewinds restaurant! I felt like I was in a Ritz, where they know you, and help you with everything!

Reviews.Title: “For Business or pleasure, this is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: JulieGee
Reviews.Content: My husband attends an annual conference at the Renaissance in Orlando - our daughter and I usually try to tag along for it and we extend our stay by a few days and make it our early Christmas present to eachother. We have done it two years in a row now and plan to do it again next year. The staff is accomodating and friendly - gotta love the glass of champagne offered at check in! The hotel is beautiful, clean, stylish... the pool is amazing, warm and well maintained, the pool side food service pricey but well worth it (large portions, tasty and awesome service) there are 2 hot tubs, one splash pool for the little ones, 2 tennis courts, a playground, a bocci ball area, a basketball area, outdoor ping pong and billiards tables, a small arcade inside and a gift shop. There is also a spa but I have not yet have had the opportunity to try it... The rooms are roomy, beautiful and comfortable. Amazing beds and quality bedding! If you are a Seaworld fan, you can't beat the location! Walked to Seaworld (right across the street), also walked to Aquatica (well worth it, by the way!) and Discovery Cove is also only a short walk away. If you are headed to other parks, there is a shuttle bus and the concierge is quite helpful in giving directions if you happen to miss it (like we did!!!) The first year we went, we stayed there for the duration of the conference. Being big Disney fans, we chose to move to a Disney hotel afterwards and chose the Port Orleans, French Quarter. BIG MISTAKE! After the Renaissance, the P.O. felt like a cheap, outdated, Ramada... we stayed one miserable night and went back to Renaissance!!! I HIGHLY recommend it: it's classy, clean and good value.... GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “A proper hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Arrondor
Reviews.Content: So many Orlando hotels are motel style it is nice to find a good value hotel that lives up to it's star rating. The Renaissance is a huge hotel that at times is soulless given it's gearing towards conferences. However, that does not mean it does not excel as an excellent family hotel. The rooms are very large and well equipped with large LCD Tv etc. The gardens and pool area are lovely, boasting a very large pool and separate childrens splash pool. There is also a nice outdoor play area for the children. There is a small selection of restaurants although the hotel is well placed for international drive with the myriad of options there. The location for Seaworld is superb with a 5 minute walk to the gates. It is ideal for popping in and out as you feel if you have a flexible Seaworld pass. Aquatica is probably too far to walk but is a short drive away. We had an excellent stay and found customer serice, particularly the superb concierge very helpful. The free lobby wifi was useful. The only thing that wasn't up to standard was the housekeeping in the rooms but this did not spoil our stay. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: Kuske
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not show up on hotels.com so it came as quite as surprise to see it directly across the street from the park when we visited last year and stayed at another hotel.
