I thought it would be neat to walk to the park and have the option of seeing the fireworks from our balcony so we booked it. We were not disappointed. Service was excellent. They have Starbucks, a Sushi bar, excellent pool bar, a sports bar, and Trade Winds restaurant serving a nice variety of entrees. The breakfast buffet was about the best I've ever had. For about twenty bucks extra we upgraded to a larger room with a huge outside patio where we sat back and enjoyed the fireworks. All in all this was a very pleasant experience. Did I say the staff was outstanding? The only negative was the air conditioning in the room. We had it on sixty degrees but the room never dropped below 75, not good enough for me. So we called the front desk. They sent a maintenance guy. He couldn't fix it so we asked for another room. Within fifteen minutes they moved us and we were sleeping soundly. It was a minor inconvenience but I think they have central air conditioning and this might be a recurring problem. If you are willing to take the chance, this is the best hotel we could find for the money. We were disappointed about the pay internet. Who does that?

Reviews.Title: “Hmm.. it's only mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: mcsto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt (also 4-star hotel) before Renaissance during our trip to Orlando. We were hoping Renaissance to be as nice or nicer than Hyatt but it wasn't even close. Especially for being on the more pricey side (speaking of rooms only). We drove there, and the first turn off was the $15 daily parking (without tax), whereas at Hyatt it was free. I understand that it is very close to Seaworld but if you think you'd be saving on parking, you would be very disappointed. The parking is more expensive than what you pay at SeaWorld. The room was huge and clean. The couch was hard, as if there is only one thin layer of cushion. The view was nasty rusty tanks on roofs (I guess we can't all have good views). The pool was smaller and filled with loud kids. I cannot believe we paid extra and spent the last day at Orlando at this hotel. It was a joke. It felt like it had to be a 3-star hotel. It looked like it was trying too hard to look nice. When we were at Hyatt, we actually planned to spend time at the hotel. Swim in the pool, walk around, ride boats. People said hi everywhere with a big smile. Very courteous and friendly service. We just should have stayed at Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: NessChesterUK
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd holiday to Orlando and 3rd stay in this lovely hotel. The rooms are big and the comfiest beds I have slept in any hotel. Linen changed daily. Perfect location for Seaworld and Aquatica, I drive trolley bus stop outside hotel. Lovely clean, warm pool with plenty of fresh towels, kids were always in pool if not at Seaworld. Beautiful buffet breakfast with an immense choice - ommelttes were my favourite!! The staff were brillient, it was my birthday while I was there and my children asked them if they had any balloons, they didnt but sent a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and glass of champagne to my room as a surprise from kids and front desk staff!!! They were so helpful if we needed anything!!! We love this hotel and would not even consider going anywhere else in Orlando when we return again!! Fantastic holiday, fantastic weather, fantastic food and fantastic hotel, Absolutely fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Craft
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Orlando is a beautiful hotel from top to bottom: the gorgeous atrium, tasteful infusion of Euro-Asian style and cuisine, and spa/resort feel, yet homey and comfortable without an "attitude" or pretentious staff. We felt welcomed and special from the moment we checked in, including a welcoming glass of champagne and apple cider, along with more complimentary drinks and newspapers in the lobby. We were never "nickled and dimed", as at some hotels: all of the resort amenities, including the fitness center, were complimentary, and the fitness center was also open 24 hours. The breakfast buffet was large and generous, and the variety of foods, including locally grown and organic, were delightful. At dinner, we were entertaining a European friend, and he was absolutely amazed to find a favorite (and somewhat rare) champagne on the menu. A large convention was present during our stay, but the convention area is thoughtfully annexed next to the hotel proper; it allows convention guests to access the main lobby easily yet separates their activities from other guests. As a result, we never felt "overwhelmed" by the convention as we do at some hotels. The Renaissance is located within walking distance of Sea World, so we had the convenience of accessing the park without having to drive or take a shuttle, yet the hotel is secluded by trees so that we never felt burdened by traffic or noise from the park. The staff is friendly and genuine; although busy at times, we never saw anyone lose their cool or treat us with impatience or, worse, ignore us. The service was excellent, wherever we went. The fact that our room came in around $100 a night absolutely amazes me, given the service, amenities, location, and overall beauty of this hotel. We have stayed at nearby resort properties at $500/night which could not compare to the Renaissance Orlando as far as amenities, service, and menu selections. I have recommended this hotel, and will continue to do so, as well as book all of our Orlando travel and business plans here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and a perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: GulfSider
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Renaissance Orlando and it was a great stay again. The first time I was with my family and they loved it. This time I was attending a conference at the hotel. The conference was well organized, the meeting rooms were nice and well equiped. The catered conference food was pretty good too. The stateroom was large and clean with a good view of sea-world. the bathroom had two sinks a large shower and Aveda products. It had a fridge, safe, desk, couch, coffee table and chair with foot stool. I believe ths was the "deluxe" king room. The bed was excellent with a full pillow assortment and I slept well, which is rare for me at any hotel. It was very quiet in my corner of the building even though my door faced the open Atrium. The atrium is a good place to kill some time, especially at night. The pool area is worth several hours of your time at least and they also have some game areas/courts (and arcade). I would reccomend to anyone, my only complaint is parking at $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “rude”
Reviews.Author: girliegirl123456
Reviews.Content: staff very rude, sad rooms for the price over all place is cold and not worth the price. food nasty $$, parking a mess to get out

Reviews.Title: “Employee theft”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover254
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the resort and had a lovely time. It's clean, although not a lot of options for restaurants, but the breakfast buffet is very very nice. Room keys are supposed to allow access to the Exercise rooms, but mine did not work. A Staff member called for someone to let me in, but no one ever came. I waited 20 minutes, and decided that was long enough. And these things happen. My biggest complaint was when we were packing to leave, I totally forgot two pantsuits in the closet. I realized it the next day and called for them to be sent to me. The housekeeper turned in only one pantsuit. They sent the one she turned in and never found the second one. So, if you plan to stay in Orlando, do NOT STAY THERE. THEY HIRE THIEVES TO WORK FOR THEM. Then I was told that they normally do not hold themselves responsible for stolen items, but they were going to extend me the courtesy of providing me with reimbursement for my items. Thank you very much, I would rather have my pantsuit. They did send me a check, but that's beyond the point.

Reviews.Title: “For Seaworld, can't be bettered”
Reviews.Author: Kinnik
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the renaissance - just for one night as we passed through Orlando and visited Seaworld. Its location - just opposite Seaworld - simply can't be bettered. The rooms are reasonably sized, reasonably priced and reasonably well-equipped. The breakfast buffet is good and the lunch/dinner restaurant has some interesting and good dishes. Simply put, if you're just visiting Seaworld, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but .............”
Reviews.Author: hollyblue67
Reviews.Content: We arrived later than expected after our flight was delayed. This was not a problem and we had a warm welcome and an offer of a better room with a large balcony facing Sea World. I was very impressed with the hotel, staff were friendly and helpful, room was cleaned every day to a high standard, room itself was great with a very nice balcony and a comfy bed and food was good in the Sports Bar. We did not eat at the main restaurant Tradewinds so cannot comment on that. The facility's at the hotel were good and the pool area was lovely. Sea World is right across the road and takes less than 10 mins to get to the main gate there. The Trolley Bus stops outside the hotel and you can purchase your tickets for this at the hotel. It goes up and down I-Drive and came in very handy. Discovery Cove and Aquatica are a very short car journey away. Now the But ............ Corporate Meetings galore. Oh yes every day of the week . They closed areas off to guests around the pool one evening as there was a corporate event going on. The noise from these people was a real pain. After their meetings they would all go to the bar and get louder and louder as the night wore on. Because of the design of the hotel everything echoes and some nights the noise was going on until passed 1 am. My hubby had 2 pillows over his head to try and shut the noise out one night. The people with balcony's facing into to the Antrim must have had it worse than us. To top it all a meeting room was set up right next to ours and by 8am they would all be in there making a noise and there was no chance of a lay in. This was the only fault, and it is pity the hotel does not keep a separate wing for the corporate people so they don't interfere with paying guests. Great Hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue88d
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. It is beautiful, it's clean and it is right in front of seaworld. I went there during summer and I had a really great time. There's a nice pool in the backyard and a jacuzzi. If you go there without a car, you can use the I Ride Trolley. It's a bus with a stop at all the great attractions (most of them). There's a stop in front of the hotel and I think it's only 7 dollars to have a week pass. The things that I didn't like were that it was very expensive to eat there (like most of the hotel) and you have to pay 24 dollars the hour to go on the internet...

Reviews.Title: “Great for Seaworld/Discovery Cove, but corporate.”
Reviews.Author: Lazarina
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is indeed perfect for the Seaworld/Discovery Cove parks, and the staff were friendly, especially those in the poolside and Tradewinds restaurants. Most rooms open onto the huge central atrium, with either a balcony or door facing that way. During our stay we had corporate convention after convention taking place, and the noise/voices from the atrium at night echoed into our room. Also our room was located next to a small suite, and were twice woken up by early morning meetings. I would suggest asking for a room at the ends of the building, away from the atrium all together.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly inexpensive with average rooms and...”
Reviews.Author: EiboNewbury
Reviews.Content: Fairly inexpensive with average rooms and service. Very business oriented with two major conventions while we were there, which leaves you feeling a bit uncomfortable traipsing through the massive atrium lobby in your shorts! Booked an escape romance package which was supposed to include a number of touches such as champagne in your room on arrival ( told to go to bar and get it ourselves, bar knew nothing about it) chocolate turndown service ( never happened) and late checkout which I had to ask for and follow up on twice . Nothing show stopping or that would ruin your stay but a bit irritating. On the plus side the breakfast in Tradewinds was excellent and one receptionist " Gloria" was superb. We also extended our stay for 2 nights due to volcanic ash situation without any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Best fitness room ever”
Reviews.Author: spaceagepop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while our son competed in a tournament, and all three of us fell in love with the hotel's fitness room--large, equipped with top-line machines, weights, and other equipment, and with capacity to handle everyone who came when we used it. We would go back again just to enjoy the chance to use such a top-notch facility.

Reviews.Title: “If your destination is Seaworld, this is your hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dangrad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a business meeting. Location is right across the street from Seaworld, a bonus for fellow travelers who brought their kids. There is a trolley (reasonably priced) that runs outside the hotel to the "business district" so you're not totally stranded at this property. You just have to be motivated to leave the grounds! Walking from the hotel isn't really an option (other than to Seaworld) as the sidewalks tend to abruptly end just after reaching a bus stop. Taxis are plentiful. On to the hotel: Took a cab from MCO, ran about $45 including tolls and tip. Offered champagne upon check-in. Chilled water in coolers available in atrium. USA Today and Wall Street Journals available in lobby as well. Check-in staff were pretty efficient. Had a room away from the elevators on a high floor. Try to get as far away from them as possible if only to keep out the noise from the atrium. If you're at the end of the building it won't be an issue. Free WIFI in the lobby (but not yet in the rooms for Marriott Rewards higher level members) as well as a Starbucks. This property used to be a 'resort" in name, but all vestiges of that have been removed from their name in order to attract more business/convention traffic. You're still paying for resort services and amenities. Rooms are large and ours included a sofa, chair, coffee table, desk/chair, and comfortable beds and linens. Bathroom had double sink and there was a Shamu "rubber duckie" on the bathtub. Aveda shampoo, etc. No robes or slippers. Our meeting food and beverage staff were attentive and the food was better than average. Other guests on our floor ordered room service and the platters would be in the hall well into the next day. A colleague tried to order room service mid-day, but couldn't get anyone to answer the phone. Pool area was very nice and there were plenty of umbrellas to shield my wife from the intense Florida sunshine. Plenty of room on the chaise lounges and in the water. It was very clean in the pool area and there were ping pong tables as well. It's not a hotel I would pick on my own but was a nice place for a week-long meeting. If you want to go to Disney/Epcot, you'll want a car because it's about 30 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't have any special requests.”
Reviews.Author: rpbMI
Reviews.Content: My first reaction was Wow! The lobby and pool area are beautiful and our room with an atrium view was awesome. We liked the double sinks in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet at Tradewinds was fresh and delicious. It was very convenient to walk across the street to Sea World. Our problems began on the night that my parents were driving in to spend one night with us. In Jan., when I booked the room, I had asked for adjoining and atrium view rooms. I was told that could not be guaranteed, which I understood. We arrived on a Thurs. and double checked to see if our request could be honored and it was punched into the computer and I was never told that it could not be guaranteed, so I assumed that we were all set. On Fri., we were going to Discovery Cove and checked with the front desk again to make sure that they were aware that my parents would be checking in before we returned and wanted to make sure they would be able to get the key for their room. Again, I was assured that things were set for the room next to us. It was a great surprise when we returned to find that my parents were not in the room next to us and did not have an atrium view, actually their room had a view of a rooftop. I was quite embarrassed, since this was a birthday gift for them. My daughter had looked so forward to being right next door to Grandma and Grandpa and being able to go back and forth between our two rooms. Now, they were on the opposite end of the hall. When I went to the desk to find out why the room next to us had been given to someone else, they had no explanation, but told us we could move to two other adjoining rooms. None of us wanted wanted to go through the inconvenience of packing up and moving for one night. To top it off, the people that they put in the room that was supposed to be for my parents were so loud. We were up between midnight and one. Since this was a gift for my parents, I had asked that they not get a bill. Well, they received one under their door. It was not included on ours. When I questioned this error, I was told that you have to request this. My response was - I did, but it was just one more request that had not been honored. We will not stay here again, simply because it will be a reminder of a very stressful time. However, if you don't have any special requests and you can be assured of having an atrium view room, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: Iloveseaworld
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at the Renaissance Orlando Resort. We wanted to stay here again after staying in 2008 and we were not dissapointed. Friendly staff and large friendly sized rooms. Enjoyed all that Orlando had to offer. If you can try to go to Discovery Cove and swim with the dolphins, a great day, out of this world. If you are staying in the Renaissance around Oct time this year check with hotel about pool it is being refubished.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ratnrol
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. It was easy to find from the airport. We stayed at the hotel for two nights. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was very large and had two queen beds. We used valet parking. They were quick and friendly. Inside side the hotel is beautiful and welcoming. Great first impressions. We ate a late dinner at the restaurant. The meals were large enough that my wife and I split our meals with our daughters! Very good food as well. The breakfast buffer was $20, which included coffee and juice. We only ate there the first morning. A bit expensive to do every day and my kids don't eat $20 worth for food :o). Never made it to the pool as the weather was cool and we were busy all day. Looked very nice though. We walked across the street to Seaworld. This was fantastic!. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location-somewhat climate-control challenged”
Reviews.Author: DixieUte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Orlando in part to attend a baby shower and in part to visit SeaWorld. There is no better location to stay in if you want to go to SeaWorld-with a 5 minute walk (or less), you are at SeaWorld's doorstep. Also, the atrium in the hotel is exquisite. Not sure I've seen a more interesting interior to a hotel. The rooms were a little small but elegant and especially nice if you get a balcony, which we did, helping to expand the living space. And the staff at the hotel were uniformly courteous. There were only two negatives for us. First of all, the in-room thermostat seemed to be a facade or at best, very inefficient. When we arrived, our room was freezing. We turned up the thermostat and nothing happened so after our call, a staff person from engineering came up to our room and told us that the system was very slow and we needed to turn up the thermostat to 90 degrees if we wanted the room to get warmer. We did but the room did not warm up until about 12 hours later, thus making for a rather chilly evening. The 2nd downside was the housekeeping staff did not appear to understand the concept of a "green" hotel. We kept putting our towels on the rack so they would not be taken away and washed but yet every time we came back to our room, the towels were brand new and fresh. So if you are into eco-travel, which is consistent with this hotel's philosophy on their website, make sure to leave a note to housekeeping or just make your bed yourself!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I looked forward to coming home to...”
Reviews.Author: FirehunterTX
Reviews.Content: I just completed a five night stay at the Renaissance Orlando at Seaworld in conjunction with working a convention booth at the nearby Orlando Orange County Convention Center. I've traveled a lot on business, and can't remember a more enjoyable hotel stay. It made my long days on the convention floor so much easier, and I did actually find myself looking forward to getting back to the hotel at night. The room was great - large, clean, quiet, newly remodeled. It opened to a balcony over the atrium, which allowed sort of an ocean resort feeling. The restaurants were decent - not great but consistently good - and they were reasonably priced. My colleague and I ate sushi at the Mist three times, and ate at the Tradewinds and Boardwalk twice. I also loved having the Starbucks onsite, and used it every morning. The pool and workout rooms were top notch, as nice as I've seen most anywhere. There was a fee for parking, but that's true everywhere I stay. The parking at this hotel was so convenient - a very easy in and out. I will stay here again, anytime I'm heading to this part of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Eskowriter
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous hotel and a great location. Unfortunately, we only stayed one night, which, when combined with a trip to Sea World, isn't nearly enough time to discover and enjoy all that this hotel has to offer. We loved the spacious room, comfortable bed and Aveda products. The view from our balcony was awesome. My only complaint is about the extra charges, which seem to be the norm at Orlando resorts but were especially high here: $15/night for parking, plus $3/bottle of water. Still, I hope to stay here again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel, making our holiday fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TheBatties
Reviews.Content: We're rather late with our review (our apologies) as were stayed at the Renaissance in October 2009. My husband and I had taken two friends along as a treat (so 2 x adjacent double rooms), as we had two very significant birthdays to celebrate, plus it was their first trip to Orlando, so we wanted somewhere special which would impress them and provide comfort. Well, the Renaissance certainly did that! We all loved the hotel and we had a fabulous 10 day holiday there. Reay, a concierge, cannot be praised enough. He was so helpful when we had trouble with our hire car. He was also incredibly kind and helpful to me when he saw my mobility problems and he instantly produced a wheelchair for my use throughout our stay (an absolute godsend). Lovely man and a great asset to the hotel. Next for thanks and compliments is Terry, the Front Desk Manager. Brilliant, friendly and always helpful. He always seemed to be around and he always had tickets for this or that, or for free drinks at various restaurants. Another lovely and helpful man. Resourceful too. Oh, and several times he gave us bottles of iced water when he saw us hot and weary. Mike, a server at Tradewinds. Friendly, chatty and very knowledgeable about US wines. We really enjoyed chatting with him (and comparing notes about wine and roller coasters!). As I've said, we really enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance, and it is the best location you could wish for for Seaworld. We were very impressed with the whole atrium and entrance areas, and our rooms were spacious (we had a great view over Seaworld, which we'd specifically requested), clean and extremely comfortable with plenty of wardrobe/drawer space. Splendid bathrooms too. We had 3 or 4 evenings when we got "home" quite late and very tired after a busy day, so being able to just head for the hotel's restaurant, Tradewinds, was such a bonus. In our experience it is actually quite unusual to find such a great hotel restaurant, so this was a terrific surprise. We thoroughly enjoyed some brilliant food there - the Black Angus Burger is tremendous, likewise the Harris Ranch Ribeye Steak. The Lobster Bisque is a meal in itself! Great selection of wines too. I'd read beforehand that the Renaissance serve an incredible breakfast, so we were looking forward to that. What I'd read was absolutely true - the buffet breakfasts at the Renaissance were superb, plentiful and delicious. On our last day, needing to return the hire car early afternoon, we had lunch by the pool in the The Palms pool bar. What a lovely, relaxing hour that was! Altogether a fantastic hotel, which ensured we had a fantastic holiday. We just cannot praise the Renaissance Orlando Resort enough. We will definitely stay there again, and will most certainly recommend it to friends or anyone. You can tell we enjoyed it, can't you? :o) Thank you, Renaissance! (I should point out that at the time we stayed the overnight parking was still free - or at least included in our holiday price. The pay machines were just being installed).

Reviews.Title: “Next to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Oriolekevin
Reviews.Content: This was a great modern hotel next to the main entrance to SeaWorld. The hotel has large and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time staying here ;-)”
Reviews.Author: iamissjamie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on business in Orlando.. Room service has a great Cuban sandwich. You really don't want to leave this hotel, it has a tropical feel to it the bar and the restaurant are great, the staff are attentive. You are directly across the street from Sea World so this is a great place to stay if you have children. Plenty of parking and there is a great gift shop and a Starbucks in the lobby..

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbedoo
Reviews.Content: Sadly only for one night, but a great location for Sea World. Had a room which you could get lost in with a super comfy bed and more pillows than I knew what to do with. Good sized bathroom with great AVADA toiletries. Had breakfast in the morning which as you would expect was on the pricey side but the buffet was well presented and was fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Large, exciting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigFootPA
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at this hotel for 1 night. It is a large, atrium hotel with interesting "aquariums" throughout which were LCD screens with colorful scenes of fish. It is clean, stimulating, and has comfortable rooms. The room service is of decent quality, the food arrived on time and was warm not very hot. I had meals at group functions which were of very good quality. This hotel is well-suited for individuals, families, and business meetings. I would consider staying there again for any of these purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Silvara
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and beautiful grounds and pool. Great location, right across the street from Sea World. Very close to Convention Center. Staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. One room that overlooked lobby was a little noisy when the door was open and during one week day, it was hard to find a cocktail during the afternoon. Food at the hotel was resort pricey, but all the food was good quality and delicious and a Starbucks in the lobby. We had a great stay and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: KARENTkent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for Christmas & New Year along with other members of my family. We honestly could not fault this hotel. The food was excellent, the staff all friendly & extremely helpful & the entire hotel spotlessly clean. It is an ideal location for Seaworld & Aquatica & transport is available for all the other parks if you are not driving. The I-ride also stops just outside. This is the third hotel I have used in this area & by far the nicest. I would happily go back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; love the location to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: kkl2856
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Christmas day. Picked this hotel because of its location right across from Seaworld and got a rate of $99 per night with additional $30 food credit. So at $69 a night, this is a steal! Hotel has a wonderful lobby. Front desk people are super nice and accomodating. Avoid the sushi bar as it's overpriced and not very fresh. Food at the main restaurant is ok but service is slow, the staff there aren't very clear about how they should account for the free meal for gold elite members and the buy-one-get-one-free-entree certificate. It all become too confusing. But luckily front desk people takes care of it immediately. We ordered room service, the ribs and chicken were actually not bad, but do avoid the steak. Overall it's a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some cleaning up for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Hudson4
Reviews.Content: Looks great from the outside and lobby. However, the rooms are in bad need of some updating. I suppose the high price is for the location, able to walk to Sea World. Good people at the desk, and overall a good experience, but update the rooms! No free internet here, $14.95 a day if you want it in your room. Parking your car will also cost you about $12 a day. I expected more for $200 + a night.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chica_bella813
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel and I was completely surprised. The lobby was beautiful and it was nice to have a room with a balcony that faced the lobby. It was like over looking a city within a little city. The beds were very comfortable. Slept very well. I will be returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: queeniethesweetest
Reviews.Content: Even being far away from the elevator as you attempt to sleep you can still hear it going up and down all night long, don’t order room service and leave ticket on door they never pick it up. Even if you pay your overnight parking of $12.00 per night at check out the automated gate won’t let you out until you pay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,super lobby”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotels location is next to Sea World and right on the shuttle/bus line. Pool is nice but there is only one and it was crowded.There is a charge for parking and room internet but it is free in lobby. Hotel staff are just average and do not go out of there way to greet you but cleaning staff was super nice. Beds, pillows, linens and towels were all a very nice high end quality and the rooms were large with great shampoos and soaps from Aveda. This looks like most Renaissance hotels and would be great for Disney trips.

Reviews.Title: “Same Fab Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Holly057
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week at the beginning of November before attending a family wedding and we weren't disappointed. We used to stay at this hotel many years ago and on returning with other family members this time, I hoped it would live up to how we rememebered it, and i'm pleased to say it did. The touches like champagne on arrival, and a Shamu in the bathroom were all very welcome. And extremely comfy beds. Found most of the staff very pleasant and obliging, especially Terry on the Front Desk. After visting the parks, it was still a lovely place to come back and relax, and the pool area is very nice, quiet and relaxing. Would definatey stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenturaGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed because of an awards ceremony we were attending at the hotel. We were not disappointed. The Mist Bar was very fun with interesting drinks. The pool and gym are nice. I only had 2 things to complain about....the water and the temperature of the hotel. I never buy bottled water but the water in the hotel is terrible! It even smells bad while taking a shower or brushing your teeth. And the temperature of the hotel was so cold that it was commonly a topic of conversation with strangers while riding in the elevator. So....bring your own bottled water and a thick sweatshirt and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & massive rooms”
Reviews.Author: digbyl
Reviews.Content: 5 day trip for a meeting. Good location though you really need car to get about, as you would for almost all of the USA. Try to get a room with a balcony if you can. Food pretty good and the staff very helpful 10 minute taxi to the mall & 5 minutes to all the places to eat on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Proximate to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: PC800er
Reviews.Content: After a few days at Disneyworld, we transferred to the Renaissance Orlando to enjoy Sea World. We were pleasantly surprised by a number of things. The hotal, for its size, (700 + rooms) is clean and attractive. Large open area in the center of the hotel. Our room had a good size bathroom, high 9-10 foot ceiling, bright colors - and was exceptionally clean. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a sitting area and balcony. It was a much better size room than your standard Disney room and so was more comfortable to spend time in the room. Our package included tickets to Sea World - which is literally a 5 min walk across the street. Made it a no stress process especially since we avoided the car rental. So good location if you are going to Sea World. I should mention it is 12 miles from the airport and, although we didn't go, on the trolley route for the nearby Orlando Premium outlets (bus stops in front of the hotel). We also enjoyed the outdoor pool. Kids had a blast while mom and dad sat at the outdoor cafe/bar. It was a nice set up - great place for snack and cocktail in a covered yet outdoor setting right next to the pool. We used the on premises Starbucks for breakfast (which was overpriced) and Tradewinds Restaurant for dinner. Again, food was a little expensive ($80 dinner with a few drinks) but the food was indeed very good. For example, I had a pasta bolognese and the advertised house made sauce was truly flavorful and homemade tasting. All the food was good quality. Kids meals were reasonable and included desert for $6. Overall everyone enjoyed the 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “The coldest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: islandstyle08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week and I've never been so cold. The air-conditioning is on full blast throughout the hotel day and night. If you don't like being cold or feel the cold easily, this place is not for you. I turned on the heating unit in my roomso at least my room was warmer but if you anywhere else, it's like the Antarctic. Otherwise the hotel is ok -rooms are large and spacious and have most amenities you need. Customer service is average. Look and feel is modern.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for an Orlando Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lancs7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our teenage daughter have just returned from this hotel and we were all very impressed with it. The staff were very welcoming on our arrival and the glass of Champagne we were given at check in was very welcome after our long journey. (Juice alternative was also available) The hotel was a real surprise inside with a central atrium which could be viewed from all floors, some rooms actually had balconies over looking this area. Our room with balacony over looked the highway not much to see during the day but a magnificant view of the fireworks at all the Disney parks in the evening! Leisure facilities were very good. Within a few minutes stroll of seaworld and close to Disney this hotel is well priced and makes a great base for all the other attractions and shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sharonmargaretw
Reviews.Content: just returned from a two week stay at this hotel everything was spot on. rooms are very clean and comfortable plenty of sunbeds all staff helpful and friendly. you dont need a car as the transport to the parks is excellent free to universal seaworld and aquatica and free to disney if you are a virgin customer if i wanted to be pickey the only complaint i would have is there is no guest laundry

Reviews.Title: “Hotel may have been remodeled in 2008-but same can't be said for their Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisBeachbum36
Reviews.Content: Email sent to us prior to arrival-offering a few extras. We took up the offer to pay for a gift from Shamu, and requested extra towels. Appreciated the complimentary champagne when checking in-but went to our room to find no gift from Shamu (we wanted to suprise our 4yo)-and three towels for three of us. Flip lock to adjoining room wouldn't throw a lock-so they sent an engineer to come fix that, while someone else searched for our gift we ordered. Located fridge in room (under safe)-put milk in there; came to find out next day it was an old courtesy bar-and the employee that assisted us couldn't understand why they hadn't put in the new refrigerators yet, as they had arrived. Brought us up an old mini fridge-door was unbolted from hinge on top-so you had to lift up door to open/close. That worked fine, until it was unplugged while we were at the parks one day. Mattresses are not at all what they rave them to be-remember those egg crates you'd put on top of dorm mattresses in college? Not too different. Our mattress was concaved to the middle so we took turns sleeping with our four yo-otherwise, we'd roll into each other during the night (the mattress was so bad that the bottom sheet wouldn't stay on). We had a late night one night at the parks (Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween)-and returned to our room at 12:30a to find that it had never been made up during the day. Garbage was full, beds unmade-and no towels. Called downstairs to ask what happened-they were unsure. Had to ask if we could at least get towels. Offered newspaper delivery when we checked in-never did get that all week-each day was a different reason as to why it hadn't been delivered. If you have ever stayed at Opryland Hotel-imagine that big open atrium area-that's how this hotel is designed-so all the hotel rooms' doors face out to that open area-it's loud til about 1/1:30a because of people congregating downstairs in the lobby area (popular sushi bar, etc)-the only saving grace to this is the darkening curtains your room has-so we'd sleep in later, but missed a lot of time being at the parks early. Pool is fabulous-especially being able to have a meal right there-they are a little stingy on the towels down there (tough some times to get one)-but if you come at the beginning of the day, there is one at each lounge chair. Food is good in the restaurants-went to all but sushi bar-neat having Starbucks right in the lobby. Disappointed in the valet-one guy in particular would be texting on his cell each morning-as we stood waiting for him to offer to assist us-when he finally did call for our car and it arrived-he'd open the door for my husband-not my daughter and I-and we quickly realized by day two-he was more interested in the tip, then in helping the ladies out. Love that they have computers set up in the lobby specifically to print your boarding passes (nice touch). If you are truly looking to get away from work, this wasn't the place to go. They really seemed to cater to business conferences and they were packed-at the pool, restaurants, and throughout the lobby-a constant reminder of work at home, not of people enjoying their leisure time/vacation. Had an extra-and hefty room service charge on our check out bill for our first night-though we had used room service once, it wasn't our first night. Front desk couldn't provide me what the charge was far, and simply removed it stating that they probably charged the wrong room number (slightly disconcerting). Our last trip, we had stayed at Hyatt Grand Cypress-and although we paid considerably more for our stay-the customer service was amazing compared to here. Can't say I'd be quick to return-unless they start to remember that it's the customers that keep that hotel going-not just the trendy decor.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DIORLOU
Reviews.Content: This is th second time my husband and I have stayed at this hotel and is certainly not the last. The service the hotel is impeccable! From room service to valet! This hotel is "ish" :) You can literally walk to Sea World by staying here. The pool and whirl pool at this hotel is top notch! Love Love Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Top Notch! Superb!”
Reviews.Author: RiusN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks at the Renaissance from 23rd September, and we were thoroughly impressed. Upon arrival at the hotel, you realise just how close it is to SeaWorld, literally it is across the road! We checked in and were given complimentary champagne, and were told we had a room with a pool view. I asked if there was a balcony in this room and was told no, and then we were offered a room on the 8th floor with a balcony, which we accepted. First point to make, the reception staff are very friendly, courteous and helpful, and this made a welcome change from some of the other hotels we have stayed at ! The atrium is lovely, very airy and spacious, with two bars and a restaurant, and also seating areas (where you see many business folk on their laptops) - there is also a Starbucks, which was handy in the morning, a shop that sells general sundries, and also the Expedia desk, who were also very helpful in arranging things for us. We flew with Virgin so we had complimentary Mears transport, so all we had to do was get a voucher from reception and then arrange our transport - all very easy! The room was very spacious, with a double sink unit in the bathroom and good shower unit. The beds were by far the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in, just gorgeous. You also get an LCD flat screen tv with basic cable, as well as 2 armchairs and a table. The view from the balcony through the sliding doors looked out onto the pool area and tennis courts and out to Orlando. I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel, we had a perfect stay, and if people were worried (like we were) about not driving on this holiday, dont be. The Mears transport is excellent and very promt for drop off and pick ups, and furthermore, there is an IRide and Lynx stop right outside the hotel, perfect for going up to I Drive, or even to Disney (Number 50 Lynx). And as i said, Seaworld is across the street,so its a short walk for there and the Busch Gardens shuttle. The swimming pool area is beautifully landscaped, and there are loungers and also a bar - the pool was lovely! For kids there is also an arcade area. A fitness centre is also located on the ground floor, and also a Fed Ex office which you have 24 hour access too if you dont have wi fi, you can use the computers in there for a small charge. One minor thing, we only ate in house once, and that was room service, it came to $43 all in for two cheeseburgers and fries. If you arent in the mood to go out of an evening, ask reception and they give you local take away delivery options that is wel worth it! All in all then, the Renaissance Orlando Resort hotel is a must stay, and we reccomend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Poirot77
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 19th September '09 for two weeks at the Renaissance hotel. We didn't get the type of room that we had requested, ie pool view or atrium view, despite the hotel being very quiet. When I asked about moving rooms, we were given the option of a pool view room, but was informed that guests could be in the pool until any time of night, and I was wary of lots of late night noise, so we stayed where were. Although the hotel had apparently been renovated, our room wasn't one of them and the ceiling had stains and needed painted. You could also hear the guests in the room next door, which luckily was only for a few nights. Also, our fridge didn't work at all. I'd advise guests to ask for a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony, overlooking Seaworld. On the plus side, the room was large and the beds very comfortable. The hotel staff were nice, although I was taken aback by the comments from one of the Duty Managers, 'Terry'. During our first week, the hotel fire alarm went off twice on seperate nights. This could of course happen anywhere, but I was concerned that the alarm was very quiet and only sounded in the main hotel reception area. There was no alarm in our room, which I feel is a safety issue, especially for the hard of hearing. My husband bearly heard it either. I looked out onto the balcony, down towards reception, as many other guests were also doing. No-one knew if we were to evacuate our rooms, there were no instructions to be heard after the alarm stopped. There was also no staff on reception when I tried phoning to ask if we were to evacuate, I had to keep waiting for the call to be answered. I mentioned this to the security guard when we returned one evening and he said a duty manager would give me a call, which'Terry' did. I expressed my concern about the low volume of the fire alarm and how many guests would simply not hear it, then it was simply turned off with no information. I said that if a fire alarm went off in a British hotel, it would be loud enough for everyone to be aware of it and everyone would need to evacuate. Terry didn't seem to have a clue about the fire alarm, as 'they have never had a fire'. He admitted he didn't know if the alarm would get louder if a fire was nearer our floor or not. Do the staff never have fire drills here? I certainly didn't feel reassured atfer speaking with this member of staff. The buffet breakfast in Tradewinds was good, although you wouldn't want to spend $20 per person each day on breakfast. We often went to Starbucks, but this had limited choice and always sold out of croissants by 9.30am. Hotel transfers to Universal or Aquatica were complimentary, when arranged, although had set times to drop you and return for you. Hotel pool was very nice, plenty of loungers which were complimentary. Car park had plenty of spaces very close to the hotel (again, we were there off peak). Food was good in the Sports Bar. Overall, we felt it was a reasonably good hotel but certainly not '5*' as we'd read in the Virgin Holiday brochure, and not worth the money we paid,. On checking out, reception staff didn't ask how we'd enjoyed our stay, which was unusual. We felt we'd get a similar hotel/facilities for better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “"Outstanding Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Pamally
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week holiday in Orlando staying at the Renaissance at Seaworld booked through Virgin Holidays. This Hotel is by far the best we have stayed in over the past 7 years. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of champagne. Our room was located on the 5th floor facing Seaworld with a very large balcony complete with sun lounger, table and chair and the room itself could not be faulted. Every staff member at this hotel cannot do enough for you and a special mention must go to Terry Simmons, Guest Services, who went out of his way to ensure our stay was perfect. The atrium area is stunning with a restaurant, sushi bar, sports bar and starbucks. Seven glass elevators whisk guests to all floors. The pool area is also impressive with an excellent pool bar, table tennis, tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball court and childrens play area. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel so much that we have already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, Large and Bright.”
Reviews.Author: TheBavers
Reviews.Content: I am a little late in writing this review but I just want to let you know about the hotel. My partner and myself stayed at this hotel in March 2007 for week. It was a package holiday booked via My Travel. I was very impressed with the hotel but when we arrived, they were in the middle of a refurbishment. I was a little disapointed with the holiday company as we did not get a holiday rep and we were kind of dumped there by the holiday company. We were not given any advice, maps or local information. We did not see anyone from My Travel during the holiday from when we got off the plane untill we got back on it. Now to the hotel. It was excellent. The room was very large, bright and light. The bath room was large and had two sinks. There was a large flat screen TV in the room. All the staff were very helpfull and provided local transport to the Disney parks. Sea world is just across the road and took 2 mins to walk there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is cheaper than staying in Disney and it was only 10 minutes in the car. The dining was excellent and we had room service most nights as it was cheap enough. The bar was good if a little expensive. The buffet breakfast was one of the best I have ever tasted and the evening meals were excellent. There was no Starbucks when we were there but they were half way through building when we stayed. We used the pool once and this was good. We were the only people in it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about, just an ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rich210uk
Reviews.Content: A Claimed $20million refurbishment on the hotel, but $20 refurbishment per room. I struggled to see why this hotel receives such good reviews. Don’t get me wrong it is nice but it lacks something, character probably and attention to detail in the rooms. It’s just a square box with an amazing lobby and standard rooms. We booked this Hotel with Virgin as a package from their "Platinum Selection". When we arrived at the hotel and walked through the doors you can see where they spent the money refurbishing. A very nice looking atrium with the sound of waterfalls and the lighting giving the hotel a warm glow. We were very impressed with the atrium. Checking in was fine but even though the guy behind the desk was very helpful I don’t think he really knew what he was doing. He offered us 3 different rooms but then retracted the offer each time and we ended up with the room we originally booked, which was fine for us anyway. Didn’t receive the champagne as advertised and no help with our bags. Entering the room the first thing we noticed was the badly fitted carpets under and around the door. Moving on, the room was just ok, nothing amazing. From a distance the room looks fine and before I reel out all the things that were wrong with the room it was a relief that it wasn’t a smelly, damp, dark dump like the last 2 hotels we stayed in when visiting Orlando last, but then we did pay nearly double this time and expected excellent rooms. Look closely and you will notice that the carpets were not hovered in the corners; the furniture in the room was quite tatty and rotten in places by the fridge and just a general lack of quality. None of the bedding fitted properly and had marks. Most of the towels were old and had stains as did the carpet in places. Check out the photos I added and you will see what I mean. I had mixed feelings about this hotel. In one hand it was a nice hotel with some nice touches but on the other it’s a bit of a let down. I didn’t expect a perfect hotel but all the small little niggles added up to the hotel being just an average one. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone paying full price but if you get a good deal then its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great conference services”
Reviews.Author: emnoonan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference and was impressed with the amenities, especially the exercise room. It made my stay that much more enjoyable. I'd definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel & friendly helpful service”
Reviews.Author: burnettc
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 2 week Holiday staying at the Renaissance and it was perfect in every way. With Champagne on arrival we then had a choice of rooms, with 2 Queen or a King size bed. We went for the King size and also requested a room overlooking Sea World which was accommodated for us on the 8th floor. The room was very spacious with a lovely view and large bathroom / living area. We were also offered a choice of newspapers to be delivered to our door each morning free of charge which we enjoyed. We did not drive at all on our trip so we picked this hotel through Virgin as it had free scheduled transportation to Walt Disney World, Universal & Sea World parks. Although the Hotel does not mention that the transport takes you to Disney it does if you have booked through Virgin. All you need to do to arrange your free transport is pick up tickets from the concierge and hop along to Expedia (next to Starbucks) who will arrange it all for you. The Mears transport was always on time if not early, just don't be late as they won't wait for you too long! The pool was large and quiet and always had sun beds and towels available. Lovely tennis \ basket ball courts to use with equipment plus table tennis, foosball and games room. The restaurants were reasonably priced and the staff were fantastic. We used the Sports bar frequently as the Tradwinds restaurant seemed to be closed in the evenings for dinner (which was a shame but wasn’t inconvenient). The only thing I would say despite this is there could have been more choice of food at the other bars. The location was perfect for us as it was out of the way of the hustle and bustle of the busy part of I – Drive so it was nice to come back to after a hectic day at the parks. You can walk to Sea World which is literally across the car park. We did purchase a 14 day I-Ride trolley bus pass which helped us get up and down I-drive for the restaurants \ shops \ Ripleys etc. the stop was right outside the hotel. All in all a very enjoyable Holiday at an excellent Hotel and I would definitely recommend this to others and stay here again myself. I hope this info is of use to you.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayeEngland
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Orlando from the UK with Virgin holidays and our party consisted of two adults and two children aged ten and fifteen. We found this hotel to be of a very high standard and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. On arrival, we were actually given a choice of three different room options and were allowed to view them all before making a decision.- we actually had interconnecting rooms so that the children could have their space and we could have ours. Both bedrooms were lovely and included lounge areas with large flat screen TVs and beautiful bathrooms. Our bedroom also had an enormous balcony that overlooked Seaworld and, being on the seventh floor, we were able to watch their nightly firework displays. The hotel has three restaurants: Tradewinds, Boardwalk and Mist – a sushi and spirit bar. It also has “The Palms” poolside bar and grill and a Starbucks. We found “Boardwalk” particularly good value for money, as the food was excellent and very reasonably priced compared with some of the restaurants in the surrounding area. On arrival at the hotel we were actually issued with a discount card too, and this enabled us to get 10% off any food or drink we purchased from the hotel. The hotel was beautiful inside and very well planned, which made it easy to find your way around. It also had impressive glass lifts which could whisk you up to any floor in seconds. The poolside area, like the rest of the hotel and gardens, was beautifully kept and very pleasant to relax in. Free drink samples and cold flannels were often brought round to keep guests cool and refreshed – complimentary pool towels were also provided. There were also tennis courts, a basketball court, a volleyball area, a putting area, children’s play area and paddling pool. There were no hire charges for using rackets, etc., and the entire pool area was fenced in with good quality fencing and secure gates (which closed automatically behind you) making it the perfect environment for people with young children. The hotel also has a spa and a modern air conditioned gym. We actually had a hire car included in our package with free hotel parking from Virgin. However, the hotel did offer free transportation to Universal studios, Islands of Adventure, Discovery Cove, Busch Gardens and Aquatica – Seaworld, of course, is directly across the road. We did use the coach to Busch Gardens, as it saved us having to find our way there and having to pay for parking (which is $12 per day at all the parks). This transport could all be booked at the Expedia desk inside the hotel. There is also a bus stop outside the front of the hotel (I Trolley) which runs frequently around the local area – unfortunately, we didn’t actually use this service so we can’t actually comment on its efficiency. We had a wonderful time in Orlando and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely give this 5 star hotel a 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Amyfish
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Massive! Restaurants inside werent amazing but near enough to the i-ride trolley to sample restaurants along international drive. I-ride stop just outside the front of the hotel. 5-10 minute walk from Seaworld. Huge spacious air conditioned room, bathroom decorated well and a good size for 2 people. Great staff with good knowledge of the area and recommendations of where to go/eat. The swimming pool and pool bar was beautiful. Especially on an evening. Spot on :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel...Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: peahertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Checking in process swift and polite accompanied with a glass of champagne...lovely. Had a room on the 9th floor which gave us a view of the pool and seaworld which is just across the road. The room was large with two huge comfy beds and a wide screen TV.Double sink bathroom with shower/bath and plenty of amenities supplied,ie shampoo etc.Cleaned every day by a lovely lady who always had a smile and a good morning for us. I was told by a receptionist that the hotel are to install new fridges in the rooms although I can,t tell you when as she didn,t have that info at the time. If you are travelling with virgin and not driving you obtain a shuttle pass from the concierge,pop into the expedia office which is next to starbucks and they will book the shuttle for you. The pool was spotless and clean towels provided ,the pool bar was great for lunches and drinks . I can,t comment on the parking as I didn,t drive and I only used the Tradeswind restaurant once,but the waitress was very nice and polite and the meal we had was excellant although in true American style far to much!! The only moan if it can be called that is that they do not have laundry facilities.They do have an arrangement with the hilton around the corner if you want to do laundry. I- ride stops right outside the hotel as does the local lynx bus Great hotel....will be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Arianne123
Reviews.Content: WOW....we are just back from the Renaissance Orlando Hotel at Seaworld. It is fantastic. I wouldnt hesitate in going back there in the morning. From the moment you arrive this Hotel says "quality". Staff are very friendly and helpful. The Hotel is immacualte. The grounds are beautfiul and very child friendly (even though I dont have children). The beauty about this from a childless point of view is that there is a seperate splash pool and play area for the children, so theyre not in the main pool....which was great. There is quite a high fence surrounds the entire pool area so the little darlings would be safe from taking off, which I thought was a very good idea for those with little people. There are two outdoor heated Jacuzzis, so you can sit in gorious warm water and watch the world go by (not that much happens because everyone is at the parks). This brings me on to my next positive, this Hotel is gloriously quiet during the day, total tranquility. The rooms are fab, very spacious, double sinks in the bathroom. The Hotel is situated a 3 minute walk from seaworld and a 7 minute walk from Aquatica. Its right on a bus stop so in the evening if you want to go to International Drive without the car it cost 1 dollar 25 cents to go anywhere on International Drive! Theres a bus every 15 minutes......brilliant!! The concierge in the Hotel very happily offers advice on the best restaurants to eat in, it couldn't be easier, he also tells you what stop to get off (the bus stops are numbered...this Hotel is 32, so he tells you if you need to get off at 24 for example, you get off, go in, hve your dinner, come out, get back on the bus and come back!) I cant be more positive about this Hotel. Brilliant. Thankyou. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “If you must stay out in this neck of the woods, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: JayW913
Reviews.Content: Normally, I stay downtown near my company's office. For a few reasons, rate certainly one of them, I stayed here. Let's get the downside out of the way: if you're a tourist, there is no downside. Sea World is across the street and Universal/Disney are each close by. And if you are a tourist, business travelers read that completely differently than you did. Also, if you are heading downtown, you get to enjoy the loveliness of I-4. Upsides: -This is the quietest "atrium" hotel I have ever stayed in. My room faced the atrium and I never knew the difference. -Above-average service. Granted, they ply you with free alcohol at check-in, so that's worth an extra point. But the valet staff was great; my car was, without fail, waiting for me at the door when needed. -Above average gym -The Sand Lake Rd. restaurants are nearby and, if you are good with your favorite online mapping service, you do NOT need to get on I-4. Overall, a good hub for any business conducted south of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and great service.”
Reviews.Author: AMA0909
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times and will definitely stay here again. The price can be a bit pricey certain times of the year but it is worth it 100%. The staff is excellent and they treat you great. The rooms are very large and have flat screen TV's in them. They also are very clean and have a Starbucks downstairs in the spacious lobby, along with 2 great restaurants and a good outdoor bar.

Reviews.Title: “pay thru the nose”
Reviews.Author: BobD2009
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay here because of it's proximity to Seaworld, as season pass holders it would have been an excellent choice. It is a beautiful hotel and the service is great but they treat you like royalty because you have to pay a kings ransom to leave. It starts at parking, there is none so you have to give up your car to the valet( ka-ching), breakfast... (ka-ching) dinner or room service (KA-CHING), they even charged $100 for using the phone and a calling card, which they later refunded once they found out we used a pre-paid calling card. The only thing that really made for an unpleasant trip was the soiled bedspread. The cost for my 2 day adventure for the 4 of us, Seaworld $200, the Renaissance $500. Sleep in your clothes and get ready to pay thru the nose!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walk to Sea World, no International drive congestion”
Reviews.Author: TravelToLiveToday
Reviews.Content: What a great location for visiting Sea World. Walk from hotel to park. Makes for a hassle free vacation. Easy parking, rooms are updated. Pool is large. No complaints whatsoever. For a Orlando family hotel, far exceeded our expectations. The fitness center is 3x larger than most hotels of this size.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: t_navidad
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. very clean, very inviting, friendly staff and right across from Sea World (no need to pay for parking). Parking was complimentary during our stay so I can't complain about the $12 extra. They gave us a pool view room with a large balcony which was great! Pool was nice. Close to theme parks too. I can't complain especially with the great price (booked from expedia). I requested a higher floor but was told I'd have to wait a bit. Instead they offered a room on the 4th floor with a balcony and a pool view (paid for an atrium view, by the way) which was better! And since it was on the 4th floor, we were able to connect to the lobby's wireless internet from our suite which was free! great experience. I'd stay there again for sure! TIP: ask for a lower floor (4th?) if you want to get the wireless internet from the lobby (which is free!) :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...nuff said!”
Reviews.Author: BLUTOV
Reviews.Content: From the soaring atrium to the spa, pool, restaurant and bars everything was great...my only gripe was, paid parking is $12 a day. The location was perfect, Sea World was right across the street...International Drive was right around the corner (the main drag) and the freeways nearby. When guests came to visit they were quite impressed. Can't wait to visit without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Conferences but nickel & dime to death”
Reviews.Author: PlayfulPlatypus
Reviews.Content: We had a great conference here. My biggest complaint is location. Yes, it is right across the street from SeaWorld but unless you eat at their restaurants, you really need a car to get to food. The I-Trolley is not a good alternative to getting to food. Definitely, buy a Lynxx or local transit pass for the week and ride the local transit. Internet access is $14.95 per day, free in the lobby but who wants to sit in the lobby just to use the internet. Parking is $12 per day extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but pool not big enough for guests”
Reviews.Author: DeDe01
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in one month beginning and end of vacation, 5 nights in total this hotel as mentioned was very welcoming. Rooms and bathrooms fabulous, very quiet and relaxing, two slight problems, one the pool isn't large enough to accommodate all the guests, however i was there on 4th July weekend so that is busy. We always had a sun lounger, you just felt for some of the large areas of wasted room at this hotel just a slightly bigger pool would have gone a long way, but still consider this one of the best on the International Drive strip and I have been in quite a few. I'm english I like tea but their starbucks closes at 3.00 pm some afternoons you did feel like it was a deserted cruise ship. Saying that would I stay again most definatly ,if you want to avoid dare I say the badly dressed bucket & chucket brigade from England this is your hotel, the English was at most at 5% so you had the genuine american hospitality. Any experienced visitor knows some of the hotels in Orlando have so many English you might as well be in Spain The hotel was at a standard I would expect for the rest of USA for 4 /5 star and not a motel that many are in orlando As with other reviews for KFC go up to International drive turn left and then first right it quicker and cheaper to eat there in the daytime and for the best local atmosphere its got to be "Millers Ale House" a true american bar, good food great offers bucket of Buds or miller lites $6.95 this bar seem to have desimated the rest of the strip at last a decent bar within International Drive for adults though kids are most welcome. And for the English readers please please tip I saw in the millars ale house many family ordering drinks like in England and then sitting down NO this is not the american custom you must wait to be seated and tip you waitress or if you want to drink and or eat at the bar tip the barman if you want good service you must tip, their pay structure is not like ours they survive on tips the hourly rate can be as low a $2 an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort...aside from nickle and diming”
Reviews.Author: Trixi01
Reviews.Content: The family spent two nights with renaissance. The place is very clean and the rooms are are very warm and comforting. Check in was wonderful, I really felt like I was welcomed. It was not until looking over room service and the places to eat in there that I cringed. We did not want to leave once we got there that evening, as we were tired. We had to go back out to eat the cheapest thing on any menu was a twelve dollar grilled cheese. Don"t look for coffee in the lobby you will have to do the Starbucks inside. Did I mention you have to pay to park (which one of the evenings the lot was full and had to park way on the other side and walk) we still had to pay both days. My other favorite is the fourteen ninety five every twenty four hours for internet. After the sweet lady at check in it was hard to get any help for local stuff and the bell hop was not happy with the tip I gave him when we left...mainly cause my husband did most of the work. Call ahead to make sure there are no conferences going on , there was two going on and we felt like we should not even go swimming due to all the people coming and going in their finest. One quick note on food Mc Donalds is less than 5 min away I saw a lot of families in the mornings and evenings with bags of food. If you want to rest play swim eat, and have a free cup of coffee do your homework and stay at another resort. If we could put our lovely room in another resort we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just average at best”
Reviews.Author: koptraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as an alternative to the Disney Resorts. The location is good as it adjacent to SeaWorld and within a short distance to Disney attractions. The hotel itself is more of a business/conference style setting. I'm mystified why they have "Resort" in their name. The hotel is average plus at best. I understand the hotel was recently renovated, but it still has an early 90s theme feel with the vibrant colors and gold accents. The staff were very nice overall. I witnessed an argument between two housekeeping staff ladies. I was waiting to ask them a question, and they continued arguing as I stood there...it was like "hello, I have a question". The food at the hotel is less than average at best. The pool is a disappointment....pretty small and crowded even with 100 people by the pool. The tennis courts and game areas near the pool are not maintained properly. Best feature of the hotel is the proximity to SeaWorld, ease of use of the trolley that winds around the area, the lobby is very nice and open, and having a Starbucks in the lobby is nice. The room is large, but the walls were paper thin. I heard my neighbors enjoying themselves to put it bluntly. And the beds were not comfortable at all. Overall I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gym... Very Expensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrlTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at this hotel and I was very impressed with the service and the quality of the room. Everything was neat clean and in its place. The lobby is beautiful and I had a room overlooking SeaWorld and saw the fireworks show every night. The gym was really good compared to most hotels. Exercise room along with free weights a plenty of cardio machines. Wake up early and the place is quiet and the fruit is fresh in the gym! The only negative to the Renaissance is the price. I did not have to pay because it was a business trip but after paying $16 for valet a night, ($12 for self parking), $15 a day internet access, (free in the lobby), and expensive hotel food (of course); I am not sure this place is one of the better value hotels... unless you want to spend a lot of money. You are also taxed on the final bill for the internet service and parking. There are other Marriott's in the area that have the Marriott quality without the resort/spa price tag. Other than that, it is family friendly, with a lot of children running around, but it is good for business as well. The staff was very friendly and the bartender at the Sushi bar, Mike, serves up some good drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: garethellis36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2009 for a conference that was taking place in the hotel. Rooms - very large ("oversized"), clean, good bathrooms, comfy kingsize beds, quiet Restaurants & bars - very good, although quite expensive. "Tradewinds" does an excellent breakfast, and I also had a great steak there on the Sunday night. The sports bar in the lobby does good wings and has a good range of beers. Location - not relevant for me as everything I needed was in the hotel, but it is great if you want to go to Seaworld or Wet n Wild, and the rest of International Drive is easily accessible via the I-Ride trolley system, which stops right outside the hotel lobby. Other - the staff were very friendly and helpful, and I only have praise for them. The internet access in the rooms is not free, but if you are fortunate you will be able to receive the WIFI signal from the lobby, where it IS free. There is a decent gym and a nice pool. General comment - typical top-of-the-market chain hotel, i.e. big, spacious, good service but lacking a little charm and individuality. Expensive, but then I wasn't paying!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - until the housekeeping staff steals something”
Reviews.Author: D46NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Overall it is a great location and nice hotel. However, we had read on this site that things "went missing" from time to time. During our stay, someone from the hotel came into the room and stole my wifes jacket. The hotel security investigated this incident and did nothing to help. Marriott's corporate offices also told us they were not liable for anything "which has not been placed in the hotel's custody for safekeeping". So be warned, unless you check your entire suitcase each day with the front desk, they apparently feel that they have no obligation to protect the traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jerry M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had wonderful stay at the Renaissance in Orlando, across the street from Sea World. We took advantage of the summer rates and celebrated our 31st wedding anniversary on July 4th weekend. The room was excellent, clean and the bed was very comfortable. Our room location overlooked the pool area. To get to Sea World, we simply walked across the street (and parking lot). We also took advantage of the spa at the hotel which is a great anniversary gift. We thought the sports bar was a bust. Way over priced and lousy service. We didn't take in the sushi bar nor the the other restaurant. The hotel itself is miles away from a lot of the International Drive area, so we driving a car is good idea. There is a grocery store (Publix) close by to get and snacks and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Conviently Located”
Reviews.Author: geministoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Orlando Resort at SeaWorld in Orlando, Florida. The rooms were comfortable and the staff were accomodating. The lobby of the hotel is very nice, and the hotel, pool, and the outside grouds were very clean, maincured and well-kept. I had a massage at the Neu Lotus Spa, located on the second floor of the hotel, and it was a very nice spa. Although we did a get-away for two, we noted that the hotel was very kid friendly, but at the same time, that didn't impose on our romantic getaway. All of the restuarants served good food, and the breakfast buffet at Tradewinds was great, although the food was a bit in the costly side. The hotel has a 24hr Fed Ex Express and a starbucks in the lobby. The Lobby is very open and roomy. The only down side of the hotel is you have to pay for parking daily, to the tune of $13.00 per day.We plan to return and stay at this hotel with our 8 year old later this summer.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to recommend to all in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Undercover
Reviews.Content: A very short one night stay at the end of a business trip to another part of Florida. I had stayed here before and enjoyed the hotel then (pre-refurbishment) and would do so again. Great location for tourists. Just walk across the road to Seaworld. I-Trolley also stops outside. Rooms large and well appointed for a 4 star hotel. Had a wonderful breakfast buffet. Drinks and snacks in the bar also enjoyable. Staff always happy to help. Would recommend a stay at this hotel and would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: TxT97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in late June 2009 as part of a large group that was holding a conference onsite. The hotel is extremely clean and equipped with the latest amenities. The decor is updated and fitting with a Renaissance property. While I was traveling sans children, it was clearly designed with families in mind. The staff was friendly, rooms were large, beds were comfortable. Pool area was nice enough, but there wasn't anything special about that area. You can't beat the proximity to Sea World (across the street), but if you're there for Disney, I'd consider properties that are closer in. However, there is a local bus that stops in front of the resort that is an affordable (though not fast) option.

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee on reservation”
Reviews.Author: jtrips1212
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance because we were taking our 11 year old daughter to discovery cove and to seaworld for her birthday. We definitely wanted to enjoy the proximity to both parks. We arrived about 8:30 pm the first night of our reservation and were told that they had NO ROOMS. A group who had been staying there had missed their flight. So rather than honor our reservation, they gave away our room to the guests who had NO reservation. They then sent us to a hotel 4 miles away which they told us was equal in quality. The marriott courtyard was NOT equal in quality. To make matters worse, they had no rooms there either when we got there. So they moved us to yet another hotel--again, nowhere near equal quality. We were told that we could check in to the Renaissance the next day at 4pm. So in addition to not being close to the parks we were visiting, and the inconvenience of two different hotels, we were out of a hotel for the afternoon--we had to check out of one hotel by 11 or 12, and we couldn't check in to the Renaissance until 4pm. Their compensation to us for all of this was to offer us free parking--wow. Further, when I said I thought I had a guaranteed reservation, they said we had a reservation, but it wasn't necessarily guaranteed. What hotel has a policy to give away a confirmed/reserved room to people who do not have a reservation???
