Reviews.Title: “Last minute choice - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KipperPhill
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The staff were all efficient and friendly. The room was very clean, large and nicely furnished (excellent television with films and tv on demand). The pool area was excellent and well staffed - towels were collected and cold flannels handed out. Excellent location for Sea World (obviously), Acquatica and I Drive - but Disney and Universal would only be a 15-20 minute drive. Internet was $15 a day and you have to pay $12 a night to park - but the rate we paid was low so we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jamvpi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for a business trip and was very impressed with every aspect of my stay. I am very picky when it comes to hotel stays...the Renaissance did not disappoint. At check-in, I was offered a complementary glass of champagne, which really tasted great after a long day. When I first checked in, I got a room on the 8th floor next to the elevator. Within minutes I could tell it was going to be too noisy, so I politely asked to be moved. There was no problem at all and I was immediately moved to a room facing Sea World on the 9th floor with a balcony! This was great as Sea World puts on a fantastic Fireworks display every night! The bed was very comfortable with nice linens and lots of fluffy pillows. The Starbucks onsite was great as I didn't want a big breakfast, so it was perfect! The hotel is really pretty and convenient to walk to Sea World. I would definitely stay here again. I also used the onsite spa for manicure/pedicure and would highly recommend as well!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to conduct Business”
Reviews.Author: Holidayyearlong
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 day business meet at this hotel and I would rate this as the best to conduct a business meet of any size. We booked about 500 rooms and had engaged various facilities of the hotel to conduct our meetings, seminars and talk shows. The facilities are top of the line and the services offered in organizing the event was truly outstanding. The coordination between the staff of various departments of the hotel ensured that the meet was a success by all means. Right from the breakfast to organizing a talk show with over 700 people in the audience, every bit of the schedule was taken care of with precision. I have attended several seminars and business meets at top hotels but I would rate this as my best experience so far.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Beautiful!! Kid Friendly!! Convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: JB&RB
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here 6/7-6/13. We chose Sea World this year over Disney to see what it was all about, and we have been to Disney the past 5 years in a row. We got there about 12:30 pm and were skeptical that we would get a room this early. But we went to the front desk and 5 minutes later we had room keys in hand with exactly what we requested.The room was very clean and the beds were amazing. The atrium is beautiful, glass elevators are amazing (my daughter loved riding on them). The pool is very nice with the kiddie pool right beside the kids play ground. The hotel is directly across the parking lot from Sea World, took us maybe 10 minutes walking from our room door to the front gate of the park. The only bad things we found were the prices for eating inside the hotel are VERY expensive ($15 for a burger with fries). Dont plan on eating inside the hotel like you can in Disney World for a reasonable price. We went out to eat every day we were there, places to eat are pretty close by. Starbucks sign said thery closed at 6pm but they were closed everyday by 3pm? Rooms dont have microwaves for those of you who have small children and you have to request a refrigerator because the ones already in the rooms dont work. Also having to pay for parking ($12 a day) is in my mind crazy. Also having to take a shuttle to other parks except Sea World you had to make reservations 90 min in advance and the pickup times are preset so you have to pick from the times avaliable. It makes you feel you are on their schedule and not your own. But overall we had a great time and would go back in the future. But only after we run our welcome out in Disney the next several years!

Reviews.Title: “way cool”
Reviews.Author: carosurf
Reviews.Content: the overall ambience of this hotel is so great...very sleek, simple furnishings in lobby and rooms. lotsof amenities like a starbucks and gorgeous plasma tv's scattered around showing underwater stuff....toiletries in room were above par and bed and furnishings in our large room were great. The pool area is nice with 2 hot tubs and a grille poolside. being across the street from seaworld entrance (you can walk) is a big plus if you are going to the park during your stay. we had a room with a view facing seaworld on the 8th floor and we had an unequaled view of fireworks at 9:50om while sitting in our comfy chairs facing the big window. very cool! The only drawbacks were minor...you had to pay to park (but you will not have to pay the parking fee in the sea world parking lot) and no free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous resort with fabulous rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted with a glass of champagne at the front desk. The staff rushed to the elevators to press the button for us. This great service continued throughout our stay. The rooms were beautiful with coffered ceilings, large bathrooms with dual vanities, bright beautiful showers and tubs, big comfy beds with soft sheets, really super furnishings. We asked for a room with a view of Sea World and staff obliged. On our last night we were able to watch the fireworks from our room. The grounds were nicely manicured, with attractive plantings and a nice pool. There were two hot tubs but one was not working during our stay. There is a large children's wading pool but it is not a themed pool area. A bar area was a nice feature at the pool but it closed at 6PM. This was disappointing since we never made it to the pool until after that time. It was one of the features we were looking for in a hotel. There are no laundry facilities at this hotel but you can do your laundry at the next door hotel, they have an agreement. Also, parking is only $12 a day if you park your own car. This was a bargain since they provide a free shuttle to Universal Studios saving you parking fees. The shuttle runs until 2AM, you just have to give 90 minutes notice. Great amenity!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: grayt63
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Beautiful inside and out especially the pool area. Would recommend this place to everyone especially if going to Seaworld. Also easy access to the trolley which takes you to all the great shopping in Orlando. Their fitness center is probably the best I have ever been in. Fantastic equipment !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GANDL100
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews on this hotel and was amazed at some of the comments. Having stayed at some of the hotels on International Drive already I was amazed by this hotel, the others are extremely run down/basic and very poor. The hotel staff could not have done enough for us, the room was clean and very spacious with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We got a glass of champagne on arrival, now I dont know of another hotel that adds that special touch in the same area! The hotel food no matter which place you ate in was brlliant. The buffet breakfast although either $15 per person for continental or $20 per person for full buffet was maybe a bit pricier than other places on International Drive but the difference here was that the food was of quality, it also kept us going until dinner. Having ate at places like Ponderosa etc all you can eat for $3.99, these are awful buffets in comparison. The hotel was in an ideal location, steps from Seaworld and the bus stop and I trolley stop right outside. The hotel is beautiful inside. I would say to the other people who have complained about the rooms and whatever else, go and stay in the Quality Inn, or the Holiday Inn, or the Wyndham Orlando, then compare, let us know what special touches and service you get there! The Spa is beautiful and offers a full range of treatments and there is a 24 hour fitness centre which we also made use of. The pool is fantastic and plenty loungers, you also get provided with towels. The food at the pool is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: norouzi_sanaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 6 nights, from the outside it looked great, even inside was pretty and looked well maintained. Once inside the room is another story, altough the room looks nice but it is quite unconfortable. The couch is rugged, the bed sheets are rough on the skin, the shower head was too low and my husband couldn't stand under it (he is 6feet). The TV kept cutting out even when weather was good, also lot of things were missing in the room like ironing board and hair dryer. The maintenance never replaced anything properly we had to call many times to ask for more coffee, she would never replace it when she cleaned the room. Also, I went to the spa for a pedicure, the girl did not speak proper english and at one point brought 3 types of exfoliants and ask me which I wanted, I chose one. The at the end when I went to pay they told me it was 15$ extra for that exfoliant, I told them nobody told me she apologized but did not deduct. so a 55$ pedicure became 84$ with taxes and surcharges. On the 5th day, I unfortunately forgot my Ipod Touch on the desk in the room and when I came back the room was cleaned and not Ipod Touch was there. I filed a report with security but obviously nothing was done. All in all I will never go back, and definetly will advise peaple no to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: flitterhopper2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Impressive atrium. Big comfortable rooms. Modern, great amenities. Huge pool with hardly anyone in it. We'll come back. Parking is expensive high speed internet available but not free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for families...!”
Reviews.Author: Templar999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 14 nights.. perfect location, fantastic pool, excellent staff service, great rooms. Would stay again but not on the 6th floor neat to the main lifts... the noise from the mechanism required the purchase of earplugs. Also the atrium is a little noisy when there is a conferance in town... we had the Harley Davidson club in the hotle for 3 nights...! The hotel is mostly aimed at the business market but remains an ideal choice for the family. The pool was perfectly warm and clean. The one worry was that the carpet in the room was dirty and the room on the whole was not well cleaned on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: AlLeGrand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Orlando Resort at Seaworld while attending a conference. From the moment I arrived until checkout the experience was nothiong less than I would expect from a first-class American hotel. The staff were cheerful, poliite and helpful. Food was excellent (the Sushi bar particularly good) and the overall experience was of individual attention and service while staying in a very large resort hotel. The only slightly below standard experience was the Starbucks in the lobby. Talk about sullen! Those girls were a bunch of seriously unhappy barristas!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing every time!”
Reviews.Author: baleo065
Reviews.Content: I visit the Renaissance Sea World hotel fairly frequently and always seem to have the same excellent service. We were in town for Cirque de Soleil show and the hotel has a great central location to all going on in Orlando. The hotel seems enormous but you would never be able to tell because everytime I have been you hardly notice any hustle and bustle. The rooms are always immaculate and I have never slept in a more comfortable bed except maybe at the Renaissance Vinoy, but pretty sure those are the same mattresses. One of the things I love about the hotel is the calm and soothing atmosphere, the only thing I didn't like was that the middle bar closes so early, especially on the weekend. It is really cool bar with great lighting, ambiance and stylish seating arrangements and could would be a great place to hang out with friends later at night. They do have another place to grab a few drinks and some bar food but its more of a sports bar type place. Plus they have some great deals on room prices if you go at the right time, check out the advance purchase rates ahead of time for a steal, you have to pay up front but you get a significant discount. Also you don't have to valet park your car if you don't want to, will save you a few bucks at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: luvs2read058
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for a Conference. We were treated like Kings and Queens. Our room, a King Suite, was beautiful and very spacious. All of the staff were polite and very friendly and very very helpful. The meals that were served during the conference were delicious. All of our needs were met quickly and very efficiently. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel- calm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MMcF
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 6 nights. The hotel is of a very good standard, the public areas are very spacious and relaxed and the bedrooms are excellent. We were able to walk to Sea World and Aquatica which saved parking charges. Really good food in the sports bar and the Starbucks in the lobby was great for breakfast. For Orlando, this hotel has an upmarket, hushed quality that is so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: mama_may97
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Renaissance April 13 - April 16. We had an extremely enjoyable stay. We loved the location, walking distance from Sea World and they provide a shuttle to Discovery Cove, free of charge. The room, as well as the bathroom, was large. We had a room with a view of Sea World and could watch the fireworks every night. They have tennis, basketball, tetherball, bocce, miniature golf, a playground, sand volleyball, a large pool and two hot tubs, truly something for everyone. This place seemed more of resort. We ordered pizza from room service one night and it was great. Otherwise, we ordered from a take out service the other two nights. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning on going to Sea World or Discovery Cove. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: bryansmommy
Reviews.Content: This was my first time traveling to Florida & I absolutely LOVED this hotel. We had originally booked the Westgate Lake Resort & started reading through the reviews on tripadvisor and immediately changed to Renaissance. We got a great price for a week stay that included 3 tickets to Sea World and Aquatica. We arrived early - around 2:30 p.m. (check in is at 4) so I wasn't expecting to get into our room right away. We originally booked a King room, but 2 days before our arrival I requested a double bed room. The clerk told me there were no double bed rooms available (as she greeted me with a cool glass of champagne), but if I didn't mind waiting she would upgrade us to a King with a balcony overlooking Sea World so our soon could watch the Sea World fire works every night. Of course we said yes. The lobby area and the hotel grounds are amazing & kept us busy exploring. Around 4:30 the clerk came to find me and apologized for the long wait...(there was no need for an apology) and then said because we waited so long she would give our room a $100 credit to be used anywhere in the hotel & didn't need to pay for parking! It's beautiful, the food was great (we had room service & ate at the Tradewind restaurant) - it was a tad pricey, but we didn't pay since we had the credit. The housekeeping staff was very nice and always greeted us whenever they saw us. Other staff members were very nice as well. They always gave our son little blow up toys or balls & offered to take family pictures for us. The pictures of this hotel are very elegant - and may make you think it's not too kid friendly - but it is EXTREMELY kid friendly & it seemed like they were all having a good time! It is close to Walmart, the hospital, post office, Sea World, International Drive, etc. We walked to Sea World a few times - directly across the street. I am SO happy we changed to the Renaissance & I HIGHLY recommend it! We had a WONDERFUL time - and I hope that we are able to visit again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: turquiosedreams
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Renaissance 4/10-4/14. Every employee I encountered was welcoming. I requested early check-in and a King room. Both were accomodated (even though I had booked through Priceline.com). I received a complementary glass of champagne at check-in, which I greatly enjoyed. My room was large, clean, had a lovely view of the landscaped grounds and pool area. It was quiet. The only negative was the price of the food at their restaurants. I ordered a muffin and coffee at Tradewinds on my first morning which came to $6.00. The muffin was smaller than the ones you can bake at home. If I had known how it was a mini muffin, I certainly would not have ordered it. When I asked the server about it, she just smiled and said "I know", but did nothing else. She didn't seem to have a strong comprehension of the english language. There are no restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. I didn't have a rental car, so I took the I-trolley twice to go shopping and to eat out. It was convenient and economical. The pool area is nice and very clean. Again, the most positive aspect of staying at this hotel were the employees. Everyone was pleasant, ready to offer assistance if needed, and seemed to enjoy being there!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property next to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: SkyPiGG
Reviews.Content: We arrived VERY early (before 10AM), during Spring Break, and they still allowed us to check in. In fact, they put us in a very spacious corner room that had recently been renovated. The hotel was very clean, and the lobby is quite spectacular. We had zero problems with noise. Two of the 7 elevators were set to stop on every floor so that a certain group did not have to push any buttons (I think it was against their religion). This was annoying, but we got over it. The housekeeping, and front-of-the-house staff were very courteous. Tradewinds (the main-restaurant) had a very good (but expensive) breakfast buffet, but the wait-staff was terrible. If you don't beat the rush for breakfast, you'll have to wait a long time for a table because there is no bus boys, and the waiters seemed too busy to turn tables. I counted TEN un-turned tables while we were waiting. Most of our wait-staff seemed unsure of themselves, and spoke broken English. We had lunch there once and it was mediocre, and extremely overpriced. We subsequenly drove a few miles to International Drive where there are tons of other choices. The location of the property is great! We walked to SeaWorld three times. Aquatica is nearby, but too far to walk. The hotel has a shuttle, but it has limted seating and you have to make an appointment. We did not utilize any of the spa offerings, but the pool was very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckymlc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Renaissance and it is truly beautiful. We arrived on April 6, 2008 at about 11:30 P.M. and were notified they were sold out of the double queen rooms. We were upgraded to the hospitality suite and parking was comped for the full week. (not bad considering parking is $12 a day) The suite was enormous, included a sofabed, 2 chairs, queen bed, and full dining room table. The major perk of the hospitality suite is that we could sit back and enjoy the Seaworld fireworks from our room every nite. The only gripes I had were that pool is not heated. Cold Cold pool. Also the restaurant prices are obnoxious. $12 hot dog and $15 burger! We had to go out to eat every nite.... You definitely need a rental car if you are staying here. There are no restaurants in walking distance. I am 100% certain I would consider staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We just keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: Wemby
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at the Renaissance Resort up unitl two years ago..now we wont stay anywhere else. The service is fantastic, the food excellent and the staff are amazing. We took my niece and nephew (10 and 6) and the staff treat them like royalty. Breakfast in the Hotel was a joy as the staff fussed the children and made sure they had everything they needed even going out of their way to find us some Salami for breakfast. There is a good mix of conference and tourist clients and the pool area is never crowded. The standard of service and food is carried throughout the hotel from the valet to the Manager who welcomed us personally. The rooms were clean and of good size and the bathrooms immaculate. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded for free!”
Reviews.Author: drinking_a_smoothie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 82$ on priceline.com. It was worth much more than we got it for. It has a sushi restaurant/bar, sports bar, and higher priced restaurant. The pool is lovely, not too crowded b/c everyone is out at Seaworld across the street! The hotel provides a free shuttle to those who don't want to walk. They also shuttle for free to Universal. (Disney is a charge, i think 15$). We told them it was our anniversary and they upgraded us to the beautiful king sized executive suite for free! Our room was HUGE and it was a corner room which had 3 big windows letting in the gorgeous Florida sun. I don't know what the regular rooms were like, but I think they were probably pretty nice. The only negative is they charge 15$ a day for internet use, and parking was 12$ daily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Love
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day trip to Florida. We got a great rate through priceline 85$ a night. We had a king suite with a balcony that overlooked Sea World. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. We requested early check in and a room with a balcony and got both. We checked in at 12:00pm on Monday. Our original room was not ready yet so they went ahead and gave us another room so we would not have to wait. The pool grounds were gorgeous and well kept. I only wish the pool was slightly larger. I loved that they had a Starbucks in the hotel too. The only downside is that they close at 3:00 every day. I wish it would have been open a little later. Overall, the hotel is great and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: girlinpa78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. I have been to Florida several times, but this was my first time at this hotel. My reason for the vacation was to get away from the cold weather, relax, and catch some Spring Training baseball games. It was a great getaway! The hotel was fairly easy to find as it's located right beside Seaworld. You can literally walk from the hotel into Seaworld. From the minute we arrived at the hotel, we knew it was a good choice. It's a large, modern, and clean hotel. It honestly caters to adults/business people. The rooms had queen or king beds with flat screen tv's. The bathroom had a double sink with a shower/tub combo and was adequate. The hotel had a lot of ammenities including a Kinko's and a spa. The pool, outdoor garden area, and gazebos were beautiful. It was nice to sit out at night and get some fresh air. They even have some game tables outside, as well as an arcade inside. I liked the two bar areas with flat screens in the lobby. There was plenty of room to spread out and relax. A lot of people brought their laptops and were sitting around working on them. We found the Starbucks in the lobby helpful as well. We just wished it stayed open a little while longer as it closed early in the afternoon. The Tradewinds restaurant was pretty good. We ate breakfast there most days. They have a buffet or a menu was available. We chose the buffet, which was nice. Beverages were included and they had a lot of items to choose from, including made to order omlettes, waffles, and pancakes. We ate room service once and that was good, too. The service was quick, which is great if you're in a hurry (like to catch a plane). If/when we return to the area (which will probably be next year), we agreed that we'd stay here again without hesitation. If you can get a discounted rate using AAA or some sort of a package deal, it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice balance between business guests and the Disney Crowd”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Orlando for one night to attend a conference at the hotel. The conference facilities are very nice and the rooms are comfortable. There is a FedEx/Kinko's on site and there are a few computers available to print out boarding passes. The hotel has a lot of nice things going for it. For one, it is right off the expressway so access is easy. It is also a stone's throw away from SeaWorld which makes it very convenient. The atrium is nice and large and the rooms are very large and comfortable. The bathrooms are basic but large. Kids would have more than enough space in these rooms. I didnt have a car, but there seemed to be ample parking. The restaurants are fine, I ate at the sports bar which had a nice menu and was reasonably priced. There is a bar in the center of the hotel that also serves sushi. Check-in and service is average, nothing superlative, but nothing to convince me not to return. The bell staff and concierge are friendly and helpful The amenities are nice. The fitness center has free weights, cardio equipment and an entire separate stretch room. Even though I travelled for business, I would bring my family back here to stay because the pool area is large and has a separate children's play area, a basketball court, a sand volleyball court, a putting green, and a bocce ball lane. There are also some very nice running trails nearby. And a game room. In summary, this hotel was very comfortable and has plenty of nice amenities for the business traveller and the family vacation crowd.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: drc1017
Reviews.Content: Having not been to Orlando in years prior to this short business trip, I did not know what to expect from the hotels there. Having said that, I really liked this hotel, it is beautiful and centered around a HUGE atrium that lets in tons of light. I was not expecting that when I walked into this place. Check in was easy and I was assigned an "interior" room which meant I was overlooking the huge lobby. I had french doors and a nice terrace. Some people had their French doors wide open, but I did notice a few birds flying around in there so I didn't really want to invite them in :) The room itself was huge! High ceilings and very spacious. King bed, full couch, which I presume opened into a bed, but I didn't check. Work desk and a dresser with flat screen on it. With all of these things there was still tons of room that was unused. The bathroom was big too with double sinks. I felt like the countertop was very high in here so it may be hard for kids but supervision it would be OK. The one annoying thing is that people kept sliding menus under my door - I would hope the hotel would police that better, it made me feel less secure somewhat, not to mention it is annoying plus I wouldn't think the hotel would want these local places taking patrons from their own restaurants, which there are a couple of in the hotel. If I was in the Orlando area again I would definitely look into staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fading fast.”
Reviews.Author: Gene_Augusta
Reviews.Content: At one time, this property was one of the premier hotels in Orlando. Its former glory can be still seen in the spectacular atrium. Alas! Nothing lasts for ever. These days, this hotel is in desperate need of major upgrades. This hotel is located just across the street from the Sea World parking lot. For those without a car, a bus stop is located just outside the main lobby. I-shuttle and Lynx bus can take you to other parks and attractions. During my three days at the Renaissance, staff always looked a bit overwhelmed. At any time, there was only one person working the front desk. Be prepared to wait on check in. We did, however, receive consistent good dinner advice and discount coupons from the concierge. My room was on the 9th floor. It was large with two queen beds. Furnishings were old, beat up, and dirty. Minibar was empty; its grubby shell powered off. Flat screen TV often flickered and at times lost reception completely. Carpet and walls were grimy. Bedding was clean, mattresses comfortable, pillows plush and plentiful. Bathroom had a large counter with two sinks. Bathtub had a few stains. Bath faucets had seen better days. I had one lunch and one breakfast at the hotel's Tradewind restaurant. My Cuban sandwich was fair at best. The waiter was very attentive. Breakfast buffet was pitiful. Continental costs $15; full breakfast will set you back $20. Selections were limited. Pastries were cold and a bit stale. If you just looking for a convenient place to crash for a few days in the Sea World area and use Priceline.com you might like this place. On the other hand, if you pay full price and expect luxury, you likely will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Xmas”
Reviews.Author: jmolidaveed
Reviews.Content: We spent Xmas and New Year at this fantastic hotel. It was our fourth visit and still continues to be our favourite. All of the staff are excellent and cannot do enough to help you. The public areas are outstanding and the rooms are very clean and spacious. All rooms have coffee makers and fridges. We have had such a fantastic holiday there that we have already booked to go again this Christmas. We have been going to Florida for over twenty years and can honestly say that this is in our opinion one of the best places to stay around Orlando We were lucky enough to have an upgrade to a suite overlooking Sea World - Wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Seaworld but also Disney”
Reviews.Author: HLAlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights after 2 weeks travelling around Florida. We had requested a slightly early check-in which we were offered although also offered a room upgrade if we waited. Balcony rooms are nice and worth the wait if you can upgrade. Location is excellent for SeaWorld - just across the car park although be aware that the hotel charge guests 12USD per day for parking (which is a bit cheeky considering the hotel is only accessible by car, therefore 4 stars awarded not 5) so it's not like you'll save money. BUT it does mean that adult guests you can take advantage of the free beer in SeaWorld and just walk home! The other advantage with the location is you're right on the junction for the I-4 which means you can get to Disney in 10-15 mins without having to go anywhere near the highly congested International Drive (aka I-Drive). Whilst I-Drive is nearby it's not walkable so you'd still need to drive if you want to go out to the bars, restaurants, shops and mini golf that are located further north (and you would over a longer stay as the hotel restaurants are a bit limited and pricey) or I suppose you could get that elusive green trolley bus that stops outside although I wouldn't want to use that regularly as they are very slow and not frequent. Hotel itself is a massive venue, geared up for meetings, incentives, conferences, events which isn't necessarily a bad thing (rooms are large and well appointed catering for business guests) but it's certainly not cosy. Pool area is nice and spacious and a good area to relax in between themeparks. Overall would definitely recommend if you want quick access to SeaWorld and Disney (and Busch), probably not if the Universal parks and the lively I-Drive scene is more your thing. P.S. Take a sick bag if you go to the new Shamu show, 'Dreams' and you are even slightly cynical.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Travelozzy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru Virgin as part of a package (first time I've done that in years but proved worthwhile, as you get free parking!). We chose it as it was near SeaWorld which was the main reason for our visit to Orlando and the location is just perfect - just a 5 min walk across the SeaWorld car park and you're in the park... Check in was a pleassant experience with a complimentry glass of fizzy stuff and they switched our room to a outside facing one without any issues (we were orginally offered one facing the atrium but wanted to see SeaWorld!) The room was a great size with plenty of room for us and our 2 year old and all her toys. Housekeeping were great and didn't even seem to mind the mess made when our daughter was ill. Very effcient and pleasant. I didn't get to actually use the spa but it looked great and the gated pool was perfect for those of us with little ones (Please note it is gated - not padlocked as described by one reviewer!!) There is also cute little playground ideal for under 6's. The pool area is very clean and well designed and not too busy even though the hotel was full. Food was fairly good throughout hotel - must try's are the wings in the sports bar and the breakfast in the restaurant but for a real treat ask reception to give you the menu for Maggianos and either book a table or takeout! All in all we had a great stay and found the staff helpful and efficient. I would definatley stay here again - especially if I-drive and SeaWorld are the main reasons for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: Came for a convention. Very nice public areas, but rooms are worn and dated. On plus side, rooms very large; can request refrigerator which is delivered after check-in; got nice glass of champagne on check-in, great staff, clean, friendly and accommodating cleaning staff. On negative side, expensive parking, mixture of unmatched furnishings that are old, worn, and dated, as is carpet and bathroom. Relatively small bathroom and closet (given size of room). Request for clean linens and extra towels honored on first day but not thereafter. Room not up to normal Renaissance Hotel standards, but acceptable. Peabody is a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AngDew
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to UK after a month away travelling all over Florida and taking in a cruise. We arrived Orlando International and proceeded to Renaissance Sea World. What a fantastic hotel. We were booked in for 2 nights, but loved it so much decided to stay for 4. We had a top floor room overlooking the pool area, the room was fantastic with super king bed, turn down service every night and fantastic view. Bathroom was very spacious with all the usual shampoo, conditioner, bath gel etc. We loved this hotel so much that we booked it for our nights stay before flying home on 8th December. The only downside was having to return to UK at all. Florida is a place we have visited many times and this hotel is up amongst the best, a true 5* in every sense. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is directly opposite Sea World, but transportation is definitely needed to get out and about around Orlando to enjoy it to the full. Restaurants in the hotel are really good, but no others are within walking distance. Thank you to all staff and management at Renaissance, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1015Dad
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on a warm Thursday night. Had a quick look around and was generally awestruck. The hotel atrium is massive with two seperate bars, which have a really welcoming atmosphere. There are also waterfalls and quiet corners in the foyer, along with a starbucks, gift shop, fed ex etc. The rooms are really big, with a 32" TV, fridge and coffee maker. Every floor at the hotel has 8 ice machines, which is a nice touch as you have an ice bucket in your room. There is also an iron and ironing board. Our room overlooked Seaworld, which is about a 5 minute walk away, there is also a bus stop outside. Free parking and free scheduled transport to the attractions. This was our first time in Orlando and after looking around I Drive, I think we made the right choice. You can't really walk to any restaurants from the hotel, so you'll need transport, however the hotel food is reasonably priced and good. There is a well equipped gym and the pool is massive and heated. There is a Spa but I didn't go in. We had the time of our lives in Orlando and the Renaissance was one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance SeaWorld was Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBabe53
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a last minute romantic getaway to the Renaissance SeaWorld Resort in Orlando and had a fabulous time! I thought it would be more family oriented since it is across from SeaWorld Orlando but it was great for our little romantic jaunt. They even have a spa called the Neu Lotus Spa and we were able to do a couples massage...a very nice touch. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We booked our room on their website... www.RenaissanceSeaWorldOrlando.com since it stated that the lowest rate is guaranteed on their website. Cheers! Visitor from PA

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: Buddy2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Not badly priced either cannot fault it. Lovely bar area, really clean and the turndown service all adds to the whole experience. Was most impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: We recently returned after a two-night stay after having spent five-nights at the Orlando Marriott World Center. This Renaissance was very nice and the location couldn't be beat. You walk across a large parking lot and you are right at the main gate to Sea World. I was fortunate enough to redeem my Marriott Rewards Points here and they upgraded me to an Executive King Room that overlooked a very attractive atrium. Everything was clean and the staff were knowledgable and attentive. Everything in the atrium has a nautical theme with a video screen above the main bar displaying fish and other forms of aquatic life. It's a nice touch. There is also another bar which appeared pretty cool where you can watch sports and news on a few flatscreens. Aside from the bars, you have a couple of restaurants to choose from (Mist and Tradewinds) that seemed decent. Our buffet breakfast at Tradewinds was good in terms of both food and service. Parking ran about 12 to self-park and 16 for valet. We opted for valet in light of the 4 dollar difference. Everyting went smoothly and the attendants were quick to help. We would definitely stay again when we return to SeaWorld

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ThePlayers
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. All staff were curteous and nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were large with 2 kings size beds which were really comfortable. Maid service was good. Bathrooms again spacious with 2 sinks. Had a high floor room facing outside, as I would have felt too claustophobic in a room overlooking atrium - I think these room are ok if you are only staying a few nights on a conference. The hotel is pretty geared up to holding these, but it did not spoil our stay, even though the hotel was sometime filled with people in suits on laptops and we were in our Tee Shirts and shorts ! Mears shuttles were included in our Virgin package and once we obtained the times etc, they were very reliable and most of the drivers were great. We ate in the restaurant several times, food good but a little pricey but thats to be expected with the reputation of the hotel, which is considered to be one of the best in the area. We travelled with our 16 year old son who loved the Gym and jaquzzi, not sure if I would have picked this hotel if I was travelling with younger children. All in all we were thoroughly delighted with this hotel as the rest of our party were staying at the Port Orleans resort and we decided to change our booking at the last minute, wanting a little more grown up atmosphere after spending all day in the parks - this is certainly what we got and we would go back again to this hotel with no question.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gareth198
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on honeymoon in April 2008 and were very happy with our choice. This hotel is slightly more expensive than some of the budget hotels in Orlando but the extra money was well worth it. The hotel was very well maintained and very clean. The maids come twice a day, leaving a weather report for the following day in the afternoon. All the staff were very attentive. It is close to Seaworld, Aquatica & Discovery Cove but the location itself was set away from the other busy areas and was pretty quiet. It is a good base to visit all the other attractions Orlando has to offer. The hotel has 4 restaurants, large pool area (with jacuzzi), gym, health spa and it's own Starbucks, so there is plenty to keep you amused should you decide to take a break from the shops or theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanh1971
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel, very friendly staff , The Expedia office arranged all our transfers to the attractions they were very helpful. The maid service was very good, Our room was cleaned beautifully every day, clean towels etc and chocolates every evening. Great breakfast in the Tradewinds restaurant, staff were very friendly. The Sports Bar was great, nice food. I was very surprised to read one review that said the towels were dirty and covered in hair. I find that hard to believe after our experience. We had no problems at all. A very nice Hotel, great location just opposite Sea World, bus stop outside the Hotel for the I Trolley and Lynx buses. It was perfect, we can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated 5 star”
Reviews.Author: owlerj2510
Reviews.Content: For our wedding anniversary, my husband and I wanted to get away for a weekend on I-Drive in Orlando. I took a chance through Priceline to book a nice hotel for less $$, and used Priceline's 'name your price' feature to find a 4 star hotel - boy did that gamble pay off when Priceline booked us at the Renaissance! From the time that we checked in until we reluctantly had to check out, we received top-notch service from a very friendly, professional staff. We only dined once at the hotel while we were there, when we had room service on our last night, and the food was great! The room was spacious, with a very comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. All of the decor in the hotel's lobby area was stunning. I have stayed in 5-star hotels that were not as nice as this one. If you are looking for a beautiful hotel and great service at a reasonable price, I highly recommend the Renaissance Resort. You will not be dissappointed! We will definitely be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: krissy85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really is nice and the rooms are big and comfortable. The rooms have a big bathroom, flat screen television, a refrigerator and a big terrace etc. The staff were really helpful and service minded. It has a ok location, but we had to take a taxi alomst every place that we where going exept seaworld. If there is one thing i didn`t like was the water in the hotel, it smelled like sewer and it did not taste any good. But bottle water works to, so I would definitly recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kargraManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my family from staying at this beautiful hotel situated directly from seaworld, the service we received from arriving and during our stay was absolutely out of this world,the staff were excellent and very helpful and the special touches when the maid leaves chocolates on your pillow.The swimming pool area was brilliant and also volley ball,tennis,table tennis,basketball and pool were available,the i ride trolley stop and the local no 50 bus to disney was directly outside the hotel.the room we were offered was overlooking seaworld with a balcony so we could watch the fireworks and had a great view. on our next visit to florida we would most definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but i would definitely not stay again !”
Reviews.Author: BEVNorthEast_England
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel expecting a 5 star hotel as noted in the virgin holidays brochure, they would be lucky to get a 3+ star from us. The best bits were the audotorium, pool and starbucks. The rooms were dirty and small, the so called fresh towels everyday had hairs on them. We didnt let any of this ruin our holiday as after all it was a holiday of a lifetime. We thoroughly enjoyed universal studios, disney, seaworld, aquatica and bush gardens. We got the trolley to international drive outside the hotel very easily. Nice restaurants at pointe orlando, our favourite was maggianos little Italy, looked expensive but was quite a decent price. Overall we had a fantastic hotel, but we would not go with virgin holidays again, next time we will go with our usual tour operator thomsons and we would definitely not stay at the renaiscance again.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: sandy666
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Renaissance we were speechless at the sheer size and decor. There was 3 of us (2 x adults, 1 x child) the staff were very helpful, the room was very spacious and was constantly spoilt by maids leaving chocolates on the pillow. My daughter who is 5 years old loved the hotel and especially the pool, she was also presented when we arrived with a cuddly seaworld toy. Even though the hotel was away from shops the I RIDE stop was outside so we could still get around. Also the great thing about this hotel that it was opposite seaworld so we spent the majority of the time there and after a long walk round - you could see the renaissance across the carpark, so it was a comforting thought not having to travel far back from a theme park. i would recomend this hotel to everyone - i would definatly come back here again. the only downside that it did not have a small shop you could buy milk, juice etc

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location for All Parks”
Reviews.Author: GeordiesfromNE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic holiday. This hotel is in a great location for Seaworld and the new Aquatica Waterpark. Its only 8-10 minutes from all other parks. As previously said this hotel has recently been refurbed and the layout is fantastic. Pool facilities were great - also had volleyball, tennis, table tennis etc. etc. Rooms were really big which meant a family had succificient room. and included a safe and fridge with no restrictions on placing your own drinks/food in them. We also had a turn down service each evening with chocolates left on bed and weather details for following day. By booking with Virgin we received free self parking and also holiding a frequent flyer card you receive 10% in bars/restaurants. Staff in Starbucks were very pleasant each morning we arrived for our morning fix of latte/hot chocolate. Concierge gave out great directions for shops/chemists etc. It certainly didn't feel like your typical Orlando hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMorins
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was a wonderful hotel in a great location. Because of hurricane/tropical storm Fay we were forced to actually spend alot of time in the hotel, and we had a great time. The hotel has many amenities including 4 restaurants and a Starbucks. The rooms were very large with spacious bathrooms. The beds were very comfy and the views of SeaWorld were great. We got a great rate through Priceline at $65 per night. I would have paid twice that for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando, hands down!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: economyclass707
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the best hotel I have ever stayed at in the entire Orlando area. I live in Florida so I have visited Orlando my entire life for quick weekend getaways. Stayed at numerous Disney properties including Contemporary, and Grand Floridian. Also have stayed at the Peabody, Omni & Ritz and JW Marriott nearby and none of them can compare to the overall quality and service of this hotel. Firstly, for the price this hotel is the best value for money compared to some of the others like the Peabody or JW who charge random crazy rates depeding on what convention is going on (although you can get off-season priceline rates to the Peabody for around $60/night). I was at the Renaissance for business and the location can't be beat. It is one light from I-4 West and 2 lights from I-4 East bound. To get to the convention center you don't even have to go on any main roadways, and even if you do it is only the extremely quiet end of I-Drive. Also, I liked that I could get to the Premium Outlets mall via the back of I-Drive quicker than if I took the highway. The hotel itself had great service from the moment you valet. At check-in they offer you a complimentary glass of Moet champagne and your room elevators are literally 15 feet away from the reception desk so you don't have to carry your bags far. The hotel has a great recently remodeled atrium lobby along with remodled rooms. The rooms have raised unique ceilings that are unlike any hotel I have stayed at. Also, the rooms are extra large so there's plenty of room for your luggage as well as a sitting area to relax. If you can, get a room with an interior balcony. I would reccomend that over an exterior balcony if you are there for business. The bathrooms and tv stand are all granite The hotel also has a full service FedEx Kinkos in the lobby. The sports bar has mediocre food but the furnishing is top notch as well as all the HD tv's they had. None of that basic Vizio brand here, only LG and Sony. The sushi bar in the center of the hotel had great food as well as extremely nice furnishings. It would be used much more if it wasn't in the middle of the lobby. They have no music playing anywhere in the restaurant so the ambiance is pretty dull. The hotel also had a great pool area with a pool bar and full size tennis, basketball, and I'm pretty sure volleyball court. The fitness center was also great with nice gym quality machines and fresh towels and headphones placed on every machine. All the treadmills have built-in tvs and there is complimentary fruit and larger towels for when you are done. Overall I would absoloutely stay here when I am back in town no matter if I was there for business or pleasure. It's a shame all Renaissance's aren't like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Anticipation”
Reviews.Author: mlhflorida
Reviews.Content: I haven't even stayed here yet and can't believe the wonderful experience I've had with the staff already. I have booked a 2 night stay for my children and myself for this Labor Day weekend. I am a single mom with two boys and I am always trying to make everything they experience very special. I am on a limited budget and use Priceline quite often. We travel to Orlando several times a year for swim meets and usually get a hotel in I-Drive. I usually work 6 days a week and this trip I was looking for relaxation and not so much hustle and bustle this time. When bidding on Priceline I went a little higher on a request hoping to land a resort for a change and was lucky enough to be accepted by the Renaissance. I never expected anything like this. After reading other reviews on this site I contacted the hotel this evening 8/26 and was greeted by a nice young man who was very professional and polite. I had a simple request but expected that being a Priceline booking they would not be able to accommodate me. To my surprise my request was easily granted. I requested a room on the Seaworld side in order for my boys to see the fireworks from a balcony. I was told that a reservation was placed for me with my request and that it was 99% certain nothing would interfere. I couldn't believe how easy it was. I've stayed in other hotels and once they've realized I've paid through Paypal been treated different then booking through the hotel directly. A+ to the staff at this Resort - I've stayed in several Marriott affliates and have always been extremely pleased. This one being a Resort location I feel will make it that much nicer - I can't wait until this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: RockyTop
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference in the hotel and arrived a day early to spend some time in Epcot. We arrived before check-in and were asked if we would like to stay in a room next to the elevator and that it was ready. We asked if it was noisy with people coming and going and were told that some people found it to be a problem. We assumed that if it was really only people talking as they got on/off the elevator that it would probably be minimal during the night and probably wouldn't bother us so we checked-in. We returned to the room very late and went to bed to find out that the noise wasn't from people, but from the elevator itself. Everytime it moved, it sounded like cables were sliding up and down behind our headboard. It kept us awake all night. We asked to be moved the next morning and were accomodated. When we checked-out, I suggested to the manager that they use that room for storage since I couldn't see how they could possibly rent it (although we paid for it since we arrived a day before the conference). Realistically, they shouldn't have charged us for that night just to maintain goodwill, but they didn't even offer. I was disappointed since we give Mariott a lot of business. Other then the room problems, the hotel was comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llamacalmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night before our flight back to England. Hotel is good positon for Seaworld and Discovery Cove but not near any restaurants. The room was on the 10th floor with a balcony overlooking the atrium, which was quite nice. Room was particularly big with two queen size beds and plenty of space. Internet was $15 which seemed rather on the high side, and self parking $12. Nice swimming pool and friendly staff throughout the hotel. Offered a glass of champagne on check in which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the noise from the balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Value_Seeker
Reviews.Content: I think I had looked forward to this hotel so much having read all the rave reviews that in the end I was slightly disappointed with a couple of aspects. However, on the whole the hotel is really good. We arrived after a long journey from the UK and were certainly not greeted with champagne! We were put in a temporary room for the first night and then upgraded to a better room with a balcony for the rest of our 2 week holiday. This room overlooked the pool which was lovely, but the noise outside from a massive generator was very, very loud! The attrium is lovely, but there are no real fish in the tanks!! Room service is fantastic, and as you can sneak your own wine into the hotel, it's actually quite a cheap alternative for the odd meal. They bring a proper table to eat from if there are 2 or more people eating! The suchi bar was very good and the pool meals are good too. It's a pity the pool bar doesn't open earlier to serve coffees, etc because even though there is a Starbucks inside, it's often busy in the morning and you don't always feel like queuing with the executives in your bikini!! The hotel shop is good with some nice clothes and jewellery and there was a sale while we were there which was really good! The proximity to everything, especially Sea World is brilliant. We stayed in Kissimee before and certainly did not miss the travelling to the main attractions. The pool area is lovely and the reception staff were very helpful, apart from on our arrival, on the odd occasions we needed them and we didn't pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good but be careful”
Reviews.Author: luvsoccer
Reviews.Content: Well to start off with the facility is really nice and pretty. We arrived at 4:00 p.m. after a 12 hour drive and were ready to check in our room (check in time is 4:00 p.m.) and our room was not ready yet. They said it would be ready in 30 minutes - back in 30 min. and still not ready - 30 min. later and still not ready. Finally got checked in near 6:00 p.m. The location is great - directly across the street from Sea World - you can actually walk over which is what we did. Downfalls, parking 12.00 per day - restaurant Tradewinds - very expensive - breakfast buffet 19.99 per person - really who can eat this much breakfast. Denny's and other restaurants nearby that have great breakfast options for alot less. TV - very complicated to work - purchased 2 movies when only trying to get to the menu for regular TV - they charged me for them but after me explaining that we did not watch any movies they reluctantly took it off. Another thing - charged my bill for 3 days worth of valet parking ($16.00 a day) plus $12.00 a day for self parking - we self parked the whole time. I had to go down to the desk and get that removed also. Be careful and check your final bill carefully. They try and add extra charges apparently. Also, housekeeping rushing us out of the room at 8:00 a.m. on checkout day - checkout is 10 a.m. Overall the facility is nice and very clean - beds are very comfortable. the staff is not overly friendly. Starbucks located in lobby is good but closes at 5:30 p.m. Nice stay here just with a few problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fireguy11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here just for one night while visiting Orlando. The room was clean, sizeable, and had all the necessities you would expect to find in a decent hotel room. The bed was super comfortable, probably the best I've ever slept on outside of my home. I don't know if all the rooms have the same mattresses, but the one in our room was out of this world. The hotel's interior design is very unique, and in essence, is one giant atrium. Room service was speedy, and attention to detail was definitely adhered to. They even followed hand written instructions on the breakfast request door hanger that I hung the night before. A little pricey, but what room service isn't? Overall, an excellent stay. All the big attractions and airport are in close proximity, and SeaWorld is right next door. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back !!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthWestMike
Reviews.Content: We’d like to be able to start this review by saying the staff at the hotel were excellent from the moment we arrived…but we can’t. We HAVE to say that service was excellent from BEFORE we arrived. Booking the hotel twelve months in advance meant we had time to obtain information prior to our trip and the hotel responded promptly to all emails and even sent us an information pack about the hotel, local transport and the surrounding area. This staff service carried on right through our holiday. They were always happy to help and very cheerful and chatty. We didn’t have a car so were dropped off right outside the door and therefore saved on the daily parking charges others have mentioned. Check-in was a breeze and wife and I were given a glass of champagne. Kids made a dive to the iced water machine located in the lobby entrance (a machine which was to become a regular stop every day of our stay). Initial reaction to the central atrium was very nice following its recent renovation. Our room was excellent. Eventhough it was a standard room, there was plenty of space and had the benefit of facing SeaWorld. We unpacked and this is where we found the only fault in our two week stay. Storage space in the room can very easily get filled up when you have two weeks worth of clothing, especially when three of the four people are female, but this was a MINOR complaint. Once unpacked, we took kids down to the pool for a quick dip. This was interrupted by a thunderstorm and hotel staff were quick to evacuate pool for safety reasons. Kids are catered for in the pool with a selection of inflatables and also table tennis and table football. The energetic can have a game of tennis or basketball and at night a screen is setup showing films for the kids, even including the popcorn. Next morning we suffered the usual Europe to US side-effect of early morning wake up and this is when we discover one of the hotels little gems. During darkness the whole of the central atrium is well lit and it is at this time that this area actually looks it best. The hotel has a number of food outlets. Firstly is the Starbucks branch for those how fancy a coffee and muffin in the morning. The hotel also has a restaurant. We didn’t eat here until our last morning, partially as it appeared a bit pricey but mainly as we didn’t have the chance. We had breakfast here on the last morning and couldn’t fault it. Kids eat free at the restaurant and this even extended to our 15 year old daughter (if only we’d realised before). For those wanting something to eat during the day, or simply crashing by the pool the best location is the pool bar. Meals are about $7to$15 approx but you can easily share one between two (as we found out from the leftovers from our first order). The pool staff take your order from your lounger, deliver to your lounger and you just charge straight to your room (or you can pay). At this stage it might be worth mentioning that any UK guests who are also member of Virgin Holidays FVC should ensure they get a voucher from reception which gives them 10% of all food in hotel. Food is also served at Sports bar (steaks and burgers) and Sushi bar but we can’t comment on these. Eating out around this hotel is a bit of a problem if you have no car. The I-Ride and Links buses to I Drive stop outside the hotel but the nearest restaurants/sops are located about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Although this isn’t far a good proportion of the walk has to be done along grass verges, albeit well worn grass verges to the corner of International Drive and Westward Boulevard. Here are Chinese, pizza, Italian, steakhouse and even a Subway. Not having a car meant that we had to take advantage of the shuttles services. The hotel runs shuttles using Mears to Universal, Aquatica etc free of charge. To book shuttle visit the Expedia desk located near Starbucks. Hi to Paul and Janette there who were excellent during our stay arranging bookings and rebookings when members of our party changed there minds, and even just having a quick chat. Three shuttles run in the morning (8.25, 9.25 and 10.25) to the parks and you can either book your shuttle back or leave it open for you to ring later. In addition to the free shuttles they can also arrange for shuttles to Disney. These are charged for unless you are staying with Virgin Holidays (you need to get a pass from the concierge desk). Tickets are also available from here. Although we didn’t need any as we already had ours, talking to them indicated they were not the usual excessively charged tickets you might expect from hotels. To be honest for those going to Aquatica I’d say walk across the road (literally!) to SeaWorld and take their shuttle. It runs all day and gives you the freedom to come when you want and go when you want. For Discovery Cove simply go out to the valet desk and they bring the hotels own car around to drive you across and they will collect you when DC ring them to advise you are coming back. All-in-all we had an excellent stay at the Renaissance. Would we go back? Well if my wife and children had there way we’d be back there next week. The hotel is ideal for visiting SeaWorld and its related parties. There was nothing better than walking across the SeaWorld in the evening and being back at your hotel 5 minutes after you leave the park.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Family Tradition - Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum rewards member I expect the best that Marriott delivers. The Renaissance Orlando Resort across from Sea World without a doubt delivers!! The Room 1009 was large and spacious and had all the stuff one needs while staying at a hotel. Front desk staff was courteous and accomodating. Housekeeping punctual and provided superb service. The beds, what can be said about the wonderful Marriott meds. Our family gets together for the 4th of July and to watch the fireworks at Seaworld without the hassle of dealing with the pushy crowds and long lines. 1009 has it's own private balcony that overlooks Seaworld. The only negative I found with this hotel is that the valet staff needs to treat vehicles a little better. My car is not a race car. I witnessed the valet peel off down the driveway and while looking for a place to park was still going forward when he jammed the car into reverse to back up to get to a spot. Unacceptable in my book and makes me uneasy about valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!!”
Reviews.Author: jeannette2780
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Beautiful inside and out. When you walk out into the lobby, the hotel is set up almost like a inverted city. Some of the guest rooms have balconies that overlook the entire lobby which consits of 4 or 5 restaurants, 2 bars, a Kinkos, ballroom, Starbucks, Large giftshop, wonderful pool/hot tub area with bar/grill restaurant, towel bar, wonderful fresh foods, very very very clean, luxurious and I paid a great price on priceline. I didn't want to leave this place. My 5 year old told us he wished that we could get an apartment in the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: toergids
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The atrium is beautiful and there is a Starbucks located in the lobby. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. We did find that the room service was extremely overpriced. This was also the case at the Tradewinds Restaurant on the ground floor. Food and drinks at the Pool restaurant was more affordable. Also be aware that the concierge will only tell you about taking taxi's to ANY location you might enquire about. They do not tell you that there is busses that stop right outside the hotel that can take you to the shopping outlets, Disney World, Downtown Disney etc. (As an example, the taxi ride to Downtown Disney cost as $25 one way - the bus is $1.75 one way! - and the bus is a direct service, so not a lot of stops). There is also a IRIDE Trolley that cost $1.00 and is a hop-on-hop-off service that can take you around. This bus stops at the same stop just outside the hotel. Other than this, we can't fault this hotel and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: crisnmike
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Orlando, and our stay was the best. The hotel was so much better than I could have ever imagined. We are Marriott Silver Elite, and are accustomed to their high standards but this hotel goes above and beyond. Everything about the property and hotel is gorgeous. We were given an upgraded room with a view and balcony. What a treat to enjoy the fireworks from Sea World every night from our balcony. The staff was super friendly and so helpful. You are literally a few steps from Sea World which is so convenient. It is a little calmer and quieter here away from the hustle and bustle of Universal and Disney, but just a short drive if you want to get there. The food and drinks were also excellent. We loved everything about our stay and will be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Rocks”
Reviews.Author: radtravels
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay at the Orlando Renaissance Resort and were very pleased. We had some reservations at first, based on our knowledge that the hotel has been there a while (we remember it in the 80s!) We were pleased to find that the resort had just completed a multi-million dollar renovation. The lobby is redesigned and very modern, yet tropical in flavor. The lobby is an open design that is quite large but has many private, quiet conversation areas. To the important things in our stay. The room was immaculate and quite large. We had a king bed, nice sofa, chair and desk. The bathroom was adequate with tub shower. We found the hotel to be quiet even with the open lobby. The most amazing thing was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. We never encountered a staff member that didn't speak and all were extremely helpful. We didn't eat any meals in the hotel -other than coffee in Starbucks. We did enjoy the sports bar several times and had a snack there. It was very good. The pool area was beautiful, well-designed, and seemed to have plenty to do for people of all persuasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel with good facilities close to theme parks”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Large corporate hotel without much soul that has recently had a multi million dollar refit. Stayed for two nights. Staff were friendly, room was a good size with an adequate bathroom. Breakfast was a fantastic experience with a vast buffet which changed on a daily basis with some of the freshest fruit i have had anywhere. Perfectly decent hotel but not in the same league as some of the hotels that carry the renaissance brand. I had been charged for my breakfast for both nights even though it was included in my rate and it took 3 attempts to remove this from my bill which was slightly irritating

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleMandy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Orlando and we paid £2200 for flights and hotel for 2 weeks on room only basis. When we arrived we were very impressed with this hotel. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to all Disney parks etc and you just had to book it at reception the night before. This must have saved us a fortune. The room itself was very nice with 2 double beds (there are 4 of us), a full size tv with movies on demand and satellite, a full size fridge and plenty of cupbard space. The bathroom was beautiful with plenty of shampoo and lotions. There was maid service every day. The hotel has a lovely pool area with a barside pool, plenty of loungers and pool towels. The restaurants inside the hotel are not cheap but very nice and the staff made a fuss of the children and enquired about our holiday each time we were there. I would recommend this as an excellent place to stay. It is a little out of the way from the main I Drive area but there is a bus stop just outside and it is right opposite Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: coedboy
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Just come back and stayed here with my wife and 3 children in one room which was massive. Great food quality and service. Amber who works in the pool bar was also brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: ttravelerbug
Reviews.Content: My husband was on business so my son and I joined him for a few nights. This hotel was perfect for our day at Seaworld. We were able to walk from the hotel so it was great to be able to go back for a break. Nice lobby and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: marco37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the last week in April with our four year old daughter.The hotel is in a great location and easily accessible to Disney and across the road from Seaworld. Our room was lovely.Two huge beds and plenty of space.The beds were a bit soft,as already stated by other reviewers,but we were so tired from the theme parks that we slept anyway. The breakfast was the best buffet breakfast we have ever had.Lots of fruit,yogurts,pastries,omlettes cooked to order and lots of other choices. The pool was nice and was heated.There was also a large paddling pool for kids. The first night we ate in the hotel restauarant and it was one of the best steaks that I had whilst we were there. I would definately stay here again(and I am fussy). My only gripe is that self parking is $12 per day.We were travelling with Virgin,and the brochure stated it was free to Virgin guests.The reception staff refused to accept this until I produced the page from the brochure.They accepted it then. The same goes for kids breakfast.It is free to Virgin guests ,but I had to tell them everyday at the restaurant. Other than that,this is an excellent hotel in a great location. c

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyonthego905
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Orlando Resort at Sea World for a week, mixing business and leisure time. The location is convenient to all the major Orlando attractions. You can walk across the street to Sea World, or take a short drive, about 5 miles, to Epcot, Magic Kingdom, and other Disney parks. Cocoa Beach is about 55 miles away, but an easy drive. Everything went well upon our arrival. Valet parking is $16 per day, or you can self park for $12. We chose valet parking and they were very prompt with bringing our car around every time. We would call about 2 or 3 minutes before leaving our room and our car would be waiting. Check-in was fast and friendly and they offer a welcome glass of champagne. Our room was a standard King room without a view, which was fine for us, but you would have to request a view of Sea World if you want that. The bed was a little soft for both me and my husband, but we slept OK overall. Nice bathroom with double sinks and plenty of complimentary toiletries, and even a little Shamu bath toy! We did have an issue the first 2 nights with noise from the room next door. The first night we didn't call the desk and they were at it until 4a.m. The second night we called the desk and they sent security right up. The next morning my husband asked what will happen if they continue the behavior and was told they would be asked once to quiet down and failure to comply would result in eviction. We were pleased with how this problem was handled. Housekeeping did a good job. The carpet seemed like it needs a good deep cleaning, however. The hotel has a sushi restaurant, Mist, which was surprisingly yummy. The menu wasn't extensive, but the sushi was fresh and there were some innovative choices. One roll, I think it was called Tara's Volcano Roll, was so good we wanted a second! The pool area was lovely. There were lots of lounge chairs, although it did fill up on the weekend. There is a nice poolside bar and grill that has tasty food (sandwiches, salads and appetizers), cold drinks, and a friendly staff. The pool is large and clean and surrounding grounds are well maintained. The spa, Neu Lotus, is small but good. I had a facial and massage and was very pleased with the facility and services. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. We'd recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travelers!”
Reviews.Author: clarely
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks on business, as my company's satellite office is within walking distance. First and foremost, the staff is RIDICULOUSLY friendly (someone has trained them well!) and helpful. Every single member of staff was personable with me, particularly the housekeeping and room service staff, which just enhanced my experience. Also, the rooms are HUGE. I wanted to do cartwheels down the middle, it was that big. If you are traveling alone or with only one other person, you will have ample space (even with kids, there's room for everyone to stretch out). The rooms are also clean, warm and cozy -- the color scheme is vibrant greens and rich blues (the scheme for the entire hotel is "Under the Sea"-like, in fitting with their proximity to Sea World). The food and general social atmosphere at the restaurants are excellent. Mist Sushi bar is PERFECT for business travelers/young professionals, as they have a fun mixed drinks menu the sushi itself is DELICIOUS. I tried sushi for the first time there, and found the fish to be fresh and flavorful, though I have to say the "wussie" sushi was my favorite -- the chicken teriyaki rolls are perfect for the raw fish phobic -- it's basically a chicken wrap, yum. All the food in the hotel, including room service, is done out of the Tradewinds kitchen, and that is a very good thing! All food at Tradewinds is fresh, seasonal and organic. Beware some pricey dishes, but the *quality* of the food for the price is unsurpassed. The fare in Tradewinds proper is healthy/fine dining, whereas you have to go to the Bar and Grill to get things like mini burgers, chicken wings and pina coladas... but just note there are duplicate items across all the restaurant menus, and everything on the room service menu, you can go down to Tradewinds and order. (that said, the service fee on room service is roughly $5 an order, but the delivery is prompt, food hot and fresh and the staff very nice) I highly recommend the Tradewinds salads! Oh, if you do the breakfast service, they are very prompt about delivering your food at the time you request! Transportation can be tricky, especially if you're not renting a car. The I-Ride shuttle is easily accessible for going to attractions on International Drive, and only $1 a trip, but if you are staying here and intend to visit parks other than Sea World, rent a car, or stay somewhere more Disney-centric. But for Sea World? Ideal location, best hotel you can get. Other amenities: gym is fantastic (and free!), with a variety of machines, weight lifting equipment and a daily yoga class. Several of the machines have TVs attached, with all the channel selections you get from the rooms. Speaking of TVs -- the giant, widescreen plasma HD TVs in the room are ACE. (randomly, also, the desk chairs in the room are ergonomic and so comfortable). I didn't use the pool, but the pool area is gorgeous, and I heard only good things about it. The Starbucks closes at 3 p.m., so no late afternoon coffees, but it's great having it there in the morning. Oh! And there are coffee makers in the guest rooms. The coffee quality isn't the best, but for instant in the room, it's pretty good! Also, the elevators are speedy, so you're never waiting around long for them, which is a plus (I waited AGES at the Peabody). CONS: probably the biggest drawback for a business customer (or just an internet obsessed person such as myself), is both the cost of the internet and the lack of wireless. "High speed" internet is $14.95 a night. I have high speed in quotations, given I don't find a 50KB transfer rate very high speed. I spent one night at the Peabody on I-Drive and their high speed was going at 300KB a second. BIG difference. Fine for checking email and doing general things, but streaming video was VERY touch and go. There is no wireless connectivity in any of the rooms -- so you have to use an ethernet cable, which means if you didn't bring your own 25 foot cord, you are bound to the desk.
