I'm someone who likes to surf in bed, so that was right out. There is wireless in the lobby area, however, so those doing conference stuff or just those who like to laze about in Starbucks will be able to connect on your laptops. This hotel was in perfect proximity to work, so it was the ideal hotel for my needs. The friendliness of the staff, and especially their understanding I was on a long term stay and not getting in my way every day (they only cleaned the room when I asked, but left me extra chocolate every day! :D), plus the size of my room and quality of the Tradewinds food (which I was eating twice a day), made up for any shortcomings the hotel might have. I had a room facing away from the Atrium, and found it very quiet, which was great -- there were plenty of kids staying there, and I barely noticed. There's a good mix of business/conference people and families, which was nice. If you're going to Sea World, on a business trip or there for a conference, I highly recommend the hotel. In general, if big, clean rooms, friendly staff and good hotel food are your priorities, it's a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDrh
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 4 nites at this Hotel and had a wonderful time. Everything was up to our expectations. This was a last minute trip and the Hotel was great. The room was large and clean and the bathroom was large and clean. Very comfortable beds. The restaurant food was very good. We did day trips to Kennedy Space Center and Daytona Beach, each easily done in a day. Seaworld is just across the parking lot so we walked there. You can book or buy tickets right at the hotel for every attraction in the area. The pool was really nice and relaxing. We enjoyed the hot tub one evening after a long day. Definitely recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the Renaissance at Sea World”
Reviews.Author: sisvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance from April 11-15 2008. The experience was incredible. The service is great from the front desk to the pool attendants. Everyone was so nice and helpful. The hotel is super clean. The food was also very good . We would stay here again. We walked across the parking lot to Sea World. There are hundreds of good places to eat around the hotel and easy access to them all.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: tomkat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights the week before Easter and loved it. We had a view of the seaworld fireworks each night. the rooms are very spacious. The staff was very helpful and considerate - bringing up a crib and setting it up/cleaning the room around us, etc.. My husband travels on business so we used Marriot points to pay for four of the nights. It was kid friendly while still maintaining elegance. Internet access is very limited - we tried to do online check in the day before and had to wait about 45 minutes to use the free computer - they charge you in the business center and only one was working. We have a 5 year old and 1 year old and we had everything we needed . But, they do not give you a fridge - but a cooler instead (which was odd) you can't keep milk in it and there is no microwave. the front desk staff let us use theirs each night and one night gave us a free bottle of champagne. We rented a car at the airport and used valet which was $16 - if you park yourself it is $12. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service by management, military friendly”
Reviews.Author: 2Beagles4Me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had prior reservations at another hotel in Orlando, but we were treated with poor customer service over military rates, so we were debating whether or not we should cancel, or just stay at the hotel for the one time. I was surprised to receive a private message regarding my comment I posted on Trip Advisor, from a manager of The Renaissance, inviting us to stay at his hotel. He said he'd be honored to have a military family stay at his hotel. My husband called, spoke to him personally, and we were given a room for Easter weekend. We immediately cancelled the reservations at the other hotel.Upon check in, my husband was informed our room was on the top floor, facing Sea World. This would be perfect to see the fireworks from Sea World at night. It was. The manager also sent us up a hand written note with some beverages and fruit, welcoming us to the hotel, and told us to contact him if we needed anything. We truly felt welcome. We only had one minor problem and that was there was no bedding on the pull out sofa. We didn't open up the bed until late at night and by that time, housekeeping had left, so we compromised and used a sheet from the bed. The next day housekeeping made up the bed, so it really wasn't a big deal. As for the room itself, it was tastefully decorated, very spacious and comfortable. My daughter and husband played tennis and swam, though the temperature of the water was cold due to the time of year. My daughter received her Shamu, which my beagle now claims as his own, and it was nice to have the bed turned down in the evening with chocolates left for us. My husband was offered a drink at check in, but politely declined. The hotel was quiet, not the typical tourist hotel where you hear all of the people outside. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants because we were basically in Orlando to visit our son who is in culinary school, so we tried to eat on a budget. My husband and I were so happy with the service we received that we will definitely stay at The Renaissance for our future overnight stays in Orlando. I want to personally thank the manager for the service he gave us. Two thumbs up to him!

Reviews.Title: “An Accurate Review”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict91
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Renaissance Sea World and have to say that some reviews I read here were not entirely accurate. The Renaissance is a lovely property and the staff is always pleasant, the pool is wonderful although definitely not heated as professed. The gym features the best equipment and had pilates and yoga classes daily. The biggest disappointment were the beds. The sheets are definitely not five, or even four star, quality. They are more like what you get in a lower level Holiday Inn. The beds themselves are horrible. Every time one of us moved ever so slightly, the whole bed moved drastically. My husband and I did not get a good night's sleep any of the four nights we stayed at the hotel. I was disappointed that some reviews here said the sleeping was wonderful. There is no way they were talking about this property. However, if you are not as sleep sensitive as we are, this may be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Bethannsd65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights due to a conference in the hotel. The room was upgraded as we were members/frequent travelers, without us having to ask. David at the front desk was very helpful. We had 2 issues in the restaurants (one in the sports bar and one at Tradewinds) and both times management handled it promptly. The food was actually very good and reasonably priced for hotel food! Parking was pricey ($12 self or $16 valet). Staff was friendly. Walking distance to Sea World, but no shuttle, pay or complimentary, to any attactions, such as Disney World or Epcot. I would think a large hotel like this would offer some sort of transportaiton, even for a small fee. Taxi's are hugely expensive. Don't rent a car at the hotel....rent it for half the cost at the airport. We learned the hard way and paid too much. We did not use the pool but it looked nice. The hotel was clean and well maintained, not a lot of kids when we were there...but we were there right before spring break began!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -- but not great”
Reviews.Author: cjdyensid
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference. The Renaissance is a decent hotel -- mostly designed for families. It is literally right across the street from SeaWorld, so if that is your thing... There are tennis courts right there, if that is your thing... Pool is decent but not fantastic. Food was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MplsAmandda
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: We stayed two nights and loved it. The renovations have put this property on the map. It felt great to stay in a place that was so new! SUSHI: We had sushi one night. It was delicious: the rainbow roll, yellow tail nigri, shrimp tempura roll, taka’s spicy mayo crab roll!!!, two bowls of miso soup and two drinks came in at $72.00. It was so much fun eating the sushi and hanging out at the beautiful bar. The bartenders were great. They introduced me to the Nuclear Meltdown drink, the same components of a long island iced tea but add pineapple juice and midori! TRADEWINDS RESTAURANT: The breakfast buffet was amazing, but come hungry and don’t plan on eating lunch. It had four different kinds of cheeses. Omelet station and French toast station. I can’t even begin to tell you how much food it had. Applewood smoked bacon. NOTE: The electricity went out while we were there, but they ran on generator power for most of the time so we couldn’t even tell it was out. ROOMS/ACCOMMODATIONS: The beds were so comfortable I never wanted to wake up. The rooms were clean and stylishly appointed.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Trip4AWeekend
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to celebrate Valentine's Day with my new husband and we absolutely loved it. Upon check-in we were offered a free glass of champagne, which was delicious. We had a top floor room with a view of the atrium. It was a nice room with a view of the whale mural that was painted on the wall in accordance with the SeaWorld theme. All the staff that we met were very polite and attentive. The rooms were spacious and well-appointed. Breakfast the following morning was at the organic restaurant. We thought it was a little expensive but the breakfast buffet was delicious. My only complaint was I thought it was a little noisy to try to sleep because the nightlife from the atrium kind of traveled north up to the rooms, but other than that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, 4-diamond hotel”
Reviews.Author: bman3333
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Renaissance the last three years for our company's annual trade show and every stay has been very enjoyable. The rooms are large, well decorated and quiet. The hotel is gigantic, but extremely clean and attractive. The pool area is expansive and relaxing. I stayed at the hotel during the renovation period in 2006, which I'm sure hurt its tripadvisor rating. But I'd highly recommend going there now that the renovation is complete. It is expensive, the breakfast buffet is $18 w/ beverages, and they charge $12/day for parking, but the location is ideal for visiting Seaworld and the other theme parks are only a 15 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff...excellent property”
Reviews.Author: syrsteel
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to stay at this hotel last weekend. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and courteous. Prior to my stay I was contacted by a Marriott platinum member coordinator who wanted to know if there was anything she could do to make my stay more enjoyable. These are the little things that go a long way with a frequent traveler like myself. Room was large and very clean...nice big tv in room. Grounds were beautiful...pool area was especially nice. Had breakfast - meal was so - so...you are probably better to eat at a local restaraunt. As far as location, hotel is close to all the parks and literally right across the street from Sea World. Although this hotel has amore of a "conference hotel feel" to it, the staff will make you feel right at home. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for theme parks”
Reviews.Author: nothingbutthebest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is typical American in style, ie big rooms, well furnished, clean but a tad impersonal. Starbucks on site, and main restaurant seems to be franchised out (called Tradewinds). Staff are friendly, restaurant has fairly limited menu but food is well presented and good value. Breakfast buffet very much to American tastes, lots of choices that would not be common in Europe, but just not to my personal taste. However, we always got a good selection that suited us, and service was fast. Hotel has good sized pool and pool bar which serves nice barfood selection up to 6 pm. Suites are vast, with balconies either overlooking the gardens (to the back of the hotel) or overlooking Seaworld to the front. Suites can be made into 1, 2 or 3 bedrooms using interconnecting rooms. Staff upgraded our two standard rooms to suite when one became available, at no extra cost which was nice. Hotel is an ideal base for "doing" the theme parks. 10 minute drive to Wet & Wild and Universal, which are the far end of Int. Drive, and 15 min to Disney. Right over the road from Seaworld (walk if you can, and save $ 10 car parking fee). Overall a good quality hotel as a base, but probably not suitable if you want to spend your time lazing around the pool all day. But then again, if you want that sort of holiday why go to Orlando ?

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsDonald
Reviews.Content: My family and I love Orlando and although we have a vacation ownership on Disney, by being a military family we do not always make it in time to have availability. We traveled to Orlando to go to Sea World and I have to say this hotel is wonderful, I would not call it a resort because it does not have all the amenities a resort should. The rooms were very clean and modern, my daughter found a shoe that was left from a previous stay and the staff moved us to an executive suite room for the inconvinience at no charge. The view was great right at Sea World. To make things even better about a week after we were home I recieved $50.00 from the company for the inconvienience as well. Once again we have waited too late to get reservations at our vacation ownership so we will be staying here again in March and I can't wait. I will say that if you have plans for Universal it may be best to stay on site because your room key is everything, we learned that as well so we actually spent Xmas 2007 at the Hard Rock Universal which I love as well, but if you are doing Sea World or anything on International the this is a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: bayarea123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days of business meetings. The room is a good size with a comfy bed, nice LCD TV's, big bathroom, and a sitting area. The rate we received was pretty reasonable but you do pay for the extras (phone/Internet package for ~$15 and another ~$12 for parking). There is a Starbucks in the hotel which was very convenient. They also have a nice funky lobby. The huge atrium in the middle has nice comfy seats. We had our meeting in one of their rooms and I was very impressed with the service. They kept the coffee filled and hot. They had us pre-order lunch making sure our food was ready when we took our breaks. All in all, a very nice hotel for corporate gatherings or personal stays.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: chowc
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 9 in 3 rooms) spent 5 nights during Christmas season. The room is HUGE. Each has 2 queen size beds and 2 sofa chairs and still has lot of space to walk around. The rooms are very clean. Beds are VERY comfortable. We are able to get $99 per night. A few minor areas for future improvement: 1. it does not have much option for food and shopping in walkable distance except SeaWorld. It has Starbucks inside the hotel but with very limited selection of pastry. There are few restaurants within short drive. We went to Denny's a few days for breakfast. 2. they charged $12 per day for parking and this is Florida, not New York City. 3. only has slow internet connection in room and there is additional fee for broadband. 4. we seems to have problem with the room keys which sometimes cannot open the door. Will love to stay here again for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but limited food facilities”
Reviews.Author: BeverleySparky
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great locatoion. I don't think that this is a 5* hotel though, i have stayed at many 4* hotels and this hotel compares equally. The rooms are clean, modern and large. As in some earlier reports they said of the front desk staff not being very friendly, i found none of this and found them all to be friendly and helpful.One word of caution though, as with alot of US hotels this hotel is very high, 10 floors in fact, and if you don't like heights as my wife doesn't it may be worth taking this into consideration, as it has glass fronted lifts as well.This hotel also gets very busy with corporate events, i didn't think this had a negative effect on the hotel i think it brought a buzz to the place. We also saw a wedding while we were there which was really nice. The florida gators american football team were staying at the hotel and also alot of supporters which also brought a buzz to the place, i got in the lift one night and 4 of the players got in, those guys were huge, i felt about 2 foot tall. Alot of long faces though as they got beat. I agree with the last few reports about the food in the hotel. The tradewinds restaurant looked quite expensive and i think you could get the same quality meal for less elsewhere, although the meal we had in the sports bar was nice the menu was very limited especially if you have children like we do. All in all a great hotel in a great location just let down slightly by the food options. On a personal point of view , if i were to go back to florida i would stay at a private villa with its own pool. This by no means puts a black cloud over the hotel, just my own point of view. I would have liked to have gone back to the villa after a long day in the parks and enjoyed a swim with the children and a glass of wine with my wife. But the main point is that i dont think i could face another burger.steak, chicken or pizza etc. as found in vast quantities in the parks, all my daughter wanted after the first week was an egg mayo sandwich, easy if your in a villa as supermarkets are vast and found everywhere, but not so easy if your in a hotel room. We often bought fruit and took it back to the room. All in all a fantastic holiday, would love to go back and see my mate Mickey but need alot of rest to recover my sore feet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Sea World visit”
Reviews.Author: cupcakeRN
Reviews.Content: a great place to stay if doing sea world. beautiful area, pool,rooms and close to other attractions...would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not all it promised........!”
Reviews.Author: Ferret1
Reviews.Content: This is a good, average hotel in Orlando - among what seems to be unlimited choice. The room was excellent - very large, with sofa and chair as well as a huge and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was well fitted out and had two hand basins, and a good selection of toiletries. The food options are very limited. From the website and other reviews we had expected to see more than one restaurant, but there was only the Tradewinds option (and a sushi place - although that's not really our scene). The breakfast buffet was good, although more choice of breads would have been appreciated. We had read about the champagne on arrival and chocolates on turn down service - but none of this happened to us. The hotel is in a great location for Sea World - just across the parking lot. It's also in a good location for driving to the other theme parks in Orlando. The valet parking is not worth the extra cost as the self-park car park is very close to the hotel's front door. We were a bit disappointed as thought this was going to be more like a "resort" but in reality it's just a huge hotel. There was no map of the place in the room, so we never located the spa - and there was no information about it in the room, so maybe it wasn't available? Just felt like they were churning people through and not particularly thinking very deeply of what their guests would like out of their stay. The staff we met were very friendly - the waiting staff in the restaurant were excellent and the concierge/bell hop service was good too.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgajsalem
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel- recently renovated. Extremely comfortable and clean room and beds. Only down side was the limited food options. Very convenient if you are going to Sea World or Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “great time to be had”
Reviews.Author: daqattaq
Reviews.Content: Located immediately adjacent to Sea World with easy access to all of Orlando's attractions. The resort is much larger than it looks from outside. The rooms were very nice. The staff was just average with both information and politeness. self parking was easy. Internet access was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ziggylu
Reviews.Content: We're staying here for four nights for a conference my husband is attending. I guess because it's called the "Renaissance Resort" we had a different expectation. Also this is our first stay at a Renaissance, which we thought was a high end luxury brand. There is nothign wrong with the hotel. It's clean and pleasant. The rooms are good sized and have all the basic amenities. But it's not a luxury hotel and it's definitely not a resort. Has the feel of a conference hotel which is exactly what it is. Service has been spotty. Some employees very pleasant and others not so much. Housekeeping also spotty. Had to call for towels this afternoon as they didn't leave new ones(but took the old ones...we're from AZ and would have been happy to reuse and not rewash but that doesn't seem to be why we weren't left new towels). We're paying the conference rate of $169 which is definitely not a value for this resort....if we were paying in the $129 or below range, especially under $100 it would be a great deal. So definitely take the rate into consideration. The location relative to Sea World is definitely great. We walked over yesterday and that was really nice. Having to deal with traffic getting toward Disney or Universal though hasn't been fun.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel, Simply the best, cant wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: boostravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin Holidays about a year ago and read all the reviews about renovation, when we got there , even though we knew it was a big hotel we were gobsmacked, it is awesome, check-in was excellent, we were given a glass of champagne and we simply sat down and took in the place, big Sushi bar, Starbucks, Sports Bar etc Its all open plan and they tend to have a lot of conferences, the tables are all laid out in the main ground floor area however because of the sheer size of the place its no problem. The mears desk is situated inside the hotel and through Virgin you can book all travel to the Disney Resorts (which were included in our package) through this desk, it was very easy and apart from once it was always on time and no problem. The Trolley Bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you up International Drive, we did not have a car and found the location great for getting around, there is noweher to eat within walking distance except in the hotel itself but you just hop on the Trolley and go where you fancy, its so easy. If you dont drive its worth checking out the Linx busses, if you want to get to the Mall at Mellenia you can get the trolley to the top of International Drive to the last stop at Prime Outlets and then catch the No 8 to the Mall at Mellenia, its a short ride and very easy to get there this way. The Florida Mall we found Taxi probably best, there is a Linx Bus you can catch from just down the road from the hotel but it takes about an hour to get there and its 10-15 mins in a taxi and costs about $20 each way. The rooms are sooo comfortable, beds fantastic, very quiet and the maid turns down the bed every night and leaves chocolate, what more can you ask for, this is the best Hotel i have stayed at and we are already planning to go back, cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: bertinaWigan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at this hotel, and cannot think of anything bad to say about it. It is kept spotlessly clean in all areas, the rooms and all facilities are excellent, the service and attitude we encountered from all staff members was first class. Without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyNavyCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Orlando Renaissance and I have nothing but the highest praise for them. I took my wife and daughter there for a brief vacation using my Marriott rewards points. The hotel is very conveniently located - literally right across the street from Sea World. We spent most of our time at Disney - the Renaissance is about 15 minutes from the Disney parking lots. There are some good restaurants within 10 minutes. Here is a summary of our stay: Rooms - spacious and well equipped with two chairs, flat screen TV and fridge. Beds - Very comfortable. Bathrooms - Nice. Swimming pool - Very nice / big / not at all crowded / nice eating area/bar. Resort - 3 tennis courts, basketball court and kids play area. Fitness center - spacious with new equipment. Lobby - Very nice. Restaurant - good food / not at all crowded. Check In / Hotel service - Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: lvgiants10
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! I was a little bit skeptical considering that the hotel was undergoing renovations, but I am happy to report that with the exception of fewer places to eat than you would like to have, the property is fairly complete. Check in was a breeze. The front desk staff were gracious and accomodating. We were offered glasses of champagne which was actually quite good. We were in our rooms within 5 minutes of checking in and our luggage was brought up with us. The rooms - WOW. While not as luxurious as say a Four Seasons would be, these were absolutely some of the largest standard hotel rooms I have ever seen. The beds were comfortable, the room was decorated in lovely shades of blue and green and the bathroom was just tremendous. There is a flat panel TV as well as a good deal of storage place. You could stay there for weeks and not feel claustrophobic. Food - There are only two restaurants open. We ate in the sports bar twice and it was very good. Our server went out of her way to make sure we were happy. The sushi bar did not seem to be open while we were there, but looked gorgeous. Of course there is a full Starbucks on the property which we indulged in quite a few times. Location - This hotel is located directly across from Sea World and it is less than a 5 minute walk. They also have rooms with exterior balconies that overlook Sea World. It's a quiet location, far from the bustle you feel in the Disney resorts. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. I had a truly wonderful experience and would not hesitate to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Stunning!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bendyGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two weeks at the Rennaisance Hotel by Seaworld from Sept 1st 2007, after reading some of the reviews earlier in the year I was a bit wary of what this hotel would be like however i needn't have worried, this hotel is beautiful, every bit a 5 star rating. The rooms have everything you need from cotton buds to irons, hairdryers and coffee machine. They are cleaned daily to an excellent standard. Like most top class hotels this one is excellent for those with disabilities with very few steps in the hotel everything is accessible, they also have rooms specific for diabled guests. The staff are very friendly from Janitors to senior managers, the food is excellent (although portions are massive) the breakfast buffet is must for everyone!!. The hotel has 5 restaurants plus a starbucks and gift shop (no deli which is reported in some brochures). Unfortunately the Atlantis restaurant and the Winstons pub were closed when we were there for refurbishment which does reduce your dining options within the hotel. For some travel companies the hotel offers free shuttle bus to all the parks, all you have to do is collect a voucher from the conceirge and hand this to the shuttle desk, bookings have to be made 90mins before departure though. If you get worn out by visiting all the parks then you can relax by the pool which is never very busy, there is also a pool side bar and restaurant which serves very good food. TV INTERNET - don't use, it's very slow and you can't get access to some sites however the business centre which is open weekdays 7am-5pm have internet access at 25c per minute, I went in there most days and it never cost me more than two dollars which is cheaper than the $10 for 24hrs the hotel charges for the tv internet. TIPS - Before you go on holiday join the Marriott rewards program, when you arrive you will receive a 10% VIP card for use in the tradewinds restaurant (food only) and since this is the only restaurant to do breakfast you can usually save around 4-5 dollars per day on breakfast alone. The I-Ride trolley is a must and there is a stop right outside the entrance to the hotel (very handy!!!) costing $1 or 25c for Senior Citizens it is an inexpensive way to travel. Pick up a brochure on board the trolley and this will give you a map of all the stops and also discount vouchers - my recommendation - go to stop 43 (premium outlets) take voucher from the I-ride book into the customer desk in the food court and they will give you a book of vouchers for the outlet shops. Seaworld is a 5 min walk, yes really!!!! PARKS - a lot of parks have now introduced fingerprinting at the entrance gates accompanied by photo id - so take your passports with you. DINING OPTIONS - we went to see Dixie Stampede which was very enjoyable, lovely dinner and very reasonable for price, you get a free souvenier drinking cup as well!! Get there early as you can see the horses that will be used in the show, there is also a pre-show event which is very funny.. CIRQUE DU SOLEIL - a must!!!! absolutely fantastic!!!! BLUE MAN GROUP - very funny, indescribable, stunning visual effects!! - beware though, if you sit in Zone 1 (behind poncho section) you may still get messy!!! BUSCH GARDENS - There is free transportation from seaworld bus parking area each morning but you need to phone in advance to book but as this is a local call is doesn't cost much from the hotel room (less than a dollar). Take a change of clothes as you will get wet on the water rides!! OVERALL TIP - BUY BEFORE YOU GO, if you can, buy your park tickets on-line before you go as this will get you the cheapest price (I went through attraction tickets direct and unlike some companies i received the actual tickets before I went on holiday and not a voucher, with the exception of the Cirque du Soleil) I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would definately go back........

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigelfromkent
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at the Renaissance and I really cannot fault this hotel. We arrived at about 4pm on a Saturday afternoon. The lady on the reception desk gave us a glass of champagne and gave my 2 year old daughter a cuddly Shamu whilst we checked in. We asked for a room with a view of seaworld and were given one with a balcony overlooking the park. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean. The rooms were very spacious and we were frequently visited by a maid in the evening offering to turn down the beds. This was in addition to the regular daily room service. A good selection of places to eat and drink. The sports bar was slightly cheaper than the rest. Got a 10% off all food voucher from the guy trying to sell Marriott time shares. The pool was never busy and a very good size. The hotel was in a perfect position for Seaworld and only a short drive to Disney. We were told our room rate included parking which was $12 per day to other guests. All in all we were delighted with the hotel and are already planning to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sea World Package...”
Reviews.Author: AHFox
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Marriott Platinum Rewards member - we stayed at the Renaissance on a package that included unlimited admission to Sea World. The convenience of the location for Sea World visitors is unbeatable. It is literally a walk across the street! The hotel pool was a nice size, grounds were pleasant, some garden areas, tennis courts, playground area, etc.. Hotel rooms are a really nice size - our standard room had a king size bed - and a sofa bed, coffee table, club chair. A very well thought out set up.. Be aware, however, these rooms do not have balconies.. this may not matter to many, but was a minus for me.... Hotel lobby/atrium renovated has been completed - is absolutely lovely. The staff at this hotel was gracious, friendly, and accomodating. We would stay here again in the future - if able to secure a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Padovanina
Reviews.Content: The resort was really very nice and modern. The room was very big: I was alone, but I had a room with 2 queen beds and a bathroom with 2 washbasins. My room was close to the lift and it was a little bit noisy (ask at the check in a room faraway from lifts). The location was nothing special: great if you want to visit seaworld (it is in front of it), but terrible if you want to visit around. You need the car to go everywhere!! Anyway there is a bus stop just in front of the hotel. The staff was very nice and kind: I asked some particular place where to go eat and they suggested very good places. They had some problems with my credit card (a visa: they were not able to read it...I do not know why), so they asked me to pay cash at the check-in..This was not very nice, also considering that they had the problem to read my crediot card. Anyway..At the end I payed some days later my arrival. The only open restaurant inside was nothing special and expensive for the quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: terarek
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on a visit to Sea World and it was wonderful. The beds were extremely comfortable and the staff couldn't do enough to make us happy. It was very clean and even though our balcony faced the atrium where a breakfast meeting was going on we never heard any of it. The pool was alot of fun also. It was also great to be able to walk across the street to Sea World. We are passholders and get free parking but with the amount of people that were there we would have literally drove our car across the street and then had to walk across the Sea World parking lot anyway so we chose to just walk across the street. I would definately recommend this hotel and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: luvlee_7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at this resort and everything was perfect, bathrooms were great and CLEAN.....Pool and everything else was GREAT. We will DEFINITELY stay at this resort again. My children ages 6 and 8 had a whole lot of fun. Trollie to I-Ride right outside the resort. I-Hop, McDonalds, Dennys very close. Seaworld right across the street........Just Wonderful, front desk very helpful housekeeping very nice.......WONDERFUL

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveFussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Direct Holidays 27th July - 11th August. I was really nervous after some of the previous reports of building works, but shouldn't have been since there is now no evidence of any work. We arrived at 5pm and were offered a fabulous room with a balconey overlooking Seaworld. I guess we are really fussy and I just had this thing about wanting one of those rooms with a view of the atrium. They didn't have one ready, but said if we went to get some tea and came back in an hour they would have one ready. Sure enough it was! The room was large and had a flat panel TV with Keyboard and Internet Access. There as a safe and fridge thrown in free of charge too. The bathroom had two sinks which was really handy of a morning and was well stocked with everything including bottled water. The papers were delivered everyday. Service? Well that was good too. One day we went out and forgot to take the 'do not disturb' off the door. We came in a 10pm to find the room had not been serviced (our fault really). We phoned down and within 10 mins the was someone there doing the full works. Also on the first morning the smoke alarm in the room went off - again we reported it and it was immediately replaced. That night there was a 'sorry' note in the room with chocolates on the beds. I guess my main gripe about the rooms was that I think there was a lack of storage draws and cupboards. Bearing in mind the size of the rooms there was plenty of space it fit them it. The Starbucks was a godsend, although it does get busy in the mornings, specially if there is a conference on, which there was a few nights. We eat in Tradewinds the first night, nothing wrong with it but you can get better cheaper outside the hotel. There was a sign saying car parking was $12 a day, but we were told this was waived for Internaional Guests and sure enough it was. Being opposite Sea World was great since we could leave the car in the hotel and walk over in the evening to see the shows or get some tea. As far as eating out was concerned I was recommend Outback and Bahama Breeze for dinner, although they get very busy. In the morning we just had a quick breakfast in Perkins or just a Starbucks if we were really in a hurry. We went to see the Shuttle STS118 take off, that was fantastic, although you need to book before you leave the Uk and take your chances!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, service just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: Booked through Seaworld and prepaid. Upon arrival was told that our booking wasn't for as many nights as I had made. Upon giving them the receipt they then "found" the extra nights that were missing. Beautiful property - liked the open air lobby. Never had towels, but called for some and they always brought them promptly. Never had hot water. Food service good and very prompt. A big conference hotel and very noisy. Starbucks always has a line. Beware that walk to Seaworld is through Seaworld parking lot and a bit far if you have small children in the hot Florida weather. Many times we drove to the entrance and paid for VIP parking. Our room was very big and fit five of us, two queens and a rollaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Martyn_Megan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from a weeks stay at the Renaissance and have had a great time and found the hotel to be everything we wanted it to be. Its easy to find from Orlando airport, just jump onto the 528 until exit 1, turn onto International Drive for half a mile and then turn right onto Sea Harbour Drive and a few hundred yards later there it was. All in all it was about a 15 mile drive and took about 20-25 minutes. Just a tip though have some dollars or quarters ready as there are 2 x 75 cent tolls on the way. Parking at the hotel is also ample and you can choose from valet parking or self parking Walking into the hotel and it is impressive. The renovations certainly look good, from the waterfall, to the sports bar, to the secluded areas in the atrium, to the sushi and main bar. In the evening it looks even better and after a trip around a theme park my wife and I always enjoyed a glass of wine, sitting down in one the many seating areas - the tall backed wicker chairs being the best - very comfortable and a great way to unwind and rest those weary feet. The pool was also great for unwinding. Its a great size with lots of space (watch out for the geckos) and we especially enjoyed the large and warm Jacuzzi. It never seemed to be overbusy either. The staff were also very helpful except for one or two exceptions, beware of one of the ladies in the gift shop! On our arrival we got upgraded to a room overlooking Seaworld so we could see the evening fireworks and the reception staff couldn't be more helpful. The Conceirge were also helpful though I don't think they were as knowledgeable as maybe they could have been but with so many guide books about it didn't really matter too much. I have stayed in quite of number of good hotels around the world and I don't think this quite was worth the 5 stars, more 4 if I was honest but maybe this is being picky. The cleaning of the rooms was ok and they were pretty clean but in comparison with other hotels I have stayed at such as the Bellagio in Vegas, the Marriott in Toronto and recently a hotel in Venice it did not quite match up. The room itself though was large, with big comfy beds and a good size bathroom with 2 sinks (though the baths could do with being a bit bigger). They have safes in them, along with an empty fridge to store your cold drinks and other non perishables and also an iron and a hairdryer. I think they may have to improve the transportation side as the connections provided to the Parks were a little hit and miss. Indeed one morning we turned up to get our connection with Mears and though we had been told to be there at 8.15am the driver had turned up 20 minutes earlier and then left putting us down as a no show. To be fair the lady in the Mears office did rectify this but even she admitted that the Mears / Taxi drivers did not always know what was happening and a couple of times we had to help the drivers ourselves. If you did not want to get these connections there were always taxis outside and we found these to be better, especially in the evenings (going to Downtown Disney, Universal Citywalk, meals out, etc). I also had the feeling that this hotel was more catered for the Business traveller rather than the holiday maker and during the week it did get overtaken slightly by some conferences but you're in Orlando and unlikely to stay around during the day too much and it didn't affect us at all though. From previous reviews I have seen some criticism of Tradewinds, their restaurant. Though we did not go there, there were quite a few positive recommendations to go there from other guests who had eaten there. We didn't eat there ourselves as there are so many other great places to eat in the area and in the mornings Starbucks in the Atrium was a godsend and I think we tried nearly every cake and danish they had. Location wise the hotel is very central. Seaworld is only 5 minutes away, Discovery Cove only around the corner (the hotel provides a free ride to this), Universal and Downtown Disney about 10-15 mintes drive away and the Magic Kingdom about 20-25 minutes away. I would recommend getting a hire car if you can for convenience sake but with the taxis, Mears and buses / trams its not essential. As for tips on what to do, everyone is different but we really enjoyed Orlando. We felt the Universal parks were the best (do the Hulk, Spiderman, MiB, Terminator and Shrek 4D especially). Get there early if posible and get the best rides done first and if you can get the fastpass in Universal. We reckon it saved us about 3-4 hours of waiting over 2 days. Citywalk is well worth an evening visit as is Downtown Disney (but book reservations at restaurants at these places if you can). Disney is Disney and always good fun and if do want to move away from the parks we really enjoyed ourselves at Kennedy Space Centre and then Cocoa Beach. The best time though was in Discovery Cove so book this if you can as it was great and a day to remember. Eating wise, there is so much! But a special mention must go to Charleys Steakhouse on i-Drive, fantastic food, House of Blues in Downtown Disney and the Hard Rock cafe in Citywalk. All in all Orlando was fantastic and the Renaissance a great, enjoyable and comfortable place to stay and explore it all from.

Reviews.Title: “Where to begin?!”
Reviews.Author: lou_pro85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from our 21 night stay at the Renaissance Orlando resort and it was a huge disappointment. We spent a huge amount of money in booking this hotel as it was a supposed to be a 5*. I have always stayed at 3-4* hotels so obviously expected this to be of some improvement. Well unfortunately, it was a shocking 2* in my opinion. On arrival, the young ladt to check us in was friendly but we were given a room opposite the elevators which were very noisy. We requested to move to a room with a balcony, but they could not accommodate this request and so, we stayed in room 5001 for 2 weeks of our stay until they finally had a balcony room. The front staff were useless, they clearly chose to help guests in suits rather than the holiday makers which was frustrating when we were obviously struggling with shopping or our luggage. We had complimentary transport to the parks with our stay but this was a total joke. It was a company called Mears. The ticket office is located in the hotel and we had to book via them every time we wanted to go to disney. There was a young man called Sylvester who was very nice, but on other days, they had a dragon by the name of Barbara who was awful! No tact with guests, no knowledge of the parks, and extremely rude (we began having to dread booking out trips with her). When we actually booked out transportation, it was then a matter of Mears actually turning up and collecting us. on the first 5 days we were collected late on 3 of our trips. One of which was at magic kingdom, where we were left for 45minutes at 11.30pm. When discussed with the 'manager', they just said it had nothing to do with them and to speak to mears. Of course, when we spoke to mears, they advised us to speak to the hotel as they are providing the payment for our taxis! It was very much blame the other person in this hotel. We were often woken up at 12am, 1am, 2am by noisy guests which staff were not interested to hear about. My boyfriend and I do not regularly complain and we certainly wanted to avoid it on holiday but it was a matter of everything that could go wrong, did go wrong. I ordered a sandwich from the tradewinds restaurant and requested no tomato because I am extremely allergic, and of course, it came with tomato. No apologies at all from the staff. The food was expensive for what it was, and twice the bread tasted stale. (we only ate there twice!) Breakfast was $20 for 1 bacon, 1 sausage, 1 egg, orange juice and a coffee! Renovations are still happening which we weren't told of (see pictures). One evening we left our room at 10pm, and when we did, we found a squashed piece of pizza next to our door. On the way out of the hotel I asked for it to be removed. We returned to out room after 12am to find the same piece of pizza. Again, we complained (not what you expect from a 5*). When I opened the door at 7am to collect my paper I was not exactly happy to see the same smelly piece of pizza by the door. In the end I just removed it because it was disgusting. Things like this I would not expect to happen in any hotel, especially an expensive one. The feeling I got was that they have recently finished major renovations and not hired enough staff to return to full capacity. You saw plenty of staff by the front desk, but none cleaning on the 10 floors or anywhere being vacuumed or tidied. All staff were about 20. On the 1st evening we arrived I got mascara on my pillow and by the 10th day it was still there. I had asked for the pillow case to be changed on the 5th day as it was getting beyond a joke. On the 8th day I rang front desk and asked for it to be changed straight away. At this point, one of the front desk staff shouted down the phone that the sheets are changed every 3 days and that I was lying it had been there that long. As you can imagine, I was furious and on the 10th day, the pillow case was still dirty, so I had to complain to the manager before it was changed! All of this was running alongside our holiday which was really taking it's strain. I went on holiday to have a good time, not to have to chase up the hotel because they could not complete any simple task. I recommend that you do not stay at this place for over 2 nights as you begin to pick up on all the things they are incapable of. No staff became friendly with us, even after being their 21 days and speaking to some of them on a daily basis. There are loads of other things that occursed but I do not have time to list them all. A place to avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Just renovated, super modern, super clean”
Reviews.Author: LovethebeachFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for a trip to Seaworld. The hotel is very clean and the beds are to die for. However, I booked an atrium-view room (because it was cheaper) and I felt a bit claustrophobic. Your window looks out toward the busy atrium rather than the outside. You can get a glimpse of the sky and clouds if you look up at the glass roof of the atrium, but that's it. It's sort of like booking an inside cabin on a cruise ship. I didn't like it, but some people might think it's cool for people watching. There's also no sense of day or night in the room which could be desirable for some. We had the breakfast buffet at Tradewinds ($19 adults, includes coffe, tea and juice). The fresh fruit and omelets were good. The coffee and pancakes were not! In fact, I could not even drink the coffee! It tasted like the kind of coffee you get from a vending machine. Luckily there's a Starbucks on site, so you can grab a quick breakfast there as an alternative. I think young singles and couples would love this hotel. There is a sushi/martini bar and a sports bar in the center of the atrium, along with some very cool seating. The walk to Seaworld is a bit tiring but saves you the $10 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant time at Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: mjimsy
Reviews.Content: Hi !, My family and i stayed at the Renaissance for two weeks between 7th -21st July and had a great time. The place is absolutely huge and very very clean. The staff are all very pleasant and very helpful ( nothing is too much of a problem ). The rooms are very big with 32" High/Def tv, lovely bathrooms with bath/shower and twin sinks which have some little bottles of shampoo, bodywash and mouthwash for everyone. We asked for a room with a view of sea world with preferably a balcony and as i said it was no problem, That's what we got !! There was also a games room for the kids ( Thankfuly ) also a great gym and a brilliant swimmingpool with two enormous spa pools. We booked this holiday through virgin holidays as it said there was free transport to all the theme parks from this hotel and they did'nt let us down, all you have to do is go to the consierge desk and they give you a voucher which you take to the mears desk (situated next to starbucks) and you arrange what time you want picked up at and what time you want to return and all you do then is go to the front of the hotel next day at your time and a minibus or a taxi ( yes they send a taxi if it's only 1 - 4 persons ) and they take you to the park you requested to go to, Brilliant ! They even sent a lincoln town car for us to take us back to the airport on our last day. The only thing that we did'nt like was that the tradewinds resturant was a bit expensive so we did'nt eat there very often. there was a lot of complaints in previous reviews about the noise from work being done at this hotel, I can tell you that we NEVER heard any noise from any workmen and all seems to be done apart from a couple of small patch work being completed. We loved this hotel and it is close to seaworld and discovery cove. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Their growing pains were a pain for us......”
Reviews.Author: snowy42
Reviews.Content: We were guests from 7/6-7/12....part of the dance competition....all details of the competition were handled nicely by staff but there were annoying problems that I don't think can be blaimed on the renovations..... Rooms were very nice although ours was a bit humid ...housekeeping was terrific! We had a sweet lady who tolerated our messy girls very well... Television was a bit lacking in choices.. Food....I CANNOT believe that any hotel would host a convention of this size (booked solid) without providing more food choices...breakfast was too expensive for every day,,,pool served best food deal...there were cold ala carte items available for breakfast and lunch in the lobby each day but they were boring after third day.. the only bar open before 5 pm was the pool bar where it was near 100 degrees each day. Steve was a huge help there in getting the girls fed quickly with a hot meal during their short meal breaks.... I realize that most conventions end daily activities at a certain time so perhaps they weren't prepared for our group....the girls are in class or competition from 8 am until 11-12 pm every day. they require a great deal of convenience. My biggest concerns were one problem getting a large spill cleaned up in a very dangerous location......security had no way of contacting the front desk and when i tried to use the house phone from the convention center there was no answer from the operator. It took 15 minutes to get someone to LOOK at the spill... Also, when we were trying to leave, we were unable to reach the bell captain by phone....another guest gave up and went out on the curb to ask for help with bags and this was NOT during the rush exit times...... Just disappointing for the price and reputation of a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Growing pains....”
Reviews.Author: hopebh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Sea World and if that is where you are going the location simply can not be beat; we loved being able to walk there from the hotel and not having to pay for any additional parking. They are at the tale end of renovating the place and it really isn’t too shabby. There is a huge part of the lobby that seems bare that looks really weird; when I asked about it I was told that they were going to leave it that way because they used that area for the convention crowd. This part of the lobby did not offend my hubby, so it could just be my high aesthetic senses kicking in; it just seemed odd that they put two obviously cool and new restaurants so close together and left a huge area bare. There was a dance competition here during our stay but we did not find the many kids that were in the hotel obtrusive. They were everywhere, even the bars, but they just seemed to go on about their business. Over all, I’d give the hotel a B-; the only way that I would go back is if we were just going to Sea World again, otherwise there are much nicer hotels in the area. Room Notes We found that room was a decent size and that the décor of the room was lovely. It had a nice sofa and chair in sea green and royal blue tones that was pretty to look at and extremely hard to sit on. There is a refrigerator but it was only for non-perishable food (I know, what’s the point??) The bed was relatively soft. The television was a LCD television with high definition channels (I never understand why hotels will put a high definition television in a room yet most of the channels are blurry….). The bathroom was typical and the tub was small (or I my butt is getting fatter). The shower had nice water pressure and a nice shower head on it. We had a room with a door out to the lobby area which was nice in concept, but not in reality; it was nice to be able to look down at the lobby but it was pretty noisy with the door open. I give the room a B+. Restaurant Notes Mist is their version of a hip and modern booze and sushi bar in their lobby area that just opened two weeks ago. Nice atmosphere and giant LCD wall that played a fish tank dvd all the time. We went down there both nights that we were there and found the staff really nice and they made some of the best martinis that I have ever had. We had a really good time there both nights. We liked the waitress and the service she gave us. I’d give it a B. Boardwalk is a sports bar right next to Mist with a lot of cheap modern furniture and lots of LCD televisions. Again, I question why they put these two obviously new restaurant/bars so close together when there is so much space in the room that is bare. Oh well… Anyhoo, we also hit this place both nights because we liked the atmosphere and found the food to be good both nights, drinks were inconsistent and the service was always bad. I’d give this place a B- because the great grub was cancelled out by the crappy service. Tradewinds – On the advice of our crappy waitress at the Boardwalk we decided to hit their breakfast buffet for $19 per person. Everything except for the service was okay; my hubby had an omelet and he thought it was delicious. I had the mini waffles and they were waffles. (How can you screw waffles up?) The bacon and sausages was typical buffet fare and some of the fruit was ripe and some of it wasn’t. They had some interesting things that I am not daring enough to try like hash browns with cheddar cheese, corn beef hash and cheese blintz. If I had a choice between this place and sitting in line at IHOP for an hour (which we did the second morning), I’d be torn; I don’t mind paying $20 per person for breakfast, but it has to be more than a C+. (BTW – the IHOP breakfast was twice as good and cost half as much.) They had what appeared to be a nicer steak restaurant which wasn’t open while we were here so I can’t comment on it. I was told that it would be opening in the next month or so. They also had a Starbucks that opened last week. We didn’t go to the gym and only walked through the pool area which seemed busy even later in the evening. They had carpeted tennis courts which I really wanted to try but just didn’t have the time to do so. Over all I thought that the hotel was pretty average in a city of some spectacular hotels. Last time we were in Orlando we stayed at the Peabody and loved everything about it; this hotel paled in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kikst555
Reviews.Content: We are from the UK and stayed at this hotel from the 18 June for 2 weeks for our honeymoon and both agreed it was one of the nicest places we had ever stayed! From the start of our stay through to the day we left, the service was excellent and we could not fault it. We were checked in as soon as we stepped through the doors and offered a glass of champagne and asked which kind of room we would like - we picked one with a king size bed and a view over seaworld which was nice to see the fireworks every night! I asked if we had a fridge in the room and was told that we did not but that one would be sent up right away - one arrived within 10 minutes. The guest relations staff were helpful during our stay along with the guys outside the hotel who are always ready to get you a cab or welcome you back after a day at a park. The room was very big and modern and the bathroom was lovely. Our bedding and towels were changed daily. The pool was also nice, clean and had towels around it for you to use. The renovations were almost finished and starbucks opened on the last day of our stay, we never heard any work going on at all. The location is great - if you want to go somewhere to eat all you need to do is hop on the I-ride trolley, this stops RIGHT outside the hotel. If you don't want to wait for this you can get a cab - we got one a few times to the centre of international drive and it cost us about $10. A cab to the I-hop or Dennys around the corner for breakfast cost us about $5. Breakfast at the hotel was nice, if a little more expensive than going out but the buffet has a good choice. There is a mears desk at the hotel where you can book tickets and transfers. We had transfers included in our package with Virgin and that was invaluable - most days we had a taxi rather than a shuttle take us to the parks as it was only us going. If you have to pay for transfers it costs about $14 round trip per person to Disney. It took us about 5 minutes to walk across the car park to seaworld and we had a good view of it. Overall, this is a great place to stay - good hotel, great location, helpful staff, the list goes on. We had the time of our lives and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: Momonthego_7
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this hotel for $119. a night, which we thought was a reasonable price. We rented a Chrysler Town & Country Mini Van which had the navigational system built in - which was really a BIG help since we were driving in unfamiliar surroundings. We liked the fact that the hotel was away from the hustle and bustle of International Drive - it took just 10 minutes to drive to Universal Studios, and Sea World was right across the street. There are no restaurants / shopping in the immediate area - so if you do not have access to a vehicle - you should probably rethink booking this hotel. One major drawback is that they do not offer free shuttles to the attractions - as so many other hotels in the area do. Upon check in the girls at the front desk could not be nicer, they changed our room to one with a doorwall facing the atrium, when we asked about it. They offered my husband and I each a glass of champange, and gave each of our kids a stuffed Shamu toy. The queen beds were exceptionally comfortable. The room was very spacious with four chairs and a desk. We had a vaulted ceiling which really made it look big. We were surprised at the Plasma TV in the room. We liked the fact that there were two bathroom sinks - it made it much quicker to get a family of four out the door in the morning. The room faced the beautiful 10 story atrium. The pool area had the feel of a luxurious resort with a cabana bar right there. We would most likely stay again - but only if we plan on renting a car again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hathawaynorth
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention. Clean, great service, and right next to Seaworld. Good food at restarants, but not far from many other choices. We didn't have a good view, but that was not important for this trip. Fast elevators, and overall no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: finfan00
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of hotels in Orlando just for fun (we live here) and this was by far our best stay and price we've had so far. I got the reservation from Priceline.com for $95.00 per night (2 nights). When we got there I asked about an upgrade since it was my birthday next day and man, did we get one! They gave us an enourmous corner room with a king bed PLUS the adjoining room with king bed, each with high def flat screen TVs all at no extra charge, plus they didn't charge us for parking for either night. On top of that, the service was wonderful, took about 20 minutes each time for our room service orders to get there. The rooms were extremely clean and looked like they may have been recently renovated. The renovation construction in the lobby area was minimal and not noisy at all. Marriott has bought this hotel recently and is making it into very high 4 star I believe. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the food at The Tradewinds restaurant in the hotel, they need to work on that, otherwise, a really wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nicola_louise
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel from June 9th until June 23rd. The hotel is still undergoing some renovations but you can hardly notice it, the new starbucks is due to open July 2nd and looks really nice. Most aspects of this hotel are really good but some things let it down. I'll start with the good things; the swimming pool area is fantastic, and the bar next to it does good food at a reasonable price. The bedrooms are quite large with a brand new plasma tv and the beds are extremely comfy!! we had breakfast in the hotel nearly everyday, the buffet costs $19 dollars each but even though its expensive the choice of food is amazing! we had dinner twice at the hotel restaurant 'tradewinds' but both times it was horrible so wouldn't recommend eating there at night. The bad things about the hotel are; some of the staff at the check in desk are very rude and dont seem like they really want to be there but the staff in the restaurants and shop are very polite and helpful. The main disadvantage for the hotel is the location, eventhough its great for seaworld (just across the car park) for restaurants at night, there arent any! you have to get the i-tolley to get to the main part of international drive, and when you have been at a park all day we found we were too tired to have to wait for a bus to be able to get a meal, but we had to as there weren't any in walking distance and the hotel food at night tasted horrible! All in all i would recommend the hotel but if i go back to florida i would stay nearer international drive or at a disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shamuBritinOrlando
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Renaissance from 9 to 23 June 2007. From the moment we arrived I felt that all the staff were there to make sure my stay was enjoyable as possible. Check-in was effortless and I was told to address any further enquiries to guest services. Guest services couldn't do enough for you. I asked about i-ride trolley tickets and received complimentary ones for the first week of my stay. I asked lots of questions about where to eat, drink and enjoy myself and always received good advice. We were in two rooms on the 4th floor, the room allocated to my daughters was large, my wife and I were allocated a suite just down the corridor which was massive to say the least. Both rooms faced Seaworld and we enjoyed the firework display most evenings. The guys out the front of the hotel would do anything for you. If you wanted a cab they would whistle and one would appear from the car park. If you were using Mears transport to go to theme parks etc, they would make sure you got in the right shuttle bus! The only two negative comments I would make are that to eat and drink in the hotel was fairly expensive and wasn't really for a family budget. Also, if a function was taking place in the center of the hotel the noise echoed around the interior and could be heard in your hotel room. We love Seaworld, so staying across the road was a great advantage. Disney is about 15 mins from the hotel and Universal is about 10mins. A Lynx 50 bus stopped outside the hotel and went to the Disney transportation centre for $1.50 (75 pence!) if you didn't have transportation as part of your holiday package. The i-ride trolley stop was also just outside the hotel, the trollies can be quite crowded this time of year and dont always arrive every 20mins as advertised on the website!! All in all my stay was very enjoyable and I would recommend anyone to go to the Renaissance for customer service and proximity for attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: stone2
Reviews.Content: Ranking 69th? Crazy!. Enormous room, clean and well appointed. Big TV, pool, everything seemed new. Staff was on the ball. Check in took about 30 seconds. Quiet and black-out drapes that really work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Indiegoddess
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a wonderful experience. We did a discovery cove package and the hotel was very accomodating. The location was excellent. They are in the process of upgrading and it looks like it will become an even better hotel. We did not spend much time in the room as it was very plain, but in just the right way. It immediately makes you want to enjoy the general area. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had a hi-def television. The door staff and valets were incredible. Gave great advice and were helpful in every way. The check in staff did not give a good overview of what the hotel had to offer, but we saw a nice pool, a small game room, lovely bars, and soon a Starbucks. Across the street is seaworld. I would say, this hotel is very family friendly and also excellent for a business traveler. We were neither, but left feeling we would enjoy staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, but lobby construction was a major detraction”
Reviews.Author: SueCav
Reviews.Content: The reason why I stayed at this hotel was because I joined by husband on a business trip, so his company paid for the room. Otherwise, the price for the hotel seems quite high, given that the lobby is undergoing major construction. I'm sure it will be beautiful when it's completed, but now it is a major eyesore and I think guests should be offerred a discount on their rooms because of it. Since my husband was at work, I stayed by myself at the hotel all day. Since the lobby was undergoing construction, it was not a pleasant place to hang out. Also, the temperatures were extremely cold and I found myself shivering every time I left the room. For me, the workout room was the best part of the hotel. There were several cardio machines (treadmills, lifesteppers, recumbent bikes) with built in TVs -- just bring your headphones and you can access all the satellite TV channels as you work out. They also had extensive free weights and nautilus type machines so you could work out virtually every muscle. They had a separate mirrored room for stretching, complete with yoga mats and medicine balls. The exercise room was extremely clean and comfortable -- better than my gym at home. The pool was nice. There is an outdoor bar to order drinks (around $5-7) and sandwiches/salads (around $9-10). My only complaint about the pool is there are these really annoying small black insects all over the place. I don't know what they're called, but they're annoying like gnats, only bigger, and they travel in pairs, as if they are constantly mating. They seem to be pretty common in the Orlando area, and for some reason, loved to hang out at the pool. The room was very comfortable. I slept well on the beds, it was quiet, and very clean. I didn't find the front desk people very welcoming at check-in, but they were responsive when we had a problem in the room and the concierge was helpful with dinner planning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb but,”
Reviews.Author: elsalawy
Reviews.Content: Originally from Gainesville, FL (home of the Florida Gators), We've booked this hotel because it was close to discovery cove. Staff was very friendly. construction was very visible and loud during the day, that didn't bother us because we were out of the hotel day time. Our room on the 10th floor was noisey due to service elevator, or may be we're very sensetive. Hotel front desk did offer us to change our room. In spite of email request and original website booking request there was no baby crib in room, it was however provided promptly upon our request onsite. Very pleased with hotel service and staff, would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: GolfingDad
Reviews.Content: I came down with my family during April. I had booked this resort because my son had always wanted to go to SeaWorld and Disney, and the location of this resort was perfect. I was a bit weary about the renovations going on. True, there was a little noise, but if you are out in the day you won't notice it...we didn't. The guest rooms are completely remodeled and they look very sharp and trendy. Also, have a couple children the extra size the standard rooms has really helps out if you are traveling for a few days. I was so very impressed by the Guest Services department. Between the valet guys also saying "hi" and greeting us (they gave me complimentary ice cold bottled water whenever I would come in from running) to them dropping us off as SeaWorld in their sleek Escalade, they were the best I've experienced. The concierge team had all of our answers about local attractions and dining. Pooja (sp?) and Daniel always greeted us with a smile and wanted our feedback of how we enjoyed their recommendations...very 5 star. Renovations are supposed to be complete I guess sometime in June or July, but they won't affect your stay anymore. It was worth mild inconvenience of renovations for the great location and spectacular service....one more thing my son now goes to sleep each night next to the stuffed shamu the man manager gave him upon our arrival...what a cool touch. Kudos Renaissance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Remodeling”
Reviews.Author: SnorkelRob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still working on a $21 million dollar renovation project as of 5-18-07. Be aware that the giant lobby area is a bit of a mess and there is some construction noise as a result. If you do stay here, you might want to request a room that faces outside instead of the rooms overlooking the lobby and noise. My room was recently updated with a flat screen TV, new paint, new carpet, etc and looked great. The pool area is bit small for hotel of this size. The hotel's location is good, directly across the street from Sea World and a short drive to Disney or other Orlando activites. This hotel is probably not a 5 star property as some sources indicate, but it is a nice place to stay. Ask for a deal when making reservations and ignore the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Just not the Renaissance you expect”
Reviews.Author: shanenolan2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 6 day stay during a trade conference. Being a regular stayer at Renaissance , I was pleased to have booked this place. However, this is not what you would expect as a deluxe hotel the niecities are few and far between . They are really not ready for guests here. They claim to be "almost through" the $20m renovation but its hard to prove. Where did they spend the money.? More than a few times , I had to call down and ask them why construction noises were waking me up at 4am or 6am and not the times they stated for construction noise of 8am to 6pm. The hotel is a bit of a barn with its huge atrium the restaurants and bars ( the ones that are actually open) seem quite vacant . More vacant of course is the service . They keep the temps quite cold in the hotel so expect to freeze in the public areas. Dont expect fining dining here. While many major Orlando hotels sport an upscale restaurant, this does not. You are greeted by many young men and women at the front desk when you check in ( they are all wearing trendy black outfits with ear pieces)giving you the sense that you might be in for great service. However ,In most cases count on having to call guest services at least twice for everything you need. The housekeeping is dreadful. Imagine a week there and they never ran a vacumm cleaner once. Room service is a bit of a joke as they are severly understaffed ( their claim). Families will like the empyty unstocked mini fridge though you will have to go shopping elsewhere for anything for that fridge as the hotel gift shop has very little to offer on the "snacks" side. The rooms as the advertising claims, are quite large though the decor is quite cheezy . I imagine they thought the lime coloured sofa blended well with the electric blue carpeting and yello painted walls. Duh ! The pool itself is not bad but don't count on good food or service at the grill restaurant. By the way, for those who think its walking distance to Sea World next door think again. Its next door alright but still a good mile walk plus . Shane Nolan

Reviews.Title: “wait until renovations complete!”
Reviews.Author: natalie10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the renaissance seaworld for four nights. We were booked in for two weeks but moved to the sheraton safari on lake buena vista for remainder of our stay. There were a couple of issues we had with the hotel-firstly the renovations in the lobby dont look like they will be finished any time soon(it is like a building site) and secondly, the location is not very good if you do not have a car. There are no restaurants or shops within walking distance and even though the trolley stops outside the hotel , it gets very busy in the evening. The hotel will be stunning when it is completed as the rooms were lovely and probably the largest i have ever stayed in. The pool area is also very nice with two huge whirlpools and very comfortable sun loungers.I will definitely return when all the work is completed and i will make sure to hire a car!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel despite building work”
Reviews.Author: EnglandJo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks in this hotel. I was very very worried about the building work going on, but the hotel was absolutely lovely. The Atlantis and Tradewinds restaurants and bar are open as normal and at the moment they are just working on the bar right in the middle of the atrium. This building work is hidden behind in the lifts as you go in so we didn't even notice it apart from when we were walking along the hallways to get to our room. I did specifically request a room overlooking Seaworld and I have to say that if anybody is going here during the building works then this is a must. Some rooms look outwards onto Seaworld or the pool, while other rooms only look out into the atrium of the hotel. We didn't hear any of the work going on from our room but as soon as we stepped outside it was fairly loud. So you are well sheltered from it if you have a room looking outside, but I can imagine the rooms over the atrium could maybe be quite noisy. I would recommend going to this hotel once all the work is finished because it looks like its going to be even better. Staff were first class, despite some other reviewers comments, and always very helpful - especially the valet guys outside. We didn't take a car and I'm glad we didn't. We had free shuttles to all the parks so it didn't cost us a penny. When we went to Disney, the shuttle took us to the specific park we wanted rather than dropping us all off at a central point. Quite often we had a taxi as it was just the two of us! There is an I-ride and Lynx bus stop right outside the hotel so it was very easy to get to International Drive for shopping and eating too. The pool area was lovely and completely spotless. We didn't try any of the restaurants inside the hotel so I can't comment on those. Our room was absolutely wonderful. It was massive with a King size bed, sofa, chair and stool, dressing table etc. Double sinks in the bathroom and all the toilettries you could need! A bonus for me too was that they gave us bottled water everyday which saved me having to buy a load! All in all this hotel was wonderful. The rennovations did not cause us any stress and the staff and rooms were wonderful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody, including non-drivers, and I hope I can save up enough to go back when it's all fnished!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kathp1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for two weeks and had the best time. The hotel was having work done to it but that was not a problem you didnt really notice it.
