When we arrived and pulled up at the front of the hotel we were met by the valets, and told we could leave the car at the front while we checked in the decide if we would like to self park or valet park for $10 a day we decided to valet park. We were helped in with out bags and check in was problem free, we were given a glass of champagne while the paper work was done. We were given a pool view room. What can I say it was just so beautiful, Large bed great bathroom and it was quiet. The staff were helpful and polite with every request. The parking staff were a fountain of knowledge and told you the best places to eat and things to do other than the main parks. every time you called down the car was waiting with the air con on when you got there with bottles of water inside waiting. You are close to everything at this hotel and sea world is just across the road, there are lots of good restaurants near, and you can go on foot, drive or get a taxi for not to much. We will be back to this hotel again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room was very nice, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Jay30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel (package w/ Discovery Cove) for our anniversary and my late birthday present. While I was impressed with the room (bed was wonderful!); I was disappointed with the staff . The staff seemed like they did not know what was going on. We were going to make coffee in our room in the morning but there was no coffee pot and when we called the front desk to find out where they sell coffee; the lady said we could make it in our room, when we told her there was no coffee pot she said to use a cup. Can you believe it? Who uses a cup to brew coffee? Especially in such an "expensive" hotel. There was one bartender in Winston's Lounge that was very snotty when we were in the bar and the hostess at Tradewinds gave us an attitude when we went looking for coffee in the afternoon. Our package deal included champagne upon arrival and breakfast each morning. We received nothing from the hotel. And I cannot believe with all the money you spend to stay on their property they charge $12 a day to park there. Unbelievable. I understand the hotel is undergoing renovations and I'm sure it will be beautiful when it is finished but I would definitely not stay there. It is too expensive and not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort across the street from Sea World”
Reviews.Author: PaFrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a close resort to Sea World and Discovery Cove, as this was a 4 day trip to Orlando from Mar 31 to Apr 3. We have been to Florida many times and was looking for something different. This resort was beautiful. The room was very big, clean and the beds were very comfy. First class all the way. The pool area was great as well. You only had to walk across the street to Sea World and they had a shuttle van to take you to Discovery Cove. I did not rent a car so Mears transportation was the best way to get to this resort from the airport. They were still doing renovations but that did'nt interfere with our stay. We were out of the room most of the day anyway. The staff was very polite and helpful. My 14 year old son really enjoyed this resort, pool and close proximity to Sea World and Discovery Cove. If you are tired of Disney and Universal this is a great place to relax and enjoy all Sea World has to offer. When we were leaving it looked like they are building a water park right next to Sea World which will open in 2008. Definitely will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: BillyColeraine
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon told our travel agent we liked Florida and to give us the best he had price was not a problem. And he sent us here on arrival the two young ladies at the desk had a heated discussion just out of our ear shot, it was clear one of them did not want us to stay in the room the other lady had for us. But it was this room we got on the 3rd floor over looking the hotels venting system shabby décor very poor bathroom with the smallest bath I have ever seen That night we ate in the hotel’s restaurant and spent the next 48 hours being violently ill bad Scallops? Or a bug caught during travel? I will let the reader be the judge. I never heard any building noise during my stay but then never saw any actual work going on! at the pace of refurbishment I think the renovations will take till Christmas 2010. My wife and I have reason to travel with work and would stay in many 5 star hotels this is not 5 star and in my opinion is a failing 3 star poor décor poor food poor accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lregine
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on March 23rd- 26th and i enjoyed it very much. It is still going through renovation..and doesnt look like its going to be finished any time soon. I was told that sometime during june it should be completed. But besides that.. the rooms are gorgeous, upscale and very clean. We had a very comfortable king size bed, huge flat screen t.v., and the room was really big. The bathroom came with double sinks, and we were stocked with new towels everyday. The staff was extremely friendly. Construction really didnt bother us. We were told that it started at 8am in the morning, but it never woke us up. We are already planning for our return, in fact we already paid for it.. but we plan on coming in july, after renovations are done, or maybe in october to attend Halloween Horror Nights. But all in all this hotel is a great ...but i recommend staying here when the renovations are finished!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dayjur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a 14 night stay at the Orlando Renaissance Resort and we have nothing but praise for all of the staff, who we found to be courteous, efficient and helpful at all times. There was the drawback of the small amount of noise created by the ongoing renovation of the lobby area, but at no time can I say that the noise was loud enough to upset us. Our room was delightful - quite the nicest we have ever stayed in - and we thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary coffee, etc. provided. The pool area was very nice and there was always an ample supply of extremely comfortable loungers available. I can heartily recommend this hotel to anyone, but with one reservation: we felt that the newly created restaurants were rather expensive and the menus offered little in the way of choice. Being "value for money" folk, we set off for International Drive each day and ate at various restaurants there. Much more choice on offer and at realistic prices.

Reviews.Title: “Will be excellent once work is completed”
Reviews.Author: geordienewcastle-7
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at hotel from the 23feb til the 9th march. We had booked this hotel a year previously and was very disappointed when 2 weeks before we were due to travel we were informed of the building work, especially as i work for the travel company and it was a STAFF booking. However they had left so little time there was no other suitable option to change to. The work was apparently due to be completed by end of march however when we were there there was still ajor works going on and when speaking to the hotel staff they were under the impression that the hotel wont be completed til at least june. The bar in middle is no where near finished either is the main entrance or the star bucks. Having said this the check in staff were very helpful in getting us a room away from noise and away from the elevators which are also meant to be noisy. The rooms were fantastic about 30 foot long with plasma tv, twin sinks etc. The work that was going on didnt really disturb our holiday much as we were always out doing parks and on our last day they opened the new Tradewinds restaurant which served buffet meals at $20 and was fantastic I wish it had opened earlier. This is aswell as the atlantis ad the palms restaurant. The pool area is nice and never very busy as full of business people. The free transport that you get if you travel with certain holiday companies is great most of the time they just send taxis for you. There were a couple of times they didnt show but if you just get a taxi and get a receipt they will refund you at hotel. The bus stop outside the hotel takes you everywhere for a dollar and is really useful. All in all I would say this hotel and the service you get is really good but will be excellent once work is completed and I fully intend to go back once work is completed. If you are looking for cheap park tickets try travel republic for disney. I wouldnt get universal til you get there unless you are looking to go to city walks more than 4 times as they working doing buy one get the second park free at universal and buy one day get one free at seaworld. Also if you aernt driving and are looking to get to and from the airport try Happy Limos on a google search they only charged £70 round trip from sanford and the coach is £33 each. They were really good and waited for us no extra charge when we were delayed they even do shopping stops. Ask for robert the driver he is fab.

Reviews.Title: “nice but under rennovation”
Reviews.Author: puggirl76
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when we got this hotel on priceline and it said it was under reno. It turned out to be fine though. Even during the hours they were working, I didn't notice much noise. The room was nice and large and it had a flat panel tv. The bed was very comfy. The couch and chair were nice to have but they were hard as a rock. Staff were friendly as well. The pool area and hot tubs were really nice as were the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Berghof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in mid February while on vacation. The hotel, as mentioned, is undergoing renovation in the lobby area and it looks like it will be several weeks before this is completed..to me this was a minor inconvenience. The noise does not start until 8am which most people are up by that time anyway. The rooms and hallways are all completely remodeled. We had room 6004. It was a very large and nicely appointed room with a LCD TV...bathrooms were very nice as well. Self parking is $8.00 a day. The pool area is very large and upscale with two whirlpools. The staff was friendly. Definitely a bargin at $100.00 a night off Priceline. They did not charge a resort fee either...maybe due to the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Room Walkways are exposed to Atrium Lobby”
Reviews.Author: jpradonc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still right in the middle of construction in February 2007. The staff are very attentive. The place is about empty. It is right across the street from Sea World and Discovery Cove. I think that it is a good hotel but I will not stay there because it has an open atrium. I have a fear of heights and I do not like hotels where I get off the elevator and walk to my room with a railing alongside that has a huge dropoff. I do not go out on balconies for this reason but this exposure to heights in unavoidable for me at this place. Most people do not have this phobia so it should be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance at Sea World”
Reviews.Author: cgarcia
Reviews.Content: My hat is off to this property for how well they handled my group. Coming right off New Year's Day Bowl Game group to a Corp. group with 300+ attendees. Front of hotel looks a little rough but once you get to your room you have forgotten about the lobby construction. Service was first rate from the time i walked through the front door, until time to go which for me was (6) days later. Meeting space is very well maintained and staffed better than i expected. Reaction time to pop-up requests was outstanding. Service staff is both well trained, and friendly. They actually seem to like where they work, and it shows. No one acted as though they were above doing whatever needed to be done. To me that is a sign of a strong Operations Dept. Job Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Had a wonderful time, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Betweet
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. This was the first real vacation that we were able to take my 9 year old daughter and we enjoyed every minute of it. Our room faced sea world and could see the fireworks at night. Sea world was right across the street and since we had flex tickets we could walk over to the park when ever we wanted. 90% of the staff was very nice and pleasant. The housekeepers were the nicest of all and always said hi when you saw them. The pool was amazing and loved the jacuzzi's, it was nice to relax after a long day at one of the parks. The litte snack shop in the lobby was reasonable to eat at, and the staff was very nice also. I would have to say the restaurant was very expensive to eat at, all though the food was good. I do wish the pool stayed open alittle longer than 11pm but I understand the reasons it closes at that time. They had several kids activities that my daughter enjoyed., like one night they had hot dogs or hamburgers and a movie out by the pool for only 5 dollars. The only bad thing that happened was the electricity went out for about an hour or so on the morning we was leaving and it kinda put a strain on things. Over-all I would definitely go back to this hotel, I felt it was worth the money we spent and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not during rennovations”
Reviews.Author: BARR71
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in September for a 2 weeks holiday. On booking this holiday we were informed by the travel company that there was ongoing rennovations. On checking there website at booking it stated all work shall be finished 31st December. As we were arriving on the 27th December we felt that work would be almost completed. On arrival we were under no illusion that work would not be completed for a long time. I had read a ladies comment on Trip Advisor about this hotel in December and not to come here. I contacted the hotel who reassured me there was still ongoing work but it would cause minimal disruption and they booked us into a room on the 10th floor away from the minimal amount of noise made. On arrival to room 1057 the room was beautiful and we could see DisneyWorld from the room, all good. Then we discovered we were under the elevator motor which kept us awake most of the night. We requested to be moved which they could not do until New Year's day. With 2 adults and 2 small children moving was not a small task. We were moved to the 5th floor,(5007) the door did'nt seal properly and thus fore we could hear the noise from the lobby (Waterfall at night but not the end of the world). We didn't want to move again due to the hassle this would cause so we just got on with it. Then during the day the real noise began. There was jack hammering going on most of the day. You could not stay in your room during the day, the noise was UNBEARABLE!! There is no were to sit in the lobby and relax during the day so we spent our complete holiday whilst in the hotel in our room. This hotel that we booked in September was due to have work completed in December 31st and paid alot of money for as a 4Star hotel. When we spoke to Duty Manager Brenda Lasaari about constuction work beginning at 07.30 - 18.00 she very firmly told us that our tour operator knew about the work and it was there responsibilty to inform us. Fair enough, she looked up our package and told us we should not have been paying for parking so she wiped the parking bill. I went back to Brenda to try and get a contact number for our tour operator and she then asked why we had left it to the end of holiday to complain, I explained about the inconvience of moving rooms again with 2 children. She then informed me that I got a cheap holiday as the price was on the form I gave her. The holiday cost £4,000 I aked her if she considered $8,000 a cheap holiday and she said yes and that if thier hotel was up and running we would never have been able to stay for this price. She then gave us 2 days vouchers for breakfast. This experience really ruined my holiday and I am really dissappointed with the Marriott group. This hotel is running on a 14% occupancy and was the only hotel in Orlando with empty rooms over the Christmas, New Year period. There is a very good reason for this. Do not go here until work is completed in April 2007. Don't do as I done and ignore these realistic facts. If you don't believe me see the pictures for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caymanfvr
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel! It was recently rennovated and was very clean. The service was excellent. Reception went out of their way to make us feel at home including upgrading us to a VERY spacious room with an incredible view. Our breakfast was included in the package and had everything we needed. Even thought the hotel is conviniently located near to Sea World, it is also located to other Orlando attractions and close to the major highways. A wonderful hotel for the money- no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ando69
Reviews.Content: Hiya Both myself and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel from 25th November 06 to 9th Dec 06 for my 21st Birthday and had a fab time. We booked the holiday nearly a year ago even though there was work being done in the lobby we are glad we stayed at the hotel. Hotel The hotel is HUGE!!! At the moment due to work being done $21 million re vamp so there is only one resturant open - Atlantis. We didnt eat at resturant but there always seemed to be people in there all the time. There is also a small shop where you can buy drinks... Mountain Dew!!! crisps newspapers etc. Also a shop(DeLI) that sold Starbucks, muffins and cakes. Hotel Room The room was recently re furbished,massive especially for just the two of us. We were on the 7th Floor over looking Seaworld!!! We had a KING size bed (really comfy!!!!) with lots of pillows!! A 38inc flat screen TV with the american channels on ABC, Disney, ESPN etc. We had a sofa bed, table and chairs and also an internet connection in the room. The bathroom was really big and so clean we had two sinks!!!! and a large bath with a shower. We got lots of shampoo and soaps each day aswell as clean towels. We also got a little free shamu in the bathroom which was really cute. Pool The pool was massive with lots of sunloungers and a pool side bar the drinks were a little expensive however u always find this if u eat and drink in the hotel. Transport We came to Florida with Airtours as a package deal included was transfers to and from all the Disney parks and Universal with Meers.There is a desk near the hotel reception where you arrange transport with them. We noticed it would have costed approx $50 dollars a day to go to disney in a cab so I would recommend either take the free transfers if it was included or just go in the car and pay $10 parking at disney. Universal would cost about $20 in a cab. Itrolley is a good cheap way getting around IDrive costs $1 adults, free for kids under 12 and 25 cent for over 60's. We were so happy we stayed at the calmer end of IDrive as the main part of IDrive gets so busy and you cant even cross the roads!!! You can get a Free 1 day pass for ITrolley at Guest Relationations in the hotel they will also give you the time tables for the trolley which runs about every 10 mins from 8.30 in the morning to 10.30pm. Trips We went to the Seaworld Makahiki Luau. We purchased and pre booked the tickets with Attraction Tickes Direct on the internet.The show itself was fantastic however the food wasnt up to much especially for me being veggie!! There was spicy pork and ribs, fried rice with chicken and mixed veg. As u can see it was a plate of veg for me!! The desert was penut butter cake again wasnt really what I liked. Soft drinks were free all nite Coke Sprite Dr pepper etc. Dolly Parton Dixie Stampeed was another show we did which was fab!!! The show celebrated Christmas there was pig racing ostrich racing ice skating, dancing and of course horses... it even snowed!!! The food the show everything was brilliant. For those meat eaters you get a whole chicken to eat with your hands!!! u also get veg soup which is really nice loads of veg and an apple pie for desert. Also drinks are free in the main show including wine and budlite!! The pre show you have to pay or drinnks which were pricey $4 dollars for soft drinnk so we only had the one. Overall as you can see we had a brilliant holiday!!!! If you have any questions pls just email me jen4hatton@hotmail.com Oh ..... dont listen to the negative reviews - we were hardley in the hotel we were there from 10pm til 8am and the work men didnt start work til 8am to 5. Have a brill holida!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge building workin in hotel 8am to 5pm 7 days a week”
Reviews.Author: stoppard
Reviews.Content: I was aware of building work taking place in the hotel but was not aware to what extent. I am still in the hotel travelling on business with my husband as I write this report. If we had been paying for the stay I would of demanded to be moved, as I & many of the guests fell that the hotel should be closed wile the building work is taking place. The hotel lobby(which is the centre of the hotel & all the rooms & facilities’ surround it) is being ripped up, & floor removed coursing huge amount of noise & dust everywhere as it is not contained in any way. All of the restaurants are closed apart from one & a bar as they are also being renovated. You can not escape the noise & dust as everywhere you go there is building work taking place. If you want to sleep after 8am get some ear plugs & if you wish to have a conversation with reception be ready to shout as you can not hear over the drilling noise. Staffs in the hotel do not help the situation as they are clearly as fed up as the guests with no smile or friendly welcome. My advice to anyone travelling to this hotel in the next few months is don’t, once the work is finished I am sure it will be great but until then it is to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “On a Scale of 1 to 5 - I give it 4 Penguins!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LANDAOZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Orlando for Halloween - 3 nights at Wilderness Lodge Disney and 3 nights at Renaissance Orlando (11/3 to 11/5/06. Booked through Seaworld site which included unlimited length of stay tickets. Was very happy with the hotel. It was very convenient to walk back and forth to Seaworld and easy to get to other attractions and airport. I was worried about the construction but found the work being done at this time minimal. The only work I saw visible was tiling for the lobby floor and some drywall installation, none of which had an effect on my stay. There was no noticable noise or disturbances. I was alittle disappointed in the dining arrangements but saw that the hotel had set up a table in the lobby with drinks, coffee, danish and snacks. I wound up eating dinner at Seaworld Shark Grill every night as a result. The hotel was very clean, the grounds were well cared for, pool was very inviting, staff were friendly and accomodating. Thought the rooms were VERY nice - am accustomed to deluxe rooms as Disney and found the rooms to be comparable with Disney's Yacht Club. Double sinks, very comfortable beds, linen were high thread count and really enjoyed the soaps/shampoos (as the airport was limiting carry on containers). I would definetly stay at this hotel again. Decor was simple, nothing eye catching but comfortable. Check out was easy - on T.V. gift shop had plenty of necessities and souveniers as well as snacks. Submitting quite a few photos - really liked the hotel and would recommend and stay again. Gave it a rating of above average - though it is average for the type of hotels I book when staying in Orlando, I found based on the renovations being advertised, I felt the stay was better than expected so I rated it above average. I am sure that once the renovations are completed and dining/food courts are back in business, it will be an even better experience. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ksti99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Nov.4-11th. Upon check in, was offered a glass of champagne or sparkling cider :) As mentioned before, the lobby area is under construction. Did not bother us, as we were up and about each day before much got underway. Hotel is at a great location. Directly across the street from Sea World. Only about a 10 min drive from the Disney Parks, and from Universal. The room itself was FABULOUS :) We had a king size bed- which I wanted to take home with me. I've never slept in such a comfy bed! The room was very spacious, clean, had a new TV, large bathroom w/ double sinks, and a cute seaworld shamu bath toy went along with the towels. We ordered room service one morning for breakfast. Food was great, service very prompt! Only one thing could be adjusted- would be the $8 fee you pay per day to keep a car on their property. Not such a big deal for us,as we needed our rental car, but for some they may mind it! Overally I had a wonderful vacation. Definately will be returning next year ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance at SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy310
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel lobby is under renovation it is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms have already been renovated and they are beautiful. I can't wait to go back after everything is completed to see the end result. Front desk and management is very helpful and friendly. The front desk manager sent a bottle of wine, fruit and cheese tray to our room because we had problems at the previous hotel. That's great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Under MAJOR Construction with amenities unavailable”
Reviews.Author: eckhoffj
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be nice, I'm sure, when the $21 million dollar renovation is complete. For now, in 10/06, it's a wreck. Only one restaurant was open, the pool bar had closed by 9 pm on a Friday night even though there were 50 or so people wanting to be served. The atrium and lobby are completely blocked off. The rooms require updating, too. If I were you, I'd spend my money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- Across street from Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom0726
Reviews.Content: We stayed (my husband and two small kids) during the labor day weekend. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and the close proximity with Seaworld. They were remodeling the hotel and was worried about dust and noise but they did a good job and it wasnt inconvenient at all. Seaworld is across the street but you have to walk the whole parking lot to get there. It would be nice if they maybe had a shuttle a couple of times a day. The kids had to cross the whole parking lot and complained about it everytime since it was still hot in september and cars were driving fast to get a parking spot. The food of course is expensive but thats a norm with every hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frogwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night in Orlando then came back again 2 days later for a second night. This was a superb hotel. When we arrived we were impressed by the size of the lobby area, and also by the super-efficient check in desk. We were given a free glass of chamagne on arrival and sat for a while in the lobby on the sofas just admiring it all. The rooms here are amazing, we asked for a high floor looking over seaworld and got exactly what we asked for. The bathroom is very big with his and hers sinks, lots of lovely bath products (and a little shamu bath toy - very important). The bed is also huge, I almost lost my husband in it, and so comfortable I thought I was in my bed at home, which was saying something as I am a bed snob. We had room service first night which was excellent food, very fast delivery, and excellent value. When we came back the second time our room was ready first thing in the morning, again just what we asked for. This time we went to the bar in the evening and received attentive service, although I'm not sure I'd rush back as it was a little crowded and they got some of the drinks orders wrong. The breakfasts here are great, I loved the little peach pastries, yum. The pool area is also first rate with a massive heated olympic sized pool and a hot tub so large you can swim around in it. Nice bar area too. I was very impressed indeed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: BigO1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly for the SeaWorld proximity. The hotel room was very well maintained and spacious. Double sinks in the bathroom was a plus. Safe, shamu toy, fridge, big screen tv and lounging area( love seat, armchair,table, desk & ottoman) were greatly appreciated. The staff was nice and friendly throughout the whole process. The pool is great for hanging out or swimming without running into young ones playing around as it is quite big and spacious. Tiki bar was also a plus with the music for ambiance. Walking distance to SeaWorld was a great plus especially at night. takes about 5 minutes from door to gates. really liked the place and will most likely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: astronut
Reviews.Content: Hi. Just got back from a fortnight at the Renaissance Orlando resort at Seaworld. Thought the place was just magnificent. We booked through Virgin Holidays and had requested a high level room. They gave us one on the 3rd floor! The lowest floor for guests. This is my one and only complaint. The hotel has around 700 rooms centred around a huge 14 storey double atrium. Rooms can have either an external view or atrium view. All atrium view rooms have bacolnies. We had an external view room, overlooking Seaworld. No balcony though. The rooms were huge. Apparently the largest in any Orlando hotel. We had two Queen size beds, 2 Armchairs with a coffee table and footrest, a desk and associated chair and the usual TV and cabinet etc. Rooms have safes, fridges, irons, coffee makers etc. Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were clean and kept clean by the house staff. Ground floor of the atrium has an atrium, a koi pond, a couple of bars and restaurants. There is a playroom with video games and a huge, clean pool with bar (and shade!). There are also a couple of tennis courts. We had free transportation to the parks via Mears. They had a desk in the lobby. ou just requested a time for pick up and waited outside the hotel. In the event that not too many are travelling from the hotel, rather than send a shuttle bus for you, they send a taxi instead. All included. Appox. 5 min. walk across the car park to Seaworld entrance. A bit longer to Discovery Cove though the hotel will take you anyway, free of charge. The Trolley, stop number 38 is right outside the hotel and day tickets for this are alos provided by the hotel. Breakfast buffet was huge, though compared ro Ponderosa ect, maybe a tad expensive at $12.00pp. We ordered room service one night and was informed it would be 20-25 minutes. After 40 minutes it hadn't arrived. So rang down and within 2 minutes it arrived, free of charge! As can probably be seen, thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and cannot fault it. Highly recommended. As an aside, the rooms are currently being renovated with LCD screen TV's etc being fitted.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: georgiagrl
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate through Priceline bidding, and was very happy that we were given one of the internal courtyard balcony rooms--it was absolutely lovely. We didn't get the complimentary glass of champagne that I had read was standard--I don't know if that was because I had booked through Priceline, had arrived at the wrong time, or if I was supposed to have asked for it. The room was beautiful and the beds were so comfy. The location to Sea World can't be beat. Some of the people at the front desk weren't the friendliest, but the person who checked me in said he would comp us for parking--don't know for certain if they don't charge guests at all or if they put something on the system not to charge certain guests, but there was a pay booth into which you are supposed to insert your room key and we were not charged for any parking. I thought it was a beautiful place--the swimming pool was fantastic and there was a children's playground also--so overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Beach710
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Renaissance Orlando Resort at SeaWorld for a weekend as part of a Sea World package. The hotel lobby is beautiful. The rooms are very nice. The bed was comfortable. The pool area was big. There seems to be plenty to do, basketball, volley ball, tennis and more. The service is lacking. We experienced the same problems as some of the previous reviews, the maid’s timing is bad, the timeshare people in the lobby leaving voice mail, the deli workers ignoring us, no answer when I called the front desk. The convenience to Sea World is the best part about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel you will ever stay in!”
Reviews.Author: stu≠tty
Reviews.Content: Wow! where do we start! This is by far the most fantastic hotel ever. It is rated as a 5 star and a 5 star it most certainly is. The entrance lobby is huge with a waterfall, fish an aviary, cafe, bar etc etc. The rooms are spacious and cleaned every day. The hotel is spotless and the staff are very friendly. We ate breakfast in the hotel twice which was nice but the room service in the evening was much better. The pool is a great size, very clean and you will always get a sun lounger (a bit more difficult to get an umbrella though). The pool bar is good and serves great food. As part of our package we had free transportation to the disney and universal parks which is operated by Mears transportation at the front desk. The times for the shuttle/taxi transfers operate very regularly and as a result it is not necessary to drive which staying at this hotel. The transfers must be booked 90 minutes before you leave and can be phoned up to an hour before your return. Overall: a wonderful hotel: will we go back?? YES YES YES (if we can afford it!!)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travellers2
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here for a dance convention a couple of years ago and returned for a short stay in July because we had enjoyed it so much the first time. We got our reservation through Priceline for a great rate. Check in was easy and the staff was very pleasant. Our room was wonderful - spacious, clean, comfortable beds - perfect for a family of four. My husband and I enjoyed the bar in the open atrium area and the gorgeous pool - with 2 jacuzzi hot tubs. We had breakfast at the snack bar which was perfect, since we didn't want a big meal in the restaurant. The location is great for visiting Sea World. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clara50
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a big hotel with everything you need for a pleasant stay. I attended a conference and everything was perfect. The rooms are big and confortable, buffet breakfast is good and not too expensive, service efficient and pleasant. Good choice for the Seaworld and International Drive area that is the best if you don´t stay inside Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: sscottishlass
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Reception went out of its way to give us a room overlooking seaworld. Rooms are large and clean., only thing was we had a double balcony sharing with our next door neighbour (strange) The hotel has a lovely pool area and a superb bar at the pool serving delicious food. The days we were sunbathing we were even treated to live music. Great place to unwind. We would go back but be warned you do need a car to get about as you are not on the main stretch of road. Another thing is the car park costs 8 dollars a day so beware it does mount up. ALl in all great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BIZZTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and the rooms were very big. I travel a lot and am in and out of hotels and this hotel was by far one of the best I have stayed in. The location is right by Seaworld, you can walk across the street to the front gate. It is a bit isolated though, aside from Seaworld, so you have to be driving to really enjoy the location. The pool, the pool bar, the restaurants ... all were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ciaexam1
Reviews.Content: We are season pass holders at Universal and Sea World and whenever we come this way, we stay at this hotel. You just cannot beat the quality and customer service this place offers. The pool and hotel are always clean, the breakfast buffet is excellent and well worth the price, and the staff is incredible. My personal thanks to Ray in the Tradewinds for making our meal there the best. I was saddened to hear that the resort will be doing renovations that will include removing the bird atrium( and the birds). To us, that is what made the hotel unique. I only hope that the new renovations wil not take away the style and comfort that is there now. Our only complaint was that management and contractors were knocking on doors asking to measure the curtains in the room. I would have waited until the people in the rooms have checked out- I hope this was an oversight on Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “My 1st Visit to Florida”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay was great at The Renaissance! I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my partner, parents and sister. We asked for adjoining rooms and this request was met with no problems. On arrival I was very impressed with the standard of service offered by all staff and was very impressed with the hotel reception. I was to be impressed further on arrival to my room. The standard to which the housekeeping staff work is exceptional and this standard was met constantly everyday of myself and my families stay. We had a wonderful view of the pool which is a good size and well maintained. Located a short walk from the pool area are three tennis courts, a basketball court and a volley area. The Renaissance is a short walk from Sea World. The I-Ride and Lynx Bus service are available outside the hotel on the main road with services running to all Disney Parks and Universal Parks as well as along International Drive. It is away from the hustle and bustle of I-Drive and is a calm, serene hotel. However, if you prefer to be located within walking distance of amenities such as shops and restaurants then this is probably not the ideal hotel for you. I would once more like to comment on the staff at the Renaissance from the bell-hops, guest services staff, shop staff, housekeeping and security. They were all so very polite and helpful during our stay. The only downsides to our stay was our first and only trip to the Tradewinds Restaurant. We arrived in the evening after a nine hour flight and an hour transfer from Sanford Airport. After settling into our rooms we decided to visit the Tradewinds. We were shown to our seats and then ignored for approximately 20 minutes after which we decided to leave. During this time waiters were clearing empty tables and attending other guests. Other a long journey we were all feeling very tired and this was not ideal. The price of food on this menu (which is also the menu for room service) was expensive. Overall a wonderful hotel with exceptionally high standards, wonderful staff and beautiful surroundings in a relaxing and tranquil environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great service, very good food. Very reasonably priced for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Clean room, great beds, wonderful showers, great atmosphere. Self parking is easy and access to and from hotel parking was great. We stayed for 5 nights while we attended Sea World for a couple of those days. We just walked accross the streat to Sea World (wonderful convenience). Pool area is great and they have planned kids activities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel, Stayed there last year in April.This is a great hotel to relax and unwind, Our hotel room was overlooking sea world which was really handy to judge how buisy sea world was. Room's are spacious and have nice interiour. The service was excellent. our only complaint is that the hotel is used a lot for conference's and weddings so it can be a bit off putting when you are waiting for the lift in the reception area with only your shorts and top on , when everyone else are in suit and jacket. However did find a lift on our last day to avoid the main reception. Will be going there again next year. Spoke to one of their representatives and they are supposed to be starting some sort of rennovation in June of this year. A top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a top class hotel - courteous, friendly staff, spotless rooms, tasty food. Location - second to none - away from the more "crowded" areas of international drive but great for visiting all the parks. Stay at this hotel - I will again, soon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Walk On the Tennis Courts! - Very unfriendly and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over the Easter holiday. Our room was not very clean nor was our bed completely made each night. It was like they stopped half way into cleaning the room. I found the food over priced, service at the pool bar area extremely slow and also a woman behind the counter was extremely rude. I found the grounds were not kept up and that the tennis courts needed repair. While walking across the court to retrieve a ball for my son I slipped on a section of worn out astro-turf and fell and broke my ankle in two places. Although the hotel states that medical assistance is available and there is a first aide sign posted, I could not get any help and had to WALK on my broken ankle through the pool area into the lobby toward the business center. At the business center I saw a hotel employee and I explained what happened and aksed for first aide. She said that they did not have first aide. I then saw FIVE additional employees NONE of which offered to help me. I walked/hopped from the business center to the elevator then to my room. I almost passed out from the pain. Once at my room I called the front desk and was told that all they could do was call security if I wanted. I didn't understand why I needed security so I asked about a hopital and location. My husband was not with me and when he returned he went to the front desk and they gave him a wheelchair with the foot rests broken off and direction to the hospital. I went to the hospital and found out that I had broken my ankle in two places. When I got back to the hotel I had a message from Security. I called and they sent a gentlemen to our room. He had no idea why he had been sent. I explained what happened and he took an accident report. He was the ONLY employee that showed any concern whatsoever. He was very polite. The rest of my trip was ruined because I could not leave the room. I couldn't go to the parks with my family nor leave my room. Only once did the hotel management call to ask if I needed anything. I missed the call because I was asleep. I called and asked if I could have a late checkout because it would take me longer to pack the day we were scheduled to leave and was told I could only have one extra hour!! Upon checking out the employees at the front desk were extremely impolite and at times rude. I never once complained about the dirty room, unkept grounds and tennis court, or the food prices. I then had to drive two days back home to Michigan. Now I'm home and have found that I have to undergo surgery to repair the damage. I received a phone call from a representative of the hotel and returned his call, he never called me back. Not very good customer service. The part that made the experience okay instead of terrible was that lobby was beautiful and the one security guard that came to the room was professional and helpful. I don't want to take away from those two things.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself my husband and my 2 children stayed here in april for 2 weeks what a fantastic 2 weeks we had. The checking in was very quick given champagne on arrival then taken up to ours rooms we did not have to touch our cases.The staff were very nice the hotel was really lovely and the pool was fantastic and most of all the cleanliness was 100%. we will be booking to go back next easter.thanks for a great 2 weeks

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hma
Reviews.Content: We had a great two weeks stay in this hotel, and, uniquely, experienced three different rooms - all of which were elegant, large, and comfortable. Because of its design the ambience was more like living in a town piazza rather than being in a 700+ bedroom hotel. The mix between holidaymakers and convention visitors kept the whole atmosphere one of constant interest. Having stayed in good hotels in USA, Canada, Asia, & Australia I would rate the Renaissance very highly -especially the staff, all of whom were professional, friendly, and eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the renaissance resort in August 2005 for a family holiday, including grandparents. We arrived after a 24hour flight delay to a very welcome glass of champagne and a complimentary dolphin. This was very nice but they had only one room booked for seven of us!! Eventually this was sorted out and we gratefully went to bed. We had visited this hotel on many occasions over the last 12 years for sunday brunch (which is excellent) and had always wanted to stay. Imagine our disappointment when the rooms and pool did not match our expectations. The rooms were large and comfortable but quite shabby. Our major disappointment was the pool. It was dirty and the tiles were covered in grime. We immediately reported this to the front desk who said they would deal with it. They didn't. The pool was only cleaned properly after a chance meeting with a member of the management in the hot tub (also dirty!) when we had a conversation about the cleanliness of the pool before we realised who he was. He agreed the hot tub was filthy and went to check the pool. He assured us something would be done and it was. The sunbeds and tables were old, broken and dirty, not what you expect from a recently renovated pool at a five star hotel. The breakfast was fine when the waffle and pancake lady was present but no better than Ponderosas $3.99 breakfast when she wasn't but it was still $15. The bagels and doughnuts in the deli were surrounded by flies. The sunday champagne brunch is a must though. The staff were friendly and helpful and willingly made reservations for us at our chosen restaurants. Room service was efficient and the food was hot and very nice. The valet parking staff were excellent and very helpful. There was no step to get into our mini van so they found us something for us to use. It is in an excellent position for walking to seaworld but the negatives out weigh the positives and we would not stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and for the most part really liked it. The staff was very responsive and friendly. We enjoyed the various places to eat, especially the deli. The hotel is very beautiful on the inside, especially the lobby. The rooms were big. We travelled with our 18 month old and our 4.5 year old. These are the things we did not like: 1. Although the pool was supposed to be heated - it was freezing! 2. The gift shop's prices were outrageous. They wanted $16 for a package of swim diapers (normally they cost around $7). They don't tell you that they will give you an individual swim diaper for free at the bar. 3. The walk to Sea World is only a five minute walk, however you have to cross a busy road and the walk home is a long one with souveniers and tired kids. I can't imagine why the hotel doesn't get a shuttle or something.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a week long stay at this hotel. We requested a king size bed in one of our rooms. We also requested a room with a balcony. When I checked in, I brought my confirmation number to varify the reservation that had been made a month earlier. Upon mentioning the balcony room, I was quickly told that there was not one available. When I tried to explain, I was interrupted and told there was not one available and that balcony rooms were not guaranteed anyway. Of course, we were not told that when we made the reservation or the request. I accepted the rude woman's answer and just decided that it was not going to bother me. When we arrived at our room, we opened the door to find double beds. I told the bellman that there had been a mistake that we requested a king size bed. I called down to the desk and of course the same woman answered the phone. I explained that I thought there had been a mistake. I was told that there had not been a mistake. That since we needed an adjoining room for the kids that they could not also give us a king size bed. By now I am upset and we have only been in Orlando thirty minutes and I am ready to go home! I went down to the front desk to speak with the woman again to express our unhappiness. She did not seem to care at all. When I asked to speak to the manager, she told me that she was the manager. I then asked for a customer service number for the hotel. She gave me the number and I called from our room. The customer service rep. was appalled at how I had been treated and told me she would be calling the hotel. To make a long story short, the resident manager Chris (nice guy) tried to make amends as best he could. We were treated to breakfast twice and had cookies etc. waiting on us when we returned to the room the following night. I only wish he had been at the front desk the day we arrived and our vacation could have started off better. I will never stay at this resort again mainly because our satisfaction did not matter! You can probably tell that I am still angry over the whole ordeal. Just to top it all off, my in-laws checked in two hours after we did and they got an adjoining room with a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jills12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 5 year old daughter for a week over Christmas. On the whole, we were pretty impressed with this hotel. The reception area is very grand and there is an avairy and large fish pond. The staff were helpful and friendly. Our room was really big compared to any other hotel we have stayed at and our balcony over looked the reception area. The bathroom too was big with 2 sinks and plenty of free shampoo, moisturiser, body wash etc replaced on a daily basis. The pool is large and there are 2 outdoor spas and a children's play park. They also have complimentary gym facilities and an indoor spa/steam room and sauna. They also have a beauty salon but at the usual through the roof hotel prices. I only have 2 complaints about this hotel, firstly, eating in the restaurants is expensive, although the Atlanis restaurant gets a really good name. Breakfast was really overpriced in comparision to other 4* hotels in Orlando so we didn't eat there. They do have a little cafe area though which serves toast, bagels, filled rolls etc which is very reasonably priced. My other complaint is that they have no guest coin laundry - although I do not use this much, it is useful to be able to wash jeans etc. They do have a laundry service but it is $8 to wash and dry a pair of jeans (you would be better buying a new pair!) On the whole, it was a lovely hotel, very clean and convenient for sea world (5 mins walking to main entrance). The hotel says it charges $7 for parking per day but we weren't charged either (like the other reviewer). I possibly would return and would recommend it to anyone if they get it at a good rate (as we did!)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but overall OK”
Reviews.Author: FloridaVisitor12
Reviews.Content: I had a Atrium view/King bed reserved ($250 incl tax). Was able to check-in around 1pm. The first room they put me in was (2) doubles and none of the phones worked, except for the bathroom phone (not what I requested). They then switched me to a King bed without an atrium view (also not what I requested and not what I paid for). The third room was correct, but the heat was on full-blast and took about 3 hours to cool the room down. I went to the front desk and they gave me a $20 breakfast certificate. That was OK, but for $250 a night, I would have expected better service. The rooms were over-sized and the bathrooms had two sinks, but the bathroom floor looked like it had not been scrubbed EVER. The showerhead had much to be desired (once again for $250/night) it should have been supurb! The hotel lobby was beautiful and clean. The breakfast buffet was mediocore. I probably would not stay there again for that price, but if I found a "special" rate, I would go back. Location was great for going to Sea World (about a five minute walk across the Sea World parking lot).

Reviews.Title: “First Class in many ways”
Reviews.Author: mpjc121
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference here but was staying at another Marriott property. I switched as soon as I could because of the bad experience I had where I was staying. I only wish I had booked in here from the beginning. This property is deluxe all the way. From the time you pull in to the time you leave the staff do everything possible to help you. The property itself is huge, almost a square shape with the rooms on the perimeter and the restaurnts, shops and lobby under a glass covered atrium 10 stories high in the center of the square. Very breathtaking when you first walk in. The rooms are huge by normal hotel standards and very well appointed. The bathrooms are large and stocked with nice bath products. The fitness room is excellent with all kinds of free weights, machines and cardio equipment. The outdoor pool area is also very nice. Room service is prompt and the food at this hotel is some of the best hotel food I've had and trust me I've had plenty bad hotel food to know the difference. I also noticed that every staff member made it a point of saying hello to every guest when they passed them in the hallways, from the chamber maids to the managers. That's some good customer service training they must have there. I was sorry to leave and come home to the real world of laundry and bills but I know where to go now when I am back in Orlando again. With so many hotels on Orlando it's hard to know where to go but this one stands out head and shoulders above the rest. I highly recomend it for business professionals and also for families because it was across the street from Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Could use some refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyJohnM
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from 10/6/05 to 10/10/05. The location is very good. The property is across the street from Sea World and a short drive to either Universal or Disney World. I am somewhat " picky ". So I would say that some of the areas in the lobby are in need of refurbishment. Elevators also. Our room was fine. We had booked a package through Priceline so the effective daily room rate was reasonable. The Atlantis Restaurant was excellent and definitely worth a try. The pool area was very nice and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Alittle pricey ....”
Reviews.Author: akawedge
Reviews.Content: I had a one-night stay at this hotel and found it alittle disappointing for the price we paid. When I booked it online, I thought it would be luxurious and very upscale. What I found was an upscale & luxurious lobby, but the rooms were not upscale at all for the price. I didn'f find the rooms any nicer than a Hampton Inn or Comfort Inn. The room was very clean & very well-taken care of, but I found it very cold, even with the air-conditioner off. What also disappointed me with this hotel was that they do not provide a shuttle service to Seaworld, which is only across the street, but is still quite a hike, especially after a long day at Seaworld when everyone is exhausted. If you're not looking for luxury, but just a nice, clean hotel to stay in, this is a good choice -- but for the money they charge plus $7.00/day for parking, a stay at a Hampton Inn would be just as nice for alot less money. You're paying alot of extra money for a fancy lobby and the fact that Seaworld is across the street. It costs $7.00 to park at Seaworld, and the hike from the parking lot is closer than the hike from the hotel to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Helpful Employees!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was so grateful for the wonderful employees at this hotel. From check-in to check-out each one was very helpful and very pleasant. The food in the resturants was excellent and very resaonable for the portions. I will surely stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Orlando. Also, for those who enjoy the fabulous Shamu... Sea World is directly across the street from the Renaissance!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentSue
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for eleven nights the hotel is fantastic and we didnt have any problems apart from the complimentry coffees that kept arriving late. The pool and spa pools were great,we used to come back from Seaworld and go and relax by the pool it was open unil 11pm,I would write my diary and my son and husband would go in the pool. I am Disabled and our room was right by the lift which was excellent not having too far to walk. Also we were given free valeting we would go out and they would collect our car for us and bring it to the front,it had a cold bottle of water in there and they parked it for us too when we came back to the hotel, the staff were brilliant and we would go back to this hotel. We were just accross from seaworld which was fantastic and when we looked out from our balcony we could see Epcot and the Swan Hotel. The room was lovely and clean and a nice size too!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from the Renaissance Hotel and were pleasantly surprised to find that our experience was completely the opposite to many of the negative comments that have been posted. The staff overall were extremely pleasant and the room was very clean and comfortable. I acknowledge that maybe the bathroom was in need of some modernising for a 5* hotel but it was very large and functional and is only a minor gripe. The swimming pool temperature was fine for cooling off and the grounds surrounding it were well maintained. I can confirm that this Hotel does also cater for the business market and there were many conferences being held during our two week stay. Personally, we had no problems with the business traveller and although parts of the atrium were cordoned off at times it was no big deal. We ate twice in the Tradewinds Restaurant and the food was excellent and good value. The drinks were slightly dearer than outside restaurants but realistically you expect that in a Hotel of this class. Having driven up and down International Drive many times during our two week holiday, the position of this Hotel was superb. It is away from the more touristy areas and my family felt extremely safe when parking the car in the car park late at night. In fact most nights when we were in the car park we saw a hotel security guard patrolling the area. On the issue of car parking, when we checked in on our arrival and the receptionist realised that we were staying for 14 nights he automatically waived the $7 dollar a day car parking fee. I would definitely return to this Hotel if I were to visit this area again and would urge anybody who has already booked to stay at this Hotel not to be put off by the negative comments as we initially were prior to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatin”
Reviews.Author: goodservice
Reviews.Content: afther looking at several hotels in the seaworld area, we decided to stay at this location. Upon arriving at the hotel lobby, we were greeted by a friendly member of staff and were offered a welcome campagne and 2 gifts for my 2 children. The hotel looks quite impressive and has a small waterfall with a lot of fish in it. Breakfast was included in our rate, we were given vouchers wich included the tips, which was nice. also the breakfast at the tradewinds restaurant was very good!. Also we used some dining room service which was also good and not way over priced. I would recommend this hotel to people wanting to visit seaworld, as it is just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: JackieBCoventry_UK
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th time we have been to Orlando and this was the best hotel we have stayed in. We had already booked the Crowne Plaza for April 2006 and on our return to the UK, we contacted the travel agent and changed it to the Renaissance. The staff were very friendly and helpful, check in was easy and the food was good. ONE THING THAT ISN'T ADVERTISED AT THE POOLSIDE BAR, IS THAT ONCE YOU HAVE BOUGHT SOFT DRINKS FOR $2, THEN YOU GET FREE REFILLS (JUST KEEP YOUR CUP) FOR THE DAY. The pool was excellent and never crowded. Never had problems getting a sun bed and we spent a lot of time around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks- 22/7-05/08. First thing I was told was I needed to pay $7.00 per day to park at the hotel. $98.00 in total I feel was a complete rip off. The glass roof in the lobby leaks every time it rains, so you find yourself having to avoid buckets and bowls on the floor. The cost of 1 pint of Budweiser is $5.00 and the guys behind the Dolphin bar were extremely miserable. I suspected I was interupting their time watching tv every time I ordered. The hotel is very business orientated, every day I was there another conference was on- it seemed to be that the staff were too busy to bother with families on holiday. The pool was dirty (even saw a turtle one morning laying at the bottom). The toilets were nasty and needed an extreme cleanse. The room was outdated and the maid service was minimal. On the whole not what I expected from a 5 star hotel- seemed 2-3 star at best. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time we had....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on a family vacation. July 10-July13, 2005. Everyone at your hotel was great. The service was wonderful. We went for my daugther's 11th birthday, at check-in I had mentioned it to someone at the front desk (I think her name was Emilie) well we went out after we checked in , we got back to our room very late, we had found that the girl at the front desk had left a little gift for my daugther, it was filled with candy and stuffed toys. It was so wonderful to think that a staff member would do such a nice thing. During out trip my daugther did not stop talking about that gift. We would surely stay at this hotel again. From the minute we walked in we were treated very good. All of the staff was very helpful. We do not have one bad thing to say about the hotel or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dafuskie
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night instead of two! If you enjoyed the 1980s than this is the place for you because it hasn't been cleaned or updated in twenty years! Very dated lobby and rooms, Tradewinds restaurant has dirty walls and furniture, the decor of the hotel also reflects the service.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: billbrum
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a prime location just opposite Seaworld. It is modern and the staff are friendly. The aquatic pool inside and the guilded aviary are amazing. Complimentary tea and coffeee are supplied to the room. Those are the good points.The bad points outweigh the the goodpoints however. 1) the Hotel charges a daily car parking fee of $7, 2) If you want to use the room internet facilities the daily charge is $10, 3) If you want to use wifi internet in the atrium the charge is 50 cents a minute. 4) cold bottled water is $3 - more than you pay in the theme parks.5) Meals within the hotel are fairly expensive eg $7 for continental breakfast. Most hotels on international Drive offer free car parking, many offer complimentary internet access. So if you are on holiday with a family and are paying for the holiday out of your own pocket I would choose another hotel.If however your boss is paying then yes you will love this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: luckier
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and two kids aged nine and seven.Hotel was excellent,pool and surroundings beautiful,staff fantastic.We ate almost every morning and evening at Tradewinds,food was delicious.There was a mixture of business people and families but it never bothered any of us as i am sure they would rather be on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was one of a 5 DCF group staying at the Renaissance for 3 days. We were very displeased and upset about the poor accomodations, service and treatment by staff. The rooms were not cleaned well. Hair was on the floor under the bathroom sink in room 8060 from checkin to checkout. Adequate linen was not replenished daily, and a torn bedspread was on a bed from checkin to checkout in 8060. The bathroom floor in 8060 was never swept or mopped. Vacation Club desk male staff was rude, dsicriminatory and gave false informaiton about VIP cards. He issued me a white card "for free breakfast or lunch, when in fact it was good for 10% discount only. He ignored me when I returned to address the matter with him, giving lenghty preference to a White couple. He stated "he was busy, and it's ridiculous to give something free". The yellow VIP card is for a free meal; however, he made not effort to be civil or compensate. I complained to the manager on the front desk, who did nothing. Birds flying freely in the lobby is a negative feature due to the possibility of their excreting waste at any time. The Renaissance is greatly overpriced, and I shall never return to this hotel, or any Marriott property as a result of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the $159 a day that they charged. I attended a convention at another hotel because that hotel was full. The Renaissance Hotel has very poor service, and it is very difficult to understand the front desk staff, as they speak very limited English. There is no coffee pot in the room, and guests are at the mercy of staff who may or may not deliver the complementary coffee to your door. The first day, there was no coffee delivered, even after 3 calls. The second day, they did deliver the service, which consisted of a pot of lukewarm water and an envelope of stale hot cocoa. Then, 30 minutes later, as I left my room, I almost stumbled over a second tray that was set by my door. I had no time to drink this, and wondered why they delivered another unrequested service. The ice machine was broken, and when I called to ask when it would be fixed, the front desk person said "I have no idea". I stayed with 4 fellow employees, and all agreed that we would never stay there again. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “loved the great pool”
Reviews.Author: rosebud50
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday and enjoyed the weather and the beautiful pool very much.Don't believe all of the bad reviews the hotel is very nice especially the 10th floor with the free continental breakfast.If you are a family traveling with children it's fine,very large clean rooms nice bathrooms.It's not true that you have to pay for the parking, you need to insert your room key and it's free, however they don't tell you at the front desk, but that's the way it works, we did it for 5 days.Yes, it is more of a business travler hotel but everything was very nice,it's not disney, but we were rarely in the hotel anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business users”
Reviews.Author: suelin0
Reviews.Content: Whilst fine for business users ,not really geared to holidaymakers,often felt quite uncomfortable in leisurewear surrounded by men in suits with mobiles stuck to their ears all around pool area.Meals in hotel pricey. Half of rooms face inwards over atrium area thus no outside veiw or fresh air. Not really for families on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the family!”
Reviews.Author: jonesytv
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! My wife and kids loved it. The pool was great, the food was fantastic and the room was neat and very clean. You can't ask any more from a hotel. Great location, the staff was friendly and all of us felt like we were welcome. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!.... stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week (4-9-05 though 4-16-05) and after reading some negitive reviews i was a little worried about how it would turn out. It is aging, but very well keep, everything was very clean, and the staff was outstanding. The large heated pool area is fantastic, the swimming is wonderful! all the pictures don't do it justice, it is a very nice hotel. The food is outstanding, the breakfast buffet is first rate! We used AAA and got a room with a king size bed with an outside balcony over looking Sea World for $159 that included 2 breakfast baffets. They do charge to park for the public because people were using their parking lot to go to Sea World, but the parking is free with your room rate if you use your room key to open the gate! We used the room key to park the rental car all week, and were not charged. The location is exellent, it's in the middle of everything, but yet is out of the main traffic ways. It's only three blocks from International Drive, and four blocks from Interstate 4. We made it to all the Disney parks in 15 minutes to the southwest, Universal Studios parks in 10 minutes to the northeast, and walked across the street to Sea World. We are planning on making this hotel our place to stay every year!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay with which we were extremely pleased. I am beginning to wonder if we stayed at the same hotel as the individuals who had many negative comments to share. We received an excellent rate ($98) for a king bed oversized room which included breakfast coupon for one each day ($16 value). Check in was effortless and as Marriott rewards members we got to enjoy the club lounge which included snacks, cocktails, etc. It was certainly a nice touch. The room was extremely clean. The location was perfect. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The pool was nice, but for the price you can do much better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went away for a business trip and turned it into a vacation. His convention was at the hotel, hence why we stayed there. For the price of the hotel, it was average. Nothing spectacular but also nothing bad. The pool was the best part of the hotel, especially the outside deli/bar. Next time, we will probably stay at the Portofino Bay for the same price we paid at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Aging”
Reviews.Author: Ron34227
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in February. Hotel has a beautiful Atrium and very friendly attentive staff. Mini bar in our room did not work. When we asked for help they put a mini refrigerator in the middle of our floor. Not acceptable. They never did fix the mini bar. Hotel was very clean. Rooms showed much aging...furniture, carpets....just did not look appealing. Overall a very nice place (other than the actual rooms which are showing their age) and friendly staff...and walking distance from Sea World is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention and for $289 a night I could not believe the poor quality of the rooms. This hotel needs to be renovated. The carpets were stained and the bathroom was dinghy. Yuck. I would never recommend this hotel when there are so many other options in Orlando. I cannot figure out how this is 4 stars. It is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of this world. The staff are very helpful, the food is lovely and its in an excellent location. We were there during thanksgiving and they really know how to look after people. Its great would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two evenings prior to our cruise leaving. This was over New Years. The hotel was hosting LSU for the Orange Bowl that weekend. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Room was amply sized and beds were comfortable. Boked this thru priceline so really felt like we got an excellent deal. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I agree withall the positive reviews.”
Reviews.Author: ERIC'S_MUM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for the first 2 weeks of Dec 2004 and loved it. Having read the negative reviews before leaving home (the UK) we were concerned that our holiday would be spoilt by poor accomodation, but the moment we walked into the lobby we were reassured. My only whinge was that we had to pay daily self-parking fees, despite my mother holding a disabled parking badge (UK blue badge scheme enabled us to obtain a temporary US equivalent, which is great). Breakfast buffet good, although at $15 each including service it was much more expensive than can be found elsewhere, but it was our treat on days when we felt like being lazy!! We have been going to Orlando for over 12 years and usually stay in Rosen Centre / Rosen Plaza/Crown Plaza . The Renaissance is currently our "new favourite hotel". Regards, Happy UK Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Stay here tonight!”
Reviews.Author: Jakesmom
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel for anyone considering a SeaWorld vacation. There are lots of benefits to staying here: wireless internet spots across the lobby and 10th floor "snack-shack" for guests who are lucky enough to be put on that floor! We were "upgraded" to the 10th floor because the hotel was about 90% empty at Christmas and we enjoyed the free breakfast and evening snacks! I don't think I'd ever pay for the upgrade, though, but you should ask if they can put you on the 10th floor if you stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why the negativity here, this place is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to plenty of hotels all over the world both on business and leisure and this place is great. Who is this hotel perfect for? If Seaworld is the focus of your Orlando Florida then you will not do better in terms of the location than the Renaissance. They have the perfect location and once you've parked your car there (and yes, there is a daily charge) you can then walk across the street to Seaworld. If other parts of Orlando are your focus then this hotel will still serve you well although obviously you've got to drive to the attractions. If you're traveling on business and have a convention or meeting at this hotel you will not be unsatisfied either. This hotel is as good as it gets in terms of handling large business meetings or events. What makes this hotel special? For one thing the rooms were top notch. If you stay frequently at Renaissance you're full-service Marriotts you know what to expect. But this hotel seemed even better that others I've stayed at. There's a spectacular koi pond in the big atrium of the hotel. There's also a neat little aviary right in the middle. I got upgraded to the Concierge floor which perhaps favorably taints this review but that was an excellent bonus with a complimentary continental breakfast and afternoon snacks. There's a small playground for kids, a pool for infants and then a wonderful pool for grownups. I believe the big pool is heated. I saw plenty of people using it during an unusually cold December spell (Brits or Canadians, perhaps!) and no one seemed to complain about the cold. Checkin and checkout were extraordinarily efficient. Maybe it was the holiday season but they were offering glasses of champagne or apple juice to people as they arrived. All in all a great experience at this hotel. Savvy travelers can book this place with complete confidence. And if you're planning a visit from Europe or the U.K. you'll be delighted with this place. One more benefit. They have a tours desk at the hotel where we got amazing deal on on Seaworld tickets. (We paid approximately $42.50 for a day ticket which was good afternoon noon and then allowed you to come back next day!) Only complaint was the relatively pricey restaurants which were fine but no bargain (unless you're visiting from Europe in which case it'll seem like a bargain. On the other hand if you're not happy there are plenty of other dining options a few minutes away. Enjoy this place and I look forward to seeing your comments as to whether you agree or disagree with my review.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: well, it was just a few weekends ago I went to the Renaissance Resort in Orlando. We were only going there becuase my Grandpa wanted us to go on a family trip and the hotel we registered for suddenly went for constuction and put us in a crappy room then we got there. We didnt go to that hotel. We registered at the Renissance. When we pulled up, they opened the doors, valleted the car, and took our luggage. I walked in and I was amazed. My chin dropped to my feet. As a 12 year old Ive never been to a resort like this. It had a spa,an indoor wirlpool, a hair salon, a resteraunt, bird flying around!!! IT WAS AMAZING!!! The rooms were perfect, the delivering of the food to the room was great, ive never been somewhere as beautiful like this!!! and i thank the employees there for making me happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (my husband myself two boys aged 9 & 13) and i have just returned from a stay from the 7th october till the 22nd october. I have to admit I was somwhat disappionted,the room was big with two queen sized beds the bathroom had two vanity sinks in it but one was cracked. The food is expensive and the hotel is not really children friendly, it is more suitable for buisiness people. The pool area was under refunishment but the pool was in use, it was freezing. In its day (The hotel is 20 years old the staff imformed me) this hotel would have been magnificant but at the moment every where looks tired and in need of updating, Im not a person to complain i have visited 4 star hotels in the U.K and i'm sorry but this is not of the same class. Most of the rooms look on to the lobbby not over looking sea world (unless you get a room on the tenth floor,this is where you get the free buffett breakfast). You may also get compementry coffee FREE OF CHARGE if you don't ask for ot believe me you wont get it. The staff in general are very nice but check you bills for service charges they should only charge on partys of 6 and over we got stung!!! but after an argument at reception was refunded the differance....

Reviews.Title: “Yada, yada, yada...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October. It was 'okay' at best. I, too, experienced the 'room dance' at this hotel...check in, up to the room, back to the desk for the room I'd 'reserved', bit of a tug-of-war, back up to the new room, only to again be disappointed, but too tired to argue anymore. Room service took an hour and a half to deliver a cold sandwich and a cold salad...an order that was placed at 9:30 at night. It was only after an inquiry call that it was finally delivered. To their credit, the food was of good quality and portions were nice. The front desk was snippy to say the least, and the self park charge irked me a bit. The lobby is indeed beautiful, but the rooms are just hotel rooms...certainly not worth better than $150-$160 a night even at peak times. The nicest thing I found about the rooms were the bath & body amenities. The location can't be beat if going to Sea World, but that would be my only draw--along with a great rate--to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sunday Brunch”
Reviews.Author: Coire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2003, we were getting married in Florida and booked this hotel for somewhere special to stay, we certainly were not dissapointed, gorgeous atrium and reception area. Our room was large and spacious with two double beds, two comfy seats, a writing desk and a large bathroom, no problems with cleanliness. To top it off the Champagne Sunday Brunch which we booked for 18 people was absolutely fantastic, we have never tasted food like it, so much choice and all delicious. No complaints!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Orlando Resort at SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 6677 Sea Harbor Dr, Orlando, FL 32821-8092
